tgt: this innovative project won an award during the 17th public sector innovation awards 2019, under the innovations harnessing 4ir solutions category.

src: die direkteur van die nasio nale tesourie, anile best, wat aan die stuur van die vuleka maliportaalinisiatief staan, sê die portaal se hoofdoel is om openbare belangstelling en kennis van, asook deelname aan die regering se finansiële programme te verhoog.
tgt: national treasury director andile best, who leads the vulekamali portal initiative, says its main aim is to increase public interest, participation and knowledge of government’s financial programmes.

src: "dit is deel van die nasionale tesourie se onderneming om meer deursigtig oor staatsfinan sies te wees.
tgt: "this is national treasury’s commitment to be more transparent about public finances.

src: begrotingsinligting word reeds op die tesourie se webwerf gepubliseer, maar die portaal bevat data wat maklik toeganklik is in n verbruikers vriendelike formaat, sodat inligting, analise en navorsing meer doeltreffende gedeel kan word," verduidelik hy.
tgt: budgetary information is already published on treasury’s website, but the portal contains easily accessible data in a userfriendly format, to enable more effective information sharing, analyses and research," he explaines.

src: volgens best, ondersteun vulekamali die burgerlike samelewing en die publiek se betrokkenheid in begrotings prosesse en stel burgers in staat om ingeligte besprekings oor regeringsbeleide te hou.
tgt: according to best, vulekamali supports involvement by civil society and the public in budget processes and enables citizens to have informed discussions about government policies.

src: "as ons die publiek vra om aan begrotingsprosesse deel te neem en hulle het nie kennis daarvan nie, kan hulle nie gehalte insette lewer nie.
tgt: "if we ask the public to participate in budgetary processes and they come from a position of not knowing, they cannot make quality inputs.

src: tweedens, wil ons hê dat die publiek moet weet hoe die regering geld uit die staatskas bestee," sê best.
tgt: secondly, we want the public to know how government spends money from the public purse," best says.

src: burgerlike samelewingsor ganisasies wil byvoorbeeld dikwels weet hoe die regering dienste lewer, hoe dienste aan die begroting verbind is en of die nasionale, provinsiale of plaaslike regering vir spesifieke dienste verantwoordelik is.
tgt: for example, civil society organisations often want to know how government renders services, how services are connected to the budget and whether national, provincial or local government is responsible for specific services.

src: best sê van die belangheb bendes wat by die projek be trokke is, is die departement van beplanning, monitering en evaluering; die burgerlike samelewingskoalisie, imali yethu; die global initiative en die regering se tegniese raad gewende sentrum.
tgt: best says amongst the stakeholders involved in the project are the department of planning, monitoring and evaluation; civil society coalition imali yethu; global initiative and the government technical advisory centre.

src: daar is verteenwoordiging van die regering sowel as die burgerlike samelewing op elke besluitnemingsvlak en in elke regeringstruktuur, sê hy.
tgt: at every level of decision making and on each governance structure, there is representation of both government and civil society, he says.

src: volgens zukiswa kota, wat namens die betrokke burger like samelewingsorganisasies praat, en hoof is van die mo niteringsen aanbevelings program by die staatsdiens se aanspreeklikheidsmonitor, asook die koördineerder van imali yethu is, is verantwoord bare begrotingsprosesse noodsaaklik vir n demokrasie.
tgt: speaking on behalf of the civil society organisations involved, zukiswa kota, the head of the monitoring and advocacy programme at the public service accountability monitor and lead coordinator of imali yethu, says accountable budgetary processes are critical to a democracy.

src: die uiteindelike doel is om beter dienslewering te beïnvloed, sê sy.
tgt: the ultimate goal is to influence better service delivery, she says.

src: "vir ons beteken toegang tot vinniger inligting dat jy nie gemeenskappe het wat gedurig ontsteld is en onbewus is van begrotingsprosesse nie," sê sy.
tgt: "for us, access to quicker information means that you do not constantly have communities upset and unaware of budget processes," she says, adding that people have a better sense of the urgency required in commenting on budgets and they know who to speak to about their frustrations.

src: saam kan ons die impak van covid19 beveg vukuzenzele unnamed die wêreld is in die wurggreep van 'n noodsituasie vir openbare gesondheid op 'n skaal wat meer as 'n eeu laas beleef is.
tgt: together we can fight the impact of covid 19 vukuzenzele unnamed the world is in the throes of a public health emergency on a scale not witnessed in over a century.

src: die verspreiding van die koronavirus, wat die siekte bekend as covid19 veroorsaak, is skrikwekkend vinnig en wyd, en word nou as 'n wêreldwye pandemie gedefinieer.
tgt: the spread of the coronavirus, which causes the disease known as covid19, has been alarmingly swift and widescale, and is now defined as a global pandemic.

src: dit het geen geografiese of territoriale grense nie, het sowel jonk as oud besmet en is aan die toeneem in sowel ontwikkelde as ontwikkelende lande.
tgt: it knows no geographical or territorial boundaries, has infected both young and old, and is on the rise in developed and developing countries alike.

src: namate die sifting en toetsing verskerp word, sal die aantal infeksies in suidafrika na verwagting toeneem.
tgt: as screening and testing is scaled up, the number of infections in south africa is expected to rise.

src: ek het onlangs 'n nasionale ramptoestand verklaar, 'n maatstaf wat ooreenstem met die erns van die bedreiging vir ons mense, ons samelewing en ons ekonomie.
tgt: i recently declared a national state of disaster, a measure proportionate to the severity of the threat to our people, to our society and to our economy.

src: dit sal ons in staat stel om 'n geïntegreerde en gekoördineerde rampbestuursprogram te bedryf en om vinnige en doeltreffende noodreaksiestelsels in plek te stel.
tgt: this will enable us to have an integrated and coordinated disaster management mechanism and to set up emergency, rapid and effective response systems.

src: hierdie virus sal uiters ontwrigtend wees, en ons priori teit is om die gesondheid en welstand van alle suidafrikaners te beskerm.
tgt: this virus will be extremely disruptive, and our priority is to safeguard the health and wellbeing of all south africans.

src: ons moet ook die onvermydelike ekonomiese nadraai aanpak.
tgt: we also have to address the inevitable economic fallout.

src: ons moet 'n afname in uitvoere verwag, 'n daling in toeristeaankomste en 'n ernstige impak op produksie en sakelewensvatbaarheid, sowel as werkskepping en die behoud van werk.
tgt: we must expect a decline in exports, a drop in tourist arrivals and a severe impact on production, business viability and job creation and retention.

src: die kabinet finaliseer tans 'n omvattende pakket van ingrypings om die verwagte impak van covid19 op ons ekonomie te verminder.
tgt: cabinet is in the process of finalising a comprehensive package of interventions to mitigate the expected impact of covid19 on our economy.

src: dit word in oorleg met sake, arbeidsen ander relevante instellings gedoen.
tgt: this is being done in consultation with business, labour and other relevant institutions.

src: dit was louis pasteur wat gesê het dat rykdom die voorbereide gees bevoordeel.
tgt: it was louis pasteur who said that fortune favours the prepared mind.

src: suidafrika is voorbereid, en is reeds 'n geruime tyd voorbereid.
tgt: south africa is prepared, and has been so for some time.

src: sedert die uitbreek van die virus aangemeld is, het ons opgetree om maatreëls vir sifting en inperking in plek te stel.
tgt: since the outbreak was first reported we have acted to put screening and containment measures in place.

src: ons nasionale reaksie is gedryf deur 'n interministeriële komitee (imk) onder die voorsitterskap en bekwame leiding van die minister van gesondheid, dr zweli mkhize.
tgt: our national response has been driven by an interministerial committee (imc) chaired and ably led by the minister of health, dr zweli mkhize.

src: die manier waarop die imk en die ondersteuningspanne op hierdie noodtoestand gereageer het, is doeltreffend en gerusstellend, veral omdat dit help om die openbare paniek te onderdruk.
tgt: the manner in which the imc and the support teams have responded to this emergency has been both exemplary and reassuring, particularly in helping to quell public panic.

src: ek sal voorsitter wees van 'n nasionale opdragraad om alle aspekte van ons nasionale reaksie te koördineer.
tgt: i will be chairing a national command council to coordinate all aspects of our national response.

src: suidafrika het 'n positiewe prestasierekord in die bestuur van noodgevalle.
tgt: south africa has a positive track record in managing public health emergencies.

src: ons het die kennis, die middele en die kundigheid.
tgt: we have the knowledge, the means and the expertise.

src: ons wetenskaplikes en epidemioloë is wêreldklas.
tgt: our scientists and epidemiologists are worldclass.

src: ons het 'n reeks noodmaatreëls ingestel en sal finansie ring beskikbaar stel om die implementering daarvan te ondersteun.
tgt: we have put a raft of emergency measures in place, and will make funding available to support their implementation.

src: dit sluit ’n reisverbod op besoekers uit lande met 'n hoë risiko in, sowel as verpligte toetsing, selfisolasie of kwarantyn vir suidafrikaanse burgers wat uit hierdie lande terugkeer; asook die versterking van waarneming, sifting en toetsing by die hawens van toetrede tot die republiek.
tgt: they include travel bans on visitors from highrisk countries; mandatory testing, selfisolation or quarantine for south african nationals returning from these countries; and strengthening surveillance, screening and testing at ports of entry into the republic.

src: sosiale distansiëring is van kritieke belang om die verspreiding van covid19 te stuit.
tgt: social distancing is critical if we are to contain the spread of covid19.

src: byeenkomste van meer as 100 mense is verbode en die massaviering van nasionale dae word gekanselleer.
tgt: gatherings of more than 100 people are prohibited and mass celebrations of national days are cancelled.

src: besoeke aan alle korrektiewe sentrums word onmiddellik vir 30 dae opgeskort.
tgt: visits to all correctional centres are being suspended for 30 days with immediate effect.

src: nienoodsaaklike internasionale reis vir regeringsamptenare is verbied en nienoodsaaklike reis binne die land word ontmoedig.
tgt: nonessential international travel for government officials has been proscribed and nonessential domestic travel discouraged.

src: altesaam 35 binnelandse plekke van toetrede in die land en twee hawens sal gesluit wees.
tgt: a total of 35 land ports and two sea ports will be closed, as will schools from the 18th of march until after the easter weekend.

src: ons sal binnekort maatreëls rakende universiteite en kolleges aankondig.
tgt: we will soon be announcing measures with regards to universities and colleges.

src: volgende maand is paasfees, 'n heilige tyd vir verskeie gelowe en 'n tyd waarin massadienste en byeenkomste gewoonlik plaasvind.
tgt: next month will be easter, a sacred period for a number of faiths and a time in which mass services and gatherings will take place.

src: die geloofsgemeenskap moet besluite neem in dié verband in die belang van hul gemeentes se gesondheid en dié van die land as ’n geheel.
tgt: the faith community should take decisions in this regard in the best interests of the health of their congregants and the country as a whole.

src: die beheer van higiëne moet in alle sektore versterk word.
tgt: hygiene control should be intensified in all sectors.

src: elkeen van ons moet beheer neem oor ons eie veiligheid deur maatreëls soos om gereeld jou hande met seep te was of handontsmetmiddels te gebruik en jou neus en mond met 'n snesie of elmboog te bedek wanneer jy hoes of nies.
tgt: every citizen should take charge of their own safety by observing measures such as frequent handwashing with soap or handsanitizers and covering their nose or mouth with a tissue or flexed elbow when coughing or sneezing.

src: as deel van ons nasionale poging sal die departement van gesondheid voortgaan met 'n intensiewe en deurlopende veldtog om bewustheid oor simptome, voorkoming, oordrag en infeksie te verhoog.
tgt: as part of our national effort the department of health will continue with an intensive and ongoing campaign to raise awareness about prevention, transmission and infection symptoms.

src: ek moedig alle suidafrikaners aan om hulle te vergewis van die toepaslike voorkomende maatreëls.
tgt: i encourage all south africans to acquaint themselves with the relevant preventative material.

src: hierdie maatreëls is soortgelyk aan dié in ander lande, en dit is belangrik dat ons almal verstaan dat dit nie ’n straf is nie, maar 'n kwessie van openbare veiligheid.
tgt: these measures are similar to those in other countries, and it is important we all understand that they are not punitive but a matter of public safety.

src: een van die grootste gevare op die oomblik is onkunde en verkeerde inligting.
tgt: one of the greatest dangers at this time is ignorance and misinformation.

src: ons moet ophou om vals en ongeverifieerde nuus te versprei, veral op sosiale media.
tgt: we should stop spreading fake and unverified news, especially on social media.

src: dit kan 'n reeds gespanne nasionale stemming vererger en die nasionale poging skade berokken.
tgt: this can exacerbate an already tense national mood and damage the national effort.

src: ons moet ook nie toegee aan die uitdrukking van vooroordeel wat ons gesien het in ander lande wat gerig is op burgers van lande waar die uitbreek begin het of die huidige episentrum in europa nie.
tgt: we must also not give in to the expressions of bigotry that we have seen in other countries directed at nationals of countries from where the outbreak began or the current epicenter in europe.

src: dit is duidelik dat die virus mense van alle nasionaliteite aantas.
tgt: this is clearly a virus that affects people of all nationalities.

src: laat ons diegene wat besmet is, sowel as dié wat uit hoërisikolande teruggekeer het, met deernis behandel.
tgt: let us lower the wing of compassion to those who are infected, and to those who have returned home from highrisk countries.

src: laat ons hulp verleen aan mense in nood en dié wat meer kwesbaar is, in plaas daarvan om hulle te vermy.
tgt: let us assist those in need and those more vulnerable, instead of shunning them.

src: ons sal getrou bly aan die waardes van verdraagsaamheid en respek wat ons as 'n volk definieer.
tgt: we will remain faithful to the values of tolerance and respect that define us as a people.

src: namens al die inwoners van suidafrika bedank ek die span wat ons landgenote uit wuhan, china, gerepatrieer het, asook die leierskap en mense van limpopo wat help met die kwarantynproses.
tgt: on behalf of all the people of south africa i thank the team who repatriated our compatriots from wuhan, china, as well as the leadership and people of limpopo who are assisting with the quarantine process.

src: dit is 'n moeilike tyd.
tgt: this is a difficult time.

src: en tog is dit in tye van teëspoed dat ons krag open baar word.
tgt: and yet it is in times of adversity that our strength is revealed.

src: ons sal beslissend optree, met vasberadenheid en doelgerigtheid.
tgt: we will act decisively, with determination and with purpose.

src: saam kan ons covid19 oorwin vukuzenzele unnamed tydens die eerste volle week van landwye inperking om die koronaviruspandemie wat die wêreld plat slaan te bekamp, is ons in dié onseker tye dankbaar vir goeie nuus wat vreugde en hoop gebring het.
tgt: together we can overcome covid19 vukuzenzele unnamed during the first full week of the nationwide lockdown to combat the coronavirus pandemic that is devastating the world, we were grateful for good news that brought us joy and hope at this difficult and uncertain time.

src: die 114 suidafrikaners wat n paar weke gelede uit wuhan in china ontruim is, se kwarantyn het tot n einde gekom en hulle is met hulle gesinne herenig.
tgt: the 114 south africans who were evacuated from wuhan in china some weeks ago ended their quarantine and were reunited with their families.

src: hulle het almal negatief vir die virus getoets en is gesond en opgeruimd.
tgt: they have all tested negative for the virus and are in good health and good spirits.

src: hulle was vir maande ingeperk, eers vir 51 dae in wuhan en toe vir 14 dae in polokwane.
tgt: for months, they had been in lockdown, first in wuhan for some 51 days and then in polokwane for 14 days.

src: hulle kon nie by hulle geliefdes wees nie, kon nie hulle woonplekke verlaat nie en was onseker oor wanneer hulle beproewing tot n einde sou kom.
tgt: they were unable to be with their loved ones, unable to leave their living quarters and uncertain about when their ordeal would end.

src: wanneer die oorblywende 17 dae van suidafrika se tyd van inperking bygevoeg word, sal hulle vir altesaam 82 dae ingeperk wees.
tgt: when we add the remaining 17 days that south africa will be under lockdown they will have been under lockdown for 82 days.

src: dit was wonderlik om tyd saam met dié diverse groep suidafrikaners van alle ouderdomme, tale en agtergronde, deur te bring.
tgt: it was wonderful to spend time with this diverse group of south africans made up of all ages, languages and backgrounds.

src: ek was beïndruk deur hulle geeskragtigheid, moed en vasberadenheid om gesond te bly.
tgt: i was impressed by their resilience and courage and by their determination to remain healthy.

src: hulle kom van die episentrum van die koronavirus in wuhan, china en het die verwoestende impak van dié virus op mense ervaar.
tgt: they have come from the epicentre of the coronavirus in wuhan in china and have seen the devastating impact this virus is wreaking on human life.

src: ek was nie verras toe hulle sê dat dit hulle missie is om die gesondheid van die mense om hulle, te beskerm nie.
tgt: it is not surprising to hear them say that they are on a mission to safeguard the health of those around them.

src: hulle geduld en vasberadenheid is nou beloon, want hulle keer terug na hulle gesinne toe.
tgt: now their patience and fortitude has been rewarded, because they are returning to their families.

src: hulle terugkeer huis toe is deur talle mense moontlik gemaak wat alles moontlik gedoen het om te verseker dat dié repatriasieproses suksesvol uitgevoer word.
tgt: their return home was made possible by a great many people who went to great lengths to make this repatriation operation a success.

src: as ’n nasie is ons ontsettend dankbaar dat die regering en die mense van china so goed na ons burgers omgesien het en ons bedank hulle vir hulle hulp met die repatriasieproses.
tgt: as a nation, we are extremely grateful to the government and the people of china for taking such good care of our citizens, and for their assistance in organising their repatriation.

src: dit is noemens waardig dat verskeie van die suidafrikaners in wuhan studiebeurse van die chinese regering ontvang het, n goedgunstige daad wat opreg waardeer word.
tgt: it is significant that several of the south africans in wuhan were on study scholarships from the chinese government; an act of generosity that is deeply appreciated.

src: ons is dankbaar vir al die mense wat by die proses betrokke was, van saapersoneel en die mediese span, tot die polisie en soldate wat hulle huis toe gebring het.
tgt: we are grateful too to all the people who were involved in the operation, from the saa flight crew to the medical team to the police and soldiers who brought them home.

src: ieder en elkeen van hulle het na vore gekom om verantwoordelikheid vir die veilig heid en welstand van ander, te aanvaar.
tgt: each and every one of them stepped forward to take responsibility for the safety and wellbeing of others.

src: hulle was bereid om n moeilike en gevaarlike missie aan te pak en om aan kwarantyn onderhewig te wees.
tgt: they were prepared to undertake a difficult and dangerous mission and to subject themselves to quarantine.

src: en hulle vertel nou vir my dat hulle gereed is vir die volgende missie.
tgt: and now, they all tell me, they are ready for their next mission.

src: ek bedank die personeel en bestuur van die ranch hotel in polokwane, wat so goed na die teruggekeerdes omgesien het.
tgt: i wish to thank the staff and management of the ranch hotel in polokwane, who took great care of the returnees.

src: hulle was bereid om hul rol te vervul in ons nasionale poging om dié siekte die hoof te bied.
tgt: they were prepared to play their part in our national effort to overcome this disease.

src: almal wat by die proses betrokke was, het suidafrika eer aangedoen.
tgt: everyone involved in this operation has done south africa proud.

src: die ervaring van die suidafrikaners in wuhan demonstreer die doeltreffendheid — en die noodsaaklikheid — van n inperkingstydperk.
tgt: the experience of the south africans in wuhan demonstrates the effectiveness – and the necessity – of a state of lockdown.

src: dit was as gevolg van die chinese regering se drastiese optrede om die siekte in wuhanstad in te perk, dat al ons mense gesond teruggekeer het en nie die virus onder lede het nie.
tgt: it was due to the drastic actions that the chinese government took to con tain the disease in the city of wuhan, that all of our people were able to return uninfected and healthy.

src: wuhan, n stad in die hubeiprovinsie, met 11 miljoen inwoners, het meer as 50 000 infeksies gehad.
tgt: wuhan, a city of 11 million people in the province of hubei, had more than 50,000 infections.

src: die provinsie het nou, na meer as twee maande nadat streng inperkingsmaatreëls ingestel is, minder as 20 nuwe gevalle in die afgelope twee weke gehad.
tgt: now, after more than two months after stringent lockdown measures were put in place, the province has had fewer than 20 new cases in the past two weeks.

src: die inperking van die siekte in wuhanstad, in hubeiprovinsie en op ander plekke reg oor china, het n massiewe en buitengewone poging vereis.
tgt: the containment of the disease in wuhan city, in hubei province and in other places across china required a massive and extraordinary effort.

src: dit het drastiese beperkings op mense se daaglikse lewens behels en n ernstige impak op die chinese ekonomie gehad.
tgt: it involved drastic restrictions on daily life and is having a severe impact on the chinese economy.

src: ander lande het soortgelyke maatreëls toegepas en ervaar groter sukses in die beheer van die siekte se verspreiding as lande wat langer geneem het om daarop te reageer.
tgt: other countries that have taken similar measures are having greater success in managing the spread of the disease than countries that have been slower to respond.

src: namate die totale aantal bevestigde covid19gevalle wêreldwyd tot meer as700 000 styg en die aantal sterftes 33 000 oorskry, kan ons by dié lande leer.
tgt: as the total number of confirmed covid19 cases worldwide grows to over 700,000 and the number of deaths exceeds 33,000, we can draw lessons from these countries.

src: dit is nou baie duidelik dat die doeltreffendste manier vir n samelewing om die verspreiding van die siekte te beperk, is vir die bevolking om vir minstens n paar weke tuis te bly en fisies van mekaar geïsoleer te wees.
tgt: it is now abundantly clear that the most effective way for a society to contain the spread of the disease is for the population to remain at home and physically isolated from each other for at least several weeks.

src: dit is ook belangrik dat die inperking en alle ander noodmaatreëls streng nagekom en deurlopend toegepas word.
tgt: and it is important that this lockdown and all other emergency measures are both strictly adhered to and consistently enforced.

src: soos die suidafrikaners wat in wuhan was kan getuig, is dit uiters moeilik om sulke beperkings op mense se daaglikse lewe, op beweging en gewone menslike kontak, toe te pas.
tgt: as the south africans from wuhan can testify, such restrictions on daily life, on movement and on ordinary human contact are extremely difficult to endure.

src: n inperking in die suidafrikaanse konteks veroorsaak bykomende ongerief en spanning en ons doen alles moontlik om die impak op ons mense te verminder.
tgt: in the south african context, a lockdown brings additional hardship and strain, and we are doing everything within our means to lessen the impact on our people.

src: die les van die suidafrikaners in wuhan is dat in perking werk.
tgt: but the lesson from the south africans in wuhan is that a lockdown works.

src: dit toon dat as ons streng by die ingestelde reëls hou om te keer dat die virus versprei, ons in staat sal wees om die infeksiekoers te verminder.
tgt: it shows that if we strictly observe the rules in place to stop the virus spreading, we will be able to bring infection rates down.

src: hulp aan ons kwesbare burgers vukuzenzele unnamed baie lande regoor die wêreld het koronavirusinperkings ingestel om die lewens van hulle burgers te red.
tgt: help for our vulnerable citizens vukuzenzele unnamed many countries around the world have imposed coronavirus lockdowns with a view to saving the lives of their citizens.

src: ons het dieselfde hier gedoen, maar ons inperking het 'n baie betreurenswaardige foutlyn in ons samelewing onthul, wat aandui hoe uiterste armoede, ongelykheid en werkloosheid die struktuur van ons gemeenskappe uitmekaar skeur.
tgt: we have done the same in our country, but our lockdown has revealed a very sad fault line in our society that reveals how grinding poverty, inequality and unemployment is tearing the fabric of our communities apart.

src: daar kan geen groter foltering wees as dié van ouers wie se kinders by hulle huil omdat hulle nie kos het nie, maar hulle het niks om te gee nie.
tgt: there can be no greater anguish than that of a parent whose children cry out to them for food, but they have none to give.

src: daar kan geen groter onreg bestaan as 'n samelewing waar sommiges in gemak en oorvloed leef, terwyl ander sukkel om met min of niks te oorleef nie.
tgt: there can be no greater injustice than a society where some live in comfort and plenty, while others struggle at the margins to survive with little or nothing at all.

src: ja, dit is die hartseer nagevolge van 'n gebroke en ongelyke verlede.
tgt: yes, these are the residual effects of a fractured and unequal past.

src: maar dit is ook 'n simptoom van 'n fundamentele mislukking in ons samelewing ná apartheid.
tgt: but they are also a symp tom of a fundamental failing in our postapartheid society.

src: die landwye inperking in reaksie op die koronavirus het 'n jarelange probleem aansienlik vererger.
tgt: the nationwide lockdown in response to the coronavirus has gravely exarcerbated a longstanding problem.

src: die afgelope paar weke is ons gekonfronteer met ontstellende beelde van desperate mense wat mekaar vir kospakkies by verspreidingsentrums vertrap en gemeenskappe wat protesoptogte hou teen voedseltekorte.
tgt: over the past few weeks, we have been confronted with distressing images of desperate people clamouring for food parcels at distribution centres and of community protests against food shortages.

src: ons het ook bewerings gehoor wat ontstellend en walglik is.
tgt: we have also had to contend with allegations both disturbing and disgusting.

src: verskeie provinsies het berigte ontvang van gewetenlose individue, sommige van hulle na bewering regeringsamptenare, wat kospakkies wat vir die behoeftiges en kwesbares bestem is opgaar of verkoop, of vir hul vriende en familie gee.
tgt: a number of provinces have received reports that callous individuals, some of them allegedly government officials, are hoarding or selling food parcels earmarked for the needy and destitute, or diverting them to their friends and families.

src: as daar bevind word dat daar enige waarheid in hierdie bewerings steek, sal ons baie streng teen die betrokke individue optree.
tgt: if there is found to be substance to these allegations we will deal with the individuals concerned harshly.

src: met die verklaring van 'n nasionale ramptoestand en die instelling van 'n landwye inperkingstoestand het ons ’n onbekende terrein betree.
tgt: with the declaration of a national state of disaster and the imposition of a nationwide lockdown we entered uncharted waters.

src: dit was nog nooit voorheen vir suidafrika nodig om 'n openbare gesondheidsnoodsituasie van hierdie omvang te hanteer nie.
tgt: south africa has never had to deal with a public health emergency of this magnitude.

src: ons moes vinnig optree om lewens te red.
tgt: we had to act quickly to save lives.

src: en ons moet erken dat die voorsiening van ondersteuning aan die land se kwesbaarste burgers in die dae en weke wat hierop gevolg het, stadiger was as wat dit moes wees, en dat sekere probleme oor die hoof gesien is.
tgt: and we must acknowledge that in the days and weeks that have followed, the provision of support to our country’s most vulnerable citizens has been slower than required, and that lapses have occurred.

src: die uitbetaling van maatskaplike toelaes het egter betreklik glad verloop, en ná 'n aantal tegniese uitdagings word die voedselverspreidingstelsel nou gestroomlyn.
tgt: however, the payment of social grants has proceeded relatively smoothly, and after a number of technical challenges, the food distribution system is being streamlined.

src: die instelling van 'n landwye inperkingstoestand op baie kort kennisgewing het tot verskeie uitdagings gelei.
tgt: imposing a nationwide lockdown at very short notice presented several challenges.

src: ons moes die relatiewe uitwerking van die nasionale reaksie opweeg teenoor die omvang van die beperkings wat ons sou moes instel.
tgt: we have had to weigh up the proportionality of the national response and the extent of restrictions we would need to impose.

src: ons het oplaas die roete van omsigtigheid gekies.
tgt: we ultimately chose to err on the side of caution.

src: en soos die ministerie van gesondheid se voorlegging onlangs aangedui het, het die inperking wat ons die afgelope tyd afgedwing het die infeksiekoers vertraag en, selfs belangriker, vir ons tyd gekoop om voor te berei op 'n moontlike toename in infeksies in die komende weke en maande.
tgt: and as the presentation by the ministry of health indicated recently, enforcing a lockdown at the time we did has slowed down the rate of infection and, more importantly, bought us time to prepare for a probable surge in infections in the coming weeks and months.

src: ons moes die impak op 'n reeds sukkelende ekonomie op die lang en kort termyn oorweeg, en ons moes die uitwerking van hierdie wesenlike ontwrigting op die lewensbestaan van miljoene mense in oënskou neem.
tgt: we had to consider the impact on an already floundering economy in both the long and short term, and the impact of this substantial disruption on the livelihoods of millions of people.

src: ons moes nadink oor wat weke se inperking by die huis sou beteken vir werkers wat nie gereelde salarisse kry nie, vir werkloses en mense wat werk soek, vir mense wat informele of seisoenale werk doen, vir diegene in die informele sektor, vir die behoeftiges en vir die kwesbares.
tgt: we had to consider what weeks of confinement to the home would mean for the employed not paid regular salaries, for the unemployed and those seeking work, for those in casual or seasonal employment, for those in the informal sector, for the indigent and for the vulnerable.

src: die kabinet gaan 'n stel maatreëls ﬁ naliseer om te reageer op die uitwerking van die inperking op die lewensbestaan van ons mense.
tgt: cabinet will finalise a set of measures to respond to the impact of the lockdown on the livelihoods of our people.

src: dit is voorafgegaan deur 'n reeks samesprekings met verskeie belanghebbendes, waaronder die sakesektor, georganiseerde arbeid, godsdienstige organisasies, die burgerlike samelewing en die presidensiële ekonomiese adviesraad.
tgt: this has been preceded by a range of engagements with a number of stakeholders including business, labour, religious organisations, civil society and the presidential economic advisory council.

src: die maatskaplike vennote het verskeie voorstelle ingedien oor ingrypings wat die onmiddellike kwesbaarheid van die armstes van die armes, waarvan die meeste staatmaak op maatskaplike hulp om te oorleef, kan verlig.
tgt: the social partners have put forward a number of proposals on interventions that could address the immediate vulnerability of the poorest of the poor, most of whom rely on social assistance to survive.

src: ons sal die voorsiening van welsynsdienste in hierdie tydperk opskerp om huishoudings wat onder die armoedegrens leef, te help.
tgt: we will scale up welfare provision during this period to help households living below the poverty line.

src: selfs as die landswye inperkingstoestand opgehef word, sal die gevolge daarvan nog 'n geruime tyd gevoel word.
tgt: even when the nationwide lockdown is lifted, its effects will continue to be felt for some time to come.

src: diegene wat bevoorreg is om 'n bestendige inkomste te verdien, sal na hul werk kan terugkeer; maar vir miljoene ander sal dit 'n verlore maand wees waar hulle andersins tydelike werk kon gehad het, in die informele sektor sake sou gedoen het of geld kon gespaar het om hul gesinsverantwoordelikhede na te kom.
tgt: those fortunate to have a steady income will be able to return to their jobs; but for millions of others this will be a lost month where they would otherwise have found temporary work, done business in the informal sector or saved money earned to meet their family responsibilities.

src: voedselondersteuning is 'n noodmaatreël op die kort termyn.
tgt: food support is a shortterm emergency measure.

src: dit moet gepaard gaan met volhoubare oplossings wat ons kwesbaarste burgers help om in die moeilike tye wat nog voorlê, te oorleef.
tgt: it will need to be matched by sustainable solutions that help our most vulnerable citizens weather the difficult times that are still to come.

src: ek wil die talle nro's, godsdienstige groepe en gewone burgers bedank wat geld skenk en as vrywilligers help om honger en behoeftige mense te voed.
tgt: i wish to thank the many ngos, religious groups and ordinary citizens who are donating money and volunteer ing to help feed the hungry and destitute.

src: om honger te verlig, is nie 'n daad van barmhartigheid nie.
tgt: alleviating hunger is not an act of charity.

src: dit is 'n noodsaaklikheid vir enige samelewing wat gegrond is op respek vir menseregte.
tgt: it is an imperative for any society that is founded on respect for human rights.

src: ons is op 'n punt in ons stryd teen die pandemie waar oorgerustheid rampspoedig kan wees.
tgt: we are at a point in our battle with the pandemic where complacency could prove disastrous.

src: ek doen 'n beroep op elkeen om waaksaam te bly, om steeds die regulasies na te kom, om veilig te bly en om ander veilig te hou.
tgt: i call on each and every one to remain vigilant, to continue to abide by the regulations, and to keep safe and keep others safe.

src: kleinsake tydens covid19 ondersteun dale hes die onsekerheid en finansiële druk wat deur die globale koronaviruspandemie op entrepreneurs en kleinsakeondernemings geplaas word, word ietwat deur n reeks privaat en staatsondersteuningskemas verlig.
tgt: small business support during covid19 dale hes the uncertainty and financial strain placed on entrepreneurs and small business owners by the global coronavirus pandemic is being alleviated by a host of public and private support schemes.

src: eienaars van kleinsake en informele handelaars is onder diegene in suidafrika wat die ergste deur die grendeltydperk beïnvloed word.
tgt: small business owners and informal traders are amongst the south africans who are most heavily impacted by the lockdown.

src: dié besigheidseienaars kan uit n aantal ingrypings voordeel trek wat die regering in plek gestel het om hulle te help om deur dié moeilike tyd te kom.
tgt: in order to get through this difficult time, these business owners can take advantage of a number of in terventions that govern ment has put in place to assist them.

src: kmmoskuldverligtingsfondsdie departement van kleinsakeontwikkeling het, ná die aankondiging van die grendeltydperk, onmiddellik n verligtingsfonds aan kleinsake wat negatief deur die covid19pandemie beïnvloed word beskikbaar gestel.
tgt: smme debt relief fundfollowing the announce ment of the lockdown, the department of small business development immediately made a debt relief fund available for small businesses negatively affected by the covid19 pandemic.

src: meer as r500 miljoen is deur die fonds beskikbaar gestel, waarvoor kleinen mediumsakeondernemings deur n aanlynaansoekproses moet aansoek doen.
tgt: more than r500 million has been made available through the fund, which small and medium enterprises must apply for through an online application process.

src: hier is die stappe wat gevolg moet word:1. jou besigheid moet op die kmmosuidafrikaportaal geregistreer wees.
tgt: here are the steps that need to be followed:1. your business must be registered on the smme south africa portal.

src: ssmesa.
tgt: smmesa.

src: gov.
tgt: gov.

src: 2. sodra jy geregistreer is, kan jy vir die covid19 kmmoskuldverligtingsfonds aansoek doen.
tgt: 2. once your registration is complete, you can apply for the covid19 smme debt relief fund.

src: die aansoekvorm is op die departement van kleinsakeontwikkeling se webwerf beskikbaar.
tgt: you can find the application form on the department of small business development’s website.

src: 3. verligtingsbefondsing sal binne 12 werksdae aan goedgekeurde aansoekers uitbetaal word, mits jy aan al die kriteria voldoen (soos dat jou besigheid aan belasting onderworpe is en 100% deur suidafrikaners besit word).
tgt: 3. if you meet all the criteria (such as your business being tax compliant and 100 percent owned by south africans), relief funding will be paid out to approved applicants within 12 working days.

src: die kleinsakeontwikkelingsagentskap is beskikbaar om jou te help om aansoek vir die skuldverligtingskema te doen as jy n mikroonderneming besit.
tgt: if you own a microenterprise, then the small enterprise development agency is available to help you to apply to the debt relief scheme.

src: versoeke om hulp moet per epos aan debtrelief@seda.
tgt: requests for assistance must be emailed to debtrelief@seda.

src: org.
tgt: org.

src: za gestuur word.
tgt: za.

src: solidariteitreaksiefondspresident cyril ramaphosa het ook die stigting van die solidariteitreaksiefonds aangekondig, wat n aanvanklike hupstoot van r150 miljoen van die regering ontvang het.
tgt: solidarity response fundpresident cyril ramaphosa also announced the launch of the solidarity response fund, which received a r150 million kickstart from government.

src: die fonds laat organisasies en individue toe om die landwye ondersteuningspogings vir kleinsake en covid19reaksiepogings deur skenkings te ondersteun.
tgt: the fund allows organisations and individuals to donate to the nationwide effort to support small businesses and covid19 response efforts.

src: meer as r2 miljard is gedurende die eerste twee weke van die fonds geskenk, wat vir verligtingspogings gebruik sal word.
tgt: in the first two weeks of the fund, over r2 billion was donated, which will be channelled into relief efforts.

src: ondersteuning vir spazawinkelsdie regering erken die unieke uitdagings van die pandemie op diegene wat in die informele sektor werk.
tgt: support for spaza shopsgovernment has recognised the unique challenges that the pandemic poses to those working in the informal sector.

src: die minister vir kleinsakeontwikkeling, khumbudzo ntshavheni, het in dié verband ook ondersteuningspakkette vir mense wat in dié sektor werk beskikbaar gestel.
tgt: in this respect, minister for small business development khumbudzo ntshavheni has also released support packages for people working in this sector.

src: dit sluit n toegewyde ondersteuningskema vir spazawinkels in.
tgt: this includes a dedicated support scheme for spaza shops.

src: "die spazawinkelondersteuning sal die toegewyde netwerkgeleenthede, aankoopkrag en grootmaataankope deur voorafgekeur en goedgekeurde groothandelaars insluit," verduidelik die minister.
tgt: "the spaza shop support will include dedicated networking, purchasing power and bulk purchasing through preselected and preapproved wholesalers," explains the minister.

src: dié ondersteuning sal spazawinkels in staat stel om toegang tot goedere te verkry wat hulle kan verkoop.
tgt: this support will allow spaza shops to gain access to goods which they can sell.

src: minister ntshavheni voeg by dat die skema ook krediet aan spazawinkeleienaars sal verskaf, wat hulle toegang sal gee tot die geld om voorraad aan te koop.
tgt: minister ntshavheni adds that the scheme will also provide credit to spaza shop owners, to allow them to access the money needed to buy stock.

src: "dit sal opgevolg word met n kredietfasiliteit om spazawinkeleienaars in staat te stel om deurlopend te koop, selfs nadat die covid19uitbraak verby is.
tgt: "this will be followed by a credit facility to enable spaza shop owners to continuously buy, even after the covid19 outbreak is over.

src: "die departement sal ook raad verskaf oor hoe om hulle winkels met sukses te bedryf.
tgt: "the department will also provide advice on how to successfully run their shops.

src: "ons ondersteun hulle ook met besigheidsbestuursondersteuning, omdat ons weet dat spazawinkels probleme aangaande die winsgewende bestuur van die ondernemings ondervind," sê ntshavheni.
tgt: "we are also supporting them with business management support because we know that there are problems in spaza shops running their businesses to be profitable," ntshavheni says.

src: help informele handelaarsdie regering werk ook daaraan om n pakket te skep wat inkomsteverligting sal verskaf aan informele handelaars wat as gevolg van die krisis hulle inkomste verloor het.
tgt: helping informal tradersgovernment is also work ing on creating a package that will provide income relief to informal traders who have lost income due to the crisis.

src: kom ons staan saam in ons stryd teen covid19 vukuzenzele unnamed die hele wêreld is in die meedoënlose greep van die koronaviruspandemie, wat vinnig versprei het.
tgt: let us unite in our fight against covid19 vukuzenzele unnamed the entire world is in the unrelenting grip of the coronavirus pandemic, whose spread has been rapid.

src: daar is nog nie n entstof nie.
tgt: a vaccine has yet to be found.

src: meer as 3,4 miljoen mense wêreldwyd het die virus en meer as 240 000 het reeds daaraan gesterf.
tgt: across the world, over 3.4 million people are known to be infected and more than 240,000 have died.

src: toe die nasionale rampstaat ses weke gelede verklaar is, het suidafrika slegs 61 bevestigde koronavirusinfeksies gehad.
tgt: when the national state of disaster was declared six weeks ago, south africa only had 61 confirmed coronavirus infections.

src: ondanks die betreklike klein hoeveelheid, het deskundiges se menings en internasionale ervaring, aangedui dat infeksies eksponensieel gaan styg.
tgt: despite the relatively low number, expert opinion and international experience indicated that infec tions would rise exponentially.

src: ek het gesê dat dringende en drastiese stappe geneem sou moes word.
tgt: i said that urgent and drastic measures would need to be taken.

src: daardie maatreëls, insluitend n landwye staat van inperking en die sluit van ons grense, was doeltreffend om verspreiding van die siekte te vertraag.
tgt: those measures – which included a nationwide lockdown and the closure of our borders – have proved to be effective in delaying the spread of the disease.

src: dit was moontlik omdat die meeste suidafrikaners die inperkingsreëls, soos die toepas van sosiale afstand en die dra van gesigmaskers, nagekom het.
tgt: this has been possible because most south africans have adhered to the lockdown provisions, practising social distancing and wearing face masks.

src: ek prys julle hiervoor, asook vir al die ander opofferings wat julle gemaak het.
tgt: i applaud you for this and for all the other sacrifices you have made.

src: ander lande het in dié stadium van die pandemie se verloop, baie meer infeksies as ons gehad.
tgt: at this stage in the progress of the pandemic, other countries had far more infections than we do.

src: tot op hede, 46 dae sedert ons ons 100ste koronavirusgeval aangeteken het, het ons 6 783 bevestigde gevalle.
tgt: as of now – which is 46 days since we recorded our 100th coronavirus case – we have 6,783 confirmed cases.

src: op die 46dae merk het italië, met n soortgelyke bevolkingstal as ons, meer as 140 000 gevalle en die verenigde state ongeveer 700 000 bevestigde gevalle, gehad.
tgt: italy, which has a similar size population to ours, had more than 140,000 cases and the united states had around 700,000 confirmed cases at the 46day mark.

src: dit beteken egter nie dat die gevaar nou verby is nie.
tgt: but this does not mean that the danger has passed.

src: ons het nog glad nie die toppunt van infeksies in suidafrika bereik nie.
tgt: we have not nearly reached the peak of infections in south africa.

src: al die wetenskaplike modelle toon dat die infeksiekoers in die volgende paar maande steeds teen n baie vinniger koers kan styg.
tgt: all the scientific models show that the infection rate will continue to rise at a much faster rate in the next few months.

src: die tempo waarteen die virus versprei en die aantal mense wat uiteindelik die virus gaan opdoen, sal egter bepaal word deur wat ons nou doen.
tgt: however, the speed with which the virus spreads and the number of people who are ultimately infected will be determined by what we do now.

src: dit is waarom die staat van inperking geleidelik en versigtig verslap moet word.
tgt: that is why the easing of the lockdown needs to be gradual and cautious.

src: dit is om dié rede dat baie regulasies steeds gehandhaaf moet word en waarom dit absoluut noodsaaklik is dat mense dit nakom.
tgt: it is for this reason that many regulations need to remain in place and why it is absolutely essential that people observe them.

src: ek weet hoe moeilik dit is en ek verstaan die besorgdheid van baie van ons landgenote oor hoe dié regulasies inbreuk maak op hulle regte en dit beperk, maar dit is alles noodsaaklik.
tgt: i know how difficult this is and i understand the concern that many of our compatriots have about how these regulations are interfering and limiting their rights.

src: ons oorheersende doelwit is om lewens te red.
tgt: our overriding objective is the preservation of life.

src: sosiale afstand en behoorlike higiëne is steeds ons beste en enigste beskerming in dié stryd.
tgt: social distancing and proper hygiene are still our best and only defences in this struggle.

src: dit is wat die regulasies wat ons vir vlak 4 van ons reaksie ingestel het, teweegbring.
tgt: this is what informs the regulations we have put in place for level 4 of our response.

src: ons oorwegings is gegrond op empiriese bewyse, sowel as wetenskaplike en ekonomiese data en internasionale beste praktyk.
tgt: our considerations are based on empirical evidence, scientific and economic data and international best practice.

src: regter arthur chaskalson het in 1994 in die uitspraak van die grondwetlike hof wat die doodstraf as onwettig verklaar het, geskryf: "die regte tot lewe en waardigheid is die belangrikste menseregte en die bron van alle ander persoonlike regte.
tgt: in the 1995 judgment of the constitutional court that outlawed capital punishment, jus tice arthur chaskalson wrote: "the rights to life and dignity are the most important of all human rights and the source of all other personal rights.

src: deur onsself aan n samelewing wat op die erkenning van menseregte gegrond is, te verbind, word daar van ons vewag om dié twee regte bo alle ander te stel.
tgt: by committing ourselves to a society founded on the recognition of human rights we are required to value these two rights above all others.

src: "die regulasies wat ons ingestel het, is gegrond op daardie toewyding aan lewe en waardigheid en dit regverdig, in dié uiterste omstandighede, tydelike beperkings op ander regte, soos vryheid van beweging en assosiasie.
tgt: "the regulations we have put in place are founded on that commitment to life and dignity, and which justify – in these extreme circumstances – temporary restrictions on other rights, like freedom of movement and association.

src: deur dit te doen, het suidafrika nie anders as baie ander lande opgetree nie.
tgt: in doing this, south africa is not unlike many other countries.

src: daar word beraam dat n vyfde van die wêreld se bevolking onder kwarantyn of in n nasionale staat van inperking is, terwyl dié getal vinnig styg in reaksie op toenemende infeksies.
tgt: an estimated onefifth of the world’s population is under quarantine or nationwide lockdown, with this number growing rapidly in response to rising infections.

src: dit sluit lande met aansienlik groter bevolkings as ons s'n in, soos indië, met 1,5 miljard mense.
tgt: this includes countries with substantially larger populations than ours, like india with its 1.5 billion people.

src: tientalle lande het aandklokreëls ingestel, soos wat nou hier ingestel is.
tgt: dozens of countries have imposed curfews such as the one that is now in place here.

src: beperkings op beweging is in verskeie lande ingestel.
tgt: limitations on movement are in place in a number of countries.

src: in brittanje en die franse hoofstad, parys, is openbare fisiese oefening tot sekere ure en binne n sekere afstand van n mens se huis af, beperk.
tgt: in the uk and the french capital, paris, public exercise is limited to certain hours and within a certain distance of one’s home.

src: inperkingen voorkomingsmaatreëls wat soortgelyk aan ons s'n is, is in verskeie lande ingestel.
tgt: containment and prevention measures similar to ours are in place in a number of countries.

src: byvoorbeeld, die verkoop van alkohol tydens die inperking is in verskeie grondgebiede en deur plaaslike regerings beperk of verbied, insluitend dele van meksiko, hongkong en groenland, wat verlede maand n verbod op alkoholverkope tydens die inperking ingestel het om infeksies asook ‘geweld teen vroue en kinders' te beperk.
tgt: for example, alcohol sales during lockdown have been either restricted or banned in a number of territories and by local governments, including parts of mexico, hong kong and greenland, which last month imposed a ban on alcohol sales during lockdown to limit infection but also ‘to curb violence against women and children.’there has been much public comment on government’s decision to extend the prohibition on the sale of tobacco products into level 4. a decision like this is bound to be controversial, but it is wrong to suggest that there are ministers or a president doing and saying whatever they want on this matter.

src: ek het op 23 april aangekondig dat die verkoop van sigarette tydens vlak 4 toegelaat sou word.
tgt: on 23 april, i announced that cigarette sales would be permitted during level 4. this was based on the view of the national coronavirus command council (nccc), and which was contained in the draft framework that was published for consulation.

src: dit was gegrond op die mening van die nasionale koronavirusbeheerraad (nkb) soos vervat in die konsepraamwerk wat vir konsultasie gepubliseer is.
tgt: after careful consideration and discussion, the nccc reconsidered its position on tobacco.

src: die nkb het na deeglike oorweging en bespreking, sy posisie oor tabak heroorweeg.
tgt: as a result, the regulations ratified by cabinet and announced by minister nkosazana dlaminizuma on 29 april extended the prohibition.

src: dit het daartoe gelei dat die die regulasies wat deur die kabinet bekragtig is en op 29 april deur minister nkosazana dlaminizuma aangekondig is, die verbod verleng het.
tgt: this was a collective decision and the public statements by both myself and the minister were done on behalf of, and mandated by, the collective i lead.

src: elke regulasie wat ons ingestel het, is deeglik oorweeg.
tgt: every regulation we have put in place has been carefully considered.

src: ons het voortdurend mediese deskundiges, verskeie kiesafdelings en verskillende industrieë geraadpleeg.
tgt: along the way there has been consultation with medical experts, various constituencies and different industries.

src: ons is deur internasionale instansies en die ervaring van ander lande gelei.
tgt: we have been guided by international bodies and the experience of other countries.

src: die werklikheid is dat ons in onbekende waters vaar.
tgt: the reality is that we are sailing in unchartered waters.

src: daar is steeds baie dinge oor die virus se epidemiologie wat onbekend is.
tgt: there is still a great deal about the epidemiology of the virus that is unknown.

src: dit is beter om nou versigtig wees as om die rampspoedige prys vir n toekomstige oordeelsfout te betaal.
tgt: it is better to err on the side of caution than to pay the devastating price of a lapse in judgment in future.

src: hoewel daar uiteenlopende menings oor sommige van die besluite is wat ons geneem het – en dit in sommige gevalle opvattings gepolariseer het – doen die regering alles moontlik om op n manier op te tree wat die reg tot lewe en waardigheid van al ons mense bevorder.
tgt: while there are differing views on some of the decisions we have taken – and in some instances these have polarised opinion – government is making every effort to act in a way that advances the rights to life and dignity of all our people.

src: een van die onderskeidende kenmerke van hoe ons, as die regering, dié pandemie hanteer, is dat ons tydens dié tydperk na ons mense en hulle bekommernisse luister.
tgt: listening to our people and their concerns during this period has been one of the distinguishing features of how we as government have managed this pandemic.

src: ons sal steeds na ons mense se bekommernisse luister en is bereid om wysigings te maak wat mense se besorgdheid oor die uitdagings wat hulle in die gesig staar, met die behoefte om lewens te red, balanseer.
tgt: we continue to listen to the concerns of our people and are prepared to make adjustments that balance people’s concerns about the challenges they face with the need to save lives.

src: in dié moeilike tyd, moet ons ons gesamentlike krag daarop rig om te verseker dat ons mense gesond bly en dat lewens gered word, asook dat die voorsiening van kos, water, gesondheidsorg, maatskaplike sekerheid en maatskaplike ondersteuning nie onderbreek word nie.
tgt: at this difficult time, our collective energies must be focused on ensuring that health and life is preserved, that the delivery of food, water, health care, social security and social support is not disrupted.

src: tapvirstap gids vir die gebruik van gesigmaskers vukuzenzele unnamed die nasionale departement van gesondheid beveel aan dat almal in suidafrika n materiaalgesigmasker (ook genoem n niemediese masker) dra wanneer hulle in die openbaar is.
tgt: step by step guide on using a facemask vukuzenzele unnamed the national department of health recommends that everyone in south africa should wear a cloth facemask (also known as a nonmedical mask) when in public.

src: pendelaars wat taxi's en ander vorme van openbare vervoer gebruik, asook mense wat tyd op plekke deurbring waar dit moeilik is om jou fisies van ander mense te distansieer, word veral aangemoedig om gesigmaskers te dra.
tgt: commuters travelling in taxis and other forms of public transport, as well as people spending time in spaces where physical distancing is difficult to practice, are mustwear cloth facemasks.

src: die hoofvoordeel wanneer almal n gesigmasker dra, is dat dit die hoeveelheid koronavirus (covid19) druppels wat deur mense wat die virus het, uitgehoes word, verminder, wat dus die verspreiding deur druppels beperk.
tgt: the main benefit of everyone wearing a facemask is to reduce the amount of coronavirus (covid19) being coughed up by those with the infection thereby reducing its spread through droplets.

src: almal behoort n gesigmasker te dra, aangesien sommige mense, wat die koronavirus het, nie simptome het nie of nie weet dat hulle die virus het nie.
tgt: since some people with the coronavirus may not have symptoms or may not know they are infected, everyone should wear a facemask.

src: asemhalingshigiëne vir die dra van materiaalgesigmaskers materiaalgesigmaskers word as deel van asemhalingshigiëne of reëls aanbeveel, wat onder meer bepaal dat jy in jou gebuigde elmboog of n snesie moet hoes of nies.
tgt: cloth facemask respiratory hygienecloth facemasks are recommended as part of respiratory hygiene or etiquette which also includes coughing and sneezing into a bent elbow or a tissue.

src: die gesigmasker moet die neus en mond heeltemal bedek.
tgt: the facemask must cover the nose and mouth completely.

src: gesigmaskers behoort nie afgehaal te word wanneer daar gepraat, gehoes of genies word nie.
tgt: facemasks should not be lowered when speaking, coughing or sneezing.

src: dit is baie belangrik dat materiaalgesigmaskers reg gebruik word.
tgt: it is very important that cloth masks are used correctly.

src: die verkeerde gebruik kan daartoe lei dat gebruikers hulself daaraan blootstel om covid19 te versprei.
tgt: incorrect use might result in users putting themselves at risk of spreading covid19.

src: selfs al dra jy n masker, moet jy steeds: jou hande was sosiale afstand handhaaf onthou om in jou gebuigde elmboog te hoes of te nies nie met ongewaste hande aan jou oë, neus of mond raak nie.
tgt: even when you are wearing a mask you must still: wash your hands observe social distancing remember to sneeze and cough into your elbow avoid touching your eyes, nose or mouth with unclean hands.

src: die publiek behoort nie chirurgiese (mediese) maskers of n95asemhalingsmaskers te gebruik nie, want dit word vir gesondheidsorgwerkers en ander frontlinie mediese personeel gespaar.
tgt: the public should not use surgical (medical) or n95 respirator masks because these are reserved for healthcare workers and other medical first responders.

src: vmei 2020 uitgawe 2hoe om jou materiaalmasker te hanteer 1. gebruik slegs 'n masker wat gewas en gestryk is.2.
tgt: may 2020 edition 2how to handle your cloth mask 1. only use a mask that has been washed and ironed.2.

src: was jou hande voordat jy die masker opsit.3.
tgt: wash your hands before putting the mask on.3.

src: sit die masker met die regte kant na jou gesig toe op en maak seker dat dit jou neus en mond behoorlik bedek.4.
tgt: place the mask with the correct side facing your face, and ensure that it covers both your nose and mouth properly.4.

src: bind die toutjies agter jou kop vas, of as jy rekkies gebruik, maak seker dat die rekkies die masker styf vashou.5.
tgt: tie the strings behind your head, or if you are using elastic bands, make sure these are tight.5.

src: maak seker dat dit goed pas.
tgt: make sure it fits well.

src: beweeg dit rond totdat dit goed pas.
tgt: move it around to get the best fit.

src: moet nooit aan die materiaalgedeelte vat nie.6.
tgt: never touch the cloth part.6.

src: wanneer jy die masker opgesit het, moet jy nie aan jou gesig vat voordat jy dit afgehaal het nie.7.
tgt: once you have put on the mask, do not touch your face again until you take it off.7.

src: wanneer jy die masker afhaal, maak die toutjies los, vou die masker onderstebo, hou dit vas aan die toutjies/rekkies en sit dit in 'n houer wat spesifiek vir die was van materiaalmaskers opsygesit is.8.
tgt: when you take it off, undo the ties, and carefully fold the mask inside out, hold it by the strings/elastic and place the mask in a container reserved for washing the cloth mask.8.

src: was jou hande deeglik en droog hulle behoorlik af voordat jy enigiets anders doen.9.
tgt: wash your hands thoroughly and dry before do ing anything else.9.

src: daar moet minstens twee materiaalmaskers per persoon wees sodat een gewas kan word en daar een skoon masker vir gebruik is.10.
tgt: you must have at least two cloth masks per person so you will be able to wash one and have a clean one ready for use.10.

src: maskers moet met seep en warm water gewas word, behoorlik uitgespoel en gestryk word.
tgt: masks should be washed with soap and hot water, rinsed thoroughly and ironed.

src: die belangrikheid van sosiale afstand sosiale afstand is uiters belangrik in die stryd teen covid19 omdat dit help om die verspreiding van dié siekte regoor die land te beperk.
tgt: the importance of social distancing in the battle against the highly infectious covid19, social distancing is extremely important to help curb the spread of this disease across the country.

src: sosiale afstand beteken dat jy 'n veilige afstand van ongeveer 2m van ander mense af moet wegbly, sodat jy die oordrag van covid 19 beperk.
tgt: social distancing is about keeping a safe distance of about 2 metres from others so that you reduce the transmission of covid19.

src: ons demokrasie sal ons help om covid19 te oorwin vukuzenzele unnamed ons aanvaar dikwels ons gesonde en lewenskragtige demokrasie as vanselfsprekend.
tgt: our democracy will help us overcome covid19 vukuzenzele unnamed we often take our healthy and robust democracy for granted.

src: dit is egter waarskynlik ons belangrikste bate in ons gewigtige stryd om die koronaviruspandemie te oorwin.
tgt: yet it is probably our greatest asset in our momentous struggle to overcome the coronavirus pandemic.

src: ons het van die mees polities betrokke burgery ter wêreld.
tgt: we have among the most politicallyengaged citizenry in the world.

src: 'n opname wat in 2018 deur die pew navorsingsentrum gedoen is, dui daarop dat suidafrikaners besonder geneig is om politieke stappe te doen oor kwessies waaroor hulle baie sterk voel, soos gesondheidsorg, onderwys, vryheid van spraak en korrupsie.
tgt: a poll in 2018 by the pew research center shows south africans are strongly inclined to take political action about issues they feel most strongly about, such as health care, education, freedom of speech and corruption.

src: die opname bevestig heelwat van wat ons reeds oor onsself weet.
tgt: the poll confirms much that we already know about ourselves.

src: ons geniet niks meer as om in robuuste gesprekke oor aktuele sake met ons regerings en ons medeburgers te tree nie.
tgt: we enjoy nothing more than robust engagement with our government and among ourselves on the burning issues of the day.

src: ons het 'n aktiewe burgerlike samelewing, wat immer gereed staan om ons fundamentele vryhede en regte te beskerm.
tgt: we have an active civil society ever ready to safeguard our fundamental freedoms and rights.

src: een van die oorwinnings van ons demokrasie is dat elke suidafrikaner glo dat die grondwet hulle beskerm en dat die howe 'n regverdige en onpartydige arbiter van hul belange is.
tgt: one of the triumphs of our democracy is that every south african believes the constitution protects them and that the courts are a fair and impartial arbiter of their interests.

src: tydens 'n onlangse besoek aan die ooskaap om die provinsie se koronagereedheidstoestand te evalueer, het ek al hoe meer oor hierdie kwessies begin nadink.
tgt: i got thinking on these matters during a recent visit to the eastern cape to assess the province’s coronavirus state of readiness.

src: 'n joernalis het my gevra of ek bekommerd is oor die hangende hofsaak wat verskeie bepalings van die wet op rampbestuur uitdaag.
tgt: i was asked by a journalist whether i was concerned at the pending litigation challenging certain provisions of the disaster management act.

src: hierdie wet is die basis vir al die regulasies wat ingevolge die nasionale ramptoestand uitgevaardig is om die koronavirus te bestry.
tgt: this law is the basis for all the regulations promulgated under the national state of disaster we declared to combat coronavirus.

src: sedert die begin van hierdie krisis het verskeie mense al hul reg uitgeoefen om hof toe te gaan.
tgt: since the start of this crisis, a number of people have exercised their right to approach the courts.

src: die inperkingsmaatreëls is reeds in die eerste week van die inperking deur 'n inwoner van mpumalanga uitgedaag, wat van die reisverbod vrygestel wou word om 'n begrafnis te gaan bywoon.
tgt: the lockdown regulations were challenged in the very first week of the lockdown by a private citizen from mpumalanga who wanted an exemption from the travel prohibition to attend a funeral.

src: in die sewe (7) weke wat daarop gevolg het, is 'n hele aantal hofaansoeke deur verskeie individue, godsdiensliggame, politieke partye, nro’s en sakeorganisasies gebring teen een of meer van die inperkingsmaatreëls waarmee hulle ontevrede was.
tgt: in the seven (7) weeks that have followed, there have been legal challenges from a number of individuals, religious bodies, political parties, ngos and from business organisations against one measure or more of the lockdown provisions they were unhappy with.

src: party was suksesvol en ander nie.
tgt: some have succeeded in their legal challenges and some have not.

src: sommige het die howe op 'n dringende basis genader, en hul argumente is verwerp, terwyl ander weer alternatiewe regshulp gevind het.
tgt: some had approached the courts on the basis of the urgency of their cases had their urgency arguments dismissed and others have found other avenues for the relief they sought.

src: ander het later besluit om hul aansoeke terug te trek ná gesprekke met die regering.
tgt: others have subsequently withdrawn their applications following engagement with government.

src: hoewel ons natuurlik eerder regstappe teen die regering wil vermy, moet ons aanvaar dat inwoners wat ontevrede is met watter stappe die regering ook al besluit om te implementeer, altyd die reg het om ons howe met die oog op regshulp te nader.
tgt: while we would prefer to avoid the need for any legal action against government, we should accept that citizens who are unhappy with whatever action that government has decided on implementing have a right to approach our courts for any form of relief they seek.

src: dit is 'n normale beginsel van 'n grondwetlike demokrasie en 'n totaal aanvaarde praktyk in 'n land wat op regsoewereiniteit gegrond is.
tgt: this is a normal tenet of a constitutional democracy and a perfectly acceptable practice in a country founded on the rule of law.

src: ons het wigte en teenwigte van toepassing om te verseker dat elke aspek van ons bestuur en beheer noukeurige grondwetlike ondersoek kan slaag.
tgt: we have checks and balances in place to ensure that every aspect of governance is able to withstand constitutional scrutiny.

src: benewens ons howe, is ons hoofstuk 9instellings ook daarop gerig om ons landsburgers se regte te bevorder en beskerm, net soos die liggame wat met die oorsigfunksie van die wetstoepassingsagentskappe belas is.
tgt: besides our courts, our chapter 9 institutions exist to advance the rights of citizens, as do the bodies tasked with oversight over the law enforcement agencies.

src: soos ek vir die joernalis gesê het, elke suidafrikaner het die reg om die howe te nader en selfs ek, as president, kan nooit in die pad staan van enigiemand wat daardie reg uitoefen nie.
tgt: as i told the journalist, every south african has a right to approach the courts and even i, as president, could never stand in the way of anybody exercising that right.

src: daar was robuuste en skerp kritiek teen verskeie aspekte van ons nasionale reaksie op die koronaviruspandemie, van die datamodellering en projeksies en die ekonomiese gevolge van die inperking, tot die regulasies – en hierdie kritiek sal ongetwyfeld in die toekoms voortduur.
tgt: there has been, and will continue to be, robust and strident critique of a number of aspects of our national response to coronavirus, from the data modelling and projections, to the economic effects of the lockdown, to the regulations.

src: ons as die regering het nog nooit gevra dat sulke kritiek onderdruk of stilgemaak moet word nie.
tgt: as government we have neither called for such critique to be tempered or for it to be silenced.

src: inteendeel, waar kritiek opbouend is, help dit ons om aan te pas en vinnig op veranderende omstandighede en toestande te reageer.
tgt: to the contrary, criticism, where it is constructive, helps us to adapt and to move with agility in response to changing circumstances and conditions.

src: dit verryk openbare debatvoering en gee vir ons almal 'n breër begrip van die kwessies wat ter sprake is.
tgt: it enriches public debate and gives us all a broader understanding of the issues at play.

src: ons het deurentyd volgehou dat ons op wetenskaplike, ekonomiese en empiriese data steun wanneer ons besluite neem en regulasies as deel van ons koronavirusreaksie formuleer.
tgt: we have consistently maintained that we rely on scientific, economic and empirical data when it comes to making decisions and formulating regulations around our coronavirus response.

src: ons het onder hierdie uitdagende omstandighede sover moontlik daarna gestreef om met belanghebbers oorleg te pleeg.
tgt: to the greatest extent possible under these challenging circumstances, we aim for consultation and engagement.

src: ons wil hê dat alle suidafrikaners deel van hierdie nasionale poging is.
tgt: we want all south africans to be part of this national effort.

src: gewone landsburgers se stemme moet altyd steeds tydens hierdie kritieke tyd gehoor word.
tgt: the voices of ordinary citizens must continue to be heard at a time as critical as this.

src: die koronaviruspandemie en die maatreëls wat ons getref het om dit te bestry, het reeds 'n massiewe negatiewe impak op ons mense gehad.
tgt: the coronavirus pandemic and the measures we have taken to combat it have taken a heavy toll on our people.

src: dit het geweldige ontwrigting en ontbering veroorsaak.
tgt: it has caused huge disruption and hardship.

src: hoewel ons beduidende vordering gemaak het om die oordrag van die virus te vertraag, is daar steeds 'n lang en moeilike pad voor.
tgt: although we can point to the progress we have made in delaying the transmission of the virus, there is still a long way to go.

src: die volgende weke en maande sal nie maklik wees nie, en sal nog meer van ons mense verg.
tgt: the weeks and months ahead will be difficult and will demand much more from our people.

src: die pandemie sal dus in die toekoms steeds enorme druk op ons samelewing en ons instellings uitoefen.
tgt: the pandemic will therefore continue to place an enormous strain on our society and our institutions.

src: die uitwerking op mense se materiële omstandighede sal ingrypend wees, selfs terwyl ons die ekonomie geleidelik ontsluit.
tgt: even as we gradually open up the economy, the impact on people’s material conditions will be severe.

src: en solank dit die geval is, bestaan die potensiaal vir konflik, onenigheid en ontevredenheid.
tgt: for as long as this is the case, the potential for conflict, discord and dissatisfaction will remain.

src: maar terwyl ons ons pad deur hierdie troebel waters vind, bly ons grondwet ons heel belangrikste riglyn en ons waardevolste beskermingsmaatreël.
tgt: as we navigate these turbu lent waters, our constitution is our most important guide and our most valued protection.

src: ons robuuste demokrasie verskaf die krag en die veerkragtigheid wat ons benodig om hierdie diepgaande krisis te oorkom.
tgt: our robust democracy provides the strength and the resilience we need to overcome this deep crisis.

src: net soos die regering besef dat die meeste hofaansoeke deur mense se algemene welstand gemotiveer word, moet ons ook insien dat die besluite wat die regering neem in goeie trou geneem word en daarop gerig is om die belange van alle suidafrikaners te bevorder, en nie te benadeel nie.
tgt: just as government appreciates that most court appli cants are motivated by the common good, so too should we recognise that the decisions taken by government are made in good faith and are meant to advance, and not to harm, the interests of south africans.

src: ons allerbelangrikste prioriteit is om lewens te red.
tgt: our foremost priority remains to save lives.

src: elke besluit wat ons neem, berus op die strewe om die reg op lewe en waardigheid soos dit in ons grondwet uiteengesit word, te bevorder.
tgt: our every decision is informed by the need to advance the rights to life and dignity as set out in our constitution.

src: ons sal in die toekoms steeds verskillende – selfs afwykende – sienings oor ons nasionale koronavirusreaksie verwelkom.
tgt: we will continue to welcome different – even dissenting – viewpoints around our national coronavirus response.

src: al hierdie sienings en menings help ons om beter en slimmer te werk.
tgt: all viewpoints aid us and help us to work better and smarter.

src: die uitoefening van ons fundamentele vryhede van uitdrukking, assosiasie en spraak is 'n barometer van ons demokrasie se welstand.
tgt: the exercise of the fundamental freedoms of expression, association and speech is a barometer of the good health of our democracy.

src: sigaretverbod sal lewens red silusapho nyanda rokers wat die koronavirus (covid19) opdoen, loop die gevaar om ernstiger simptome te ontwikkel.
tgt: cigarette ban will save lives silusapho nyanda smokers who con tract the corona virus (covid19) are at risk of suffering more severe symptoms.

src: covid19 is 'n respiratoriese virus (virus wat die asemhalingstelsel aantas).
tgt: covid19 is a respiratory virus.

src: rokers loop dus dubbel die gevaar om ernstiger simptome te ontwikkel as mense wat nog nooit gerook het nie, sê dr catherine egbe, 'n spesialiswetenskaplike by die suidafrikaanse mediese navorsingsraad se eenheid vir alkohol, tabaken dwelmnavorsing.
tgt: as such, smokers are twice as likely to suffer more serious symptoms than people who have never smoked, says dr catherine egbe, a specialist scientist at the south african medical research council’s alcohol, tobacco and other drug research unit.

src: dr egbe sê dat daar reeds bewys is dat rook verskeie onderliggende mediese toestande veroorsaak wat met ernstige simptome van covid19 verbind word.
tgt: dr egbe says that smoking is known to cause many of the underlying medical conditions that have been linked to severe symptoms of covid19.

src: dit sluit in: kanker hartsiekte en beroerte asma diabetes.
tgt: these include: cancers heart disease and stroke asthma diabetes.

src: "selfs al veroorsaak rook nie direk dat 'n roker aan covid19 sterf nie, kan dit steeds indirek die oorsaak wees, omdat rokers meer waarskynlik aan die siektes ly wat daartoe kan bydra dat mense aan covid19 sterf," sê sy.
tgt: "even if smoking does not directly cause a smoker to die from covid19, it could cause this indirectly because smokers are more likely to have the diseases that could make a person die of the virus," she says.

src: daarbenewens beskadig sigaretrook bykans elke orgaan in die liggaam en verminder in die algemeen die liggaam se vermoë om siektes te bestry.
tgt: in addition to this, cigarette smoking harms nearly every organ of the body and generally reduces the body’s ability to fight diseases.

src: dr egbe sê dat tabakrook meer as 7 000 chemikalieë produseer; 250 hiervan is as toksies vir die menslike liggaam bewys.
tgt: dr egbe says that tobacco smoking produces more than 7 000 chemicals; 250 of these chemicals have been confirmed to be toxic to the human body.

src: negeensestig van hierdie 250 chemikalieë veroorsaak kanker.
tgt: out of these 250 chemicals, 69 are known to cause cancer.

src: dit benadeel rokers se gesondheid asook die gesondheid van diegene wat aan tweedehandse rook blootgestel word, verduidelik dr egbe.
tgt: this reduces the health of smokers as well as those exposed to secondhand smoke, dr egbe explains.

src: sy sê dat diegene wat aan tb of asma ly ook as hoërisiko pasiënte vir covid19 beskou word.
tgt: she says that those who have tb and asthma are also highrisk patients where covid19 is concerned.

src: "daar is bewyse dat mense wat aan asma ly die risiko loop om ernstige simptome te ontwikkel of selfs te sterf as hulle covid19 opdoen.
tgt: "so far, there is evidence to show that those who have asthma are at risk of having severe symptoms or even dying if they contract cov id19.

src: daar is nog nie enige studies oor tbpasiënte se risiko gepubliseer nie, maar die wêreldgesondheidsorganisasie het gewaarsku dat dit nie onwaarskynlik is dat mense wat tb het swak op behandeling sal reageer as hulle covid19 opdoen nie.
tgt: there is no study that has been published showing tb patients’ risk but the world health organisation has warned that it is not unlikely that persons with tb will have poor treatment outcomes if they contract covid19.

src: "sy sê die besluit om die verkoop van sigarette onder die huidige inperkingsvlak te verbied, is in die publiek se belang.
tgt: "she says the decision to ban the sale of cigarettes under the current lockdown level is in the interests of the people.

src: verkoop van sigarettepresident cyril ramaphosa het aanvanklik aangekondig dat sigaretverkope onder vlak 4 toegelaat sal word, maar die regering het die besluit omgekeer nadat die nasionale koronavirusbevelsraad met mediese kenners en verskeie rolspelers oorleg gepleeg het.
tgt: sale of cigarettepresident cyril ramapho sa had initially announced that under level 4, cigarette sales would be allowed but government reversed the decision after the national coronavirus command council consulted with medical experts and various roleplayers.

src: dr egbe sê dat, benewens die direkte gesondheidsimplikasies van rook, sigarette dikwels onder vriende gedeel word, wat tot vinniger verspreiding van covid19 in gemeenskappe kan lei.
tgt: dr egbe says apart from the direct health implications of smoking, cigarettes are often shared among friends which can lead to faster community transmission of covid19.

src: "onthou, mense word versoek om nie aan hul mond, neus en oë te raak nie.
tgt: "remember, people are being asked to avoid touching their mouth, nose and eyes.

src: wanneer 'n persoon rook, sal hy of sy nie daardie higiënepraktyk kan nakom nie," sê dr egbe.
tgt: when a person is smoking, he or she will not be able to keep to that hygiene practice," says dr egbe.

src: gegewe dat ons in 'n land woon met 'n hoë voorkoms van onder meer miv/vigs, tb, dwelmmisbruik en alkoholisme, glo dr egbe dat die regering die regte besluit geneem het.
