tgt: in a country with a high prevalence of hiv/aids, tb, substance abuse and alcoholism, among others, dr egbe believes that government made the right call.

src: sy sê dat die regering die data tot sy beskikking gebruik om voorkomende maatreëls in te stel om suidafrikaners voortdurend teen toestande soos dié wat in lande soos italië ontstaan het, te beskerm.
tgt: she says government is using the data at its disposal to take precautionary meas ures to continue to protect south africa from experiencing the scenes witnessed in countries like italy.

src: "dit is nie 'n permanente verbod nie; mense moet dit onthou," sê sy.
tgt: "it’s not a permanent ban; people must remember that," she says.

src: suidafrika het tans 'n beperkte aantal ventilators, en indien die aantal mense wat ventilators gedurende die pandemie benodig skerp styg, sal die land hom in 'n posisie bevind waar diegene wat hulp nodig het, nie gehelp kan word nie.
tgt: currently, south africa has a limited number of ventilators and should the number of those needing ventilators spike during the pandemic, the country would find itself in a corner and not be able to help those who need aid.

src: "ons het net meer as 3 000 ventilators.
tgt: "we have a little over 3 000 ventilator s. imagine if those above 65 years who are smokers, happen to need ventilators.

src: dink net wat sal gebeur as mense wat ouer as 65 is en rokers is, ventilators sou benodig.
tgt: we will need over 10 000 ventilators only for that group alone.

src: dit is een van die probleme wat die regering probeer vermy.
tgt: that is one of the things that government is trying to avoid.

src: ons hoop dat mense dit sal beskou as 'n goed genoeg rede om op te hou rook," sê sy.
tgt: we hope that people will see this as a good reason to quit smoking," she says.

src: het jy geweet?
tgt: did you know?

src: jy kan die nasionale raad teen rook by 011 720 3145 skakel om jou te help om op te hou rook.
tgt: you can call the national council against smoking at 011 720 3145 to assist you to quit smoking.

src: die kankervereniging van suidafrika bied 'n aanlynprogram aan wat ondersteuning en inligting aan rokers wat wil ophou rook bied.
tgt: the cancer association of south africa runs an online programme, which provides support and information for smokers who would like to stop smoking on http://www.

src: sa beweeg na waarskuwingsvlak 3 vukuzenzele unnamed president cyril rama phosa het aangekon dig dat suidafrika met ingang van 1 junie na vlak 3 beweeg het – met die gepaardgaande ontsluiting van meer sektore van die ekonomie en die opheffing van 'n aantal beperkings op mense se bewegings.
tgt: sa moves to alert level 3 vukuzenzele unnamed president cyril rama phosa has announced that south africa has moved to level 3 with effect from 1 june with more sectors of the economy opening and the removal of a number of restrictions on the movement of people.

src: tydens sy toespraak oor die ontwikkelings in suidafrika se risikoaangepaste strategie om die verspreiding van covid19 te bestuur, het die president gesê dat die land 'n gedifferensieerde benadering volg in die hantering van gebiede met veel hoër infeksieen oordragvlakke.
tgt: addressing the nation re cently on the developments in south africa’s riskadjusted strategy to manage the spread of the coronavirus (covid19), the president says the country will have a differentiated approach to deal with areas that have far higher levels of infection and transmission.

src: covid19 brandpuntehierdie gebiede is tot korona virusbrandpunte verklaar, en sluit die volgende metro's in: stad tshwane stad johannesburg ekurhuleni ethekwini nelson mandelabaai buffalo city en kaapstad.
tgt: covid19 hotspotsthese areas have been de clared as coronavirus disease hotspots.

src: ander gebiede wat as brandpunte geïdentifiseer is, is die weskus, die overberg en die kaapse wynlanddistriksmunisipaliteite in die weskaap, chris hanidistrik in die ooskaap, en ilembedistrik in kwazulunatal.
tgt: they include the following metros: city of tshwane city of johannesburg ekurhuleni ethekwini nelson mandela bay buffalo city cape town.

src: 'n brandpunt word omskryf as 'n gebied met meer as vyf besmette mense per elke 100 000 mense, of waar nuwe infeksies teen 'n vinnige tempo toeneem.
tgt: other areas that have been identified as hotspots are the west coast, overberg and cape winelands district municipalities in the western cape, chris hani district in the eastern cape and ilembe district in kwazulunatal.

src: ten einde die virus in hierdie gebiede te hanteer, sal die regering intensiewe ingrypings maatreëls implementeer, wat daarop gerig is om die aantal nuwe infeksies te verminder.
tgt: to deal with the virus in these areas, government will implement intensive interventions aimed at decreasing the number of new infections.

src: "ons implementeer beter maatreëls vir waarneming, infeksiebeheer en bestuur.
tgt: "we are putting in place enhanced measures of surveillance, infection control and management.

src: ons sal 'n voltydse span bestaande uit ervare personeel aan elke brandpunt toewys," het die president verduidelik.
tgt: we will assign a fulltime team of experienced personnel to each hotspot," the president says.

src: hierdie spanne sal bestaan uit epidemioloë, huisartse, verpleegpersoneel, gemeen skapsgesondheidswerkers, kenners op die terrein van openbare gesondheid asook mediese nooddienste, en sal deur kubaanse spesialiste bygestaan word.
tgt: this team will include epidemiologists, family practition ers, nurses, community health workers, public health experts and emergency medical services, to be supported by cuban experts.

src: "elke brandpunt gaan aan toetsdienste, isolasieen kwarantynfasiliteite, behandeling, hospitaalbeddens en kontak opsporing gekoppel word.
tgt: "we will link each hotspot to testing services, isolation facilities, quarantine facilities, treatment, hospital beds and contact tracing.

src: "indien die verspreiding van die infeksie ondanks ons ingrypings nie beheer word nie en die gevaar ontstaan dat ons gesondheidsgeriewe oorweldig kan word, kan enige deel van die land weer na vlak 4 of 5 terugkeer, het hy gesê.
tgt: "should it be necessary, any part of the country could be returned to alert levels 4 or 5 if the spread of infection is not contained despite our interventions and there is a risk of our health facilities being overwhelmed," he says.

src: die lys van brandpuntgebiede sal elke twee weke hersien word, afhangend van die vordering van die virus.
tgt: the list of hotspot areas will be reviewed every two weeks depending on the progression of the virus.

src: ontsluiting van die ekonomiedie implementering van waarskuwingsvlak 3, wat aan die begin van junie in werking getree het, beteken dat die meeste ekonomiese sektore hul bedrywighede kon hervat, onderhewig aan die nakoming van streng gesondheidsprotokols en reëls oor sosiale afstand.
tgt: opening the economythe implementation of alert level 3 which started at the beginning of june, involved the return to operation of most sectors of the econo my, subject to observance of strict health protocols and social distancing rules.

src: al hoe meer staatsamptenare het ook teruggekeer werk toe ooreenkomstig die bepalings van die wet op beroepsgesondheid en veiligheid, en die riglyne van die departement van staatsdiens en ad ministrasie in samewerking met al die ander regeringsdepartemente.
tgt: more public servants have also returned to work in accordance with provisions of the occupational health and safety act and as guided by the department of public service and administration, working together with all other departments in government.

src: protokols en werkplekplannenamate al hoe meer sektore van die ekonomie weer begin sake doen, sal die regering sterk op sosiale kompakte met alle sleutelrolspelers steun om die sleutelrisikofaktore by die werkplek en in die kontakpunte tussen werknemers en die publiek nougeset te bestuur.
tgt: protocols and workplace plansas more sectors of the econ omy open, government will rely on social compacts with all key role players to address the key risk factors at the workplace and in the interface between employees and the public.

src: "ons sal dus 'n aantal sektorprotokols finaliseer en van ondernemings verwag om 'n werkplekplan op te stel voordat hulle mag heropen," het hy gesê.
tgt: "we will therefore be finalising a number of sector protocols and will require every company to develop a workplace plan before they reopen," he says.

src: volgens hierdie planne moet ondernemings higiëneen sosialeafstandmaatreëls en fasiliteite implementeer; werkers elke dag skandeer wanneer hulle by die werkplek aanmeld, diegene wat moontlik besmet is in afsondering plaas en reëlings maak om hulle te laat toets.
tgt: according to these plans, companies will need to put in place sanitary and social distancing measures and facilities; they will need to screen workers on arrival each day, quarantine those who may be infected and make arrangements for them to be tested.

src: "hulle moet ook help met kontakopsporing indien werknemers positief toets.
tgt: "they also need to assist with contact tracing if employees test positive.

src: omdat personeel ouer as 60, en diegene wat aan onderliggende toestande soos hart siekte, diabetes, chroniese lugwegsiekte en kanker ly meer kwesbaar is, moet hulle verkieslik tuis bly," het die president verduidelik.
tgt: because of their vulnerability, all staff who are older than 60 years of age and those who suffer from underlying conditions such as heart disease, diabetes, chronic respiratory disease and cancer should ideally stay at home," the president says.

src: werknemers wat van die huis af kan werk, moet toegelaat word om dit te doen.
tgt: employees who can work from home should be allowed to do so.

src: onderhewig aan hierdie maatreëls het alle vervaardiging, mynbou, kon struksie, finansiële dienste, professionele en sakedienste, inligtingstegnologie, kommunikasiedienste, regerings dienste en mediadienste op 1 junie heropen.
tgt: subject to these measures, all manufacturing, mining, construction, financial services, professional and business services, information technology, com munications, government services and media services, reopened from 1 june.

src: die toepaslike heropeneningsen infaseringsreëlings sal vir elke werkplek gespesifiseer moet word.
tgt: the appropriate restart and phasing in arrangements will need to be put in place for every workplace.

src: "grooten kleinhandel kan ten volle heropen, insluitend winkels, spazawinkels en informele handelaars.
tgt: "wholesale and retail trade will be fully opened, including stores, spaza shops and informal traders.

src: ehandel sal steeds oop bly.
tgt: ecommerce will continue to remain open.

src: ander sektore wat reeds heropen het, soos landbou en bosbou, nutsdienste, mediese dienste, voedselproduksie en vervaardiging van higiëneprodukte, sal oop bly," het hy gesê.
tgt: other sectors that opened previous ly, such as agriculture and forestry, utilities, medical services, food production and manufacture of hygiene products, will remain fully opened," he says.

src: akkommodasie en binnelandse vlugte, behalwe vir sakereise, wat ingefaseer sal word op datums wat nog aangekondig sal word.
tgt: accommodation and domestic air travel, except for business travel, which will be phased in on dates to be announced.

src: konferensies,funksies, vermaak en sportaktiwiteite.
tgt: conferences, events, entertainment and sporting activities.

src: persoonlike sorgdienste, insluitend haarkapperen skoonheidsdienste.
tgt: personal care services, including hairdressing and beauty services.

src: beweging van mense en verkoop van alkoholmense mag enige tyd van die dag oefening doen, mits dit nie in groepsverband is nie.
tgt: movement of people and sale of alcoholpeople will be able to exer cise at any time during the day, provided this is not done in groups.

src: die aandklokreël op die beweging van mense is opgehef.
tgt: the curfew on the movement of people will be lifted.

src: "alkohol mag vir tuisverbruik slegs onder streng voorwaardes verkoop word, op spesifieke dae en vir 'n beperkte aantal uur.
tgt: "alcohol may be sold for home consumption only under strict conditions, on specified days and for limited hours.

src: aankondigings in hierdie verband sal gedoen word sodra besprekings oor die spesifieke omstandighede met die sektor afgehandel is," het die president verduidelik.
tgt: announcements in this regard will be made once we have concluded discussions with the sector on the various conditions," the president says.

src: die verkoop van tabakprodukte bly verbode op waarskuwingsvlak 3, weens die gesondheidsgevare wat met rook gepaardgaan.
tgt: the sale of tobacco products will remain prohibited in alert level 3, due to the health risks associated with smoking.

src: "alle byeenkomste bly verbode, buiten begrafnisse met hoogstens 50 mense, of vergaderings in die werkplek vir werksdoeleindes.
tgt: "all gatherings will remain prohibited, except for funerals with no more than 50 people or meetings in the workplace for work purposes," he says.

src: "verwag toename in infeksies"volgens president rama phosa is ongeveer 20 000 hos pitaalbeddens vir covid19gevalle opsygesit, en 27 veldhospitale word regoor die land gebou.
tgt: expect rise in infectionspresident ramaphosa says, in preparation for the expected increase in covid19 infections in the country, around 20 000 hospital beds have been, and are being, repurposed for covid19 cases, and 27 field hospitals are being built around the country.

src: "sommige van dié hospitale is nou gereed om koronaviruspasiënte te ontvang."
tgt: "a number of these hospitals are ready to receive coronavirus patients."

src: die president het gesê dat die regering die werk van staatsamptenare hoog op prys stel, veral diegene in die voorste linie in die stryd teen covid19.
tgt: the president says government appreciates the work that continues to be done by public servants, especially those in the front line in the fight against covid19.

src: "die veiligheid van alle werkers, ook staatsamptenare, is vir ons uiters belangrik.
tgt: "the safety of all workers, including public servants, is a matter of concern to us.

src: ons sal alles moontlik doen om voldoende persoonlike beskermingstoerusting te voorsien om almal se veiligheid te verseker terwyl hulle werk.
tgt: we will continue to make all efforts for the adequate provision of personal protection equipment to ensure safety for everyone while at work.

src: "ons prioriteit is om die geleenthede vir oordrag van die virus te verminder en 'n veilige omgewing vir almal te skep," het hy afgesluit.
tgt: "our priority is to reduce the opportunities for the transmission of the virus and create a safe environment for everyone," he says.

src: »onthou om sosiale afstand te handhaaf.
tgt: »remember to social distance.

src: »dra jou gesigmasker.
tgt: »wear your face mask.

src: »was jou hande deeglik met seep.
tgt: »wash your hands with soap thoroughly.

src: was die agterkant van jou hande, tussen jou vingers en onder jou naels.
tgt: wash the back of your hands, between the fingers and under the nails.

src: was altyd jou hande met seep voordat jy eet en nadat jy in die openbaar beweeg het.
tgt: always wash your hands with soap before you eat and after being out in public.

src: »bedek jou mond met 'n sneesdoekie wanneer jy hoes of nies.
tgt: »cover your mouth with a tissue paper when you cough and sneeze.

src: moet onder geen omstandighede met vuil hande aan jou gesig raak nie.
tgt: avoid touching your face with dirty hands at all times.

src: »kry mediese hulp as jy siek voel.
tgt: »seek medical help if you feel unwell.

src: tipiese simptome van covid19 sluit in 'n gehoes, loopneus, koors en kortasem.
tgt: typical symptoms of covid19 include coughing, runny nose, fever and shortness of breath.

src: kry onverwyld mediese hulp indien jy enige van hierdie simptome ervaar.
tgt: if you are experiencing any of these symptoms, seek medical attention promptly.

src: vir meer inligting, skakel die nasionale instituut vir aansteeklike siektes se 24uurblitslyn by 0800 029 999 of teken aan op www.
tgt: for more information, call the national institute of communicable diseases’ 24hour hotline at 0800 029 999 or visit www.

src: health.
tgt: health.

src: laat ons ons kinders beskerm en ondersteun vukuzenzele unnamed internasionale dag vir die beskerming van kinders, wat wêreldwyd op 3 junie gevier word om die aandag op kinders se regte en welstand te vestig.
tgt: let us protect and support our children vukuzenzele unnamed the international day for protection of children, which is commemorated globally on 03 june, draws attention to children's rights around the world and welfare.

src: op gepaste wyse is dit op dieselfde dag ook die vn sewêrelddag vir ouers, wat hulde bring aan ouers en versorgers se toewyding aan kinders se welsyn.
tgt: fittingly, it is also the un global day of parents on the same day, honouring the commitment of parents and caregivers to the wellbeing of children.

src: ek wil die miljoene ouers, grootouers en versorgers in suidafrika wat voortdurend 'n belangrike rol in die vormingsjare van ons jongste landsburgers speel, bedank.
tgt: i want to thank the millions of parents, grandparents and caregivers around south africa who continue to play an important role in the formative years in the lives of our youngest citizens.

src: die aanmoediging, ondersteuning en beskerming wat kinders van hul ouers en ver sorgers ontvang, is noodsaak lik vir hul toekomstige geluk en sukses.
tgt: the encouragement, sup port and protection children receive from their parents and caregivers is essential for their future happiness and success.

src: die land het op 1 junie 'n nuwe fase in die stryd teen die koronavirus begin.
tgt: on 01 june the country started a new phase in its fight against the coronavirus.

src: baie ekonomiese en sosiale aktiwiteite is hervat, insluitend 'n fasehervatting van skoolopleiding.
tgt: many economic and social activities restarted, including a phased resumption of schooling.

src: ons het gesê dat ons, met die raad van ons wetenskaplikes as riglyn, 'n geleidelike benadering volg, wat deur die realiteite op grondvlak en oorlegpleging met belanghebbendes gelei word.
tgt: we have said that we are taking a gradual approach, guided by the advice of our scientists and led by the realities on the ground and consultations with stakeholders.

src: die afgelope paar weke, namate ons voorbereidings getref het om terug te keer skool toe, het ons uitgebreide en gedetailleerde gesprekke met al die rolspelers in die onderwyssektor gevoer.
tgt: in the last few weeks, as we have prepared to return to school, we have had extensive and detailed discussions with all roleplayers in the education sphere.

src: dit het as riglyn gedien vir ons benadering tot hierdie ingewikkelde en uitdagende taak.
tgt: these have guided our approach to this complex and challenging task.

src: verskeie van hierdie be langhebbendes – waaronder onderwysers en ouers – het hul kommer uitgespreek oor die gereedheidsvlak van baie skole.
tgt: several of these stakeholders – including teachers and parents – have expressed concern about the state of readiness in many schools.

src: ons het dit gehoor, ons verwelkom hul bydraes en neem stappe om hul kommer sowel as voorstelle te hanteer.
tgt: we have heard them, we welcome their contributions and are taking steps to address their concerns as well as proposals.

src: dit is verstaanbaar dat baie ouers en versorgers in hierdie tyd gemengde gevoelens oor die heropening van skole het.
tgt: it is understandable that many parents and caregivers have mixed emotions at this time about the reopening of schools.

src: dit is ’n verligting dat kinders hul onderwys kan hervat ná 'n lang afwesigheid uit klaskamers en lesingsale.
tgt: there is relief that children will be able to resume their education after a prolonged absence from classrooms and lecture halls.

src: jong mense is gretig om weer skool te gaan en om hul vriende en onderwysers weer te sien.
tgt: young people are eager to be in school again and to see friends and teachers.

src: maar ouers, opvoeders en leerders is ook ongerus daaroor.
tgt: but there is also apprehension on the part of parents, edu cators and learners themselves.

src: ouers wil die versekering hê dat die nodige voorsorgmaatreëls getref word om leerders voldoende te beskerm.
tgt: parents want reassurance that the necessary precautions should be in place to adequately protect learners.

src: die veiligheid van ons jongste burgers vanuit 'n gesondheidsen fisieke perspektief is nie onderhandelbaar nie.
tgt: the safety of our youngest citizens from a health and physical perspective is not negotiable.

src: dit is ons grootste prioriteit.
tgt: it is our foremost priority.

src: terwyl ons voorberei op die geleidelike heropening van ons skole en instansies vir hoër onderwys, het onderwys owerhede hard gewerk om die nodige gesondheidsen veiligheidsmaatreëls in gereedheid te bring.
tgt: as we prepare for the gradual reopening of our schools and places of higher learning, education authorities have been hard at work putting the necessary health and safety measures in place.

src: die nodige dokumentasie rakende standaard prosedures is aan alle skole voorsien.
tgt: that documentation regarding standard operating procedures have been provided to all schools.

src: hierdie standaardbedryfsprosedures handel oor kwessies soos opleiding en oriëntasie van diegene wat sifting van leerlinge behartig, hersiening van roosters en die herrangskikking van klaskamers om aan die vereistes van sosiale afstand te voldoen.
tgt: these standard operating procedures cover issues like train ing and orientation of screen ers, timetable realignment and configuring classrooms to meet social distancing requirements.

src: ons lewer steeds persoonlike beskermende toerusting af en maak seker dat daar voldoende wateren sanitasiedienste is.
tgt: we are continuing with the process of delivering personal protective equipment and ensuring the availability of water and sanitation services.

src: sodra klasse weer begin, sal dit onder streng voorwaardes met die voorgeskrewe beperkte aantal leerders en studente wees.
tgt: learning, once it commences, will take place under strict conditions with a correctly limited number of learners and students.

src: as ouers, onderwysers, be heerliggame en die regering is ons dit eens dat geen skool moet heropen totdat al die nodige voorsorgmaatreëls in gereedheid is nie.
tgt: as parents, teachers, governing bodies and government, we are in agreement that no school should reopen until all the necessary precautions are in place.

src: daar moet deursigtigheid wees oor die vlak van paraatheid van elk van die skole.
tgt: there needs to be transparency about the level of preparedness of each of the schools.

src: elkeen wat 'n belangrike rolspeler is, of dit nou 'n ouer, 'n lid van die skoolbeheerliggaam, 'n onderwyser of 'n regeringsamp tenaar is, moet oor die korrekte inligting oor die stand van sake by elke skool beskik.
tgt: everyone who is a key role player, be they a parent, a school governing body member, a teacher or a government official should be able to have the correct information about the state of preparedness of each school.

src: dit is ons kollektiewe verantwoordelikheid om te verseker dat die leeromgewing veilig is.
tgt: it is our collective responsibility to ensure that the learning environment is safe.

src: ek wil graag hulde bring aan ouers en versorgers vir die rol wat hulle die afgelope twee maande gespeel het.
tgt: i want to salute parents and caregivers, in particular, for the role they have played over the last two months.

src: met skole wat gesluit is, moes hulle daagliks 'n groter verantwoordelikheid neem vir die opvoeding en ontwikkeling van hul kinders.
tgt: with schools closed, they have had to take greater daily responsibility for the education and development of their children.

src: baie ouers en versorgers moes leerders tuis help met hul skoolwerk, en het sonder twyfel ook besef en waardeer hoe hard ons onderwysers elke dag werk.
tgt: many parents and caregivers have had to assist learners with their schoolwork at home, no doubt gaining a keen appreciation of the hard work being done by our teachers every day.

src: sodra die inperking opgehef word en meer leerders terugkeer skool toe, moet ons ouers voortgaan om 'n meer aktiewe rol in die opvoeding van ons kinders te speel, hetsy deur toetrede tot skoolbeheerliggame, vrywilligerswerk by skole of ander vorme van hulp.
tgt: once the lockdown is lifted and more learners return to school, we parents should continue to play a more active role in the education of our children, whether it is through joining school governing bodies, volunteering our services at schools or other forms of assistance.

src: ouers kan help met die skoonmaak van skole, die vestiging van groentetuine of hulle kan deel wees van skole se veiligheidskomitees.
tgt: parents can join in volunteering to clean schools, establishing vegetable gardens or being part of neighbourhood school safety committees.

src: dit kan die skole omskep in ware betekenisvolle "gemeenskapskole".
tgt: this can turn the schools into real, meaningful "community schools".

src: hoewel ons angstig en on rustig kan voel wanneer ons seuns en dogters ons sorg verlaat, moet ons moed put uit die feit dat alles moontlik gedoen word om hulle te beskerm.
tgt: though we may feel anxious and fearful as our sons and daughters leave our care, we must draw courage from the fact that every effort is being made to protect them.

src: as ouers het julle die wel stand en veiligheid van julle kinders aan ons toevertrou.
tgt: as parents, you have entrusted us with the welfare and safety of your children.

src: sajeug is n bron van inspirasie en hoop vukuzenzele unnamed elke keer wat ek die geleentheid het om met jong suidafrikaners te praat, kom frantz fanon se woorde, naamlik dat 'elke generasie sy missie moet ontdek', by my op.
tgt: sa youth are a source of inspiration and hope vukuzenzele unnamed the words of frantz fanon that ‘each generation must discover its mission’ come to mind every time i have an opportunity to speak with young south africans.

src: elkeen het n brandende begeerte om die wêreld te verander, ongeag waar hulle woon en wat hulle doen.
tgt: no matter where they live and no matter what they do, they each have a burning desire to change the world.

src: hulle wil ook, terwyl hulle beslis hulle eie lewens wil verbeter, n beter samelewing en wêreld tot stand bring.
tgt: while they certainly want to improve their own lives, they also want to achieve a better society and a better world.

src: hulle sien hulself as agente vir fundamentele transformasie.
tgt: they see themselves as agents for fundamental transformation.

src: jong mense was nog altyd regdeur die geskiedenis n dryfkrag vir verandering.
tgt: throughout history young people have been a driving force for change.

src: jong mense het die afgelope paar dekades verskeie veldtogte teen ongeregtigheid gevoer, van die 1968studenteopstand in parys, tot die teenoorlogbeweging in die verenigde state in die 1960's, tot die teenkoloniale stryd in baie afrikaen asiatiese lande, tot die stryd teen apartheid, tot die arabiese lente.
tgt: in just the last few decades, young people have waged numerous struggles against injustice, from the 1968 student uprising in paris, to the antiwar movement in the united states in the 1960s, to the anticolonial struggle in many african and asian countries, to the fight against apartheid, to the arab spring.

src: jong mense was mees onlangs aan die spits van die #blacklivesmatterbeweging, wat wêreldwyd steun verwerf het nadat george floyd in die verenigde state vermoor is.
tgt: most recently, young people have been at the forefront of the #blacklivesmatter movement that has gained global support in the wake of the killing of george floyd in the united states.

src: aktiviste van regoor die wêreld het ook die afgelope paar weke die verwydering van simbole wat die barbaarsheid en geweld van die slawehandel en kolonialisme verheerlik, geëis.
tgt: over the past few weeks, activists around the world have also been demanding the removal of symbols that glorify the barbarity and violence of the slave trade and colonialism.

src: n betoger het onlangs by n betoging by oxford universiteit n plakkaat gedra met die woorde 'rhodes moet val', 'n strydkreet van studente in ons eie land vyf jaar gelede.
tgt: at an oxford university demonstration recently a protestor carried a placard with the words ‘rhodes must fall’, the rallying cry of students in our own country five years ago.

src: jong mense regoor die wêreld het n gemeenskaplike doelstelling gevind.
tgt: young people across the world have found common cause.

src: hulle breek standbeelde en simbole van rassisme af, eis die dekolonisasie van opvoedkundige kurrikula en vereis van instansies om rassisme en maatskaplike uitsluiting aan te pak.
tgt: they are tearing down statues and symbols of racism, demanding the decolonisation of educational curricula, and calling for institutions to address racism and social exclusion.

src: ons het op 16 junie 2020 hulde aan die generasie van 1976 gebring en bring ook hulde aan die jeug van postapartheid suidafrika, die waardige erfgename van dié edele nalatenskap.
tgt: and so, as we paid tribute to the generation of 1976 on 16 june 2020, we also salute the youth of postapartheid south africa, the worthy inheritors of this noble legacy.

src: die 1976generasie se missie was om bantoeonderwys af te breek; die missie van vandag se jeug is om die projek van nasionale versoening en transformasie voort te sit.
tgt: the mission of 1976 generation was to dismantle bantu education; that of today’s youth is to take forward the project of national reconciliation and transformation.

src: daar sal mettertyd gesê word dat dié jaar, 2020, die begin van n nuwe epog in menslike geskiedenis was.
tgt: in time to come it will be said that this year, 2020, marked the start of a new epoch in human history.

src: die koronavirus het nie net n enorme impak op mense se lewens en bestaan gehad nie, maar ook die globale maatskaplike orde verander.
tgt: not only has coronavirus had a momentous impact on people’s lives and livelihoods, it has also shaken up the global social order.

src: die wyse waarop die pandemie toegeslaan het, is n herinnering aan die onderlinge verbintenisse van die mensdom en die diep ongelykhede wat tussen lande en in lande bestaan.
tgt: the manner in which the pandemic has taken hold has been a reminder of the interconnectedness of the human race and of the deep inequalities that exist between countries and within countries.

src: die pandemie bied n geleentheid om n wêreld wat deur erge materialisme, selfsugtigheid en selfbeheptheid van individue en hele samelewings gekenmerk is, te 'herstel' .
tgt: the pandemic presents an opportunity to ‘reset’ a world that is characterised by crass materialism, selfishness and selfabsorption not just on the part of individuals but whole societies.

src: jongmense sê vir ons dat die noodsaaklike waardes van integriteit, deernis en eensgesindheid die kenmerke van die nuwe samelewing moet wees wat na vore sal kom en dat hulle vasbeslote is om die kampvegters vir dié nuwe, beter wêreld te wees.
tgt: young people are telling us that the essential values of integrity, compassion and solidarity must be the hallmarks of the new society that will emerge, and that they are determined to be the champions of this new, better world.

src: ek het in my gesprekke met jongmense gesê dat ons nooit die mag van n idee moet onderskat nie, want idees kan en het die wêreld verander.
tgt: in the discussions i have had with young people i have said that we should never underestimate the power of an idea, because ideas can and have changed the world.

src: idees het menslike vooruitgang aangewakker en dit is wat ons in staat stel om n nuwe pad in die postkoronavirusera uit te stippel.
tgt: ideas have spurred human progress and they are what will enable us to chart a new path in the postcoronavirus era.

src: dié jongmense het hulle idees in optrede omgeskakel.
tgt: these young people have turned their ideas into action.

src: hulle het nie toegelaat dat n tekort aan hulpbronne hulle kniehalter nie.
tgt: they have not let a lack of resources hinder them.

src: hulle het in n hele aantal sektore, van hipertegnologie tot omgewingsvolhoubaarheid, vir hulself n nis uitgekerf.
tgt: they have carved a niche for themselves in a number of sectors from hightech to environmental sustainability.

src: ons sal nou, meer as ooit, ons op die innoverende en baanbrekersgees van ons jeug beroep om oplossings vir die werkloosheidskrisis te vind wat vir hulle, hulle gemeenskappe en die samelewing voordelig sal wees.
tgt: now more than ever we will look to the innovative and pioneering spirit of our youth to come up with solutions to the unemployment crisis that benefit them, their communities and society.

src: ek daag terselfdertyd ons land se jeug uit om programme te prakseer en ontwerp wat ons in staat sal stel om ons ontwikkelingsdoelwitte te bereik.
tgt: at the same time, i challenge our country’s youth to craft and design programmes that will enable us to meet our developmental goals.

src: revolusionêre kuba het in 1961 talryke jong studentevrywilligers na die berge en dorpies toe gestuur om skole te bou, geletterdheid te onderrig en nuwe opvoeders op te lei.
tgt: in 1961, revolutionary cuba sent legions of young student volunteers into the mountains and villages to construct schools, teach literacy and train new educators.

src: dit word steeds as een van die suksesvolste geletterdheidsveldtogte in die moderne geskiedenis beskou.
tgt: it is still held up as one of the most successful literacy campaigns in modern history.

src: ons jongmense moet maatskaplike opheﬃ ngsinisiatiewe ontwikkel en aan die stuur daarvan staan.
tgt: our young people must develop social upliftment initiatives and they must lead them.

src: die aansienlike energie van ons jeug moet, net soos wat hulle die stryd vir geslagsgelykheid in hoër onderwys aangedurf het, ook vir die stryd vir gelyke toegang tot gesondheidsorg, die transformasie van grondeienaarskap en, die belangrikste, vir geslagsgeregtigheid, aangewend word.
tgt: just as they took up the struggle for equality in higher education, the considerable energies of our youth must also be brought to bear to fight for equitable access to health care, for the transformation of land ownership and, most importantly, for gender justice.

src: ek, soos alle suidafrikaners, is diep ontsteld oor n opwelling in die aantal moorde op jong vrouens deur mans.
tgt: like all south africans, i have been deeply disturbed by a surge in the murder of young women at the hands of men.

src: dit is skokkende, onmenslike dade wat nie in ons samelewing tuishoort nie.
tgt: these are shocking acts of inhumanity that have no place in our society.

src: burgerlike aktivisme, bewusmaking en portuurberading wat deur die jeug gelei word, is kernbelangrike hulpbronne in ons poging om geslagsgebaseerde geweld in ons samelewing uit te roei.
tgt: youthled civic activism, awareness raising and peer counselling are vital tools in our efforts to eradicate genderbased violence from society.

src: ons moet terselfdertyd ons regstelsel versterk en verseker dat oortreders aan die pen sal ry, dat borgtogen paroolvoorwaardes opgeskerp word en dat diegene wat tot lewenslange tronkstraf gevonnis is, die res van hulle lewens agter tralies sal spandeer.
tgt: at the same time, we must strengthen our justice system, ensuring that perpetrators are brought to book, bail and parole conditions are tightened and that those sentenced to life spend the rest of their lives behind bars.

src: alhoewel dit optrede van regoor die samelewing vereis, vra ek vir jong mans in besonder om die stryd teen geslagsgebaseerde geweld aan te pak.
tgt: while this needs societywide action, i call on young men in particular to take up the struggle against genderbased violence.

src: die droom van n nuwe samelewing sal ons bly ontwyk, tensy ons die oorlog wat teen suidafrikaanse vrouens woed, beëindig.
tgt: unless we end the war that is being waged against south african women, the dream of a new society will remain elusive.

src: diegene van ons wat tydens die apartheidsera deel van die studentebewegings was, word gereeld gevra wat ons van vandag se jongmense dink.
tgt: those of us who were part of student movements during the apartheid era are often asked what we think of the young people of today.

src: daar is n versoeking om in nostalgie oor die 'glorieryke dae' van studentepolitiek en jeugstryd wat nooit herhaal kan word nie, te verval.
tgt: there is a temptation to retreat into nostalgia about ‘the glory days’ of student politics and youth struggle, never to be replicated.

src: net soos wat die jeug van die verlede hulle missie bepaal het, bepaal vandag se jeug egter ook hulle sn.
tgt: but just as the youth of yesteryear defined their mission, today’s youth have defined theirs.

src: die suidafrikaanse jeug van 2020 voldoen beslis aan die hoë standaard van hulle voorgangers.
tgt: south african youth of 2020 more than meet the high standard set by their predecessors.

src: hulle is optimisties, lewenskragtig en dapper, dikwels in die moeilikste omstandighede denkbaar.
tgt: they are optimistic, resilient and courageous, often in the face of the harshest of circumstances.

src: ma met onderliggende siektetoestand oorwin covid19 silusapho nyanda insaaf mohammed sê dit is baie belangrik vir suidafrikaners, veral diegene met onderliggend siektetoestande, om verantwoordelikheid vir hulle gesondheid te aanvaar.
tgt: mom with comorbidity beats covid19 silusapho nyanda insaaf mohammed says it is very important for south africans, especially those with comorbidities, to take responsibility for their health.

src: mense met onderliggende siektetoestande — soos asma, hoë bloeddruk, kroniese niersiekte en diabetes — kan ernstiger koronavirussimptome (covid19simptome) ervaar en kan selfs as gevolg van die spanning wat die virus op hulle liggame plaas, sterf.
tgt: people with comorbidities – such as asthma, hypertension, chronic kidney disease and diabetes – could experi ence more severe coro navirus (covid19) symptoms, and may even die as a result of the strain the virus puts on their bodies.

src: toe die arbeidsterapeut van kaapstad en ma van drie, insaaf mohammed (40) positief vir covid19 getoets is terwyl sy siek was met asma, was sy gelukkig in staat om beide toestande te hanteer en nie ernstig siek te word nie.
tgt: fortunately, when cape townbased occupational therapist and mother of three insaaf mohammed (40) tested positive for covid19 while ill with asthma, she was able to manage both conditions and did not become seriously ill. mohammed contracted covid19 from her husband, who works at the groote schuur hospital’s laboratory.

src: mohammed se sewejarige seun het ook positief getoets.
tgt: mohammed’s sevenyearold son also tested positive.

src: al drie het hulself tuis geisoleer nadat hulle positief getoets het.
tgt: after testing positive, all three selfisolated at home.

src: "ons het onsself in ons slaapkamer geïsoleer terwyl my skoonma —wat diabetes en hoë bloeddruk het, en gelukkig nie die virus gekry het nie — na ons ander twee kinders omgesien het," sê mohammed.
tgt: "we selfisolated in our bedroom, while my motherinlaw – who has diabetes and hypertension and thankfully didn’t contract the virus – took care of our other two children," says mohammed.

src: mense met hoë bloeddruk, diabetes en kroniese niersiekte is onder diegene met die mees algemene onderliggende siektetoestande van covid19, volgens die departement van gesondheid.
tgt: according to the western cape department of health, people with hypertension, diabetes and chronic kidney disease are among the most common comorbidity sufferers of covid19.

src: mense met die volgende onderliggende siektetoestande het, soos op 25 mei, ernstige simptome getoon: hoë bloeddruk, 58 persent diabetes, 56 persent kroniese niersiekte, 17 persent miv , 16 persent asma of kroniese asemhalingsiekte, 15 persent hartsiekte, 11 persent vetsug, 13 persent tb, 13 persent kanker, twee persent ander kroniese siektes, 16 persent.
tgt: as of 25 may, people with the following comorbidities showed serious symptoms of covid19; hypertension, 58 percent diabetes, 56 percent chronic kidney disease, 17 percent hiv , 16 percent asthma or chronic respiratory disease, 15 percent cardiac disease, 11 percent obesity, 13 percent tb, 13 percent cancer, two percent other chronic illnesses, 16 percent.

src: mohammed het gesê dat haar grootste vrees was om ernstige asemhalingskomplikasies as gevolg van covid19 te ervaar.
tgt: mohammed says her worst fear was experiencing serious respiratory complications from covid19.

src: "ek het moegheid, 'n gehoes en 'n toe bors ervaar, wat met my asmapomp opgelos is.
tgt: "i experienced tiredness, coughing and tightness of the chest, which my asthma pump resolved.

src: my simptome was nie so erg soos my man sn nie, wat liggaamspyne, naarheid, n toe bors, kortasemrigheid, verstopte sinusse, dik slym in sy bors en n koors gehad het.
tgt: my symptoms were not as severe as my husband’s, who had body aches, nausea, a tight chest, shortness of breath, blocked sinuses, thick phlegm on his chest and a fever.

src: my seun het vir drie dae n koors gehad, maar het redelik vinnig herstel nadat hy sy simptome oorkom het," sê sy.
tgt: my son had a fever for three days, but recovered quite fast once he overcame his symptoms," she says.

src: mohammed se gesin het by alle higiëneprotokolle by die huis en by die werk gehou om nie die virus op te doen nie.
tgt: mohammed’s family had been following protocols at work and home, to avoid contracting the virus.

src: "my familie het begrip getoon, omgegee en was ondersteunend en het elke aand vir ons aandete gebring, maar n mens se gemeenskap kan soms afsydig wees en die skade wat op sosiale media veroorsaak word, is skrikwekkend," sê mohammed.
tgt: "my family was understanding, caring and supportive, and brought us supper every evening, but sometimes your community can be uncaring and the harm caused on social media is scary," says mohammed.

src: die departement van gesondheid sê dat dit belangrik is om gehidreer te bly en jou bloedsuiker en temperatuur te kontroleer ten einde covid19 te hanteer, veral vir pasiënte met onderliggende siektetoestande.
tgt: the western cape department of health says that keeping hydrated and monitoring your blood glucose, blood pressure and temperature are key to managing covid19, especially for patients with comorbidities.

src: die departement raai ook mense met onderliggende siektes aan om die volgende voorsorgmaatreëls te tref: neem jou medisyne korrek, soos deur jou gesondheidsorgpraktisyn voorgeskryf.
tgt: in addition, the department advises people with comorbidities to: take medication correct ly, as prescribed by your healthcare practitioner.

src: was jou hande vir minstens 20 sekondes met seep en water voordat jy aan enige medikasie raak.
tgt: wash your hands with soap and water for at least 20 seconds, before you touch any medication.

src: moenie ophou om medisyne te neem tensy n gesondheidsorgpraktisyn vir jou so sê nie en moet nooit medisyne met enigiemand te deel nie.
tgt: do not stop taking medication unless a healthcare practitioner tells you to and never share medication with anyone.

src: probeer om elke dag vir 30 minute te oefen.
tgt: try to do physical exercise for 30 minutes a day.

src: die departement sê dat mense met diabetes meer geneig is om ernstige komplikasies weens covid19 te ervaar, maar die risiko om baie siek te word is baie laer as n mens se diabetes goed hanteer word.
tgt: the department says that people with diabetes face a higher chance of experiencing serious complications from covid19, but the risk of getting very sick is lower if one’s diabetes is well managed.

src: "mense met diabetes is in die algemeen meer geneig om ernstige simptome en komplikasies te ervaar wanneer hulle n virus onder lede het.
tgt: "in general, people with diabetes are more likely to experience severe symptoms and complications when infected with a virus.

src: voortdurende sosiale of fisiese distansiëring word, waar moontlik, aanbeveel, aangesien diabetiese individue meer geneig is om covid19 op te doen.
tgt: as diabetic individuals are at increased risk of severe covid19, ongoing social or physical distancing is recommended where possible.

src: om oorgewig te wees, is ook n risikofaktor vir ernstige covid19.
tgt: being overweight is also a risk factor for severe covid19.

src: gesond verklaarmohammed het ná 14 dae se isolasie teruggekeer werk toe.
tgt: "clean bill of healthafter being in isolation for 14 days, mohammed returned to work.

src: sy sê dat haar denkprosesse en perspektief oor die lewe verander het namate sy van die virus herstel het.
tgt: she says recovering from the virus changed her thought processes and perspective on life.

src: "jy waardeer jou gesin en die klein dingetjies in die lewe selfs nog meer.
tgt: "you appreciate your family and the small things in life even more.

src: ek wil hê dat mense in enige werksomgewing verantwoordelikheid vir hulle gesondheid moet aanvaar en hulle gesinne en kinders daaroor moet opvoed, veral noudat kinders teruggekeer skool toe.
tgt: i want people in any working environment to take responsibility for their health and to educate their families and children, especially now that kids are back at school.

src: "help jou kind om kreatiewe maniere te kry om liefde teenoor hulle vriende te betoon sonder om naby aan mekaar te gaan en aan mekaar te raak.
tgt: "help your child find creative ways to show affection to their friends, without going close and touching each other.

src: regering berei voor vir covid19piek allison cooper voorbereidings vir 'n moontlike toename in covid 19gevalle word tans getref, met die regering en die privaat sektor wat veldhospitale bou, persoonlike beskermende toerusting koop, en verseker dat suidafrika ventilators vervaardig.
tgt: government prepares for covid19 spike allison cooper preparations for a possible increase in covid19 cases are underway with the government and the private sector building field hospitals, purchasing personal protective equipment and ensuring that south africa manufactures ventilators.

src: daar word verwag dat suidafrika se koronavirusgevalle (covid1 9gevalle) in die komende weke sal toeneem en die regering werk hard om te verseker dat die gesondheidsektor gereed is.
tgt: south africa’s coro navirus disease (covid19) cases are expected to increase in the coming weeks and government is working hard to ensure the health sector is ready.

src: "ons het persoonlike beskermende toerusting (pbt) van regoor die wêreld gekoop en ondersteun plaaslike maatskappye om dit hier te produseer," bevestig president cyril ramaphosa.
tgt: "we have been buying personal protective equipment from across the world and supporting local companies to produce them here," confirmed president cyril ramaphosa.

src: "ons verbeter die infrastruktuur in hospitale, stel tydelike hospitale op en kry meer beddens vir covid19pasiënte," voeg hy by.
tgt: "we have been improving the infrastructure in hospitals, setting up temporary hospitals and finding more beds for covid19 patients," he added.

src: meer as 27 000 publieke hospitaalbeddens is teen die begin van junie vir covid19pasiënte geoormerk.
tgt: by the beginning of june, over 27 000 public hospital beds were put aside for covid19 patients.

src: veldhospitale sal, wanneer hulle voltooi is, 13 000 beddens hê.
tgt: once complete, field hospitals will have 13 000 beds.

src: kwarantynterreine en veldhospitaledie minister van openbare werke en infrastruktuur, patricia de lille, sê die volgende: 1 751 fasiliteite is as voorgestelde isolasieterreine geoormerk, wat nasionaal meer as 129 600 beddens, in al 44 distrikte en agt metro's, verteenwoordig.
tgt: quarantine sites and field hospitalspublic works and infrastructure minister patricia de lille said: 1 751 facilities have been marked for as proposed isolation sites, representing over 129 600 beds nationally, in all 44 districts and eight metros.

src: 358 fasiliteite is in die weskaap geïdentiﬁ seer, wat meer as 27 500 beddens verteenwoordig.
tgt: 358 facilities have been identified in the western cape, repre senting over 27 500 beds.

src: 395 fasiliteite is deur die departement van gesondheid geassesseer, wat 35 759 beddens verteenwoordig.
tgt: 395 facilities have been assessed by the department of health, representing 35 759 beds.

src: die kaapstadse internasionale konvensiesentrum, die grootste veldhospitaal in die land, het 862 beddens.
tgt: 32 hospitals in the eastern cape, 19 in kwazulunatal and 10 in mpumalanga have been identified for renewal and repair as field hospitals.

src: n spesiale huldeblyk aanons gesondheidswerkers vukuzenzele unnamed die aantal sterftes weens die koronavirus het onlangs 2 000 oorskry.
tgt: a special tribute to our healthcare vukuzenzele unnamed the number of deaths from coronavirus recently passed the 2000 mark.

src: onder diegene wat hul lewens verloor het, is gesondheidsorgwerkers en toe gewyde professionele mense wat nie net na die siekes omgesien het nie, maar ook on dersteuning en vertroosting aan pasiënte wat geïsoleer en sonder hul geliefdes in die hospitaal was, gebied het.
tgt: among those who have lost their lives are healthcare workers, consummate professionals who cared for the ill, and were a support and comfort to those in hospital isolated from their families.

src: dit is n verpletterende terugslag dat die mans en vroue wat dié edelste en heiligste plig uitvoer, self siek word en sterf.
tgt: that the men and women carrying out this most noble and sacred of duties are themselves falling ill and dying is a devastating blow.

src: hulle staan aan die voorpunt van die stryd teen dié pandemie.
tgt: they are on the frontline of fighting this pandemic.

src: hulle werk onder erge druk en dra ook die sielkundige las van die wete dat hulle self die risiko loop om die virus op te doen.
tgt: they are working under great pressure and must carry the psychological strain of knowing they are at risk of contracting the virus.

src: hulle is die ware helde en heldinne van ons stryd teen die koronavirus.
tgt: they are the true heroes and heroines of our battle against coronavirus.

src: ons bring hulde aan dié dap per suidafrikaners wat hulle woonplekke, gesinne en geliefdes agterlaat om elke dag getrou vir diens by klinieke, hospitale en ander gesondheidsfasilite ite, aan te meld.
tgt: we salute these brave south africans who leave their homes, families and loved ones to report without fail for duty every day in clinics, hospitals and other health facilities.

src: hulle verskaf mediese sorg, administratiewe ondersteuning en ander dienste soos skoonmaakdienste en spyseniering.
tgt: there they provide medical care, administrative support and other services like cleaning and catering.

src: net soos hulle hul profes sionele plig uitvoer, het ons ook n plig teenoor hulle en hul gesinne.
tgt: just as they perform what is their professional duty, we too have a duty to them and to their families.

src: hulle gesondheid en veiligheid is van die uiterste belang.
tgt: their health and their safety must be paramount.

src: ons bring hulde aan hulle en ondersteun hulle as die mans en vroue wat wys dat hulle bereid is om hul lewens in gevaar te stel, sodat ons kan lewe.
tgt: we honour them and uphold them as the men and women who have demonstrated they are prepared to risk their lives so that we may live.

src: om hulle reusetaak te kan uitvoer, het hulle nie net ons ondersteuning nodig nie, maar hulle moet ook beskerm word deurdat persoonlike beskermende toerusting (pbt) aan hulle voorsien word.
tgt: for them to do their herculean work they need our support as well as protection through the provision of personal protective equipment (ppe).

src: deur die ondersteuning van die solidariteitsfonds en donasies van talle individuele suidafrikaners, besighede en stigtings, sowel as ander regerings, kon ons die nodige beskermende toerusting vir dié dapper frontliniewerkers, aanskaf.
tgt: with the support of the solidarity fund and donations from many individual south africans, businesses, foundations and other governments, we have been able to procure personal protective equipment for these brave frontline workers.

src: waar daar ’n tekort aan pbt in hospitale is, skenk ons hospitale dringend aandag aan die tekorte om seker te maak dat daar voldoende voorraad is.
tgt: where there have been shortages of ppe our hospitals are urgently attending to ensuring that they are available.

src: ons weet dat toegang tot pbe nie die enigste uitdaging is wat ons gesondheidsorgwerkers in die gesig staar nie.
tgt: we know that access to ppe is not the only challenge our healthcare workers face.

src: die land se klinieke en hospitale ervaar ook landwyd n tekort aan personeel.
tgt: across the country clinics and hospitals are facing staff shortages.

src: daar word aandag aan dié probleem geskenk.
tgt: this problem is being attended to.

src: ter ondersteuning van die werk wat ons frontliniewerkers regdeur die land doen, word ons ministers en adjunkministers na elk van die distrikte ontplooi sodat hulle n idee kan kry van spesifieke uitdagings in die verskillende distrikte en om met provinsiale gesondheidsowerhede saam te werk.
tgt: to support the work that our frontline workers are performing around the country we are deploying ministers and deputy ministers to each of the districts in the country to get a line of sight of specific challenges in these districts and to work with provincial health authorities.

src: ons moet saam werk om nie net die gesondheid van ons frontliniewerkers nie, maar ook dié van die hele werkerskorps te beskerm.
tgt: we need to work together to safeguard the health of not just our frontline workers but the entire workforce.

src: die vakbonde het reeds deeglike werk gedoen om hul lede oor infeksiebeheer en voorkoming, sowel as higiëne, in te lig.
tgt: there has already been sterling work done by unions in educating members around infection control and prevention and hygiene.

src: hulle ondersteun ook die werk van die departement van indiensneming en arbeid betreffende werkplekinspeksies om te verseker dat gesondheidsen veiligheidsprotokolle vir terugkerende werkers, ingestel is.
tgt: they are also supporting the work of the department of employment and labour in conducting workplace inspections to ensure health and safety protocols are in place for returning workers.

src: baie van ons vakbonde verskaf ook koronavirusinligting aan hul lede en werkgewers hou bewustheidsveldtogte.
tgt: many of our trade unions are also providing coronavirus information to their members and employers are running awareness campaigns.

src: een van die uitdagings wat in ons land vorendag gekom het is die stigmatisering van mense wat positief vir die koronavirus getoets het.
tgt: one of the challenges that has emerged in our country is the stigmatisation of people who have proven positive with coronavirus.

src: as n samelewing, het ons die gemeenskaplike verantwoordelikheid om die stigmatisering van mense wat die koronavirus het, met wortel en tak uit te roei.
tgt: as a society, we have a collective responsibility to stamp out the stig matisation of people infected with the coronavirus.

src: daar is ontstellende berigte van individue wat uit hul gemeenskappe verstoot word en van gemeenskappe wat teen koronaviruspasiënte wat by plaaslike hospitale en klinieke opgeneem is, betoog.
tgt: there have been disturbing reports of individuals being ostracised from their communities and of communities protesting against coronavirus patients being admitted to local hospitals and clinics.

src: dit moet stopgesit word.
tgt: this must stop.

src: net soos wat ons saamgestaan het om die aanvaarding van mense wat met miv lewe te bevorder en ons teen viktimisering verset het, moet ons nou begrip, verdraagsaamheid, welwillendheid, empatie en deernis teenoor diegene wat die virus het, asook vir hulle gesinne, toon.
tgt: just as we came together to promote acceptance of people living with hiv and stood firm against victimisation, we must show understanding, tolerance, kindness, empathy and compassion for those who are infected with this virus and for their families.

src: daar word gesê dat stigma tisering aangehits word deur die vrees om die siekte te kry en n gebrek aan begrip.
tgt: it is said that this stigmatisation is driven by fear of con tracting the disease and lack of understanding.

src: die beste manier om ons instinktiewe vrees vir siekte en aansteeklikheid te oorkom is om die higiëneprotokolle wat ingestel is, na te kom.
tgt: the best way to overcome our instinctive fear of illness and contagion is to observe the hygiene protocols that are in place.

src: die vrees vir aansteeklikheid is gegrond en werklik.
tgt: the fear of infection is wellfounded and real.

src: ons weet egter wat ons moet doen om onsself en ander te beskerm.
tgt: at the same time, we know what we have to do to protect ourselves and others.

src: ons weet wat die virus veroorsaak en wat ons kan doen om te keer dat ons dit opdoen.
tgt: we know what causes the virus and what we can do to protect ourselves from becoming infected.

src: ons weet dat ons sosiale distansiëring moet handhaaf, onsself moet isoleer as ons kontak gehad het met iemand wat die virus het, en na n hospitaal moet gaan as ons simptome het.
tgt: we know we have to maintain social distancing, to selfisolate if we have come into contact with those infected and to present to a hospital if we have symptoms.

src: ons moet steeds gelei word deur feite en nie deur gerugte nie.
tgt: we must continue to be guided by facts and not rumours.

src: die tyd toe mense kon sê dat hulle niemand ken wat die koronavirus het of daardeur geraak word nie, is lankal iets van die verlede.
tgt: the time when anyone could say they do not know anyone who is infected or affected by coronavirus has long passed.

src: ons vriende, families, kollegas en bure het ons empatie en ondersteuning nou, meer as ooit, nodig.
tgt: now, more than ever, our friends, families, colleagues and neighbours need our empathy and support.

src: ons sal soms in die dae, weke en maande wat voorlê, wanhopig en angstig word namate ons sien dat die aantal mense wat die virus onder lede het en wat daaraan sterf, toeneem.
tgt: in the days, weeks and months that lie ahead, we will at times find ourselves despondent and fearful as we see the numbers of people infected and dying continue to rise.

src: dinge het dalk vererger, maar ons is seker dat dit weer beter sal word.
tgt: it may be that things have gotten worse, but we are certain that they will get better.

src: ons wetenskaplikes en mediese raadgewers sê vir ons dat die infeksiekoers sal styg namate ons nader aan die hoogtepunt beweeg.
tgt: our scientists and medical advisers told us that the rate of infections will go up as we move towards our peak.

src: jong boer ontvang covid19steun silusapho nyanda 'n opkomende ooskaapse boer is een van die begunstigdes van die regering se koronavirusverligtingsfonds.
tgt: young farmer receives covid19 support vukuzenzele unnamed nomagcinandile suduka (27) is growing her family’s legacy and wealth by investing in agriculture.

src: nomagcinandile suduka (27) ontwikkel haar gesin se nalatenskap en welvaart deur in landbou te belê.
tgt: the o wner of 4 u and 4 me primary cooperative in mooiplaas village received support from the department of agriculture, land reform and rural development’s coronavirus (covid19) relief fund for her egg, livestock and vegetable farm.

src: die departement het r1.2 miljard se ontvangsbewyse aan behoeftige boere toegeken.
tgt: the department has awarded r1.2 billion worth of vouchers to farmers in need.

src: suduka sê dat haar ont vangsbewyse haar sal help om haar onderneming se eierproduksie te verbeter.
tgt: suduka says her vouchers will help her grow the egg producing side of her business.

src: "ek het drie ontvangsbewyse van altesaam r19 000 ontvang.
tgt: "i received three vouchers totalling r19 000. a voucher for r12 000 to buy layer egg chickens, a voucher for r6 500 to buy feed and a r500 voucher to buy medicines.

src: dit sluit in n ontvangsbewys van r12 000 om hoenders wat eiers lê, aan te koop, n ontvangsbewys van r6 500 om voer te koop en n r500ontvangsbewys om medisyne te koop.
tgt: "she started her egg production farm by feeding her family’s traditional chickens with layer grower feed, which enables them to produce eggs without mating.

src: "sy het haar eierboerdery begin deur haar gesin se tradisionele hoenders lêmeel te voer, wat hulle in staat stel om eiers te lê sonder om te paar.
tgt: her chickens now produce 50 eggs a day, which she sells weekly.

src: suduka, wat ook met 73 bok ke, 25 skape en 25 koeie boer, het in 2015 begin boer nadat sy haar n6sertifikaat vir openbare bestuur by ikhala oplei dingsen beroepsonderwys en opleidingskollege, verwerf het.
tgt: suduka, who also farms with 73 goats, 25 sheep and 25 cows, started farming in 2015 after obtaining a public management n6 certificate from ikhala training and vocational education and training college.

src: toe sy besef het dat daar nie baie werksgeleenthede is nie, het sy besluit om haar gesin se destydse bestaansboerdery oor te neem en dit in n winsgewende onderneming te verander.
tgt: after realising that there were not a lot of job opportunities out there, she decided to take over the family’s then subsistence farm and turn it into a profitable business.

src: suduka sê: "ons het met boerdery grootgeword; ek het dus nadat ek gegradueer het, besluit om te boer, eerder as om werk te soek."
tgt: suduka says: "we grew up practising farming, so after graduating i decided to farm rather than look for a job."

src: dit was n geïnspireerde be sluit, aangesien sy die aantal bokke en koeie vermeerder het.
tgt: this proved to be an inspired decision, as she has grown the number of goats and cows.

src: suduka se groenteplaas van ses hektaar, lewer mielies, aartappels, ertjies en boontjies.
tgt: suduka’s sixhectare vegetable farm produces maize, potatoes, peas and beans.

src: sy bou n beter lewe vukuzenzele unnamed drieentwintigjarige silondiwe magwaza, het vanuit ne derige omstandighede in die kwanongomagemeenskap, kwazulunatal, talle struikelblokke oorkom om haar droom om n konstruksiebestuurder te word, te verwesenlik.
tgt: building a better life vukuzenzele unnamed from humble begin nings in kwanon goma village, kwa zulunatal, 23yearold silondiwe magwaza has conquered many obstacles to reach her dream of becoming a construction manager.

src: deur in ’n omgewing groot te word waar sy deur swak infrastruktuur omring was, is magwaza gemotiveer om nuwe maniere te vind om haar gemeenskap op te hef.
tgt: growing up surrounded by poor infrastructure motivated magwaza to explore new ways to uplift her community.

src: sy is nou die eerste lid van haar gesin wat n graad verwerf het.
tgt: she is now the first member of her family to obtain a degree.

src: magwaza het in 2019 haar graad in konstruksiestudies aan die universiteit van die witwatersrand verwerf.
tgt: magwaza qualified at the university of the witwatersrand in 2019, obtaining an undergraduate degree in construction studies.

src: "kwanongoma het baie swak infrastruktuur en dit lyk of die verskaffing daarvan baie stadig gebeur.
tgt: "kwanongoma has very poor infrastructure.

src: ek is aangemoedig om iets wat aan konstruksie verwant is te doen, sodat ek een van die mense kan wees wat toestande daar kan verander," sê sy.
tgt: looking at all the challenges faced by my hometown, i was encouraged to do something relating to construction so that i can be one of the people to change the current state," she says.

src: om haar graad te verwerf was nie n maklike taak nie.
tgt: obtaining her qualification was no easy feat.

src: magwaza sê dat dit moeilik was om te konsentreer omdat sy haar voortdurend oor befondsing bekommer het.
tgt: magwaza says she found it difficult to concentrate due to her constant worry about funding.

src: die munisipale infrastruktuur ondersteuningsagentskap (misa) het toe hulp aangebied.
tgt: then, the municipal infrastructure support agent (misa) stepped in to assist.

src: "ek my baie oor befondsing bekommer, aangesien ek uit n benadeelde agtergrond kom.
tgt: "i used to stress a lot about funding as i come from a disadvantaged background.

src: maar dit het in 2018 verander toe ek n beurs van misa ontvang het.
tgt: that was until 2018, when i received a bursary from misa.

src: dit het my gehelp om my graad sonder enige verdere spanning te voltooi.
tgt: this helped me to complete my degree without any more stress.

src: alles was betaal en ek kon net op my studies fokus," sê sy.
tgt: i had everything paid for, all i had to do was focus on my studies," she says.

src: magwaza is een van hon derde studente wat jaarliks deel van misa se jeugontwikkelingsprogramme is.
tgt: magwaza is one of hundreds of students who pass through misa’s youth development programmes each year.

src: die pro gramme verskaf befondsing en steun en help studente om werk te kry wanneer hulle gekwalifiseer is.
tgt: the programmes provide funding and support and help students find job placements once qualified.

src: "ek het regtig uitgesien na ons gradeplegtigheid.
tgt: "i was really looking forward to our graduation ceremony.

src: dit sou baie beteken het, aangesien ek die eerste een in my gesin sou gewees wat ’n graad het.
tgt: it would have meant a lot considering that i was going to be the first graduate in my family.

src: ek hoop steeds dat ons ’n gradeplegtigheid sal hê, maar dit sal dalk as gevolg van die koronaviruspandemie nie moontlik wees nie," sê sy.
tgt: i am still hoping that we have our graduation ceremony, but this might not be possible given the coronavirus pandemic," she says.

src: die konstruksiebedryf bestaan hoofsaaklik uit mans.
tgt: the construction industry mainly consists of men.

src: "soms word vrouens ver kleineer omdat daar aan hulle vermoë om verandering mee te bring getwyfel word.
tgt: "at times, women are made to feel small because their ability to bring about change is doubted.

src: soms word hulle stemme nie gehoor nie.
tgt: sometimes their voices are not heard.

src: "ek het nogtans konstruk siebestuur gekies omdat ek glo dat ek die mag het om die bedryf, waar nodig, te verander en te verbeter.
tgt: "i still chose construction management because i believe that i have the power to change the industry and improve it where there is a need.

src: ek het gesien hoe vroue in dié bedryf topposisies bereik en invloedryk is.
tgt: i have seen women in this industry making it to top positions and having influence.

src: ek glo dat ek dit ook kan maak," sê sy.
tgt: i believe that i too can make it," she says.

src: danksy befondsing van misa is silondiwe magwaza die eerste gegradueerde in haar gesin is.
tgt: misa bursaries are advertised on www.

src: suidafrika gee tekort aan ventilators ’n hupstoot silusapho nyanda die stryd teen koronavirussiekte (covid19) in suidafrika het ’n hupstoot gekry met die eerste ventilator wat in die land gemaak is.
tgt: south africa acts to address ventilator shortage silusapho nyanda a locally developed ventilator will help patients with mild covid19 symptoms to breathe easier.

src: die cpapventilator (continuous positive airway pressure) help pasiënte met ligte simptome van covid19 om 'n plaaslik ontwikkelde ventilator help pasiënte met ligte covid19 simptome om makliker asem te haal.
tgt: the fight against the coronavirus disease (covid19) in south africa has been boosted with the production of the first ventilator made in the country.

src: makliker asem te haal deur 'n beperkte hoeveelheid suurstofhoudende lugdruk te voorsien wat hul lugweë oop hou.
tgt: the continuous positive airway pressure (cpap) ventilator helps patients with mild symptoms of covid19 to breathe easier by providing a mild level of oxygenated air pressure to keep their airways open.

src: die ventilator is deur die wetenskaplike nywerheidsnavorsingsraad (wnnr) in samewerking met 'n aantal plaaslike vennote ontwerp, en sal landwyd versprei word vir die behandeling van pasiënte met respiratoriese nood in die vroeë fase van die covid19infeksie.
tgt: the ventilator was designed by the council for scientific and industrial research (csir) in collaboration with a number of local partners and will be rolled out nationwide to patients showing respiratory distress in the early phase of covid19 infection.

src: "die lug wat ’n persoon normaalweg inasem, het 'n suurstofkonsentrasie van 23 persent.
tgt: "the air a person normally breaths has a 23 percent concentration of oxygen.

src: die cpapventilator kan meer suurstof pomp en sodoende 'n pasiënt help om asem te haal.
tgt: the cpap ventilator can pump a higher amount of oxygen, helping a person breathe.

src: die cpap kan deurlopend gekonsentreerde suurstof pomp.
tgt: the cpap pumps continuous concentrated oxygen.

src: ’n mens kan die hoeveelheid suurstof wat ’n pasiënt inasem, verhoog of verlaag," sê die uitvoerende bestuurder van die wnnr se future production manufacturing, martin sanne.
tgt: you can increase or decrease the amount of oxygen one is breathing in," says executive manager of csir future production: manufacturing martin sanne.

src: pasiënte wat met die ventilator behandel word, word deur 'n gesigmasker aan die ventilator gekoppel.
tgt: patients using the ventilator are connected via a face mask.

src: suurstof word uit 'n suurstoftenk gepomp en met natuurlike lug in die ventilator gemeng, waarvandaan dit na die masker oorgedra word en deur die pasiënt ingeasem word.
tgt: oxygen is drawn from an oxygen gas tank and is mixed with natural air in the ventilator, from where it is transmitted to the mask and breathed in by the patient.

src: sanne sê benewens die inpomp van suurstofhoudende lug, help die cpap pasiënte ook om uit te asem.
tgt: sanne says that in addition to pumping oxygenated air, the cpap also helps patients exhale.

src: die cpapventilator kan in hoëtegnologie kliniese omgewings, sowel as tydelike instellings soos veldhospitale en kwarantyngeriewe gebruik word.
tgt: the cpap device can be used in both hightech clinical environments and temporary settings, such as field hospitals and quarantine facilities.

src: sanne sê die wnnr sal teen einde augustus 10 000 ventilators kan vervaardig.
tgt: sanne says the csir will have produced 10 000 ventilators by the end of august.

src: in samewerking met siemens, simera, akacia, gabler, umoya en die universiteit van kaapstad, het die wnnr die cpap volgens die standaarde van die wêreldgesondheidsorganisasie vervaardig.
tgt: working with siemens, simera, akacia, gabler, umoya and the university of cape town, the csir produced the cpap according to world health organisation standards.

src: die eerste stel ventilators sal aan staatshospitale voorsien word wat onder druk is weens die tekort aan toerusting om covid19 te hanteer.
tgt: the first batch of ventilators will be given to state hospitals experiencing pressure due to the unavailability of equipment to deal with covid19.

src: die wnnr het aan die cpap begin werk nadat daar wêreldwyd 'n ernstige tekort aan ventilators ontstaan het.
tgt: the csir started working on the cpap after the world began experiencing an extreme shortage in ventilators.

src: "teen ongeveer maart en april was daar skielik ’n tekort aan ventilators van ons internasionale verskaffers.
tgt: "around march and april, there suddenly became a short supply of ventilators from our international suppliers.

src: as ’n mens dit in die hande kon kry, was dit baie duur; die regering het daarom ’n tender vir die vervaardiging van ventilators uitgereik," sê sanne.
tgt: where you could get them, they were very expensive so government issued a tender for the production of ventilators," says sanne.

src: die tender was deel van die regering se nasionale ventilatorprojek in die departement van handel, nywerheid en mededinging.
tgt: the tender was part of the government’s national ventilator project within the department of trade, industry and competition.

src: die wnnr werk ook aan 'n tweevlakpositiewe lugwegdrukventilator wat daarop gerig is om pasiënte met meer ernstige covid19simptome te behandel.
tgt: the csir is also working on a bilevel positive airway pressure ventilator aimed at helping patients with more severe symptoms of covid19.

src: help om die verspreiding van covid19 te stuit vukuzenzele unnamed ons nasie staar die ernstigste krisis in die geskiedenis van die land se demokrasie in die gesig.
tgt: help stop the spread of covid19 vukuzenzele unnamed our nation is con fronted by the gravest crisis in the history of our democracy.

src: ons het meer as 120 dae lank daarin geslaag om die verspreiding van 'n virus wat verwoesting oor die hele wêreld saai, te verlangsaam.
tgt: for more than 120 days, we have succeeded in delaying the spread of a virus that is causing devastation across the globe.

src: maar die styging in infeksies wat deur ons mediese spesialiste voorspel is, het nou begin.
tgt: but now, the surge in infections that we had been advised by our medical experts would come, has arrived.

src: meer as 'n kwartmiljoen suidafrikaners het die koronavirus opgedoen, en ons weet dat baie meer infeksies nie aangemeld word nie.
tgt: more than a quarter of a million south africans have been infected with coronavirus, and we know that many more infections have gone undetected.

src: meer as 12 000 nuwe gevalle word nou daagliks aangeteken.
tgt: we are now recording over 12,000 new cases every day.

src: sedert die begin van die uitbreking in maart, het minstens 4 079 mense weens covid19 gesterf.
tgt: since the start of the outbreak in march, at least 4,079 people have died from covid19.

src: soos die massiewe koue fronte wat hierdie tyd van die jaar ons land vanuit die suidatlantiese oseaan binnestroom, is daar min dele van die land wat nie deur die koronavirus geraak word nie.
tgt: like the massive cold fronts that sweep into our country from the south atlantic at this time of year, there are few parts of the country that will remain untouched by the coronavirus.

src: die koronavirusstorm is baie feller en meer vernietigend as enigiets wat ons voorheen beleef het.
tgt: the coronavirus storm is far fiercer and more destructive than any we have known before.

src: dit plaas ongekende druk op ons hulpbronne en ons vasberadenheid.
tgt: it is stretching our resources and our resolve to their limits.

src: die styging van infeksies wat ons deskundiges en wetenskaplikes meer as drie maande gelede voorspel het, is nou met ons.
tgt: the surge of infections that our experts and scientists predicted over 3 months ago has now arrived.

src: dit het in die weskaap begin en na die ooskaap en gauteng uitgebrei.
tgt: it started in the western cape and is now underway in the eastern cape and gauteng.

src: hoewel infeksies eksponensieel styg, is dit belangrik om daarop te let dat ons sterftesyfer van 1,5 persent onder die laagste ter wêreld is.
tgt: yet, while infections rise exponentially, it is important to note that our case fatality rate of 1.5 percent is among the lowest in the world.

src: dit word vergelyk met 'n wêreldwye gemiddelde sterftesyfer van 4,4 persent.
tgt: this is compared to a global average case fatality rate of 4.4 percent.

src: ons kan die betreklik lae aantal sterftes in ons land toeskryf aan die ervaring en toewyding van ons gesondheidswerkers en die dringende maatreëls wat ons getref het om die kapasiteit van ons gesondheidstelsel op te bou.
tgt: we owe the relatively low number of deaths in our country to the experience and dedication of our health professionals and the urgent measures we have taken to build the capacity of our health system.

src: hoewel die meeste van ons mense voorkomingsmaatreëls om die verspreiding van die virus te beperk, nakom, is daar ander wat dit nie doen nie.
tgt: even as most of our people have taken action to prevent the spread of the virus, there are others who have not.

src: daar is mense in ons geledere wat die regulasies wat ingestel is om die siekte te bestry, ignoreer.
tgt: there are some among us who ignore the regulations that have been passed to combat the disease.

src: te midde van so 'n pandemie, kan mense se optrede soos om in 'n taxi te klim sonder 'n gesigmasker; saam met vriende te kuier; partytjies by te woon of selfs familie te besoek, die virus maklik laat versprei en lewens in gevaar stel.
tgt: in the midst of such a pandemic, getting into a taxi without a face mask, gathering to meet friends, attending parties or even visiting family, can too easily spread the virus and cost lives.

src: hoewel dit 'n siekte is wat deur 'n virus veroorsaak word, word dit deur menslike optrede en gedrag versprei.
tgt: this may be a disease that is caused by a virus, but it is spread by human conduct and behaviour.

src: deur ons eie optrede – as individue, as gesinne, as gemeenskappe – kan en moet ons die verloop van hierdie pandemie in ons land verander.
tgt: through our own actions – as individuals, as families, as communities – we can and we must change the course of this pandemic in our country.

src: elke keer as ons uit ons huise gaan, moet ons 'n materiaalmasker dra wat ons neus en mond bedek.
tgt: we need to wear a cloth mask that covers our nose and mouth whenever we leave home.

src: ons moet steeds gereeld ons hande met seep en water of ontsmetmiddel was.
tgt: we must continue to regularly wash our hands with soap and water or sanitiser.

src: ons moet aanhou om alle oppervlakke in alle openbare ruimtes te reinig en te ontsmet.
tgt: we must continue to clean and sanitise all surfaces in all public spaces.

src: die belangrikste is dat ons 'n veilige afstand – minstens 2 meter – van ander mense af moet hou.
tgt: most importantly, we must keep a safe distance – of at least 2 metres – from other people.

src: daar kom tans bewyse aan die lig dat die virus ook in klein deeltjies deur die lug oorgedra kan word in plekke wat oorvol of toe is, of waar die lugsirkulasie swak is.
tgt: there is now emerging evidence that the virus may also be carried in tiny particles in the air in places that are crowded, closed or have poor air circulation.

src: om dié rede moet ons die binnenshuise omgewing onmiddellik verbeter op openbare plekke waar die risiko vir besmetting die grootste is.
tgt: for this reason we must immediately improve the indoor environment of public places where the risk of infection is greatest.

src: ons besluit om 'n landwye inperking te verklaar toe ons gesondheidsdienste nog nie voldoende voorberei was nie, het ’n massiewe aanvanklike styging in infeksies sowel as meer lewensverliese voorkom.
tgt: our decision to declare a nationwide lockdown prevented a massive early surge of infections when our health services were less prepared, which would have resulted in a far greater loss of lives.

src: ons het in die tyd wat ons tot ons beskikking gehad het, belangrike maatreëls getref om ons gesondheidsrespons te versterk.
