tgt: in the time that we had, we have taken important measures to strengthen our health response.

src: ons het meer as twee miljoen koronavirustoetse gedoen en gemeenskapsgesondheidswerkers het meer as 20 miljoen siftings voltooi.
tgt: we have conducted more than two million coronavirus tests and community health workers have done more than 20 million screenings.

src: ons het bykans 28 000 hospitaalbeddens beskikbaar gestel vir covid19 pasiënte en het funksionele veldhospitale regoor die land opgerig.
tgt: we have made available almost 28,000 hospital beds for covid19 patients and have constructed functional field hospitals across the country.

src: ons het nou meer as 37 000 kwarantynbeddens in private en openbare fasiliteite regdeur die land, wat gereed is om mense te isoleer wat dit nie tuis kan doen nie.
tgt: we now have over 37,000 quarantine beds in private and public facilities across the country, ready to isolate those who cannot do so at home.

src: om ons frontliniewerkers te beskerm, het ons miljoene artikels persoonlike beskermende toerusting by hospitale, klinieke en skole regdeur die land aangekoop en afgelewer.
tgt: we have procured and delivered millions of items of personal protective equipment to hospitals, clinics and schools across the country to protect our frontline workers.

src: ons het ook bykomende verpleegkundiges, dokters en noodgesondheidspersoneel gewerf en werf steeds meer.
tgt: we have recruited and continue to recruit additional nurses, doctors and emergency health personnel.

src: ons maak vordering met ons pogings om covid19 te hanteer, maar ons grootste uitdaging lê nog voor.
tgt: we continue to make progress in our efforts to deal with covid 19, but our greatest challenge still lies ahead.

src: ons werk in al die provinsies daaraan om meer beddens in die algemene sale, sowel as vir kritieke covid19pasiënte beskikbaar te stel.
tgt: across all provinces, we are working to further increase the number of general ward and critical beds available for covid19 patients.

src: kapasiteit in algemene sale word in verskeie hospitale geskep deur gevalle wat minder dringend is tot later uit te stel, sommige hospitaalruimtes in bykomende sale te omskep en veldhospitale op te rig of uit te brei.
tgt: ward capacity is being freed up in a number of hospitals by delaying nonurgent care, the conversion of some areas of hospitals into additional ward space and the erection or expansion of field hospitals.

src: ons werk daaraan om groter hoeveelhede suurstof, ventilators en ander toerusting vir diegene wat kritieke sorg verg beskikbaar te stel, deur onder meer die toevoer van suurstof vanaf ander bronne te herlei.
tgt: we are working to increase supplies of oxygen, ventilators and other equipment for those who will need critical care, including by diverting the supply of oxygen from other purposes.

src: ons gebruik digitale tegnologieë om die identifisering, opsporing en isolasie van kontakte uit te brei en om ondersteuning te bied aan diegene wat positief toets.
tgt: we are deploying digital technologies to strengthen the identification, tracing and isolation of contacts, and to provide support to those who test positive.

src: namate ons die hoogtepunt van infeksies nader, moet ons meer voorsorg tref en bestaande maatreëls verskerp om die oordragtempo te vertraag.
tgt: as we now approach the peak of infections, we need to take extra precautions and tighten existing measures to slow down the rate of transmission.

src: die regulasies oor die dra van maskers word verskerp.
tgt: regulations on the wearing of masks will be strengthened.

src: werkgewers, winkeleienaars en bestuurders, openbare vervoeroperateurs en bestuurders, sowel as eienaars van enige ander openbare gebou is nou wetlik verplig om te sorg dat elkeen wat hul perseel of voertuig betree, 'n masker moet dra.
tgt: employers, shop owners and managers, public transport operators, and managers and owners of any other public building are now legally obliged to ensure that anyone entering their premises or vehicle must be wearing a mask.

src: taxi’s wat plaaslike reise onderneem, sal nou toegelaat word om hul kapasiteit tot 100 persent te verhoog, terwyl langafstandtaxi's nie toegelaat sal word om 70 persent besetting te oorskry nie, op voorwaarde dat nuwe protokolle vir risikovermindering wat met maskers, ontsmetting van voertuie en oop vensters verband hou, gevolg word.
tgt: taxis undertaking local trips will now be permitted to increase their capacity to 100 percent, while long distance taxis will not be allowed to exceed 70 percent occupancy, on condition that new risk mitigation protocols related to masks, vehicle sanitising and open windows are followed.

src: duidelike bewyse het nou aan die lig gekom dat die hervatting van alkoholverkope daartoe gelei het dat hospitale, insluitend traumaen intensiewesorgeenhede, onder aansienlike druk geplaas is weens motorongelukke, geweld en ander alkoholverwante trauma.
tgt: there is now clear evidence that the resumption of alcohol sales has resulted in substantial pressure being put on hospitals, including trauma and icu units, due to motor vehicle accidents, violence and related trauma.

src: ons het derhalwe besluit om die verbod op die verkoop en verspreiding van alkohol weer in te stel om die druk op hospitaalkapasiteit te verlig.
tgt: we have therefore decided that in order to conserve hospital capacity, the sale, dispensing and distribution of alcohol will be suspended with immediate effect.

src: as 'n bykomende maatreël om die druk op hospitale te verminder, sal 'n aandklokreël tussen 21:00 en 04:00 van krag wees.
tgt: as an additional measure to reduce the pressure on hospitals, a curfew will be put in place between the hours of 9pm and 4am.

src: ons is ten volle bewus daarvan dat die instelling van hierdie maatreëls onwelkome beperkings op mense se alledaagse lewens plaas.
tgt: we are taking these measures fully aware that they impose unwelcome restrictions on people’s lives.

src: dit is egter noodsaaklik om ons deur die hoogtepunt van die siekte te dra.
tgt: they are, however, necessary to see us through the peak of the disease.

src: daar is geen manier hoe ons die aanslag van die koronavirus kan vryspring nie.
tgt: there is no way that we can avoid the coronavirus storm.

src: maar ons kan die skade wat dit in ons lewens kan aanrig, beperk.
tgt: but we can limit the damage that it can cause to our lives.

src: ons het as 'n nasie saamgestaan om mekaar te ondersteun, om troos te bied aan siekes en om aanvaarding vir dié wat nog die virus het, te bevorder.
tgt: as a nation we have come together to support each other, to provide comfort to those who are ill and to promote acceptance of people living with the virus.

src: nou, meer as ooit tevore, is ons verantwoordelik vir die lewens van diegene rondom ons.
tgt: now, more than ever, we are responsible for the lives of those around us.

src: brandbestryder van ‘crew juliet’ deel haar storie dale hes vroue moet die weg baan, sê brandbestryder.
tgt: crew juliet firefighter shares her story dale hes young firefighter vuyiseka arendse (26) is part of crew juliet, south africa’s first allfemale wildland firefighting team.

src: die jong brandbestryder, vuyiseka arendse (26), is deel van crew juliet, suidafrika se eerste veldbrandbestrydingspan wat net uit vroue bestaan.
tgt: her strength and determination to make a name for herself in the maledominated world of firefighting is a true inspiration to all women.

src: arendse het in die klein weskaapse dorpie beaufortwes grootgeword.
tgt: arendse grew up in the small western cape town of beaufort west.

src: na skool het sy aan 'n kollege in oudtshoorn probeer studeer, maar het besluit om terug te gaan huis toe om haar gesin te onderhou.
tgt: after school, she tried studying at a college in oudtshoorn, but decided to move back home to support her family.

src: sy het 'n rukkie by 'n supermark gewerk, maar toe het brandbestryding haar aandag getrek.
tgt: she worked at a supermarket for a while, but then firefighting caught her eye.

src: "ek het die brandbestryders in hul uniforms en groot rooi vragmotors gesien.
tgt: "i saw the firefighters in their uniforms and the big red trucks.

src: dit het my dadelik gefassineer en ek wou meer uitvind," sê arendse.
tgt: i immediately became interested and wanted to find out more," says arendse.

src: arendse was een van die studente wat by die weskaapse regering se chrysalis akademiejeugontwikkelingsprogram in 2016 gegradueer het.
tgt: arendse was one of the graduates of the western cape government’s chrysalis academy youth development programme in 2016. after the programme, she worked at the fire station in beaufort west, earning only r1 900 per month.

src: maar toe hoor sy van ’n opleidingsgeleentheid wat verlede jaar deur ncc environmental services aangebied word.
tgt: but then she came across an opportunity offered by ncc environmental services last year.

src: "ek was ’n fasiliteerder by die chrysalis akademie toe ncc met die studente kom gesels het oor ’n geleentheid om aansoek te doen vir die eerste vroulike veldbrandbestrydingspan.
tgt: "i was at chrysalis academy as a facilitator when ncc came to talk to the students about the opportunity to apply for training for the first allfemale wildland firefighting team.

src: al was ek nie ’n student nie, het ek baie belanggestel.
tgt: even though i was not one of the students, i was very interested and applied for the training, and i was accepted," arendse says.

src: ek het aansoek gedoen vir die opleiding en is aanvaar," sê arendse.
tgt: arendse went through the training, which combined theory and practical aspects of firefighting.

src: "ek het so baie geleer.
tgt: "i learnt so much.

src: ek het byvoorbeeld nooit geweet dat daar brandbestryders is wat net veldbrande blus nie.
tgt: for one, i didn’t know that there were firefighters tasked with putting out wildfires.

src: ek het voorheen gedink hulle werk net in stedelike gebiede om brande in geboue te blus," vertel sy.
tgt: i had previously thought they only worked in towns to put out fires in buildings," she says.

src: arendse sê voorts dat dit 'n wonderlike gevoel was om die opleidingskursus te slaag en deel van die eerste vroulike brandbestryderspan van sy soort te word.
tgt: arendse adds that it was an amazing feeling to pass the training and become part of the first allfemale firefighting team of its kind.

src: "ek was vreeslik opgewonde, veral omdat baie van die mense vir wie ek vertel het dat ek ’n brandbestryder wou word, gesê het ek kan dit nie doen nie omdat ek ’n vrou is en nie opgewasse sou wees vir die taak nie.
tgt: "i felt very excited, especially because when i had told people i wanted to be a firefighter, many of them said i could not do it because i am a woman and would not cope with the job.

src: dit het my aangespoor om vir hulle te wys dat ek dit wel kon doen, nie net vir myself nie, maar ook vir al die vroue van suidafrika."
tgt: this pushed me to show them that i can actually do it, not only for myself but for the rest of the women in south africa.

src: arendse sê haar eerste groot brandbestrydingstaak in noordhoek was nie net 'n groot uitdaging nie, maar ook ’n bevredigende ervaring.
tgt: "arendse says that fighting her first major fire in noordhoek was a challenging but highly rewarding experience.

src: "dit was my eerste volle 24uurskof en die eerste keer dat ons saam met al die ander manlike brandbestryders gewerk het.
tgt: "it was my first full 24hour shift and the first time we were working with all the other male firefighters.

src: dit was vermoeiend en ons het baie warm gekry in ons beskermende uitrustings, maar ons het die werk voltooi en daarna ’n gevoel van bevrediging ervaar.
tgt: it was tiring and very hot in our protective gear but we finished the job and the feeling afterwards was very rewarding.

src: "arendse moedig suidafrikaanse vroue aan om hulself nooit te onderskat nie.
tgt: "arendse encourages the women of south africa to never underestimate themselves.

src: vereer vroue deurvereer vroue deurekonomiese insluitingekonomiese insluiting vukuzenzele unnamed suidafrika vier in augustus vrouemaand.
tgt: celebrating women through economic inclusion vukuzenzele unnamed in august south africa celebrates women’s month.

src: dié geleentheid is die herdenking van die dag in 1956 toe 20 000 vroue na die uniegebou opgemars het — n see van vroue van alle rasse, wat verskillende tale gepraat het en uit verskillende oorde gekom het.
tgt: this occasion marks the anniversary of the day in 1956 when 20,000 women marched to the union buildings – a great sea of womankind speaking many languages, from different places and of all races.

src: hulle was verenig in hulle aandrang op die einde van die aaklige paswette en vir hulle reg om in vryheid te lewe.
tgt: they were united in their demand for an end to the dreaded pass laws and for their right to live in freedom.

src: die huidige status en posisie van vroue in suidafrika is heeltemal anders as wat ons ma's en ouma's in 1956 in die gesig moes staar.
tgt: the status and position of women in south africa today is vastly different to that faced by our mothers and grandmothers in 1956. we have come a long way in realising a south africa that is nonracial, nonsexist, democratic, prosperous and free.

src: ons het ver gekom om n suidafrika te verwesenlik wat nierassig, nieseksisties, demokraties, vooruitstrewend en vry is.
tgt: there has been real progress in improving the lives of south african women in the economy, in the political sphere and in public life.

src: maar ons is bewus daarvan dat daar nog heelwat vordering gemaak moet word.
tgt: at the same time, we know there is so much further we still have to go.

src: vroue staar steeds diskriminasie, teistering en geweld in die gesig en dra die grootste las van armoede.
tgt: women still face discrimination, harassment and violence, and bear the greatest brunt of poverty.

src: as ons die belofte wat in ons grondwet vervat is wil verwesenlik, moet ons die ekonomiese en finansiële uitsluiting wat vroue meer kwesbaar vir mishandeling en geweld maak, die hoof bied.
tgt: if we are to truly realise the promise of our constitution we have to tackle the economic and financial exclusion that makes women more vulnerable to abuse and violence.

src: ons het by ’n baanbrekerveldtog aangesluit wat ons met globale pogings om teen 2030 geslagsgelykheid te bereik, verbind.
tgt: we have joined a groundbreaking campaign that links us to global efforts to achieve gender equality by 2030. generation equality is an ambitious and transformative agenda to end discrimination and violence against women and for their equal participation in political, social and economic life.

src: generation equality is n vooruitstrewende en transformatiewe agenda om diskriminasie en geweld teen vroue te beëindig en te verseker dat hulle gelyke deelname in die politieke, maatskaplike en ekonomiese sfere het.
tgt: as part of this campaign, we have joined two ‘action coalitions’, one for economic justice and rights and another against genderbased violence.

src: albei is kernbelangrik vir ons eie nasionale agenda.
tgt: both of these themes are critical to our own national agenda.

src: elf maande sedert die toepassing van die noodreaksieaksieplan om geslagsgebaseerde geweld en vrouemoord te bekamp, het ons vordering gemaak met die uitbreiding van ondersteuning en sorg vir oorlewendes.
tgt: eleven months since the emergency response action plan to combat genderbased violence and femicide was implemented we have made progress in expanding support and care to survivors, and progress is being made in legal reforms to afford them greater protection.

src: ons het in augustus begin om die nasionale strategiese plan vir die bekamping van geslagsgebaseerde geweld en vrouemoord, uit te voer.
tgt: during the month of august, we begin the implementation of the national strategic plan to combat genderbased violence and femicide.

src: n kernaspek van die plan is om die finansiële insluiting van vroue te verseker.
tgt: a key aspect of the plan is on ensuring greater women’s financial inclusion.

src: dit is omdat ekonomiese en maatskaplike ongelykheid onderling verbind is.
tgt: this is because economic inequality and social inequality are interconnected.

src: die ekonomiese status van vroue in suidafrika maak hulle meer kwesbaar vir mishandeling.
tgt: the economic status of women in south africa makes them more vulnerable to abuse.

src: ons moet dus ondersteuning vir vroue verskerp om hulle in staat te stel om finansieel onafhanklik te word.
tgt: we must therefore scale up support for women to enable them to become financially independent.

src: ons het verskeie beloftes onder gene ration equality gemaak, wat deur die nasionale strategiese plan nagekom sal word.
tgt: we have made a number of commitments under generation equality that will be given effect to through the national strategic plan.

src: ons gaan eerstens vroue se ekonomiese insluiting deur openbare verkryging verbeter.
tgt: firstly, we are going to drive women’s economic inclusion through public procurement.

src: ons doelwit is om te verseker dat minstens 40 persent van goedere en dienste wat deur openbare entiteite verkry word, van besighede wat deur vroue besit word verkry sal word.
tgt: we have set the target of ensuring that at least 40 percent of goods and services procured by public entities are sourced from womenowned businesses.

src: tweedens, gaan onsondersteuning vir kmmo's in vroue se besit, en vir vroue wat in die informele sektor werk of wat werkloos is, verskerp.
tgt: secondly, we are going to scale up support for womenowned smmes and for women who work in the informal sector or are unemployed.

src: dit sal medewerking met die finansiële sektor insluit om finansiële dienste meer toeganklik en bekostigbaar vir vroue te maak.
tgt: this will include engagement with the financial sector to make financial services accessible and affordable for women.

src: derdens, wil ons verseker dat meer vroue toegang tot produktiewe bates, soos grond, het.
tgt: thirdly, we want to ensure more women have access to productive assets such as land.

src: dit is noodsaaklik dat vrouebegunstigdes van die versnelde grondhervormingsprogram is.
tgt: it is essential that women are beneficiaries of the accelerate land reform programme.

src: dit is beduidend dat 53 persent van die begunstigdes van die r75 miljoen vir covid19noodleniging wat vir boederyinsetbewyse opsy gesit is, landelike vroue sal wees.
tgt: it is significant that of the r75 million in covid19 relief earmarked for farming input vouchers 53 percent of the beneficiaries will be rural women.

src: ons moet verseker dat vroulike bestaansboere en kleinskaalse boere steeds na afloop van die pandemie ondersteun word.
tgt: we must ensure that women subsistence and smallscale farmers continue to receive support beyond the pandemic.

src: vierdens, wil ons verseker dat vroue teen geslagsgebaseerde geweld in die werkplek beskerm word.
tgt: fourthly, we want to ensure that women are protected from genderbased violence in the workplace.

src: ons sal in dié opsig op nasionale en streeksvlak vir die regstelling van die iaokonvensie oor geweld en teistering in die werkplek werk.
tgt: in this regard, we will be working at a national and regional level towards the ratification of the ilo convention on violence and harassment in the workplace.

src: daar word gesê dat vryheid nie gegee word nie, maar geneem word.
tgt: it is said that freedom is not given, but taken.

src: die emansipasie van vroue is slegs woorde op papier, tensy dit met n verbintenis deur alle sektore van die samelewing gepaardgaan.
tgt: the emancipation of women is only words on paper unless it is matched by commitment from all sectors of society.

src: wanneer ons ná die koronaviruspandemie vir die herbou van ons ekonomie voorberei, kan ons nie bloot terugkeer na waar ons voor die uitbreking van die virus was nie.
tgt: as we prepare for the reconstruction of our economy in the wake of the coronavirus pandemic, we have said that we cannot simply return to where we were before the outbreak of the virus.

src: ons moet n ekonomie bou wat wesentlik anders is, wat onder meer die materiële posisie van vroue daadwerklik verbeter.
tgt: we must build a fundamentally different economy which, among other things, substantially improves the material position of women.

src: dit beteken dat ons beleggings in infrastruktuur nie net die ontwikkeling van plaaslike nywerhede moet ondersteun nie, maar ook ondernemings wat deur vroue besit word.
tgt: this means that our investment in infrastructure must support not only the development of local industry, but also womenowned businesses.

src: dit moet doelbewus werksgeleenthede vir vroue op alle vlakke van beplanning, finansiering, konstruksie en die onderhoud van infrastruktuur skep.
tgt: it must deliberately create employment opportunities for women in all stages of planning, financing, building and maintaining infrastructure.

src: net soos die maatreëls vir die verskerping van ons openbare indiensnemingsprogramme, moet ons ook seker maak dat veral jong vroue as deelnemers aangewys word.
tgt: by the same measures, as we scale up our public employment programmes, we must ensure that young women in particular are identified as participants.

src: benewens ’n inkomste, sal die programme hul ook geleenthede bied om vaardighede en ervaring te verkry wat nodig is om die hoofstroomekonomie te betree.
tgt: in addition to an income, these programmes will provide them with an opportunity to acquire some of the skills and experience necessary to enter the mainstream economy.

src: hoewel dit die regering se verantwoordelikheid is om ekonomiese geleenthede vir vroue en n bemagtigende raamwerk vir die bevordering van geslagsgelykheid te skep, moet almal in die samelewing hul deel doen.
tgt: as much as it is government’s responsibility to provide economic opportunities for women and create an enabling framework for advancing gender equality, everyone in society needs to play their part.

src: die sakesektor moet ondernemings wat deur vroue besit word ondersteun wanneer goedere en dienste verkry word.
tgt: businesses must support womenowned enterprises in the procurement of goods and services.

src: hulle behoort meer vroue in diens te neem en meer vroue in bestuursposisies aan te stel.
tgt: they should employ more women and appoint more women to management positions.

src: dit is veral belangrik as mens in ag neem dat die privaat sektor se rekord oor geslagsverteenwoordiging op bestuursvlak agter dié van die staatsdiens is.
tgt: this is all the more important considering that the private sector’s record on genderrepresentation at management level lags behind that of the public sector.

src: hierdie kwessie word herhaaldelik in gesprekke wat ek met verskeie sakeorganisasies vir vroue gehad het geopper.
tgt: this is an issue that is repeatedly raised in engagements i have had with a number of women’s business organisations.

src: net so moet ons ongelykheid ten opsigte van vergoeding vir mans en vroue uit die weg ruim en uiting gee aan die beleid van gelyke vergoeding vir gelyke werk soos in die wet op gelyke indiensneming vervat word.
tgt: by equal measure, we must eliminate gender disparities in pay for men and women, and give effect to the principle of equal pay for equal work contained in the employment equity act.

src: vroue moet ook teen teistering en diskriminasie in die werkplek beskerm word.
tgt: women must also be protected from harassment and discrimination in the workplace.

src: dit is vervoeroperateurs, universiteitsadministrateurs, skoolbeheerliggame engodsdienstige organisasies se plig om omstandige te skep waarin vroue en meisies veilig kan reis, studeer en aanbid.
tgt: it is up to transport operators, university administrators, school governing bodies and religious organisations to create conditions for women and girls to travel, study and worship in safety.

src: ons moet ons pogings om chauvinisme, seksisme en patriargie uit te roei, met mening voortsit.
tgt: we must forge ahead with our efforts to eradicate chauvinism, sexism and patriarchy.

src: dit is hierdie opvattings wat die onderdrukking van vroue in staat stel.
tgt: it is these attitudes that enable the oppression of women.

src: dit is die plig van beide mans en vroue om te bevestig dat vroue se waarde, posisie en opinies nie minder as mans sn is nie.
tgt: it is up to us – both men and women – to affirm that a woman’s value, position and opinions are no less than that of a man.

src: terugkeer werk toe nadat jy van covid19 herstel het allison cooper wanneer kan jy te rugkeer werk toe as jy positief vir die koronavirus (covid19) getoets het?
tgt: back to work after covid19 a full guide allison cooper when can you return to work if you have tested positive for the coronavirus (covid19)?

src: die nasionale instituut vir oordraagbare siek tes het die nodige antwoorde.
tgt: the national institute for communicable diseases has the answers you need.

src: hoe lank moet ek in iso lasie bly as ek positief vir covid19 getoets het?
tgt: when i test positive for covid19, how long do i have to stay in isolation?

src: mense wat positief vir co vid19 getoets het maar nie simptome het nie, moet vir 10 dae, vanaf die dag wat hulle die positiewe toetsresultaat ontvang het, in isolasie by die huis of in n regeringsisolasiefasiliteit bly.
tgt: people who test positive for covid19, but don’t have any symptoms, must remain in isolation at home or in a government isolation facility for 10 days, from the day they receive their positive test result.

src: diegene met matige simptome moet vir 10 dae, vanaf die dag wat hulle simptome begin het, in isolasie by die huis of in n regeringsisolasiefasiliteit bly.
tgt: those who have mild symptoms must remain in isolation at home or in a government isolation facility for 10 days, from the day their symptoms start.

src: diegene wat ernstig siek is en hospitaal toe moet gaan, moet vir 10 dae, vanaf die dag wat hulle stabiel is en nie meer suurstof nodig het nie, in isolasie bly.
tgt: those who have severe disease, who have to go to hospital, must remain in isolation for 10 days, from when they are stable and don’t need oxygen anymore.

src: hoe kan mense wat co vid19positief is die siekte aan ander oordra?
tgt: how can a covid19 positive people transfer the disease to others?

src: volgens die minister van gesondheid, zweli mkhise, kan die meeste mense met n matige infeksie die virus vir tussen sewe en 12 dae oordra.
tgt: according to health minister zweli mkhize, most people who have a mild infection can spread the virus for between seven to 12 days.

src: mense wat baie siek word kan egter aansteeklik wees en kan die virus vir n langer tydperk aan ander oordra.
tgt: however, people who become very sick could be infectious and be able to transmit the virus to others for a longer period of time.

src: moet ek nog 'n covid19toets doen om te bewys dat ek negatief is voordat ek kan terugkeer werk toe?
tgt: do i have to have another covid19 test, proving that i am negative, before i return to work?

src: nee.
tgt: no.

src: daar word nie aanbeveel dat mense wat matig siek was en gesond geword het, weer getoets moet word nie.
tgt: retesting people who have experienced mild illness and have recovered is not recommended.

src: n persoon word as veilig geag om terug te keer werk toe en uit isolasie te kom wanneer hulle nie meer aansteeklik is nie.
tgt: a person is considered safe to return to work and come out of isolation if they are no longer infectious.

src: dit beteken dat hulle die eerste simptome meer as 10 dae gelede ontwikkel het en vir minstens drie dae geen simptome gehad het nie.
tgt: this means they developed their first symptoms more than 10 days ago and have not had any symptoms for at least three days.

src: werknemers kan in die meeste gevalle terugkeer werk toe sonder om weer getoets te word as: hulle 10 dae van verpligte kwarantyn of selfisolasie voltooi het.
tgt: in most cases, employees can return to work without testing again if: they have completed 10 days of mandatory quarantine or selfisolation.

src: diegene wat matige tot ernstige simptome gehad het, medies ondersoek is.
tgt: those who had moderate or severe symptoms undergo a medical evaluation.

src: hulle steeds persoonlike higiëne en sosiale distansiering handhaaf.
tgt: they continue to practice personal hygiene and social distancing.

src: die werkgewer die werker monitor om te verseker dat hy/sy nie agteruitgaan nie.
tgt: the employer monitors the worker to ensure they do not regress.

src: hulle vir minstens 21 dae ná die diagnose n masker dra.
tgt: they wear a mask, from the date of diagnosis for at least 21 days.

src: my toets was negatief maar ek het steeds simptome.
tgt: i have tested negative but i still have symptoms.

src: wat nou?
tgt: what now?

src: dit is moontlik om n vals ne gatiewe toetsresultaat te kry.
tgt: it is possible to get a false negative test result.

src: dit beteken dat jou eerste toets negatief kan wees, maar dat jy in n later stadium positief kan toets.
tgt: this means that your first test could be negative, but you could test positive at a later stage.

src: kontak n professionele gesondheidsorgwerker as jou covid19 simptome voortduur.
tgt: if you continue to have covid19 symptoms contact your healthcare professional.

src: en as ek na 10 dae steeds simptome het?
tgt: what if i am still showing symptoms after 10 days?

src: dit is algemeen vir pasiënte om vir meer as 10 dae simptome te ervaar.
tgt: it is common for patients to continue to have symptoms for longer than 10 days.

src: dit kan ’n paar weke neem om ten volle te herstel.
tgt: full recovery may take several weeks.

src: raadpleeg jou gesondheidsorgwerker as jy steeds simptome het.
tgt: if you still have symptoms, seek advice from your healthcare professional.

src: vir meer inligting oor covid19, besoek die nasionale instituut vir oordraagbare siektes se webwerf by www.
tgt: for more information about covid19, visit the national institute for communicable diseases’ website at www.

src: bestuur covid19: tuis of by n toegewyde fasiliteit allison cooper as jy nie kan selfisoleer nie, skakel die nasionale koronavirusblitslyn by 0800 029 999 vir meer inligting oor jou naaste isolasieof kwarantynfasiliteit.
tgt: managing covid19: at home and at a dedicated facility allison cooper if you are not able to selfisolate, call the national coronavirus hotline at 0800 029 999 for more information about your closest isolation or quarantine facility.

src: as jy positief vir covid19 vir covid19 getoets het, is dit uiters belangrik om getoets het, is dit uiters belangrik om jouself van ander mense af te sonder, tuis of by 'n gratis isolasiefasiliteit.
tgt: it’s extremely important to separate yourself from others, either at home or at a free isolation facility, if you have tested positive for covid19.

src: jouself van ander mense af te sonder, tuis of by 'n gratis isolasiefasiliteit.
tgt: many south af ricans who test positive for the coronavirus (covid19) cannot selfisolate because their home is too small for them to live and sleep in a room that’s not shared by anyone else.

src: baie suidafrika ners wat positief vir die koronavirus (covid19) getoets het kan nie selfisoleer nie, omdat hulle huise te klein is om in n kamer wat nie deur ander gedeel word nie te leef en te slaap.
tgt: government has ensured that dedicated isolation facilities are available for people who have tested positive, and dedicated quarantine facilities are available for people who are still waiting for their test results.

src: albei dienste is gratis.
tgt: both services are free.

src: volgens dr. marlin mccay, n algemene praktisyn van florida aan die wesrand, is die eerste ding wat jy moet doen wanneer jy met covid19 gediagnoseer is, om die verspreiding van die infeksie te beperk.
tgt: according to dr marlin mccay, a general practitioner based in florida on the west rand, the first thing you need to do when diagnosed with covid19 is to limit the spread of the infection.

src: "jy wil jou gesin beskerm," sê hy.
tgt: "you want to protect your family," he says.

src: om dit kan doen, moet jy in isolasie wees — tuis of by n isolasiefasiliteit.
tgt: to do this, you need to go into isolation – either at home or at an isolation facility.

src: "as jy selfisoleer beteken dit dat jy in ’n deel van die huis heeltemal van die res van die gesin afgesonder moet wees.
tgt: "if you are selfisolating it means you have to find a part of the house where you are totally cut off from the rest of the family.

src: niemand behoort binne drie meter van jou af te kom nie.
tgt: no one should come within three metres of you.

src: jy moet alleen eet, jou eie messegoed en breekware gebruik, jou eie badkamer gebruik indien moontlik, en seker maak dat daar geen kontak met enigiemand anders in die huishouding is nie.
tgt: you must eat on your own; use your own cutlery and crockery; use your own bathroom, if possible; and make sure there’s no contact with anyone else in the family.

src: "jou dokter of primêre versorger behoort jou van sekere basiese medisyne te voorsien om die meeste van die simptome te verlig, veral tekens soos liggaamspyne, hoofpyn en koors.
tgt: "your doctor or primary care giver should help you with certain basic medications to ease most of the symptoms, especially things like body aches and pains, headache and fever.

src: daar is ook vitamienes wat jou kan help om gesond te bly," sê hy.
tgt: there are also some good vitamins one can use to stay healthy," he says.

src: dit is ook belangrik om genoeg te rus en genoeg water of helder vloeistowwe te drink om seker te maak dat jou urine bleek en deursigtig bly.
tgt: it’s also important to get enough rest and drink enough water or clear fluids to make sure that your urine stays a pale clear colour.

src: die meeste mense wat matig siek word sal binne n week nadat die eerste simptome begin het, beter voel, maar dit is belangrik om jou simptome noukeurig dop te hou.
tgt: most people with mild illness will start feeling better within a week of the first symptoms, but it’s important to monitor your symptoms carefully.

src: as jy enige noodwaarskuwingstekens ontwikkel, soos moeilike asemhaling, borspyn of druk op jou bors wat nie weggaan nie, bloed hoes, deurmekaar raak, erge slaperigheid ervaar of as jou gesig of lippe blou word, moet jy onmiddellik ’n ambulans ontbied of hospitaal toe gaan.
tgt: if you develop any emergency warning signs, such as trouble breathing, chest pain or pressure in your chest that does not go away, coughing up blood, becoming confused, severe sleepi ness or blue lips or face you must call an ambulance or go to hospital immediately.

src: kwarantynfasiliteitevir diegene wat hulself nie van ander wat in die huis bly kan afsonder nie, het die regering gratis kwarantynfasiliteite regoor die land opgerig om hulle en hul geliefdes veilig te hou.
tgt: for those who are not able to keep themselves away from others living in the home, government has setup free quarantine facilities around the country to keep you and your loved ones safe.

src: die weskaapse regering het onlangs kommentaar deur ’n paar pasiënte oor sy isolasiefasiliteite gepubliseer.
tgt: the western cape government recently published some comments from patients about its isolation facilities.

src: marie jantjies van witzenberg het besluit om gesondheidsorgwerkers se raad te volg en na die isolasiefasiliteit te gaan omdat haar 97jarige ma by haar en haar kinders woon en sy hulle wou beskerm.
tgt: marie jantjies from witzenberg decided to follow healthcare workers’ advice and go to the isolation facility because her 97yearold mother lives with her and her children and she wanted to protect them.

src: "ek is baie goed behandel.
tgt: "i was treated very well.

src: die kos was lekker — selfs lekkerder as by die huis.
tgt: the food was nice – even nicer than at home.

src: ek het besef dat ek net positief moes bly.
tgt: i realised i just had to stay positive.

src: ek was angstig, maar het gebid en probeer om te ontspan," sê sy.
tgt: i was anxious, but i prayed and tried to relax," she said.

src: "daardie plek kan lewens red!
tgt: "that place can save lives!

src: dit is regtig die beste," sê john arnoldus, wat by n isolasiefasiliteit in drakenstein van covid19 herstel het.
tgt: it really is the best," said john arnoldus, who recovered from covid19 at an isolation facility in drakenstein.

src: "een van my vriende was tuis in kwarantyn en hy het gesukkel om op sy eie reg te kom.
tgt: "one of my friends was in quarantine at home and he struggled to recover on his own.

src: ek het vir hom gesê om die mense te kontak wat my versorg het — dit is hoe om beter te word.
tgt: i told him to contact the people who cared for me – that is the way to get better.

src: die mediese personeel en die bestuurder daar se ondersteuning — dit trek jou deur", sê hy.
tgt: the support of the medical staff and the manager there – that pulls you through," he said.

src: arnoldus was eers huiwerig om na die isolasiefasiliteit te gaan weens die wanopvatting dat ’n mens daar sieker sal word en doodgaan.
tgt: arnoldus was initially hesitant to go to the isolation facility because of the wrong perception that if you go to a facility like this you will get sicker and die.

src: "ek het die ergste verwag, maar ek was baie goed ontvang.
tgt: "i expected the worst, but i was received so well.

src: lof aan al die personeel!
tgt: hats off to the staff!

src: hulle het vir my verduidelik dat niemand by die fasiliteit my siek kan maak nie, aangesien ek reeds covid19 gehad het," sê hy.
tgt: they explained to me that as i already have covid19, no one at the facility could make me sick," he said.

src: wat kan jy van 'nn kwarantynfasiliteit verwag?
tgt: what can you expect from a quarantine facility?

src: volgens die weskaapse regering word daar aan al jou behoeftes voorsien.
tgt: according to the western cape government, all of your needs are taken of.

src: laat ons mekaar veilig hou vukuzenzele unnamed in ons reaksie op die koronaviruspande mie, het ons land na waarskuwingsvlak 2 be weeg.
tgt: let’s keep each other safe vukuzenzele unnamed our country has moved to alert level 2 in our response to the coronavirus pandemic.

src: dit is 'n verligting vir alle suidafrikaners wat die afgelope vyf maan de onder streng beperkings moes leef.
tgt: this has come as a relief to all south africans who have had to live under stringent restrictions for the last five months.

src: dit is 'n teken van die vordering wat ons maak om nuwe infeksies te laat afneem en die eise wat dit aan ons gesondheidsinstellings stel te verlig.
tgt: it is a sign of the progress we are making in reducing new infections and demand on our health facilities.

src: dit is ook 'n baie belangrike ontwikkeling vir ons ekonomie, omdat ons daarna streef om ekonomies weer op dreef te kom.
tgt: it is also a very important development as we strive to restart our economy.

src: ons is steeds middein 'n dodelike pandemie wat meer as 11 000 lewens in suidafrika geëis het.
tgt: we are still very much in the middle of a deadly pandemic that has taken over 11,000 lives in south africa alone.

src: met meer as 'n halfmiljoen bevestigde ge valle het ons steeds die vyfde grootste aantal infeksies ter wêreld.
tgt: at more than half a million confirmed cases, we still have the fifth highest number of infections in the world.

src: en daar is altyd 'n kans dat die siekte weer sal opvlam.
tgt: and there is always a chance of a resurgence of the disease.

src: as ons ooit ’n sterk herinne ring nodig het hoe belangrik dit is om waaksaam te bly, hoef ons net te kyk na die onlangse gebeure, duisende kilometers ver in nieusee land.
tgt: if we ever need a stark reminder of the need for vigilance, we should look to recent events thousands of kilometres away in new zealand.

src: drie maande nadat die land koronavirusvry verklaar is, het nieuseeland weer eens ’n staat van inperking aangekondig.
tgt: three months since the country was declared coronavirusfree, new zealand is once again under lockdown.

src: hoewel daar tydens die jongste uitbre king betreklik min gevalle was, het die regering vinnig beperkings heringestel.
tgt: although the latest outbreak was of relatively few cases, the government swiftly reimposed lockdown restrictions.

src: soortgelyke beperkings moes in verskillende dele van europa heringestel word, aangesien hulle 'n 'tweede golf' van infeksies ervaar.
tgt: similar restrictions have had to be reimposed in several parts of europe as they experience a ‘second wave’ of infections.

src: hierdie ervarings wys hoe vinnig covid19 dinge kan laat verander.
tgt: these experiences show just how swiftly things can change when it comes to covid19.

src: dit is 'n wekroep vir ons almal wat moontlik dink dat ons selfs naby die einde van hierdie ernstige openbare gesondheidskrisis is.
tgt: it is a wakeup call to any among us who may harbour illusions that we are even close to seeing the end of this grave public health emergency.

src: maar daar is beslis tekens van hoop.
tgt: certainly, there are signs of hope.

src: die aantal nuwe bevestigde gevalle in suidafrika neem steeds af.
tgt: the number of new confirmed cases in south africa continues to decline.

src: op die piek van die siekte, net ’n maand gelede, het ons onge veer 12 000 nuwe gevalle per dag aangeteken.
tgt: at the peak of the disease just one month ago, we were recording around 12,000 new cases a day.

src: dit het die afgelope week tot gemiddeld ongeveer 5 000 per dag ge daal.
tgt: this has dropped to an average of around 5,000 a day over the past week.

src: ons herstelpersentasie staan op 80 persent.
tgt: our recovery rate stands at 80 percent.

src: namate die land na vlak 2 beweeg, is baie beperkings op sosiale en ekonomiese aktiwi teite opgehef.
tgt: as the country moves to alert level 2, many restrictions on social and economic activity have been lifted.

src: hiermee saam kom 'n verhoogde risiko van oordrag.
tgt: with this comes increased risk of transmission.

src: ons moet nou hierdie risiko bestuur en seker maak dat die vooruitgang wat ons tot dus ver gemaak het om die ver spreiding van die pandemie te stuit, nie omgekeer word nie.
tgt: we now need to manage this risk and ensure the gains we have made thus far in containing the pandemic’s spread are not reversed.

src: die grootste bedreiging vir die nasie se gesondheid is nou 'n oorgeruste selfvol daanheid.
tgt: the greatest threat to the health of nation right now is complacency.

src: ons mag wel weer vriende en familie besoek, by kuierplekke bymekaar kom, reis vir ontspanning en alko hol in restaurante, kroeë en tavernes gebruik.
tgt: it may be that we are now permitted to meet friends and family, to visit entertainment venues, to travel for leisure and to consume alcohol in restaurants, bars and taverns.

src: maar soos die gesegde lui, beteken dit nie net omdat jy dit kan doen, jy dit moet doen nie.
tgt: but as the old adage goes, just because you can, doesn’t mean you should.

src: baie mense wat die korona virus het, het nie simptome nie en weet dalk nie eens dat hulle besmet is nie.
tgt: many people who have the coronavirus do not have symptoms and may not even know they are infected.

src: dit is 'n ontnugterende werklikheid, want dit beteken dat enigeen van ons nou besmet kan wees en ander onbewustelik kan besmet.
tgt: this is a sobering reality because it means that any of us could be infected right now and could unwittingly infect others.

src: dit is veral die geval wan neer ons familielede besoek, veral bejaardes en diegene met bestaande mediese toe stande wat hulle kwesbaar maak vir infeksie.
tgt: this is particular the case when visiting relatives, especially the elderly and those with preexisting medical conditions that render them vulnerable to infection.

src: dit geld ook vir godsdienstige by eenkomste of kulturele akti witeite.
tgt: it is also true for attending religious services or cultural activities.

src: die 'tweede golf' van in feksies wat verskeie ander lande ervaar het, is vir ons ook 'n moontlikheid.
tgt: the ‘second wave’ of infections that several other countries have experienced is an everpresent possibility for us too.

src: hoewel verskeie beperkings opgehef is, beteken dit nie dat dit nie heringestel kan word as ons 'n beduidende toename in infeksies ervaar nie.
tgt: although many restrictions have been lifted, it does not mean they will not return should we experience a significant rise in infections.

src: hierdie pandemie is 'n saak van lewe en dood.
tgt: this pandemic is a matter of life and death.

src: ons moet aanpas en ons moet waaksaam wees.
tgt: we need to adapt and we need to be vigilant.

src: in die dae, weke en maande wat voorlê, moet ons pogings daadwerklik op herstel toe gespits wees.
tgt: in the days, weeks and months that lie ahead, we must urgently focus our efforts on recovery.

src: ons ekonomie het heelwat skade gely en ons samelewing het swaargekry.
tgt: our economy and our society has suffered a great deal.

src: namate ons ekonomiese ak tiwiteite in byna alle nywer hede hervat word – en ons daaraan werk om die skade wat aangerig is te herstel – is dit ons verantwoordelikheid as individue, werkgewers, gemeenskappe, gesinne, professionele mense, werkers en landsburgers om steeds waaksaam te bly.
tgt: as we return to economic activity across almost all industries – and work to repair the damage done – we have a responsibility to not let our guard down as individuals, employers, communities, families, professionals, workers and citizens.

src: nie een van ons wil na die dae van uiterste inperking te rugkeer nie.
tgt: none of us wants a return to the early days of extreme lockdown restrictions.

src: ons wil aangaan met ons lewens.
tgt: we want to move on with our lives.

src: ons wil hê dat ons vriende en geliefdes gesond en veilig moet bly.
tgt: we want our friends and loved ones to remain healthy and safe.

src: laat ons as ’n volk steeds saamwerk om te verseker dat ons vordering maak.
tgt: as a nation, let us continue to work together to ensure that we progress.

src: die reëls oor sosiale afstand, die dra van maskers, sosiale by eenkomste en internasionale reise is steeds van krag.
tgt: the move to alert level 2 of the lockdown is not a ‘free for all.’ the rules on social distancing, mask wearing, social gatherings and international travel remain.

src: ons sukses berus op ons vermoë om hierdie regulasies na te kom en dat elkeen van ons waaksaam en verant woordelik moet optree.
tgt: our success rests on our ability to abide by these regulations and to ensure that we each behave carefully and responsibly.

src: elke keer as ons enige vorm van nienoodsaaklike akti witeite oorweeg, moet ons onsself afvra: wat is die risiko van besmetting vir onsself en ander?
tgt: every time we are considering any form of nonessen tial activity, we should ask: what is the risk of infection to ourselves and to others?

src: waar daar 'n risiko is, selfs 'n geringe risiko, is dit beter om dit nie te doen nie.
tgt: where there is a risk, even a slight one, it is better not to do it.

src: laat ons, soos altyd, met omsigtigheid voortgaan.
tgt: let us proceed, as ever, with caution.

src: nsfas het my drome bewaarheid more matshediso die nasionale fi nansiële hulp skema vir studente (nsfas) het karabo ma shego (21) se tekort aan geld en sy plan om verder te studeer, oorbrug.
tgt: nsfas powered my dreams more matshediso the national student financial aid scheme (nsfas) has bridged the financial gap between karabo mashego (21) and his plan to further his studies.

src: mashego, van sebokeng in gauteng se vaalomgewing, sê hy sou nooit die klasgeld en die ander uitgawes ver bonde aan tersiêre onderrig kon betaal as hy nie 'n beurs van nsfas ontvang het nie.
tgt: mashego of sebokeng in gauteng’s vaal area says he would not have managed to afford tuition fees and the other expenses that come with postmatric education had he not received a bursary from nsfas.

src: "die maandelikse toelaag wat ek van nsfas ontvang, stel my ook in staat om met 'n vol maag te gaan slaap en te studeer," sê hy.
tgt: "in addition, the monthly allowance i receive from nsfas enables me to sleep and study on a full stomach," he says.

src: mashego is 'n derdejaar student wat vir ‘n graad in siviele ingenieurswese aan die universiteit van preto ria studeer.
tgt: mashego is a thirdyear student studying towards a degree in civil engineering at the university of pretoria.

src: "onderrigfooie is baie hoog.
tgt: "tuition fees are very expensive.

src: ek sou nie eers kon bekostig om vir die eerste semester van die kursus wat ek gekies het te betaal nie, wat nog te sê ’n volle akademiese jaar," verdui delik hy.
tgt: for the course that i have chosen, i really could not afford to pay for a semester, never mind a single academic year," he explains.

src: mashego het in 2016 ma trikuleer en was een van die toppresteerders in sy klas, maar het nie geld gehad om vir verdere studies te betaal nie.
tgt: mashego matriculated in 2016 and was a top learner in his class, but had no means to pay for his studies.

src: sy aansoek om nsfasbefondsing vir die 2018 akademiese jaar was egter suksesvol.
tgt: he successfully applied for funding from nsfas for the 2018 academic year.

src: "dit het my die geleent heid gegee om my droom om ingenieurswese te stu deer te bewaarheid.
tgt: "this gave me the opportunity to make my dream of studying engineering come true.

src: onder rig speel ’n baie belangrike rol in my persoonlike ont wikkeling en help my om vordering te maak met alles wat ek wil bereik.
tgt: education plays a huge role in my personal development and it helps me to progress in all that i intend to achieve.

src: dit stel my ook in staat om ander mense in my gemeenskap te bemagtig en sodoende tot die land se ekonomie by te dra," verduidelik mashego.
tgt: moreover, it empowers me to empower other people in my community and thus contribute to the economy of our country," mashego explains.

src: "ek doen ’n ernstige be roep op jong mense om vir nsfasbefondsing aansoek te doen, omdat hul drome om verder te studeer nie gratis verwesenlik kan word nie; dit verg geld en nsfas sal in daardie behoefte voorsien," sê ma shego.
tgt: "i urge young people to apply for nsfas funding because following your dream is not a free exercise, it needs funding, and nsfas will bridge that gap for you," he says.

src: die minister van hoër onderwys, wetenskap en innovering, dr blade nzimande, het die nsfas 2021aansoeksiklus vir ‘n tydperk van vier maande, van 3 augustus tot 30 no vember 2020, oopgestel.
tgt: the minister of higher education, science and innovation, dr blade nzimande, has opened the nsfas 2021 application cycle for a period of four months, from 3 august to 30 november 2020. students from disadvan taged and workingclass backgrounds who wish to further their studies at any public technical and vocational education and training (tvet) college or university may apply.

src: studente uit agtergeblewe en werkersklasagtergronde wat hul studies aan enige openbare of tegniese of beroepsopleidingskollege (tvet) of universiteit wil voortsit, kan aansoek doen.
tgt: to be eligible for nsfas funding, an applicant must be a south african citizen and come from a family with a combined annual household income of not more than r350 000. the household annual income for students with a disability should not be more than r600 000.

src: om in aanmerking te kom vir nsfasfinansiering, moet 'n aansoeker 'n suidafrikaanse burger wees en uit 'n gesin kom met 'n gesamentlike jaarlikse huis houdelike inkomste van hoogstens r350 000. die jaarlikse huishoudelike in komste vir studente met 'n gestremdheid mag nie meer as r600 000 beloop nie.
tgt: "in the current academic year, nsfas has funded over 700 000 students, 248 242 at tvet colleges and 481 339 at universities (students with registrations data).

src: dit is 'n toename van 20 persent teenoor die vorige jaar, as ons registrasiege gewens wat in dieselfde tydperk van 2019 teenoor 2020 ontvang is, vergelyk," sê minister nzimande.
tgt: this is a 20 percent increase from the previous year when we compared registration data received in the same period of 2019 versus 2020," says minister nzimande.

src: nsfas is verantwoorde lik vir 40 persent van die voorgraadse bevolking aan universiteite en 70 persent aan tvetkolleges.
tgt: nsfas accounts for 40 percent of the undergraduate population at universi ties and 70 percent at tvet colleges.

src: vhoe om aansoek te doen aansoekers moet www.
tgt: v applicants must visit www.

src: nsfas.
tgt: nsfas.

src: org.
tgt: org.

src: za besoek en op mynsfas klik.
tgt: za and click on mynsfas.

src: skep 'n mynsfasrekening, klik op die applyoortjie, beantwoord die vrae op die skerm en laai die vereiste dokumente op.
tgt: they must create a mynsfas account, click the apply tab, answer the questions on screen and upload the required documents.

src: klik dan op submit.
tgt: once that is done, they must click submit.

src: nadat die aansoeker op submit geklik het, sal ’n verwysingsnommer vir die aansoek op die skerm verskyn.
tgt: after clicking submit, the application reference number will appear on the screen.

src: die verwysingsnommer word ook na die selfoonnommer en eposadres wat verskaf is, gestuur.
tgt: the reference number will also be sent to the cellphone number and email address that the applicant provided.

src: aansoekers kan 'n selfoon, tablet of re kenaar gebruik om aansoek te doen.
tgt: applicants can use a cellphone, tablet or computer to apply.

src: die nsfasportaal het geringe veranderinge ondergaan om dit makliker om te gebruik en veiliger te maak.
tgt: the nsfas portal has undergone minor changes to make it easier to use and more secure.

src: nuwe aansoekers het 'n afskrif van hul id of geboortesertifikaat nodig om te registreer en 'n profiel op die mynsfasportaal te skep.
tgt: new applicants need a copy of their id or birth certificate to register and create a profile on the mynsfas portal.

src: aansoekers met bestaande rekeninge moet by hul rekeninge aanmeld – onthou, slegs een profiel per aansoeker word toegelaat.
tgt: applicants with existing accounts need to log into their accounts – remember, only one profile per applicant is allowed.

src: aansoekers moet toestemming gee dat hul persoonlike inligting deur 'n derde party gekontroleer mag word; as hulle nie daartoe instem nie, sal hulle nie toe gelaat word om met die aansoekproses voort te gaan nie.
tgt: the applicant must give consent for their personal information to be checked by a third party and if they do not agree to this, they will not be allowed to continue with the application process.

src: beskerm ons vroue en kinders vukuzenzele unnamed duisende vroue, mans en kinders het n jaar gelede, amper tot op die dag, na die parlement opgeruk om teen n stortvloed van verkragtings en moorde op vroue en kinders te betoog.
tgt: protect our women and children vukuzenzele unnamed a year ago, almost to the day, thousands of wom en, men and children marched to parliament to protest against a spate of rapes and killings of women and girls.

src: suidafrikaners het in daardie stadium onder die moorde van uyinene mrwetyana, leighandre jegels, jesse hess en verskeieander vroue wat hulle lewens deur die toedoen van wreedaardige mans verloor het, gesteier.
tgt: at the time, the nation was reeling from the murders of uyinene mrwetyana, leighandre jegels, jesse hess and a number of other women who had lost their lives at the hands of brutal men.

src: die vreedsame betogers uit alle vlakke van die samelewing, jonk en oud, studente en werkende vroue, het plakkate omhoog gehou met 'genoeg is genoeg' en 'is ek volgende?'
tgt: from all social backgrounds, young and old, students and working women, the peaceful protesters held aloft placards that read ‘enough is enough’ and ‘am i next?’.

src: die angs en woede was daardie dag tasbaar.
tgt: the anguish and the anger was palpable that day.

src: toe ek hulle duidelik uitgespelde eise ontvang het, het ek besef dat ons dringend en met vasberadenheid moesoptree.
tgt: as i received their clearly articulated demands, it was clear to me that we needed to act urgently and with determination.

src: dit was vir my belangrik om met opregtheid te reageeer en nie leë beloftes te maak nie.
tgt: it was important to me that i did not respond with hollow words and empty promises.

src: n paar dae later het ek n gesamentlike sitting van dieparlement belê waartydens ons n noodreaksieplan van r1.6 miljard om geslagsgebaseerde geweld (ggg) en vrouemoord te bestry, aangekondig het.
tgt: a few days later, i called a joint sitting of parliament, where we announced a r1.6 billion emergency response action plan to combat genderbased violence and femicide (gbvf).

src: oor die ses maande waartydens die plan in werking gestel is, is staatsbesteding in verskeie regeringsdepartemente herprioritiseer om ingrypings vir die beskerming en ondersteuning van oorlewendes, bewustheidsen voorkomingsveldtogte, sowel as wette en beleide te verbeter, en om die ekonomiese bemagtiging van vroue te bevorder en die strafregstelsel te versterk.
tgt: over the six months of its implementation, public spending in various government departments was reprioritised to support interventions for care and support for survivors, for awareness and prevention campaigns, to improve laws and policies, to promote the economic empowerment of women, and to strengthen the criminal justice system.

src: nou is ons op die spits van die verreikendste wetgewende hersiening in die stryd teen ggg en vrouemoord.
tgt: and now we are on the cusp of the most farreaching legislative overhaul in the fight against gbvf.

src: drie sleutelwetsontwerpe wat met ggg verband hou is onlangs by die parlement ingedien.
tgt: three key bills relating to gbvf have been introduced in parliament recently.

src: deur hierdie wetsontwerpe in te dien, kom ons die belofte wat ons verlede jaar aan die betogers en alle vroue in die land gemaak het, na.
tgt: through the introduction of these bills, we are honouring the promise we made to the protestors last year and to all the women of this country.

src: die drie wysigingswetsontwerpe is daarop gerig om die gapings wat sommige oortreders van hierdie misdade toelaat om geregtigheid te ontwyk, te vul, asook om uiting te gee aan die regte van ons land se vroue en kinders.
tgt: the three amendment bills are designed to fill the gaps that allow some perpetrators of these crimes to evade justice and to give full effect to the rights of our country’s women and children.

src: wanneer hierdie wetsontwerpe gefinaliseer is, sal dit help om die vertroue van ons land se vroue, dat die wet hulle inderdaad sal beskerm, te herstel.
tgt: these bills, once finalised, will help to restore the confidence of our country’s women that the law is indeed there to protect them.

src: die eerste is die wetsontwerp wat die wysigingswet op die strafreg (seksuele misdrywe en verwante aangeleenthede) wysig.
tgt: the first is the bill to amend the criminal law (sexual offences and related matters) amendment act.

src: dit skep n nuwe oortreding van seksuele intimidasie; dit brei die omvang van die bloedskandeoortreding uit en brei ook die aanmeldingsplig van persone wat vermoed dat n seksuele oortreding teen n kind gepleeg is, uit.
tgt: this creates a new offence of sexual intimidation, extends the ambit of the offence of incest, and extends the reporting duty of persons who suspect a sexual offence has been committed against a child.

src: verder brei dit ook die omvang van die nasionale register vir seksuele oortreders uit om alle seksuele oortreders se besonderhede in te sluit.
tgt: it expands the scope of the national register for sex offenders (nrso) to include the particulars of all sex offenders.

src: tot op hede, was dit slegs van toepassing op seksuele oortreders wat aan seksuele misdade teen kinders of mense met geestesongesteldhede skuldig bevind is.
tgt: until now, it has only applied to sex offenders convicted of sex crimes perpetrated against children or persons with mental disabilities.

src: die tydperk wat oortreders se besonderhede op die register moet bly, is verleng en oortreders wat op die register gelys is, sal hierdie feit bekend moet maak wanneer hulle aansoek doen om werk met kwesbare mense.
tgt: the time an offender’s particulars must remain on the register has been increased, and those listed on the register will have to disclose this when they submit applications to work with vulnerable persons.

src: die wetsontwerp maak ook voorsiening dat die name van persone op die nasionale register vir seksuele oortreders aan die publiek beskikbaar moet wees.
tgt: the bill also provides for the names of persons on the nrso to be publicly available.

src: die wysiginswetsontwerp op die strafreg en verwante aangeleenthede sal onder meer die toestaan van borgtog aan oortreders van ggg en vrouemoord verstewig, en oortredings waarvoor minimum vonnisse opgelê moet word, uitbrei.
tgt: the criminal and related matters amendment bill tightens, among others, the granting of bail to perpetrators of gbvf, and expands the offences for which minimum sentences must be imposed.

src: die wysigings stel nuwe verpligtinge op wetstoepassings amptenare en op ons howe in.
tgt: the amendments impose new obligations on lawenforcement officials and on our courts.

src: wanneer n aanklaer nie in sake van geslagsgeweld en vrouemoord borgtog teenstaan nie, moet hulle hul redes op rekord plaas.
tgt: when a prosecutor does not oppose bail in cases of gbv, they have to place their reasons on record.

src: tensy die beskuldigde uitsonderlike omstandighede kan gee waarom hy/sy op borgtog vrygelaat moet word, moet die hof beveel dat die beskuldigde in aanhouding bly totdat die strafregverrigtinge afgehandel is.
tgt: unless a person accused of gbv can provide exceptional circumstances why they should be released on bail, the court must order their detention until the criminal proceedings are concluded.

src: die howe word verplig om met verskeie oorwegings rekening te hou wanneer daar oor n borgtogaansoek besluit word.
tgt: in reaching a decision on a bail application, the courts are compelled to take a number of considerations into account.

src: dit sluit in voorverhoorverslae oor die wenslikheid daarvan om die beskuldigde op borgtog vry te laat, dreigemente van geweld teen n oorlewende en die oorlewende se opinie oor haar of sy veiligheid.
tgt: they include pretrial reports on the desirability of releasing an accused on bail, threats of violence made against a survivor, and the view of the survivor regarding his or her safety.

src: wat parool betref, moet n klaer of familielid van n oorlede slagoffer n voorlegging aan die paroolraad kan lewer.
tgt: when it comes to parole, a complainant or a relative of a deceased victim must be able to make representation to the parole board.

src: gegewe die onaanvaarbare hoë vlakke van geweld op intieme maats in ons land, het ons die bepalings van die wet op huishoudelike geweld, verskerp.
tgt: given the unacceptably high levels of intimate partner violence in our country, we have tightened the provisions of the domestic violence act.

src: huishoudelike geweld word nou omskryf om diegene wat vir enige tydsduur verloof is, in n verhouding is, in ’n gewoonteverhouding is of ’n werklike of skynbaar romantiese, intieme of seksuele verhouding is, in te sluit.
tgt: domestic violence is now defined to cover those in engagements, dating, in customary relationships, and actual or perceived romantic, intimate or sexual relationships of any duration.

src: die wetsontwerp brei ook die omskrywing van 'huishoudelike geweld' uit om die beskerming van ouer persone teen mishandeling deur familielede, in te sluit.
tgt: the bill also extends the definition of ‘domestic violence’ to include the protection of older persons against abuse by family members.

src: klaers sal aanlyn om n beskermingsbevel aansoek kan doen.
tgt: complainants will be able to apply for a protection order online.

src: om n scenario te voorkom waar oortreders n vorige geskiedenis van huishoudelike geweld kan wegsteek, sal n geïntegreerde bewaarplek van beskermingsbevele tot stand gebring word die voorgestelde wysigings verplig ook die departemente van maatskaplike ontwikkeling, basiese onderwys, hoër onderwys en gesondheid om, waar nodig, sekere dienste aan oorlewendes te voorsien, en om hulle vir beskerming en mediese sorg te verwys.
tgt: to prevent a scenario where perpetrators can hide past histories of domestic violence, an integrated repository of protection orders will be established.

src: die omstandighede waaronder n aanklaer kan weier om vervolging in te stel wanneer oortredings ingevolge die gewysigde wet gepleeg is, of om klagtes terug te trek wanneer dit liggaamlike besering behels, of waar n wapen gebruik is om n klaer te bedreig, word beperk.
tgt: the proposed amendments also oblige the departments of social development, basic education, higher education and health to provide certain services to survivors where needed and to refer them for sheltering and medical care.

src: die voorgestelde wysiging tot die wet wat moontlik die beduidenste pionierswerk inlui, is dat as iemand kennis, n redelike oortuiging of vermoede het dat huishoudelike geweld teen n kind, persoon met n gestremdheid of ouer persoon gepleeg is en dit nie by n maatskaplike werker of polisiebeampte aanmeld nie, hulle n boete of tronkstraf opgelê kan word.
tgt: the circumstances under which a prosecutor can refuse to institute a prosecution when offences have been committed under the amended act or to withdraw charges when it involves the infliction of bodily harm or where a weapon was used to threaten a complainant have been limited.

src: versuim deur n lid van die sapd om hulle verpligtinge ingevolge die wet na te kom sal ook as wangedrag geag word en moet by die burgerlike sekretariaat vir polisiediens, aangemeld word.
tgt: in perhaps the most groundbreaking proposed amendment to the act, if someone has knowledge, reasonable belief or suspicion that an act of domestic violence has been committed against a child, a person with disability or an older person and fails to report it to a social worker or police officer they can be fined and even imprisoned.

src: woza matrics program geloods dale hes die woza matricsprogram poog om alle graad 12 leerders te help om hulle finale eksamen te slaag.
tgt: woza matrics launched dale hes this year’s ma triculants have to faced considerable challenges because of the coronavirus disease (covid19).

src: vanjaar se matri kulante staar wesenlike uitdagings in die gesig as gevolg van die koronavirus (covid19).
tgt: the department of basic education (dbe) has ensured that the safe reopening of schools is one of its top priorities, along with supporting learners with various programmes to help them successfully complete the academic year.

src: die departement van basiese onderwys het verseker dat die veilige heropening van skole, sowel as bystand aan leerders deur verskeie programme wat hulle help om hul akademiese jaar suksesvol te voltooi, een van die departement se topprioriteite is.
tgt: one of these is the woza matrics programme, which was launched on 1 september in collaboration with a number of broadcasting partners and educational experts.

src: een so ’n program is die woza matricsprogram wat op 1 september, in samewerking met verskeie uitsaaivennote en opvoedkundige deskundiges, geloods is.
tgt: as part of the programme, catchup lessons on six key matric subjects are being aired on sabc, dstv and openview (channel 122) every day for 12 weeks, from 8am to 10am and 1pm to 3pm.

src: bystand in die hof vir gggslagoffers more matshediso die nasionale vervolgingsgesag (nvg) het n gespesialiseerde diens om jou by te staan as jy 'n slagoffer van geslagsgebaseerde geweld (ggg) is en ondersteuning by n hof nodig het.
tgt: court support for gbv victims more matshediso if you have suffered genderbased violence (gbv) and are in need of support at court, the national prosecuting authority (npa) has a specialised service to assist you.

src: die ke bona lesedi hofvoor bereidingsprogram is by die meeste howe vir seksuele oortredings beskibaar, sowel as by ander howe wat ggg hanteer.
tgt: the ke bona lesedi court preparation programme is available at most sexual offences courts and other courts that deal with gbv.

src: ke bona lesedi beteken 'ek sien die lig' in setswana.
tgt: ke bona lesedi means ‘i see the light’ when translated from setswana.

src: n gggslagoffer kan by die nvg aansoek doen om hulp.
tgt: a gbv victim can submit a request to the npa for assistance.

src: die senior staatsaanklaer of hofvoorbereidingsbestuurder sal dan n geskikte hofvoorbereidingsbeampte aanwys om te help.
tgt: the senior public prosecutor or court preparation manager will then identify an appropriate court preparation officer to assist.

src: "die diens hou nie die belofte van n besondere uitkoms in die saak in nie en elke individu se ervaring is uniek.
tgt: "the service does not promise a particular outcome in the case and each individual’s experience is unique.

src: dit help wel om slagoffers te bemagtig en hul waardigheid te herstel," sê n verklaring van die nvg.
tgt: nonetheless, it assists with empowerment and restoring the victim’s dignity," says a statement from the npa.

src: daar is landwyd 161 hofvoorbereidingsbeamptes by verskeie howe.
tgt: there are 161 court preparation officers at various courts across the country.

src: die diens is een van verskeie inisiatiewe wat deur die regering daargestel is om die aakli ge plaag van ggg te hanteer.
tgt: the service is one of various initiatives introduced by government to deal with the scourge of gbv.

src: volgens die nvg, sal die klaer, slagoffer, oorlewende of getuie, deur n hofvoorbereidingsbeampte van die hof waar hy of sy sal getuig, gekontak word.
tgt: according to the npa, the complainant, victim, survivor or witness will be contacted by a court preparation officer from the court where she or he will testify.

src: die hofvoorbereidingsbeampte sal beskikbaar wees om die klaer by die hof en regdeur die verhoor, by te staan.
tgt: the court preparation officer will be available to support the complainant at court and throughout the trial.

src: gespesialiseerde hulpbronne en tegnieke word gebruik om die slagoffer visueel te wys dat hy of sy gehoor, beskerm en gerespekteer word.
tgt: specialised tools and techniques are used to visually show the victim that she or he is heard, protected and respected.

src: klaers kan in hulle eie taal praat en die hofvoorbereidingsbeampte sal toesien dat die slagoffer vir berading of terapie verwys word, om hulle te help op hul pad na genesing.
tgt: complainants can speak in their own language and the court preparation officer will ensure that the victim is referred for counselling or therapy, to complete their healing journey.

src: baie vroue en kinders wat slagoffers van ggg, byvoorbeeld verkragting, is, voel angstig om in die hof te getuig en intieme besonderhede oor insidente voor vreemdelinge weer te gee.
tgt: many women and children who have suffered gbv, for example, rape, are anxious about going to court to testify and relate intimate details of events in front of strangers.

src: dié diens sal help om hulle meer op hulle gemak te laat voel.
tgt: this service will help them feel more at ease.

src: algemeenjy kan die hofvoorbereidingsbestuurder/koör jy kan die hofvoorbereidingsbestuurder/koör dineerder in jou provinsie kontak deur n teledineerder in jou provinsie kontak deur n telefoonoproep of ’n epos te stuur na onderstaande foonoproep of ’n epos te stuur na onderstaande kontakbesonderhede:kontakbesonderhede: ooskaap (grahamstad) ooskaap (grahamstad) – pumla nomfemele 041 502 5443 – pnomfemele@justice.

src: sa media n steunpilaar vir ons demokrasie vukuzenzele unnamed die koronaviruspan demie het in baie lande regoor die wêreld n beperking van burgerlike vryhede geverg en sosiale samehorigheid op die proef gestel.
tgt: sa media is a key pillar of our democracy vukuzenzele unnamed in many countries around the world, the coronavirus pandemic has required the limita tion of many civil liberties and put social cohesion to the test.

src: lande met sterk instellings, waaksame regstelsels en n gesonde media kon egter verhoed dat menseregte on dermyn en die gesag van die staat misbruik word.
tgt: but countries with strong institutions, vigilant judicial systems and a robust media have been able to prevent human rights from being undermined and the authority of the state being abused.

src: dit is ses maande sedert die nasionale ramptoestand verklaar is.
tgt: it has been six months since the national state of disaster was proclaimed.

src: ons het goed ge vaar, odanks die ongekende aard van die siekte en die ontsaglike uitdaging om n land van 58 miljoen mense in n staat van inperking te plaas.
tgt: despite the unprecedented nature of the disease and the immense challenge of placing a country of 58 million people under lockdown, we have fared well.

src: ons kon die verspreiding van die siekte, hoofsaaklik danksy al ons landsburgers se same werking en waaksaamheid, in bedwang hou.
tgt: we have managed to contain the spread of the disease primarily because of the cooperation and vigilance of all citizens.

src: dit is tot ’n groot mate ook te danke aan ons media se deeglike werk.
tgt: this is in no small part due to the sterling work of our media.

src: ons is dank verskuldig aan suidafrika se hardwerkende en volhardende joernaliste.
tgt: we owe a debt of gratitude to south africa’s hardworking and tenacious journalists.

src: hulle het ons mense inge lig gehou deur belangrike gesondheidsboodskappe oor sosiale distansiëring en higiëne te versprei.
tgt: they have kept our people informed by disseminating key health messages about social distancing and hygiene.

src: hulle het dit onder uiters moeilike omstandighede, dikwels met beperkte hulpbronne, gedoen.
tgt: they have done so under extremely trying conditions, often with limited resources.

src: hulle het stories oor die uitwerking wat die inper king op mense se lewens en besighede gehad het, vertel.
tgt: they have told the stories of the effects of lockdown on the lives of people and their businesses.

src: deur gemeenskappe, dorpe en stede te besoek om gewo ne mense se stories na vore te bring en mense se aandag landwyd op probleme wat in hospitale en klinieke ervaar word, te vestig, het hulle regeringsoptrede aangehits.
tgt: they have been out in the villages, towns and cities, bringing stories of ordinary people and drawing national attention to problems being experienced in hospitals and clinics, prompting government action.

src: ons media het ook die aandag op uitspattighede ge vestig wat normaalweg dalk nie vorendag sou gekom het nie.
tgt: our media have also shone a light on excesses that perhaps would not have ordinarily come to light.

src: hulle het hul waghondrol vervul deur korrupsie en wanadministrasie openbaar te maak, wat n omvattende nasionale debat aangehits het en tot verskeie hoëpro fielondersoeke gelei het.
tgt: they have fulfilled their watchdog role by unearthing acts of corruption and maladministration, sparking a massive national debate and leading to a number of highprofile investigations.

src: deur hierdie soort verslaggewing het hulle mense se vertroue gewen.
tgt: through this reporting they have earned people’s trust.

src: n vrye pers is nie n doel op sigself nie.
tgt: a free press is not an end in itself.

src: dit is n manier om te versker dat demokrasie uit geleef en gehandhaaf word.
tgt: it is a means by which democracy is secured and upheld.

src: ons media het tydens dié pandemie nie net sy tradisio nele waghondrol vervul nie, maar ook sy burgerlike plig nagekom deur die nasionale poging om die koronavirus in toom te hou, te ondersteun.
tgt: during this pandemic, our media has played not just its traditional watchdog role, but exercised its civic duty in supporting the national effort to contain the coronavirus.

src: gegewe die belangrikheid van die media vir ons demo krasie se gesondheid, is dit n ernstige bron van kommer dat, soos alle ander sektore van die ekonomie, die ko ronavirus ook ’n negatiewe uitwerking op ons media huise gehad het.
tgt: given the importance of the media to the health of our democracy, it is a great concern that like all other sectors of the economy, the coronavirus crisis has hit our media houses hard.

src: sommige publikasies het aan die begin van die inperking soveel as 60 persent van hul inkomste verloor.
tgt: some publications lost as much as 60 percent of their income in the early days of the lockdown.

src: verskeie maatskap pye moes salarisse besnoei, en personeel of werksure verminder.
tgt: a number of companies have had to implement salary cuts, reduce staff numbers or reduce hours worked.

src: ongelukkig is sommige publikasies waar onder van suidafrika se mees gevestigde en bekende tydskriftitels, genoodsaak om toe te maak.
tgt: regrettably, some publications have even been forced to close, among them some of south africa’s most established and wellknown magazine titles.

src: die werksverliese as gevolg van die inperking het n kri sis vir mediamaatskappye wat reeds uitdagings soos die verlies aan advertensieinkomste, dalende sirkulasie en markaandeel wat deur vars nuus op mobiele toestelle en ander tegnologieë vervang is, vererger.
tgt: the job losses that have resulted from the lockdowns have exacerbated a crisis for media companies already facing challenges like loss of advertising revenues, falling circulation and market share being taken by mobilefirst news and other technologies.

src: sulke finansiële hindernisse word algemeen, van aanlynpublikasies en tra disionele breëbladkoerante, tot die openbare uitsaaier, in die gesig gestaar.
tgt: these financial difficulties are being faced across the board, from online titles to traditional broadsheets to the public broadcaster.

src: dit was een van die sleu telkwessies wat tydens my vergadering met die suidafrikaanse nasionale redakteursforum geopper is.
tgt: this was one of the issues that was raised sharply during my engagement with the south african national editors’ forum recently.

src: in plaas daarvan dat hul le hul lot betreur, werk die mediabedryf egter hard om besigheidsmodelle te verfyn, om innovering aan te dryf en soveel personeel as moontlik te behou.
tgt: instead of lamenting their fate, however, the media industry is working hard to refine business models, to drive innovation and to retain staff as much as possible.

src: die media is terselfdertyd n unieke entiteit in enige same lewing omdat sy praktisyns n rol vervul wat noodsaaklik vir ons demokratiese orde is.
tgt: at the same time, the media is a unique entity in any society because its practitioners fulfil a role that is so essential to our democratic order.

src: hulle werk om die publiek in te lig en die mag in toom te hou.
tgt: they work to keep the public informed and to keep power in check.

src: ons het meer joernaliste nodig, nie minder nie.
tgt: we need more journalists, not less.

src: dit is waarom die verlies aan selfs n enkele joernalis nie net n verlies vir die bedryf is nie, maar ook vir die land.
