src: ons gaan, namate daar meer en meer mense ingeënt word, lewens red en boonop voortskrydend die risiko van infeksie onder die bevolking verminder.
tgt: as more and more people are vaccinated, we will both save lives and progressively reduce the risk of infection across the population.

src: een van die jaar se grootste uitdagings gaan wees om genoeg inentings te bekom — en seker te maak dat dit die mense wat dit benodig, bereik.
tgt: getting enough vaccines as quickly as possible – and making sure that they reach the people who need them – will be one of the biggest tasks of the year.

src: wat dit verder bemoeilik, is dat al die lande regoor die wêreld meeding vir die beperkte voorraad inentings wat beskikbaar is.
tgt: this will be particularly challenging as every country in the world is clamouring to secure a limited supply of vaccines.

src: ons werk egter saam met handelsvennote, asook vennote in die arbeidsektor en die burgerlike samelewing, hard daaraan om soveel moontlik inentings te bekom.
tgt: but we are hard at work with partners in business, labour and civil society to make this happen.

src: ons is tans op n hele paar fronte besig om inentings te probeer kry, insluitend die globale covaxfasiliteit, die inisiatief van die afrikaunie asook deur ons eie samesprekings met entstofvervaardigers.
tgt: we are working on several fronts to get vaccines, including through the global covax facility, the african union initiative and through our own engagements with vaccine manufacturers.

src: ons gaan ook kragte moet saamsnoer om ons ekonomie te herbou en transformeer, namate ons saamstaan om die pandemie die hoof te bied.
tgt: as we act together to overcome the pandemic, we will need to work together to rebuild and transform our economy.

src: ons het beide die vermoëns en die wil om ekonomiese aktiwiteite te stimuleer, die ekonomie te ontwikkel en sodoende werkskepping te bevorder; dít alles te midde van n pandemie.
tgt: we have both the ability and the will to stimulate economic activity, grow our economy and create jobs.

src: staatsfinansies is erg onder druk, nou meer as ooit vantevore, weens die koste van ons gesondheidsaksieplan met betrekking tot kovid19 en die maatskaplike en ekonomiese verligtingsmaatreëls wat ons in plek gestel het om besighede en armoedige huishoudings te steun.
tgt: public finances are under extreme strain, now even more so because of the cost of our health response to covid19 and the social and economic relief measures we put in place to assist businesses and poor households.

src: die krimping in die ekonomie beteken dat belastinginkomste ook noemenswaardig afgeneem het.
tgt: the contraction of the economy also meant that tax revenue has declined significantly.

src: daar is sommige dele van die ekonomie wat langer gaan neem om te herstel, danksy die daling in die algemene wêreldwye aanvraag, asook die beperkings op internasionale reis.
tgt: there are some parts of the economy that will take longer to recover due to lower global demand generally and restrictions on international travel.

src: ons gaan juis daarom innoverend moet wees en ons moet toespits op ons planne om die ekonomie te herbou.
tgt: that is why we need to be innovative and focused in our plans to rebuild the economy.

src: dit is noemenswaardig dat die ekonomiese herkonstruksieen herstelplan wat ons laasjaar in oktober aangekondig het, gebaseer is op die breë konsensus onder alle maatskaplike vennote rakende die aksies wat geneem moet word om die ekonomie te herbou.
tgt: significantly, the economic reconstruction and recovery plan that we announced in october last year is based on broad consensus among all social part ners on the actions needed to rebuild the economy.

src: dit skep n vaste basis vir doeltreffende samewerking gestel in die hulpbronne, vermoëns en kragte van alle dele van die samelewing.
tgt: this lays a firm basis for effective cooperation that draws on the resources, capabilities and energies of all sections of society.

src: dié is merkbaar op verskeie praktiese maniere.
tgt: we are seeing this in various practical ways.

src: ons is, byvoorbeeld, in noue samewerking met verskeie privaat befondsers en multilaterale ontwikkelingsinstellings met betrekking tot infrastruktuurprojekte in gebiede soos vervoer, menslike nedersettings, water en telekommunikasie.
tgt: for example, we have been working closely with private funders and multilateral development institutions to prepare infrastructure projects in areas like transport, human settlements, water and telecommunications.

src: ons is besig om befondsingsmodelle vir dié projekte te ontwikkel wat van verskeie bronne in beide die openbare en privaat sektor gebruik sal maak en wat die infrastruktuurfonds as middel gebruik.
tgt: using the infrastructure fund as one of the vehicles, we are developing funding models for these projects that draw on several sources in both the public and private sectors.

src: dit is veral van belang gegewe die huidige beperkings op staatsfinansies.
tgt: this is particularly important at a time when public finances are limited.

src: die presidensiële werkskeppingstimulus is nog n voorbeeld van sulke vennootskappe in aksie.
tgt: the presidential employment stimulus is another example of partnership in action.

src: ons het, met die verstandhouding dat dit tyd gaan neem vir ekonomiese groei om n styging in werkskepping in die privaat sektor te toon, die ekonomiese stimulus geloods om onmiddellik te begin om werksgeleenthede te skep.
tgt: understanding that it will take time for economic growth to translate into private sector employment, we have launched the employment stimulus to start creat ing work opportunities now.

src: die presidensie koördineer dié program, maar dit word deur n verskeidenheid staatsdepartemente en verskillende staatsfere geïmplementeer.
tgt: this programme is being coordinated from the presiden cy, but is being implemented by a range of government departments and different spheres.

src: derduisende werklose mense is, danksy dié program, nou in staat om beide geld te verdien asook om nuwe vaardighede aan te leer terwyl hulle waardevolle maatskaplike dienste lewer.
tgt: through this programme, tens of thousands of unemployed people are able to both earn and learn as they provide valuable social services.

src: dié program sal mettertyd ook n 'maatskaplike' indiensnamegedeelte insluit, waar ons saam met ander maatskaplike rolspelers bande gaan smee om mense in n verskeidenheid aktiwiteite in diens te stel — wat wissel van die bevordering van voedselsekuriteit tot die aanspreek van geslagsgebaseerde geweld en die opgradering van informele nedersettings — alles in die belang van die samelewing.
tgt: in time, this programme will include a ‘social employment’ part, where we will partner with other social actors to employ people in a variety of activities – from improving food security, to tackling genderbased violence to upgrading informal settlements – that all contribute to the common good.

src: al dié werk word benadruk met n aggressiewe fokus op die ekonomiese hervormings wat tot die grootste mate op groei gefokus is.
tgt: all this work is being reinforced by an aggressive focus on those economic reforms that will have the greatest focus on growth.

src: dit sluit in om elektrisiteitsopwekkingkapasiteit te verhoog, om ons hawens meer doeltreffend en mededingend te maak, om toegang tot bekostigbare breëband te verbeter, en om die omkeertye van water, mynbouen ander lisensies te verbeter.
tgt: these include the expansion of electricity generation capacity, making our ports more efficient and competitive, improving access to affordable broadband, and improving turnaround times for water, mining and other licenses.

src: dié werk word gesamentlik deur my kantoor en die nasionale tesourie gemonitor en gekoördineer.
tgt: these efforts are being coordinated and monitored jointly by my office and national treasury.

src: daar is soveel wat ons in die jaar wat voorlê te doen staan en ons gaan sonder twyfel teen baie steil uitdagings te staan kom.
tgt: there is much to be done in the year ahead.

src: allison cooper die nuus dat n kind epilepsie het, kan n skok vir die hele gesin wees.
tgt: parenting a child with epilepsy allison cooper while it may be a shock for a family to learn that a child has epilepsy, you can build an understanding, loving and accepting environment in which your child can grow and believe in their ability to succeed.

src: tog is dit moontlik om n omgewing vol begrip, liefde en aanvaarding te skep waarin jou kind kan groei en kan glo in hul vermoëns om sukses te behaal.
tgt: according to epilepsy south africa, parents could be concerned about their child’s future and find epilepsy difficult to accept or talk about.

src: volgens epilepsy south africa kan ouers van n kind met epilepsie besorg wees oor hul kind se toekoms en dit moeilik vind om die toestand te aanvaar of daaroor te praat.
tgt: you may feel angry, depressed, inadequate and guilty, but you can overcome these feelings and your anxiety by educating yourself about the condition.

src: jy mag moontlik angstig, kwaad, depressief, onvolwaardig of skuldig voel, maar jy kan hierdie gevoelens oorkom deur jouself oor epilepsie in te lig.
tgt: epilepsy is the tendency to have recurrent seizures, which occur when there is an abnormal electrical discharge in the brain.

src: hoekom my kind?
tgt: why my child?

src: om epilepsie en die rede vir stuipe te verstaan, verduidelik egter nie hoekom dit juis met jóú kind gebeur nie.
tgt: understanding epilepsy and why seizures occur doesn’t explain why this happened to your child.

src: die onderliggende oorsaak van epilepsie is in ongeveer 66% van alle gevalle onbekend.
tgt: in approximately 66% of cases, the underlying cause of epilepsy is unknown.

src: dit word na verwys as idiopatiese epilepsie.
tgt: this is referred to as idiopathic epilepsy.

src: in die res van die gevalle kan die onderliggende oorsake wel geïdentifiseer word en word dit simptomatiese epilepsie genoem.
tgt: in the remaining cases the underlying causes can be identified, which is known as symptomatic epilepsy.

src: daar is n verskeidenheid onderliggende oorsake, byvoorbeeld kopbeserings, wat op enige ouderdom kan plaasvind; n besering tydens geboorte, soos n suurstoftekort met geboorte; koorsstuipe, enkefalitis, meningitis of masels as kind; en metaboliese of biochemiese versteurings of wanbalanse.
tgt: there can be a variety of underlying causes such as a head injury, that can occur at any age; a birth injury, such as a lack of oxygen during birth; fever convulsions, encephalitis, meningitis or childhood measles; and metabolic or biochemical disturbances or imbalances.

src: n doktor sal medikasie voorskryf na aanleiding van die ouderdom en fisiese toestand van jou kind, asook die tipe aanvalle wat jou kind kry.
tgt: a doctor will prescribe medication based on the age, physical condition and type of seizures your child has.

src: onthou dat antistuipwekkende medikasie nie epilepsie genees nie, maar, in die meeste gevalle, sal dit die frekwensie en felheid van die aanvalle beperk.
tgt: remember, anticonvulsant medication does not cure epilepsy but, in most cases, will reduce the frequency and severity of seizures.

src: wenke vir ouers van kinders met epilepsie maak jou kind bewus van die toestand.
tgt: some tips on parenting a child with epilepsy: make your child aware of the condition.

src: kinders van so jonk as drie jaar oud kan verstaan dat die brein die liggaam beheer.
tgt: children as young as three can understand that the brain controls the body.

src: ouer kinders kan n meer breedvoerige verduideliking met meer besonderhede verstaan.
tgt: older children should be given a more comprehensive explanation.

src: lig familielede na aan die gesin in, asook jou kind se vriende, onderwysers en ander verantwoordelike skoolbeamptes.
tgt: inform close relatives and your child’s friends, teachers and other responsible school officials.

src: maak seker dat jou kind n breedvoerige mediese ondersoek by n gekwalifiseerde professionele mediese kenner ondergaan, ideaal gesproke n neuroloog.
tgt: ensure your child receives a comprehensive medical assessment by a qualified professional, ideally a neurologist.

src: beklemtoon jou kind se talente en enige aktiwiteite wat hul selfvertroue, selfaanvaarding en eiewaarde sal bevorder.
tgt: emphasise your child’s abilities and any activity that will improve their selfacceptance, selfworth and selfconfidence.

src: maak seker dat daar altyd volwasse toesig by aktiwiteite soos, byvoorbeeld, swem is.
tgt: ensure adult supervision for some activities, such as swimming.

src: 'n eer om die au te lei vukuzenzele unnamed suidafrika se ter myn as voorsitter van die afrikaunie het ten einde geloop.
tgt: an honour to lead the african union vukuzenzele unnamed south africa’s term as chair of the african union has come to an end.

src: wanneer ons oor ons jaar in hierdie posisie besin, onthou ek die ou spreekwoord wat lui: "van die nood ‘n deug maak.
tgt: as we reflect on our year in this position, i am reminded of the old saying that ‘in crisis lies opportunity’.

src: "dit was ’n vuurdoop, omdat ons die voorsitterskap oorgeneem het in dieselfde maand as wat die eerste geval van die koronavirus op die kontinent aangemeld is.
tgt: ours was a baptism of fire, having assumed the chairship in the same month the first case of coronavirus was reported on the continent.

src: die prioriteite wat ons vir ons termyn gestel het, waaronder die uitbreiding van vrede en sekuriteit, die ekonomiese bemagtiging van vroue en ’n verdieping van ekonomiese integrasie, moes onmiddellik en ingrypend aangepas word om ons op die pandemie toe te spits.
tgt: the priorities we outlined for our term, among them furthering peace and security, the economic empowerment of women and deepening economic integration, had to be immediately and dramatically reoriented to deal with the pandemic.

src: ons dringendste taak was om die fokus van die afrikaunie te rig op die hantering van die ergste wêreldwye noodsituasie in meer as ‘n eeu.
tgt: our most pressing task was to steer the focus of the african union to addressing the worst global emergency in over a century.

src: covid19 het al die lande op die kontinent geaffekteer.
tgt: covid19 has affected all the countries on the continent.

src: tot op hede is daar meer as 3,5 miljoen bevestigde gevalle in afrika, en meer as 88 000 mense het gesterf.
tgt: to date there are more than 3.5 million confirmed cases in africa, and more than 88,000 people have died.

src: dit was ’n gesondheids, humanitêre, sosiale en ekonomiese krisis vir afrikalande, en die meeste van hierdie lande beskik nie oor voldoende hulpbronne om ‘n gesondheidskrisis van so ‘n omvang te hanteer nie.
tgt: it has been a health, humanitarian, social and economic crisis for african countries, most of whom are inadequately resourced to manage a health emergency of this size.

src: en tog, so ongeëwenaard as wat die aard van hierdie pandemie tot dusver was, so ongeëwenaard was ook die wyse waarop afrikalande saamgestaan het om dit te beveg.
tgt: and yet, as unprecedented as the nature of the pandemic has been, so too has been the manner in which african countries have come together to fight it.

src: ons het hoofsaaklik op die kontinent se eie kundigheid, vermoëns en instellings gesteun, waaronder die afrika sentrum vir siektebeheer en voorkoming (africa cdc).
tgt: in doing so we have drawn principally on the continent’s own expertise, capabilities and institutions such as the africa centres for disease control and prevention (africa cdc).

src: afrika het nie net passief sit en toekyk hoe die werklike omvang en gevaar van die pandemie ontvou nie.
tgt: africa did not sit by passively as the true extent and danger of the pandemic unfurled.

src: sedert die vroegste dae van die pandemie is daar onder leiding van die au spoedig ’n kontinentale reaksiestrategie ontwikkel wat aangedryf is deur die afrika cdc en streekstaakmagte.
tgt: from the earliest days of the pandemic and led by the au, we swiftly developed a continental response strategy, driven by the africa cdc and regional task forces.

src: ons het besef dat elke land op die kontinent ernstig deur die pandemie geraak sou word.
tgt: we realised that every country on the continent would be severely affected by the pandemic.

src: die meeste lande sou nie oor die nodige hulpbronne beskik om die uitdagings van die openbare gesondheidsektor te hanteer of hulle ekonomieë te beskerm nie.
tgt: most would not have the resources needed to meet the public health challenge or to protect their economies.

src: ons het daarom as afrikalande ooreengekom om verskeie prominente afrikane aan te wys as spesiale verteenwoordigers om met internasionale befondsers en multilaterale instellings in gesprek te tree om afrika se saak vir finansiële ondersteuning en skuldverligting te stel.
tgt: we therefore agreed as african countries to appoint several prominent africans as special envoys, who would engage with international funders and multilateral institutions to make the case for financial support and debt relief on africa’s behalf.

src: op hierdie wyse was ons, deur as ‘n kontinent saam te werk, in staat om skuldverligting en finansiële hulp vir baie lande ten opsigte van ons covidrespons en ekonomiese herstel te beding.
tgt: in this way, working as a one continent, we were able to achieve debt relief for many countries and financial assistance towards our covid response and economic recovery.

src: maar al het afrikalande hulle na die internasionale gemeenskap gewend vir hulp, het ons eers onsself gehelp – deur ‘n kontinentale covid19reaksiefonds op te rig en te kapitaliseer.
tgt: but much as african countries went to the international community for support, we first helped ourselves – establishing and capitalising a continental covid19 response fund.

src: vir elke vennootskap wat met lande met meer hulpbronne asook die internasi onale skenkergemeenskap aangegaan is, het ons ons eie innoverende en baanbreker afrikamediesevoorraadportaal gevestig om alle afrikalande in staat te stel om vinnig persoonlike beskermende toerusting en ander mediese voorraad op ’n billike en bekostigbare wyse te bekom.
tgt: for every partnership forged with betterresourced nations and the international donor community, we set up our own innovative and groundbreaking african medical supplies platform to enable all african countries to quickly secure personal protective equipment and other medical supplies in an equitable, affordable manner.

src: en nou dat die covid19entstof beskikbaar is, het ons as ‘n kollektief saamgewerk om te verseker dat die kontinent sy regverdige deel kry deur saam met die covaxfasiliteit te werk, gelei deur ons eie entstoftaakspan (african vaccine acquisition task team).
tgt: and now that the covid19 vaccine is available, we have worked as a collective to ensure that the continent gets its fair share, working with the covax facility and led by our own african vaccine acquisition task team.

src: ontplooiing van die entstof het reeds ’n aanvang geneem op die konti nent en ons streef daarna om die meerderheid van die kontinent se bevolking teen die einde van 2021 ingeënt te hê om kuddeimmuniteit te bereik.
tgt: vaccine rollout has already commenced on the continent and we aspire to have the majority of the continent’s population vaccinated by the end of 2021 to achieve herd immunity.

src: ons het soos een mens opgetree om gesondheid, mense en mense se bestaansmiddele op die kontinent te beskerm.
tgt: we have acted as one to protect health, people and livelihoods on the continent.

src: deur dit te doen, het ons gewys dat ons die kapasiteit het om na onsself te kyk en oor die vermoë beskik om ons eie ontwikkeling aan te dryf.
tgt: in doing so, we have demonstrated our capacity for selfreliance and our ability to be the drivers of our own development.

src: ongeag die oorheersing van covid19, het ons nog steeds daarin geslaag om in talle van ons sleutelprioriteite vordering te maak.
tgt: despite the dominance of covid19, we have still managed to make advances in several of our key priorities.

src: tydens ons termyn is die afrika kontinentale vryehandelsgebied (afcfta) uiteindelik bekendgestel, wat ’n nuwe era van intraafrika handelen ekonomiese integrasie inlui.
tgt: during our term, the africa continental free trade area (afcfta) was finally launched, heralding a new era of intraafrican trade and economic integration.

src: selfs onder die moeilike omstandighede weens die pandemie het die kontinent voortgestu om die "gewere op die kontinent stil te maak."
tgt: even under the difficult conditions posed by the pandemic, the continent has pushed ahead with towards the goal of ‘silencing the guns’ on the continent.

src: die au was onder andere aktief betrokke in onderhandelinge rakende die groot ethiopiese renaissancedam, die bewerkstelliging van ’n skietstilstand in libië sowel as die bevordering van vrede in suidsoedan.
tgt: the au has been actively involved in negotiations around the grand ethiopian renaissance dam, in achieving a ceasefire in libya and promoting peace in south sudan.

src: nog ‘n fokuspunt van ons termyn was die ekonomiese bemagtiging van vroue, waarmee ons sal voortgaan al het ons termyn verstryk, en ook regdeur die afrikavroue se dekade van finansiële en ekonomiese insluiting tot 2030. wanneer ons dan nou die stokkie oorgee aan die demokratiese republiek van die kongo (drc), laat ons hierdie voortreflike kontinentale liggaam in ’n sterker posisie.
tgt: another focus of our term has been on the economic empowerment of women, which we will continue to champion even beyond our term and throughout the decade of african women’s financial and economic inclusion to 2030. as we hand over the baton to the democratic republic of congo (drc) we leave this preeminent continental body in a position of greater strength.

src: suidafrika sal voortgaan om sy kant te bring om integrasie op die kontinent te bewerkstellig, en sal die inkomende voorsitter sowel as die organisasie ondersteun in sy pogings om die aspirasies van die au se agenda 2063 te bereik.
tgt: south africa will continue to play its part to foster integration on the continent, and support the incoming chair and the organisation in its efforts to meet the aspirations of the au’s agenda 2063. when the organisation for african unity was founded in 1963, member states planted the seeds of cooperation and solidarity in pursuit of a better life for all the peoples of africa.

src: toe die organisasie vir afrikaeenheid in 1963 gestig is, het lidstate die saadjies van samewerking en solidariteit in navolging van ‘n beter lewe vir al die mense van afrika gesaai.
tgt: they affirmed that african unity was paramount if the welfare and wellbeing of africa’s people was to be assured.

src: hulle het bevestig dat afrikaeenheid van die grootste belang is om die welsyn en welvaart van afrika se mense te verseker.
tgt: history bears witness that these seeds have not always fallen on fertile ground, and over the years the continental unity project has experienced many hurdles and false starts.

src: covid19 entstof: wat jy moet weet allison cooper met suidafrika se grootskaalse koronavirus (covid19)inentingsprogram wat in februa rie vir gesondheidswer kers ontplooi word, werp vuk’uzenzele ‘n bietjie lig op wat die covid19entstof is en waarom dit so belangrik is om die verspreiding van die virus te bekamp.
tgt: covid19 vaccine: what you need to know allison cooper with south afri ca’s mass coro navirus disease (covid19) vaccination programme rolling out for healthcare workers in february, vuk’uzenzele sheds some light on what the covid19 vaccine is, how it works and why it’s so important to stop the spread of the virus.

src: wat doen ’n entstof?‘n entstof leer jou liggaam se immuniteitstelsel (wat infeksie beveg) om teenliggaam pies (proteïene wat siektes beveg) te vervaardig – presies soos dit sou doen as jy aan ’n virus blootgestel sou word.
tgt: a vaccine trains your body’s immune system (which fights infection), to produce antibodies (proteins that fight disease) – exactly like it would if you were exposed to a virus.

src: hoekom is die entstof so belangrik?
tgt: why is the vaccine so important?

src: inenting teen covid19 is ’n doeltreffende manier om jouself teen die virus te beskerm, want jy het ’n verminderde risiko op infeksie.
tgt: being vaccinated against covid19 is an effective way to protect yourself against the virus because your risk of infection is reduced.

src: die kans is dan ook kleiner dat jy die virus aan iemand anders sal oordra.
tgt: you are then less likely to pass the virus on to someone else.

src: die doelwit van inenting is om kuddeimmuniteit te bereik – wanneer genoeg mense van die bevolking immuun teen die virus is, verskaf dit indirek beskerming aan diegene wat nie immuun is nie, wat die verspreiding van die virus onder beheer bring.
tgt: the aim of vaccination is to reach herd immunity – when enough of the population is immune to the virus it provides indirect protection to those who aren’t immune, bringing the spread of the virus under control.

src: is entstowwe noodsaaklik om die verspreiding van covid19 te voorkom?
tgt: are vaccines necessary to prevent the spread of covid19?

src: daar is oorweldigende wetenskaplike bewyse dat inenting die beste verdedigingsmeganisme teen ern stige infeksies is.
tgt: there is overwhelming scientific evidence that vaccination is the best defence against serious infections.

src: sal die entstof voorkom dat ek covid19 kry?
tgt: will the vaccine stop me from getting covid19?

src: geen entstof bied 100% bes kerming nie.
tgt: no vaccine provides 100% protection.

src: kuddeimmuniteit bied ook nie volledige beskerming aan diegene wat nie ingeënt is nie, alhoewel hierdie mense tog beduidende beskerming sal geniet.
tgt: herd immunity also does not provide full protection to those who are not vaccinated.

src: is die entstof veilig?
tgt: is the vaccination safe?

src: covid19entstowwe onder gaan ’n veeleisende, multifasetoetsproses, insluitend kliniese proewe waaraan tienduisende mense deelneem.
tgt: covid19 vaccines go through a demanding, multistage testing process, including large trials that involve tens of thousands of people.

src: elke entstof wat in suidafrika se grootskaalse entstofprogram gebruik word, moet deur die suidafrikaanse reguleringsowerheid vir gesondheidsprodukte (sahpra) goedgekeur word.
tgt: every vaccine used in south africa’s mass vaccination programme has to be approved by the south african health products regulatory authority.

src: die oxford universiteitastrazenecaentstof is reeds deur verskeie reguleerders regoor die wêreld goedgekeur en word tans in ander lande ontplooi.
tgt: the oxford universityastrazeneca vaccine has already been approved by various regulators around the world and is being rolled out in other countries.

src: wie gaan die entstof eerste kry?
tgt: who will get the vaccine first?

src: die land se geskatte 1,25 miljoen gesondheidsorgwerkers gaan die entstof eerste kry.
tgt: the country’s estimated 1.25 million healthcare workers will receive the vaccine first.

src: in fase twee sal prioriteit gegee word aan essensiële werkers soos onderwysers, die polisie, munisipale werkers, taxibestuurders en ander frontliniepersoneel; mense in inrigtings en tehuise soos ouetehuise, skuilings en tronke; asook mense ouers as 60 en volwassenes met onderliggende siektetoestande.
tgt: in phase two, essential workers such as teachers, police, municipal workers, taxi drivers and other frontline personnel; people in institutions such as old age homes, shelters and prisons; and people over 60 and adults with comorbidities will be prioritised.

src: in fase drie sal ongeveer 22,5 miljoen van die oorblywende bevolking ingeënt word.
tgt: in phase three, about 22.5 million of the remaining adult population will be vaccinated.

src: die mikpunt is om 67% van die bevolking teen die einde van 2021 in te ent.
tgt: the target is to vaccinate 67% of the population by the end of 2021. by then we should reach herd immunity.

src: stappe om die ekonomie weer op die been te bring vukuzenzele unnamed dit sal binnekort n jaar wees sedert die eerste koronavirusgeval in ons land aangeteken is.
tgt: steps to revive the economy vukuzenzele unnamed it will soon be a year since the first reported case of coronavirus disease (covid19) in our country.

src: die pandemie het n hewige tol geëis in beide openbare gesondheid en die lewensbestaan van miljoene van ons mense.
tgt: the pandemic has come at a great cost to both public health and the livelihoods of millions of our people.

src: baie werknemers het deel van hul inkomste verloor met die afskaal van hul werksure, met baie ander wat hul werk heeltemal kwyt is weens afleggings.
tgt: many workers lost part of their income as their work hours were reduced with many being retrenched.

src: verskeie ondernemings het groot verliese gely weens werksaamhede wat afgeskaal is.
tgt: several businesses have incurred heavy losses from scaledback operations.

src: ander besighede moes heeltemal sluit.
tgt: others have had to close.

src: werkers in die informele sektor het ook hieronder gely.
tgt: people working in the informal sector have also suffered.

src: die ergste van alles is dat die pandemie die broodwinners in baie gesinne geëis het, wat dié gesinne behoeftig en vol vrees vir die toekoms laat.
tgt: most difficult of all, the pandemic has claimed the lives of breadwinners in many families, leaving them destitute and fearful for the future.

src: dít is hoekom die omvattende verligtingsmaatreëls wat ons in plek gestel het beide broodnodig en baie dringend was.
tgt: this is why the extensive relief measures we put in place were both necessary and urgent.

src: en nou, n jaar later, is die doeltreffendheid van dié maatreëls bewese.
tgt: and, now that nearly a year has passed, we can say that these measures have proved effective.

src: van al die verligtingsmaatreëls wat ons in plek gestel het, is die twee met die grootste impak bes moontlik die spesiale kovid19toelae en die wvf se kovid19 tydelike werkgewerwerknemerverligtingskema, algemeen bekend as kovid ters.
tgt: of the full package of relief measures that we introduced, perhaps the two measures that had the greatest impact were the special covid19 social relief of distress grant and the unemployment insurance fund's (uif) covid19 temporary employer/employee relief scheme, generally known as covid ters.

src: ons sou nie hierdie maatreëls so vinnig kon uitrol as ons nie reeds n omvattende maatskaplike sekerheidsinfrastruktuur in plek gehad het nie.
tgt: we would not have been able to roll out these measures in such a short space of time if we had not had an extensive social security infrastructure already in place.

src: ons was in staat om vinnig op dié dringende en reuse behoefte in ons samelewing te reageer danksy die wesenlike landswye infrastruktuur en stelsels van die suidafrikaanse maatskaplike sekerheidsagentskap (sassa) en die werkloosheidsversekeringsfonds (wvf).
tgt: we were able to respond to this huge and immediate need in our society thanks to the substantial nationwide infrastructure and systems of the south african social security agency and the uif.

src: daar het ongetwyfeld hier en daar n paar tegniese en ander foute ingeglip, maar meeste hiervan is sommer gou reggestel.
tgt: there were certainly technical and other glitches along the way, but most of these were speedily resolved.

src: dié staatsagentskappe het uitstekende werk verrig om miljoene mense te registreer en seker te maak dat hulle hul uitbetalings ontvang.
tgt: these government agencies did outstanding work to enroll millions of new beneficiaries and ensure they were paid.

src: die steun wat deur die wvf gelewer is, was n lewenslyn aan ondernemings en individue in nood.
tgt: the support provided by the uif was a lifeline to struggling businesses and employees.

src: dit was die verskil tussen ondernemings wat hul deure kon oophou of moes sluit; tussen werke wat behou is en wat verlore gegaan het.
tgt: it made the difference between companies remaining open and being forced to close, between jobs saved and jobs lost.

src: dit het besighede soos sihle’s brew, n restaurant in gauteng, bevoordeel; die restaurant was in staat om sy 18 werknemers te behou, danksy die tersskema.
tgt: this benefited businesses like sihle’s brew, a restaurant in gauteng, which was able to retain its 18 employees because of the ters scheme.

src: danksy staatsondersteuning kon mamoshalagae trading and projects, n outoelektriese onderneming in mokopane, sy werkers betaal asook die besigheid se huurgeld en uitgawes tydens die inperking dek.
tgt: thanks to government support, mamoshal agae trading and projects, an autoelectrical business in mokopane, was able to pay its workers as well as its rent and rates during the lockdown.

src: werknemers in nood was in staat om n deel van hul salarisse te ontvang.
tgt: employees in dire straits were able to receive a portion of their salaries.

src: lindiwe ntuli, n regsassistent in centurion, het getuig hoe die toelae wat sy ontvang het, dit vir haar moontlik gemaak om van die huis af te kon werk en haar huur te kon bekostig.
tgt: lindiwe ntuli, a paralegal in centurion, has told how receiving her benefits enabled her to work from home and be able to afford her rent.

src: daar is baie verhale van ondernemings wat die afgelope jaar danksy die steun wat hulle van die wvf ontvang het hul deure kon oophou.
tgt: there are many stories of companies that have been able to stay afloat over the past year because of the support they received from the uif.

src: dit geld ook vir kleinhandelsake wat deur die verskeie toelae en lenings wat deur verskillende departemente toegestaan is, geholpe is.
tgt: the same can be said of the small businesses helped by the various grants and loans provided by a number of departments.

src: dié maatreëls het ons mense in tye van nood bygestaan.
tgt: these measures greatly helped our people in their time of need.

src: soos wat ons beweeg van verligting na herstel, moet ons van rat verander.
tgt: as we transition from relief to recovery, we have to shift gear.

src: terwyl hierdie verligtingsmaatreëls van tydelike aard is, gaan die ekonomie steeds vir n hele ruk die nagevolge van die pandemie ervaar.
tgt: while these relief measures were designed to be temporary, the economy will continue to feel the effects of the pandemic for some time.

src: selfs met die verslapping van baie van die inperking se beperkings, sukkel vele ondernemings steeds met die nagevolge van maande en maande se beperkte werksaamhede en verlore inkomste.
tgt: even as lockdown restrictions have been eased, many companies are struggling to cope with the fallout of months of diminished operations and lost revenue.

src: daar is dus besluit, na aanleiding van omvattende gesprekvoering met maatskaplike vennote by nedlac, dat die kovid tersvoordele met drie maande verleng sal word tot 15 maart 2021 in sektore wat nog nie ten volle operasioneel is nie.
tgt: it is for this reason that, following extensive discussion with social partners at the national economic development and labour council the covid ters benefit has been extended until 15 march 2021 for sectors that have not been able to fully operate.

src: die spesiale kovidtoelae is met drie maande verleng.
tgt: the special covid grant has been extended for another three months.

src: ons moet nou daarop begin fokus om n omgewing te skep waarin besighede kan herstel en wat werkskepping en belegging aanmoedig.
tgt: our focus now must be on creating an enabling environment for businesses to recover, and for economic growth that spurs job creation and attracts invest ment.

src: die herstel gaan moeilik wees en tyd neem, veral synde ons steeds te midde van die pandemie is.
tgt: the recovery will be difficult and will take time, not least because we are still in the midst of the pandemic.

src: so belangrik soos die verligtingsmaatreëls is, kan ons dit nie onbepaald in plek hou nie.
tgt: important as these relief measures are now, we will not be able to sustain them indefinitely.

src: ons moet seker maak dat hierdie verligtingsmaatreels n stewige basis vorm vir die breër herstel van die ekonomie sonder om die land verder in die skuld te dompel.
tgt: we need to make sure that these relief measures provide a firm foundation for a broader recovery without driving the country deeper into debt.

src: tensy ons ons nasionale skuld kan afbring na onderhoubare vlakke, sal geen betekenisvolle herstel moontlik wees nie.
tgt: unless we can bring our national debt down to sustainable levels no meaningful economic recovery will be possible.

src: ons nasionale bewussyn moet nou verby verligting na herstel strek, en ons moet almal ons deel bring om dit te bewerkstellig.
tgt: our national consciousness must now move beyond the realm of relief into that of recovery, and we must all be part of this effort.

src: as die staat gaan ons vanjaar moeilike besluite oor openbare besteding moet neem en implementeer.
tgt: as government, hard decisions on public spending will need to be made and implemented this year.

src: maatskappye gaan innoverend moet wees met be stuursmetodes en prosesse om hul volhoubaarheid en winsgewendheid te verseker, met die voorkoming van werksverlies as hul grootste oorweging.
tgt: companies will need to be innovative in driving methods and processes that secure their sustainability and profitability, with job retention being their foremost consideration.

src: ons moet geld in ons ekonomie terugplaas deur plaaslike produkte te koop, plaaslike besighede en bedrywe te ondersteun en by plaaslike verskaffers te aan te koop.
tgt: we must put our money back into our economy by buying local products, supporting local businesses and industrie and procuring from local suppliers.

src: n beseerde pasiënt met goeie kanse vir herstel ontvang gereelde fisioterapie om hom te help om sterker te word sodat hy gou weer op sy eie voete kan staan.
tgt: an injured patient with strong prospects for recovery is given regular phys ical therapy to help them get stronger until they can stand unaided.

src: hoe om die verlies van n geliefde te hanteer vukuzenzele unnamed baie mense het weens die koronaviruspandemie geliefdes aan die dood afgestaan en dié verlies voel dikwels onwerklik en moeilik om te begryp.
tgt: dealing with the loss of a loved one vukuzenzele unnamed many people have lost loved ones as a result of the coronavirus pandemic and the death may often feel unreal.

src: "jy is nie die enigste een nie," verseker zanele ludziya, n gemeenskapsielkundige verbonde aan die stiklandhospitaal in die weskaap.
tgt: "you are not alone," says community psychologist zanele ludziya from the stikland hospital in the western cape.

src: om n geliefde te verloor, is nooit maklik nie en kan n vlaag emosies ontketen.
tgt: losing a loved one is never easy and can trigger a range of emotions.

src: "daar is baie tekens wat daarop dui dat n geliefde deur die rouproses gaan, maar n gebrek aan sigbare simptome beteken nie noodwendig dat die persoon nie rou nie.
tgt: "there are many signs you can look out for when a loved one is grieving, but an absence of symptoms does not mean that the person is not grieving.

src: "mense mag tekens van woede, irritasie, hartseer of onverskilligheid toon.
tgt: "people may show signs of anger, irritability, sadness or apathy.

src: hul kognitiewe funksionering kan ook aangetas word omdat hulle ingedagte is danksy gedagtes oor en herinneringe van die ontslape geliefde.
tgt: their cog nitive functioning may also be affected, as they may be preoccupied with thoughts and memories of the deceased.

src: hulle mag dalk sukkel om te konsentreer of verstrooid voorkom," sê ludziya.
tgt: they could also have trouble concentrating or may appear confused," says ludziya.

src: sy raai mense aan om op te let na gedragsveranderinge soos tranerigheid of n toename in alkoholen dwelmgebruik.
tgt: she advises people to be aware of behavioural changes, such as being tearful or increased alcohol and substance use.

src: "hulle mag dalk meer as gewoonlik rook, hulle mag hulself onttrek of isoleer, of hulle mag mense en plekke vermy.
tgt: "they may smoke more than they usually do, they may withdraw or isolate or they may avoid people and places.

src: hulle mag dalk stilte of harder geraas soek.
tgt: they may want silence or increased noise.

src: hulle kan ook meer aggressief en kortaf wees," sê sy.
tgt: they could also be more aggressive or snappy," she says.

src: wanneer mens steun bied aan n geliefde, help dit om die rouproses te verstaan en te besef dat elke persoon dit anders ervaar, volgens ludziya.
tgt: when supporting a loved one, ludziya says it is helpful to understand the grieving process and that everyone experiences it differently.

src: sy verduidelik dat om te rou nie n toestand is nie, maar wel n proses; en dat mense deur verskillende fases gaan tydens die rouproses.
tgt: she explains that grief is not a state, but a process, and people usually go through stages of grief.

src: die algemene fases van die rouprosesdie algemene fases tydens die rouproses is ontkenning of isolasie (weens skok of verslaentheid); woede (word kwaad vir ander mense wanneer hulle niks verkeerd gedoen het nie); onderhandeling (skuldgevoelens oor dinge wat nooit gesê is nie en ongedane sake); depressie (die hartseer wanneer n mens besef die lewe sal aangaan sonder die geliefde); en aanvaarding (die persoon aanvaar die werklikheid, maak vrede met die verlies en vind n manier om steeds n vervulde lewe sonder die geliefde te lei).
tgt: common stages of griefthe common stages of grief are denial or isolation (experiencing numbness or shock); anger (getting angry with others when they have not done anything wrong); bargaining (experiencing feelings of guilt over things not done or said); depression (the sadness that comes with realising that life will continue without their loved); and acceptance (finding a way to living a fulfilled life without the person).

src: "een van die maniere waarop n mens die situasie kan hanteer en ondersteuning kan bied is om begrip te hê met die roufase waarin jy of die ander persoon is.
tgt: "one way of coping or showing support is to understand the stage of grief you are in or that a loved one is experiencing.

src: 'n professionele staatsdiens vukuzenzele unnamed met my verkiesing as staatspresi dent het ek des tyds gesê dat die skepping van ’n doeltreffende, be kwame en etiese regering, vry van enige korrupsie, een van my grootste prio riteite is.
tgt: a professional public service vukuzenzele unnamed when i was elected to the position of president of south africa, i said that building an efficient, capable and ethical state free from corruption was among my foremost priorities.

src: slegs ’n bekwame, doeltref fende, etiese en ontwikke lingsgeoriënteerde regering kan die verbintenis tot die verbetering van die lewens van die mense van hierdie land nakom.
tgt: only a capable, efficient, ethical and developmentoriented state can deliver on the commitment to improve the lives of the people of this country.

src: dit beteken dat die staats diens beman moet word deur mense wat professioneel, vaardig, onbaatsugtig en eerlik is.
tgt: this means that the public service must be staffed by men and women who are professional, skilled, selfless and honest.

src: hulle moet daartoe verbind wees om die waardes van die grondwet te handhaaf en moet, soos ek in my in huldigingstoespraak gesê het, "hulself getrou vir geen ander saak as dié van die publiek beywer nie".
tgt: they must be committed to upholding the values of the constitution, and must, as i said in my inaugural speech, "faithfully serve no other cause than that of the public".

src: tydens die afgelope twee weke het openbare kon sultasies plaasgevind met betrekking tot ’n belangrike beleidsdokument wat groter dryfkrag gaan gee aan ons werk om die staatsdiens te steun, versterk en bevoeg te maak.
tgt: over the past two weeks, public consultations have been underway on an important policy document that will give greater impetus to our efforts to bolster, strengthen and capacitate the civil service.

src: die konsep vir die nasionale implementeringsraamwerk vir die professionalisering van die staatsdiens is daarop gemik om ’n regering tot stand te bring wat ons volk beter dien, wat geïsoleer is van onbehoorlike politieke inmenging, en waar aanstel lings op meriete plaasvind.
tgt: the draft national implementation framework towards the professionalisation of the public service aims to build a state that better serves our people, that is insulated from undue political interference and where appointments are made on merit.

src: die raamwerk is in novem ber laasjaar deur die kabinet goedgekeur en gestruktureer de konsultasie met verskeie sektore van die samelewing word tans onderneem.
tgt: the framework was approved by cabinet in november last year and structured consultation with various sectors of society are now underway.

src: na seweentwintig jaar van demokrasie kan ons die vol gende van die staatsdiens sê: ondanks uitnemendheid op talle terreine, is daar in baie staatsdepartemente steeds ernstige uitdagings met betrekking tot vaardighede, bekwaamheid en professio naliteit.
tgt: twentyseven years into democracy, it can be said of the public service that while several pockets of excellence exist, we have serious challenges in many government departments with regards to skills, competence and professionalism.

src: te dikwels is mense aange stel in en bevorder tot sleutel posisies waarvoor hulle nie geskik of bekwaam was nie.
tgt: all too often, people have been hired into and promoted to key positions for which they are neither suitable nor qualified.

src: dit het die werksprestasie van die regering beïnvloed en ook bygedra tot nepo tisme, politieke inmenging in die werksverrigting van departmente, ’n gebrek aan verantwoordbaarheid, wan bestuur en korrupsie.
tgt: this affects government performance, but also contributes to nepotism, political interference in the work of departments, lack of accountability, mismanagement and corruption.

src: daar is ook die verwante probleem van politieke en uitvoerende inmenging in die administrasie van die staatsdiens.
tgt: there is also the related problem of political and executive interference in the administration of the public service.

src: 'n mens hoef net te kyk na die onstabiliteit in staatsdepartemente wan neer seniorbestuur verskuif of vervang word elke keer as ’n nuwe minister aangestel word.
tgt: one need only to look at the instability in government departments when senior managers are swopped or replaced each time a new minister is appointed.

src: direkteursgeneraal en pro vinsiale departementshoofde word veral hierdeur geraak.
tgt: directorsgeneral (dgs) and provincial heads of departments (hods) are particularly affected.

src: in sommige departemente het dgs, departementshoofde en uitvoerende bestuur die voor deel van 'n stabiele amps termyn geniet, wat sulke departemente in staat gestel het om met min ontwrigting aan te hou funksioneer.
tgt: in some departments, dgs, hods and executive managers have had stability of tenure, enabling the departments to function with little disruption.

src: in die meeste sulke departemente waar daar stabiele leierskap is, is ouditverslae geneig om positief en openbare be fondsing verantwoordbaar te wees.
tgt: in most of these departments where there is leadership stability, audit outcomes tend to be positive and public funds can be accounted for.

src: een van die belangrikste voorstelle in die konsepraamwerk is dat die staats diens gedepolitiseer moet word en dat staatsdeparte mente van politiek geïsoleer moet word.
tgt: one of the key recommendations made in the draft framework is that the public service must be depoliticised and that government departments must be insulated from politics.

src: professionalisering is nood saaklik vir stabiliteit in die staatsdiens, veral in die se nior range.
tgt: professionalisation is necessary for stability in the public service, especially in the senior ranks.

src: staatsamptenare moet hul pligte kan uitvoer "ondanks enige veranderinge onder die ministers, lede van die uitvoerende raad of raadslede in die regerende party met betrekking tot die administrasie, of verskui wings van politieke partye na afloop van verkiesings".
tgt: public servants must be able to continue doing their jobs "regardless of any changes of ministers, members of the executive council or councillors within the governing party in charge of the administration, or changes to political parties after elections".

src: ons stel ’n aantal verrei kende hervormings voor, byvoorbeeld die verlen ging van die ampstermyn van departementshoofde op grond van meriete en prestasie, die instelling van beroepsgebaseerde bekwaamheidsassesserings asook die betrokkenheid van die staatsdienskomis sie wanneer onderhoude met kandidate vir die poste van direkteursgeneraal en adjunkdirekteursgeneraal gevoer word.
tgt: we are proposing a number of farreaching reforms, such as extending the tenure of hods based on merit and performance, doing occupationbased competency assessments and involving the public service commission in the interviews of dgs and deputy dgs.

src: die instelling van integri teitstoetsing vir alle kandi date wat op die kortlys is, sal daartoe bydra dat ons staatsamptenare kan werf wat met eerbaarheid kan dien.
tgt: introducing integrity tests for all shortlisted individuals will help so that we can recruit civil servants who can serve honestly.

src: ons moet voorts ook die verpligte intreeeksamens wat ons in april 2020 inge stel het, uitbrei na meer as slegs die senior bestuurders.
tgt: we also need to extend the compulsory entrance exams that we introduced in april 2020 beyond senior management.

src: suksesvolle ontwikkelende regerings het soortgelyke maatreëls wat professiona lisme onder die staatsdiens bevorder.
tgt: successful developmental states have similar measures which help advance professionalism within the public service.

src: soos ons in die konsepraamwerk noem, "moet die burokrasie voortdurend lo jaal en nougeset die politieke mandaat wat deur die kiesers en die party daargestel is, implementeer, maar hulle daarvan weerhou om self politieke rolspelers te wees.
tgt: as we note in the draft framework, "the bureaucracy must continue to loyally and diligently implement the political mandate set by voters and the party, but to refrain from being political actors themselves.

src: "ons voorstel is ’n stren ger benadering jeens die werwing en keuring, in duksie en prestasiebestuur van staatsamptenare.
tgt: "we are suggesting a more rigorous approach towards recruitment and selection of public servants, induction and performance management.

src: dit sluit in volgehoue leer en ’n duidelike professionele ontwikkelingspad vir elke staatsamptenaar.
tgt: this includes continuous learning and a clear professional development path for every public servant.

src: die konsepraamwerk benadruk die behoefte om staatsamptenare verant woordbaar te hou vir on reëlmatighede en sodoende ’n kultuur van straffeloos heid in die wanbestuur en misbruik van regeringshulp bronne te verhoed.
tgt: the draft framework puts emphasis on the need to hold public servants accountable for irregularities, to do away with a culture of impunity in the mismanagement and misappropriation of state resources.

src: professionalisering van die staatsdiens behels die opleiding van rekening kundige beamptes oor al die regeringsfere heen met betrekking tot die toepaslike wetlike bepalings.
tgt: professionalising the public service involves training for accounting officers across all spheres of government on the applicable legislative provisions.

src: die nasionale regerings kool speel ’n sleutelrol in hierdie verband.
tgt: the national school of government (nsg) has a vital role to play in this regard.

src: professionalisme behels nie net die regte kwalifikasies en tegniese kennis nie, maar ook die toepaslike standaarde van respek, hoflikheid en integriteit in skakeling met lede van die publiek.
tgt: professionalism is not only about having the right qualifications and technical skills, but also about having appropriate standards of respect, courtesy and integrity in dealing with members of the public.

src: die staatsdiens is uiteen lopend, met ’n wye verskei denheid vaardighede, kwa lifikasies en bekwaamhede.
tgt: the public service is diverse, with a huge range of skills, qualifications and capabilities.

src: baie staatsamptenare het gespesialiseerde vaardig hede wat noodsaaklik is vir doeltreffende dienslewering.
tgt: many public servants have specialised skills that are necessary for the effective provision of services.

src: dit is dus nie noodwendig die geval dat ons ’n kleiner staatsdiens benodig nie; wat ons wel nodig het is ’n ef fektiewe staatsdiens met die nodige vaardighede, profes sionele etiek en ’n verbintenis om die gemeenskap te dien.
tgt: it is therefore not necessarily the case that we need a smaller public service: what we actually need is a fitforpurpose public service with suitable skills, a professional ethic and a commitment to serving the people.

src: die mense in die staatsdiens moet in staat gestel word om hul rol te vervul in die strewe na ontwikkeling en die kon solidering van demokrasie.
tgt: the men and women of the public service need to be capacitated to play their role in driving development and consolidating democracy.

src: dit is ons beste waarborg vir ’n bekwame staat wat die belange van sy landsburgers dien.
tgt: this is our best guarantee of a capable state that serves the interests of citizens.

src: ek doen ’n beroep op julle almal om deel te neem aan die openbare konsultasie proses vir hierdie konsepraamwerk, wat op die nasionale regeringskool se webwerf beskikbaar is, en om jul stemme te laat hoor.
tgt: i call on you to be part of the public consultation process around this draft framework, which is available on the nsg's website, and to make your voice heard.

src: ons vier internasionale downsindroomdag kgaogelo letsebe downsindroom in ternasionaal het 21 maart as die internasionale downsindroomdag ingestel ter viering van diegene wat hard veg vir die insluit ing van hul geliefdes wat met dié siekte saamleef.
tgt: celebrating world down syndrome day kgaogelo letsebe down syndrome international has confirmed march 21 as world down syndrome day, to celebrate those fighting for the inclusion of their loved ones who are living with the illness.

src: downsindroom (ds) is ’n chromosale afwyking wat tydens bevrugting ontstaan.
tgt: down syndrome (ds) is a chromosomal disorder arising at the time of conception.

src: ’n mediese praktisyn in mpumalanga, dr midah maluleka, verduidelik: "daar is ’n ekstra nommer 21 chromosoom (trisomie 21) wat vertragings in fisiese en intellektuele ontwikkeling veroorsaak.
tgt: mpumalangabased medical practitioner dr midah maluleka says: "there is an extra number 21 chromosome (trisomy 21) which causes delays in physical and intellectual development.

src: daar is geen definitiewe oorsaak van hierdie afwyking nie.
tgt: there’s no definite cause for this extra chromosome.

src: daar is bewys dat dit geensins verband hou met ouderdom, sosioekonomiese status, ras of geloof nie.
tgt: it has been proven to have no relation to age, socioeconomic status, race or religion.

src: maleluka voeg by dat downsindroom die mees algemene chromosomale afwyking onder pasgebore babas is.
tgt: "maluleka adds that ds is the most common chromosomal disorder in newborns.

src: "een uit elke 1 000 babas wat in eerstewêreld lande gebore word, met een uit elke 650 babas in ontwikkelende lande soos ons, word geraak.
tgt: "one in 1 000 babies born in first world countries with one in 650 babies born in developing countries , like ours, are affected.

src: minstens 80% van alle babas wat deur ds geraak word, se ma’s is jonger as 35, ten spyte van die algemene persepsie dat vrouens bó die ouderdom van 35 ’n groter risiko het om ’n kind met downsindroom te hê.
tgt: at least 80% of children affected by ds are born from mothers under the age of 35, despite women over the age of 35 being deemed to be at higher risk of having a child with ds.

src: "sy sê dat omdat die af wyking reeds vanaf bev rugting opgespoor kan word, is daar sekere tekens waarvoor 'n mens op die uitkyk kan wees.
tgt: "she says because the disorder can be picked up at conception, there are some telltale signs to look out for.

src: "in die vroeë stadium van swangerskap word ’n 12tot 13week ultrasoniese skan dering aanbeveel.
tgt: "in the early stages of pregnancy, a 1213 week ultrasound scan is advised.

src: tydens hierdie prosedure word daar ’n akkurate meting geneem van die nekvel van die fetus, genaamd nekkuiltransluse nsie ("nuchal translucency").
tgt: this accurately measures the thickness of fluid behind the baby's neck, called the nuchal translucency.

src: dit is dikwels dikker in babas met downsindroom.
tgt: this is often larger in babies with ds.

src: "nog 'n voorgeboortelike toets is ’n amniosintese.
tgt: another prenatal test is an amniocentesis.

src: dit is wanneer klein hoeveelhede amniotiese vloeistof verwy der en vir chromosoomana lise gestuur word.
tgt: this is when small amounts of amniotic fluid is collected and sent for chromosome analysis.

src: hierdie toets is ongeveer 98% ak kuraat om downsindroom te diagnoseer."
tgt: this test is about 98% accurate for diagnosis.

src: maluleka sê dat kinders met downsindroom in staat is om sinvolle, gesonde en lang lewens te kan lei.
tgt: "maluleka says that children with ds are able to live full, healthy and long lives.

src: "alhoewel downsindroom nie genees kan word nie, kan mense met downsindroom voordeel trek uit ’n liefdevolle tuisomgew ing, die korrekte mediese versorging, vroeë intervensie asook opvoedkundige en be roepsgerigte dienste.
tgt: "although there’s no cure, people with ds benefit from loving homes, appropriate medical care, early intervention, educational and vocational services.

src: danksy gevorderde mediese sorg het mense wat met downsindroom gebore is vandag ’n lewensverwagting van ongeveer 55 jaar.
tgt: due to advanced medical care, most people born with ds today have a life expectancy of approximately 55 years.

src: mense met downsindroom het die selfde emosies en behoeftes as enige ander persoon en verdien dieselfde geleent hede en sorg," sê maleluka.
tgt: people with ds have the same emotions and needs as any other person and deserve the same opportunities and care," says maluleka.

src: noordwesgebaseerde onderwyser tshepo kekana sê, "nie alle studente met spesiale behoeftes hoef re mediërende en spesiale skole by te woon nie.
tgt: north westbased teacher tshepo kekana says, "not all special needs students need to go to remedial and special schools.

src: tradisionele leiers van sleutelbelang tot herstelpogings vukuzenzele unnamed ons moes, in die afgelope paar maande, van twee van ons land se mees gesiene konings afskeid neem.
tgt: traditional leaders key to recovery efforts vukuzenzele unnamed in the last few months, we have had to bid a sad farewell to two of our country’s most respected traditional monarchs.

src: die zoeloenasie het on langs sy majesteit, koning goodwill zwelithini ka bhekuzulu, wat vir n halfeeu regeer het, ter ruste gelê.
tgt: the zulu people recently laid to rest his majesty king goodwill zwelithini ka bhekuzulu who reigned for half a century.

src: die bapedivolk het in januarie kgoshikgolo thulare thulare iii ter ruste gelê wat minder as n jaar na sy inhuldiging oorlede is.
tgt: in january, the bapedi people buried kgoshikgolo thulare thulare iii, who passed away less than a year after his inauguration.

src: ons het, met hul afsterwe, kampioene van die bewaring van ons land se erfenis en die geskiedenis van hul onder skeie volke verloor.
tgt: with their passing, we have lost champions of the preservation of our heritage, and revered custodians of the histories of their respective peoples.

src: hulle het terselfdertyd ook wesenlik tot landelike ont wikkeling bygedra en was toegewy aan die steun van programme ter verbetering van hul mense se lewensge halte.
tgt: at the same time, they were vital players in rural development, and were committed to driving programmes to uplift the material conditions of their people.

src: een van die nuwe regering se prioriteite, met die koms van demokrasie in 1994, was om die integriteit en reg matigheid van tradisionele leierskap in ooreenstemming met tradisionele wette en gebruike, en onderworpe aan die grondwet van die republiek, te hervestig.
tgt: with the advent of democracy in 1994, it was a priority of the new government to restore the integrity and legitimacy of traditional leadership in line with indigenous law and customs and subject to the constitution of the republic.

src: die tradisionele leierskaps instelling speel steeds n belangrike rol in die lewens van miljoene mense regoor ons land, veral in landelike gebiede.
tgt: the institution of traditional leadership continues to play an important role in the lives of millions of people around our country, especially in rural areas.

src: tradisionele leiers ondersteun en dryf ontwik keling in hul gemeenskappe.
tgt: traditional leaders support and drive development in their communities.

src: ek het onlangs die geleent heid gehad om oor die debat van die opening van die na sionale huis van tradisionele leiers deel te neem; dié debat het op die dringende kwes sies wat die land in die gesig staar, gefokus.
tgt: recently, i had the opportunity to participate in the debate on the opening of the national house of traditional leaders, which was concerned with the most pressing issues currently facing the country.

src: wat juis besonders verfris send van dié kragtige ge sprekvoering was, was dat die tradisionele leierskap n besondere begrip van die moeilike ekonomiese toe stande wat die land in die gesig staar het en graag deel wil wees van die poging om die uitdagings van onderont wikkeling en armoede in hul omgewings aan te spreek.
tgt: what was particularly refreshing about the robust engagement was that traditional leadership has a keen appreciation of the difficult economic conditions facing our country, and want to be part of addressing the many challenges of underdevelopment and poverty in their areas.

src: ek het nog altyd gesê dat ons ekonomiese herstel na af loop van die koronaviruspan demie inklusief moet wees, en dat niemand agtergelaat moet word nie.
tgt: i have consistently said that our economic recovery in the wake of the coronavirus pandemic must be inclusive, and that nobody must be left behind.

src: die sukses van die ekono miese herkonstruksieen her stelplan rus op die smee van sterk vennootskapsbande tussen nie net die staat, han del en arbeid nie, maar ook met tradisionele leierskap en ander gemeenkapsgroepe.
tgt: the success of the economic reconstruction and recovery plan rests on forging strong partnerships between not just government, business and labour, but also with traditional leadership and other societal formations.

src: n deurlopende tema tydens die debat was dat tradisio nele leiers nie van aalmoese nie vir hulle gemeenskappe afhanklik wil wees nie en ook nie wil hê hul gemeenskappe moet die heeltyd van die regering se finansiële steun afhanklik wees nie.
tgt: a constant refrain from participants in the debate recently was that they do not want to be dependent on handouts or for their communities to perpetually look to government for financial assistance.

src: hulle wil die nodige steun, opleiding en bemagtiging hê om landelike gemeenskappe in staat te stel om selfversor gend te wees.
tgt: they want to be provided with the necessary support, training and enabling environment to allow rural communities to be selfsufficient.

src: hulle wil die stedelikelandelike skeiding, met be trekking tot staatsdienste en privaat sektorhulpbronne, oorbrug.
tgt: they want to bridge the urbanrural divide in access to government services and private sector resources.

src: hul wil graag sien dat lande like gebiede omskep word in spoelpunte van ekonomiese aktiwiteit, asook bedryfsen werksgeleenthede.
tgt: what they would like to see is for rural areas to become centres of economic activity, industry and employment opportunity.

src: dit weer spieël die doelwitte van die distriksontwikkelingsmodel (dom) wat in 2019 geloods is.
tgt: this mirrors the aspirations of the district development model (ddm), which was launched in 2019. traditional leaders are well positioned to ensure that district plans are informed by and respond to the real needs of communities and that they reflect the lived reality in rural areas.

src: tradisonele leiers is goed geplaas om te verseker dat distriksplanne ingelig word deur en ook spreek tot die ware behoeftes van ge meenskappe en dat hulle die lewensrealiteite in landelike gebiede getrou weerspieël.
tgt: just as the ddm supports localised programmes that focus on the needs, strengths and opportunities in specific areas, traditional leaders have pioneered their own approach to local economic development.

src: hulle het die investrural masterplan ontwikkel wat laasmaand in die noordwes geloods is.
tgt: they have developed the investrural masterplan, which was launched in north west last month.

src: dit is besonders bemoedigend dat tradisio nele leiers hul gewig agter dié plan gooi en saam met plaas like owerhede wil werk om die plan se sukses te verseker.
tgt: it is greatly encouraging that traditional leaders have rallied behind the plan and want to work with local authorities to ensure it is a success.

src: daar is tydens die debat in die nasionale huis van tradisionele leiers voor gestel dat een van die die vernaamste suksesfaktore van die investruralprogram sou behels dat tradisionele strukture opgelei, versterk en bevoeg gemaak word.
tgt: during the debate in the national house of traditional leaders it was proposed that a major success factor for the investrural programme is that traditional structures are trained, strengthened and capacitated.

src: van die deelnemers aan die debat het ekonomiese planne voorgelê wat reeds in gevorderde stadiums van ontwikkeling is.
tgt: a number of participants outlined economic plans that are already in advanced stages of development.

src: dié planne behels onder meer landbou projekte, bioprospektering en hernubare energie.
tgt: these range from agricultural projects to bioprospecting to renewable energy.

src: dit was ooglopend dat die tradisionele leierskap begryp dat professionalisering nood saaklik is vir landelike besig hede soos klein, mediumen makroondernemings asook koöperasies om deel van die hoofstroomekonomie te word.
tgt: what was evident is that the institution of traditional leadership understands that professionalisation is necessary for rural businesses in the form of small, medium and micro enterprises and cooperatives to become part of the mainstream economy.

src: die tradisionele leiers wat toesprake tydens die debat gelewer het, het hul visie van 'ontwikkelingsheersers' bekend gestel, wat hulself nie net as die bewaarders van erfenis beskou nie, maar ook as drywers van ekonomiese vooruitgang en sukses.
tgt: the traditional leaders who spoke presented their vision of ‘developmental monarchs’, who see themselves as not just custodians of heritage but also as drivers of economic prosperity and progress.

src: hulle het verskeie projekte en eko nomiese geleenthede geïden tifiseer wat werkskepping en die lewensgehalte in lande like gebiede sal bevorder.
tgt: they have identified several projects and economic opportunities that will create jobs and improve livelihoods in rural areas.

src: tradisionele leiers het ook hul gewilligheid uitgespreek om n aktiewe rol in die grond hervormingsproses te speel.
tgt: traditional leaders have also expressed their willingness to play an active part in the land reform process.

src: tradisionele leiers het sedert 2018 ongeveer 1 500 000 hektaar gemeenskaplike grond beskikbaar gestel vir ontwikkeling en daar word gehoop dat dit in die toekoms nog meer sal word.
tgt: since 2018, traditional leaders have made around 1 500 000 hectares of communal land available for development, and it is hoped this will increase in future.

src: ons het, ten einde n geko ördineerde en volhoubare strategie te ontwikkel, oor eengekom om in die ko mende jaar n presidensiële spitsberaad oor grond te hou.
tgt: to develop a coordinated and sustainable strategy, we have agreed to hold a presidential land summit in the next year.

src: dié spitsberaad sal dringende kwessies rakende grond hervorming en die impak daarvan op gemeenskaplike grond — waarvan groot dele in landelike omgewings geleë is — bespreek.
tgt: this will discuss pressing issues around land reform and its impact on communal land, much of which is located in rural areas.

src: die stemming van die debat in die nasionale huis was n gepaste weerspieëling van n klimaat waarin ekono miese herstel bo aan die lys is.
tgt: the tone of the debate in the national house was a fitting reflection of a climate in which economic recovery is foremost among our considerations.

src: dit was terselfdertyd n belowende teken dat tradi sionele leiers hul waardering van hul rol as deel van die nasionale herstelpoging toon deur proaktief en innoverend te wees.
tgt: at the same time it was a promising signal that traditional leaders appreciate their role in being part of the national recovery effort through being proactive and innovative.

src: die mees gepaste nalaten skap van groot leiers is dat die saadjies van ontwikkeling wat hulle tydens hul bewind saai, uiteindelik groei tot groot, sterk bome wat hul gemeenskappe veilig hou en koester vir nageslagte daarna.
tgt: the most fitting legacy of great leaders is that the seeds of development they sow during their tenure grow into mighty trees that protect and shelter their communities for posterity.

src: help om lewens te red allison cooper die sonneblom fonds doen n beroep op alle suidafrikaners om die etniese diversiviteit van die organisasie se bloedstamselskenkers databasis n hupstoot te gee en só kinderlewens te red.
tgt: help save lives allison cooper the sunflower fund is calling on south africans to boost the ethnic diversity of its blood stem cell donor database to save children’s lives.

src: volgens palesa mokomele, die sonneblomfonds se hoof van bemarking en kommuni kasie, word daar jaarliks dui sende pasiënte met bloedver wante siektes gediagnoseer.
tgt: according to palesa mokomele, the sunflower fund’s head of marketing and communications, thousands of patients are diagnosed with bloodrelated diseases every year.

src: sulke diagnoses was in die verlede dikwels as n doods vonnis beskou, maar vandag kan bloedstamseloorplan tings as lewensreddende behandeling dien aangesien dit die persoon se defektiewe stamselle met gesonde stam selle vervang.
tgt: in the past, this diagnosis was often fatal.

src: baie pasiënte wie sou kon baat by dié prosedure ont vang ongelukkig nooit die behandeling nie, omdat dit so moeilik is om n gepaste skenker met n soortgelyke weefseltipe te vind.
tgt: today, a blood stem cell transplant can be a potentially lifesaving treatment as it replaces a person’s defective stem cells with healthy ones.

src: "gekleurde pasiënte word benadeel deur die kleiner aan tal geregistreerde skenkers vanuit die swart, gekleurde en indiërbevolkingsgroepe," sê mokomele.
tgt: sadly, many who could benefit from this procedure do not get the treatment they need because finding a donor with a similar tissue type is difficult.

src: n tweede lewenskanszyaan makda (19) se wêreld is deurmekaar gekrap toe sy in 2007 met heterosigotiese he moglobienopatie, n lewens gevaarlike en ongeneesbare bloedsiekte, gediagnoseer is.
tgt: a second chance at lifezyaan makda’s (19) world was turned upside down when she was diagnosed with heterozygote haemoglobinopathy, a lifethreat ening and incurable blood disorder, in 2007. her best chance of survival was a blood stem cell donor, but a match couldn’t be found.

src: sy moes gevolglik elke twee weke n bloedoortapping ondergaan.
tgt: as a result, she had to have blood transfusions every two weeks.

src: "die are in my hande het platgeval en ek moes n port in my bors laat inplant.
tgt: "the veins in my hands collapsed and i had a port put in my chest.

src: ek was die heeltyd vreeslik moeg, my galblaas en galstene moes verwyder word en my skildklier was onderaktief.
tgt: i also experienced constant fatigue, had my gallbladder and gallstones removed and suffered from an underactive thyroid.

src: ek was dikwels om mediese redes afwesig van skool en ek kon nie aan enige sportsoorte deelneem nie.
tgt: i was frequently absent from school for medical reasons and could not take part in sports.

src: dit was moei lik om lang tydperke aaneen in die hospitaal te spandeer," vertel sy.
tgt: spending long periods of time in hospital was difficult," she says.

src: makda se toestand het ook geheueverlies en stuipe ver oorsaak, en sy het drie skool jare gemis.
tgt: makda’s condition also caused memory loss and seizures and she had to take three years off school.

src: sy het, ten spyte van al dié uitdagings, positief gebly.
tgt: despite these challenges, she remained positive.

src: makda het uiteindelik n skenker gevind, maar haar gesondheidsreis was nog ver van verby.
tgt: makda finally found a donor, but her journey to health was far from over.

src: sy moes breinsjirurgie ondergaan om n litteken op haar brein te verwyder.
tgt: she had to have brain surgery to remove a scar on her brain.

src: "dit is nou drie jaar sedert die oorplanting en ek leef n lewe wat ek nooit gedink het moontlik sou wees nie, alles danksy my duitse skenker se asemrowende onbaatsugtig heid en goeie daad.
tgt: "i’m now three years posttransplant and living a life i never thought possible, thanks to my german donor’s amazing act of humanity and kindness."

src: "skep hoop vir iemandnaledi senamela (14) is in mei 2020 met leukemie (bloedkanker) gediagnoseer.
tgt: be someone’s hopenaledi senamela (14) was diagnosed with leukaemia (blood cancer) in may 2020. she joins countless patients who need a matching donor.

src: "ek kan sedert my diag nose nie meer goed presteer in my skoolwerk nie.
tgt: "since my diagnosis, i cannot perform well at school.

src: ek kan nie aan sport deelneem of die dinge doen wat ek voorheen geniet het nie," sê senamela, wat daarvan droom om eendag n doktor te word.
tgt: i can’t play sport or do the things i used to enjoy," says senamela, who dreams of becoming a doctor.

src: gewillige skenkers tussen die ouderdom van 18 en 55 kan senamela en baie ander mense wat skenkers benodig, help deur op die sonneblomfonds se web werf te registreer.
tgt: willing donors between the ages of 18 and 55 can assist senamela and many others in need of a donor by registering on the sunflower fund’s website.

src: dit neem n paar minute en verg n eenvoudige wattepluisie.
tgt: all it takes is a simple cotton swab and a few minutes of your time.

src: versoek n depperstel by die sonneblomfonds deur www.
tgt: request a swab kit from the sunflower fund by visiting www.

src: godsdienstige gemeenskap is onontbeerlik in die stryd teen kovid19 vukuzenzele unnamed baie suidafrikaners het onlangs saam met mense regoor die wêreld belangrike ge wyde feeste gevier.
tgt: religious community vital in the fight against covid19 vukuzenzele unnamed recently many south africans of faith have joined others across the world in important religious observances.

src: lede van die joodse geloof het pesach eerbiedig, chris tene vier paasfees en mos lems sal binnekort die hei lige maand van ramadan onderhou.
tgt: members of the jewish faith celebrated pesach, chris tians observed easter and muslims will soon be observing the holy month of ramadan.

src: vir die tweede agtereen volgende jaar word hierdie geleenthede gevier te midde van ’n vernietigende wêreld wye pandemie wat reeds die lewens van 2.5 miljoen mense regoor die wêreld geëis het.
tgt: for the second year, these occasions have been marked in the midst of a devastating global pandemic that has cost the lives of more than 2.5 million people across the world.

src: geloofsgebaseerde orga nisasies was sover onont beerlik in ons nasionale reaksie tot die siekte, nie net deur geestelike vertroosting en leiding te bied nie, maar ook deur te sorg vir diégene wat die kwesbaarste is vir die nagevolge van die pandemie, onder meer deur die verskaf fing van kos, huisvesting en ander maatskaplike dienste.
tgt: faithbased organisations have been vital to our national response to the disease, not only providing spiritual comfort and guidance, but also by caring for those most vulnerable to the effects of the pandemic, including through the provision of food, shelter and other social services.

src: geloof speel ’n belangrike rol in die lewens van mil joene suidafrikaners, en gesamentlike aanbidding as ’n geloofsgemeenskap speel ’n onontbeerlike rol in hulle godsdienstige uitlewing.
tgt: religion plays an important role in the lives of millions of south africans, and congregational worship forms a vital part of their religious practice.

src: om as ’n geloofsgemeens kap te kan vergader, is ook ’n welkome blaaskans te midde ’n tydperk van erge swaarkry vir individue, gesinne en ge meenskappe.
tgt: being able to gather for religious services is also a welcome respite from a period of great hardship for individuals, families and communities.

src: dit is te verstane dat na meer as ’n jaar van gebuk gaan onder beperkings op godsdienstige saamtrekke, die godsdienstige gemeens kap uitsien na ’n teken van normaliteit.
tgt: it is understandable that after more than a year of labouring under restrictions on religious gatherings that the faith community are keen for a return to a semblance of normality.

src: ter erkenning van die belangrikheid van gemeens kaplike aanbidding vir ons mense het die regering met die geloofsgemeenskap in gesprek getree.
tgt: in recognition of the importance of congregational worship to the lives of our people, government has been engaging with the faith community.

src: leiers van die geloofsge meenskap begryp en voorsien die gevaar van ’n nuwe vlaag van kovid19infeksies.
tgt: leaders of the faith community understand and appreciate the very real danger of a new wave of covid19 infections.

src: sedert die uitbreek van die pandemie het godsdienstige leiers proaktiewe en posi tiewe maatreëls in plek gestel om die verspreiding van die siekte onder aanbidders te beperk.
tgt: since the outbreak of the pandemic, religious organisations have taken proactive and positive measures to limit the spread of the disease among worshippers.

src: nog ’n belangrike faktor is dat godsdienstige orga nisasies wesenlike verliese tydens die onderskeie inper kingsvlakke gely het, wat gevolglik hul volhoubaar heid bedreig.
tgt: another important factor is that during the various alert levels, religious organisations have incurred substantial financial losses that threaten their sustainability.

src: as regering bly ons daartoe verbind om saam met die geloofsgemeenskap te werk om werkbare oplos sings te vind.
