tgt: as government we remain committed to working with the faith community to find workable solutions.

src: terselfdertyd moet openba re gesondheid en veiligheid ons belangrikste oorweging bly.
tgt: at the same time, public health and safety must be our paramount consideration.

src: die geloofsgemeenskap het ondernemingsgees en inisiatief in hul aanbidding getoon in ’n tyd wat daar groot onsekerheid oor die gang van die pandemie was.
tgt: the religious community has shown innovation and initiative in the holding of worship at a time when there was a great deal of uncertainty over the trajectory of the pandemic.

src: byeenkomste is aanlyn ge hou en aanbidders is aange moedig om tuis te bid eerder as om dienste by te woon.
tgt: congregational services were held online and worshippers were encouraged to pray in their homes instead of attending services.

src: dit het baie bygedra tot die nasionale poging om die verspreiding van die virus te bekamp.
tgt: this greatly aided the national effort to contain the spread of the disease.

src: godsdienstige leiers speel ’n deurslaggewende rol daarin om die publiek aan te moedig om gesondheids maatreëls rakende belangrike gebruike en kulturele rituele, soos begrafnisse, na te kom.
tgt: religious leaders played a pivotal role in encouraging public adherence to health measures around important customary and cultural rituals like burials.

src: net so het ons mense ook hul verbintenis getoon om openbare gesondheidsmaat reëls en sosiale afstand te handhaaf.
tgt: by equal measure, our people have demonstrated their commitment to adhering to public health protocols and to social distancing.

src: hulle verstaan ook dat hulle moet voortgaan om groot skares te vermy.
tgt: and they correctly appreciate that they must continue to avoid large gatherings .

src: ons is nou in ’n tyd waar voorsorg belangriker as ooit is.
tgt: we are now at a time where precaution is needed above all.

src: die koronaviruspande mie is nog nie uitgewis nie, hetsy in ons eie land of in die wêreld.
tgt: the coronavirus pandemic has not been eliminated, either in our own country or around the world.

src: die gevaar van ’n derde vlaag is ’n werklikheid.
tgt: the threat of a third wave is real and everpresent.

src: internasionale ondervin ding het ons geleer dat ons nie die noodlot moet tart nie.
tgt: international experience has taught us that we should not tempt fate.

src: baie lande het hulle maatreëls, verslap, net om daarna weer ’n skerp toe name in infeksies te ervaar, wat dan die instelling van selfs strenger beperkings noodsaak.
tgt: many countries have eased restrictions, only for there to be resurgences, necessitating the imposition of even harsher restrictions.

src: groot byeenkomste, hetsy godsdienstig of andersins, het die potensiaal om die virus te versprei ongeag die toepassing van maatreëls oor sosiale afstand en ontsmet ting.
tgt: large gatherings, whether religious or otherwise, have the potential to spread the virus, despite the application of measures around social distancing and sanitising.

src: miljoene suidafrikaners onderhou deurlopend steeds ’n belangrike beginsel van hul geloof.
tgt: millions of south africans have been observing an important tenet of their faith.

src: in ’n land wat die reg tot godsdiensvry heid verskans, moet alles moontlik gedoen word om ons mense te ondersteun in die uitoefening van hierdie reg.
tgt: in a country that enshrines the right to religious freedom, all effort must be made to support our people in the exercise of this right.

src: en in die uitoefening van hierdie reg moet ons seker maak dat ons nie die regte of lewens van ander op die spel plaas nie.
tgt: and in exercising this right, we need to make sure that we do not place the rights or the lives of others at risk.

src: dit is ’n beginsel wat die godsdienstige leiers met wie ek gepraat het, ten volle begryp en ondersteun.
tgt: this is a principle that the religious leaders i met with fully support and appreciate.

src: hulle verstaan die verantwoorde likheid van alle gelowiges – inderdaad van alle suidafrikaners – om die praktiese maatreëls wat in plek gestel is om mense se gesondheid te beskerm en lewens te red, na te kom.
tgt: they understand the responsibility of all people of faith – indeed of all south africans – to observe the practical measures put in place to protect people’s health and save lives.

src: pluimveemeesterplanpluimveeplan ’n meesterhou vir plaaslike boere vukuzenzele unnamed suidafrika se hoenderen eierbedryf vlieg hoog danksy die pluimveemeesterplan.
tgt: poultry master planpoultry plan amasterstrokefor local farmers vukuzenzele unnamed south africa’s chicken and egg industry is soaring thanks to the poultry master plan.

src: toe beverly mhla bane winkel toe is om eiers te koop, het sy nie geweet dat teen die tyd wat sy terug sou wees, ’n plan vir haar eie klein suksesvolle besig heid in haar agterkop sou broei nie.
tgt: when beverly mhlabane took a trip to the shop to buy eggs, little did she know by the time she returned home an idea would be hatched for her own successful business.

src: "ek is eendag winkel toe om eiers te koop en sien toe die eiers is baie duur.
tgt: "one day i went to the shop to buy eggs and found the eggs to be very expensive so i decided to buy 10 egglaying chickens so we could get eggs for the house," she says.

src: ’n hen lê elke 26 uur ’n eier, wat beteken dat mhlabane ’n gemiddelde van agt of nege eiers elke dag kon kry.
tgt: a chicken lays an egg every 26 hours, which meant that mhlabane would get an average of eight or nine eggs a day.

src: twee maande later het sy begin om die eiers aan haar bure te verkoop.
tgt: two months later, she started selling the eggs to neighbours.

src: dit het daartoe gelei dat sy haar motorhuis in ’n hoenderbat terystelsel omskep het.
tgt: this led to her converting her home garage into a chicken battery house.

src: sy het op daardie stadium ook ’n groentetuin in haar agter plaas gehad.
tgt: at the time she also had a backyard vegetable garden.

src: mhlabane, wat voorheen ’n ingenieur was, het altyd beplan om die korporatiewe wêreld te verlaat en haar eie eiendomsagentskap te begin.
tgt: mhlabane, a former engineer, always had plans to leave the corporate world to start her own property business.

src: in 2014, nie lank nadat sy die hoenders aangeskaf het, het sy twee hektaar grond in benoni, gauteng, gekoop met die bedoeling om woon stelle daar te bou.
tgt: in 2014, a while after acquiring her chickens, she bought two hectares of land in benoni, gauteng, with the intention to build apartments.

src: sy kon egter nie voortgaan met haar plan nie, aangesien die grond geoormerk was vir landboudoeleindes.
tgt: however, she couldn’t go through with her plan because the land was demarcated for agricultural use.

src: sy het toe liewer besluit om haar klein boerderyonderneming uit te brei.
tgt: she decided to expand her small farming enterprise instead.

src: lang proses’n gebrek aan infrastruktuur soos heinings, watertenks en elektrisiteit het egter beteken dat sy eers in 2016 die grond kon begin gebruik.
tgt: long processa lack of infrastructure such as fencing, water tanks and electricity meant she only started using the land in 2016. the 49yearold remembers how she used search engine google to conduct research on farming.

src: die 49ja rige onthou hoe sy navorsing oor die boerderybedryf op google gedoen het.
tgt: her baby steps paid off and today, she is the proud owner of zapa farm, a successful commercial agricultural enterprise.

src: sy het van krag tot krag gegaan en waar sy aanvank lik haar twee hektaar grond gebruik het om haar eierpro duksie te verhoog en spina sie, krulkool, groen soet rissie en tamaties te kweek, wat sy plaaslik verkoop het, het sy vandag twee groen tetonnels waar 1.5 hektaar verbou word en lêhuise met ’n kapasiteit van 5 000 en 2 000 lêhoenders.
tgt: she progressed from using her two hectares of land to increase her egg production and grow spinach, kale, green pepper and tomatoes, which she sold locally, to eventually installing two vegetable tunnels, cultivating 1.5 hectares and building 5 000and 2 000capacity layer houses.

src: die plaas lewer produkte aan onder meer vier wimpyrestourante, pick n pay, ’n holiday innhotel en plaas like spazawinkels.
tgt: the farm supplies four wimpy restaurants, pick n pay, a holiday inn hotel and local spaza shops, among others.

src: "ons ervaar egter ’n tekort aangesien ons aanvraag ons aanbod oorskrei.
tgt: "however, we have a shortage as our demand exceeds our capacity and, as a result, we source eggs from other local producers.

src: ons het ’n goedgekeurde omgewingsimpakasses sering vir 120 000 lêhenne en het dus kapitaal vir die uitbreiding nodig," sê sy.
tgt: we have an approved environmental impact assessment for 120 000 layers and therefore need capital for the expansion," she says.

src: pluimveemeester planmhlabane het hulp gehad om ’n suksesvolle boer te word.
tgt: poultry master planmhlabane had help in becom ing a successful farmer.

src: sy is een van die talle opkomende boere wat voor deel trek uit die pluimvee meesterplan wat ontwikkel is deur die regering en be langhebbendes in die bedryf, insluitend pluimveeprodu sente, boere, verwerkers, uitvoerders, invoerders en georganiseerde arbeid.
tgt: she is one of the many emerging farmers benefitting from the poultry master plan, which was developed by government and industry stake holders, including poultry producers, farmers, processors, exporters, importers and organised labour.

src: die plan, wat in 2019 on derteken is, is daarop gemik om werk in die bedryf te skep deur ’n aantal maatreëls toe pas wat oor die volgende paar jaar bekendgestel sal word.
tgt: signed in 2019, the plan aims to grow jobs in the industry through a number of measures that will be introduced over the next few years.

src: as ’n uitvloeisel van hierdie plan het die suidafrikaanse pluimveevereniging (sapa) vir mhlabane se waterge bruiklisensie betaal en haar van opleiding oor eierpro duksie voorsien.
tgt: it was as a result of the plan that the south african poultry association (sapa) paid for mhlabane’s water use licence and provided her with egg production training.

src: steun vir boeresapa se algemene bestuur der, izaak breitenbach, sê die bedryf het miljoene belê in die ondersteuning van swart boere en die uitbreiding van pluimveeproduksie met 5%.
tgt: support for farmerssapa general manager izaak breitenbach says the industry has invested millions into supporting black farmers and growing poultry production by 5%.

src: in slegs 12 maande is 13 swart boere in produksie ge vestig en 960 werksgeleent hede geskep.
tgt: in just 12 months, 13 black contract grower farmers were established and 960 jobs were created.

src: "die bedryf het r870 mil joen belê om markte vir 50 swart kontrakprodusente te skep en om uitvoere te fasi liteer om plaaslike werksge leenthede te skep.
tgt: "the industry has invested r870 million to create markets for 50 black contract growers and to facilitate exports to create local jobs.

src: die bedryf het ook betaal vir besigheid studies vir 19 swart boere wat in ’n program van die departement van landbou, grondhervorming en lande like ontwikkeling opgeneem is," sê hy.
tgt: the industry has also done and paid for business studies for 19 black farmers who are in a programme with the department of agriculture, land reform and rural development," he says.

src: veertig onafhanklike swart boere word ook voorsien van pluimveeverwante raad en opleiding.
tgt: forty independent black farmers are also being given poultryrelated advice and training.

src: durbanhawe skep 'n see vir sa van geleenthede vukuzenzele unnamed ek het onlangs die durbanhawe be soek om te gaan kyk na die werk wat verrig word om die hawe meer doeltreffend en mededin gend te maak.
tgt: port of durban creates a sea of opportunities for sa vukuzenzele unnamed recently, i visit ed the port of durban to see for myself the work being done to make the port more efficient and competitive.

src: ek het, na n inligtingsessie met transnet se senior be stuur, per sleepboot deur die hawe getoer.
tgt: after a briefing with the senior management of transnet, i toured the harbour in a pilot boat, which is usually used to guide large ships through the entrance channel to the pier.

src: sleepbote word gewoonlik gebruik om groot skepe deur die ingangskanaal na die dokke te begelei.
tgt: seeing the workings of the port from the water, one is reminded of its vast scale and complexity.

src: as die hawe nie doeltreffend funksioneer nie, lei die hele ekonomie daaronder — van invoerders en uitvoerders tot verbruikers.
tgt: if the port does not function efficiently, the entire economy suffers, from importers and exporters to consumers.

src: aan die ander kant, as die hawe doeltreffend funksioneer kan dit ekonomiese groei dryf en ons ekonomie posisioneer as n poort tot die streek en ook die kontinent.
tgt: on the other hand, if the port works well it can drive economic growth and position our country as a gateway to the region and the continent.

src: toe ek in oktober 2019 durban besoek het, het baie plaaslike besighede en gebruikers van die hawe hul besorgdheid oor die werksver rigting van die durbanhawe met my gedeel.
tgt: when i visited durban in october 2019, many local businesses and port users raised concerns with me about the performance of the durban port.

src: skeepsmaatskappye, in besonder, het hul kommer uitgespreek oor verkeersop eenhopings met betrekking tot vervoertrokke en wagtye, vertragings in ankerlegging en verankering, swak in standhouding van toerusting en algemene lae produktiwiteit in die hawe.
tgt: shipping companies, in particular, expressed concern about truck congestion and waiting times, ship berthing delays and anchorage times, poor maintenance of equipment and generally low productivity in the port.

src: my onlangse besoek aan die hawe was om te gaan kyk of die verbintenisse wat na aanleiding van dié kwessies aangegaan is, wel geïmple menteer is.
tgt: my recent visit to the port was to check whether the commitments made in response to these concerns had been implemented.

src: daar is werklik oor die afge lope jaar groot vordering ge maak om die werksverrigting van die hawe om te swaai, ten spyte van kovid19 se impak.
tgt: there has indeed been great progress over the past year in turning around the performance of the port, despite the impact of covid19.

src: dié harde werk toon reeds resultate in die verbeterde in standhouding van toerusting, verminderde verkeersopeen hopings, korter omkeertye en meer gebruik van spoorver voer eerder as padvervoer.
tgt: these efforts are already showing results in improved maintenance of equipment, reduced congestion, quicker turnaround times and increased use of rail instead of road transport.

src: dié vordering is belangrik, maar daar is nog baie werk wat gedoen sal moet word om durban as n wêreldklashawe en middelpunt in die suidelike halfrond te posisioneer.
tgt: while this is important progress, there is still much work to be done to position durban as a worldclass port and as a hub port for the southern hemisphere.

src: die hawe het oor die afge lope paar jaar van sy posisie as die nommer een hawe in afrika tot nommer drie gedaal; na tangier in morokko en port said in egipte.
tgt: in recent years, the port has slipped from its position as first in africa to third, behind tangier in morocco and port said in egypt.

src: so ook het die betroubaarheid van skeepsladingtoerusting tot 80% verbeter en is dit vinnig oppad na minstens 95% om internasionale standaarde te haal.
tgt: similarly, the reliability of cargo handling equipment has improved to 80% and is heading towards at least 95% to meet international benchmarks.

src: skeepswagtye het tot in drukwekkende vlakke gedaal.
tgt: ship waiting times have reduced to impressive levels.

src: dié statistieke mag dalk teg nies en duister voorkom, maar dit het n direkte invloed op ons ekonomiese groei en op die pryse wat ons as verbruikers betaal.
tgt: these statistics may seem technical and obscure, but they have a direct impact on the growth of our economy and on the prices we pay as consumers.

src: ons het die verbetering van die doeltreffendheid van ons hawens as deel van operasie vulindlela n prioriteit gemaak en fokus daarop om trans net, een van ons waardevolle staatsbeheerde onderne mings, te herbou.
tgt: we have made improving the efficiency of our ports a priority of operation vulindlela and have focused on rebuilding transnet, which is one of our valued stateowned enterprises.

src: transnet se nuwe bestuur en hul bedryfsafdelings is spits gefokus op die omkeer van die hawe se werksverrigting.
tgt: the new management of transnet and its operating divisions are resolutely focused on turning the performance of the port around.

src: die bestuur het ambisieuse en opwindende planne vir die uitbreiding vir al vyf van die hawe se pole.
tgt: the management has ambitious and exciting expansion plans for all five of the port’s precincts.

src: dit sluit in die verdieping van die maydonkaai om groter, meer moderne skepe in staat te stel om die hawe binne te vaar, die invulling van pier 1 en pier 2 om ekstra kapasiteit te skep vir houers, en die ontwikkeling van n nuwe hou erterminaal in die pointpool.
tgt: these include the deepening of the maydon wharf channel to allow larger, modern vessels to enter the port, the infill of pier 1 and pier 2 to create additional capacity for con tainers and the development of a new container terminal in the point precinct.

src: die uitbreiding van die hawe sal altesaam r100 miljard in nuwe beleggings oor die volgende dekade en langer benodig.
tgt: altogether, the expansion of infrastructure at the port will require r100 billion in new investment over the next decade and more.

src: dit gaan die hawe heeltemal van gedaante laat verwissel en sy kapasiteit vir die hantering van skeepshou ers verhoog van 2.9 miljoen eenhede tot meer as 11 mil joen eenhede.
tgt: this will completely transform the port, expanding its capacity for container handling from 2.9 million units to more than 11 million units.

src: dié ambisieuse planne gaan groter deelname en belegging van die privaatsektor vereis.
tgt: these ambitious plans will require greater private sector participation and investment.

src: transnet, waaronder die durbanhawe, is n belangrike nasionale bate wat aan die mense van suidafrika be hoort.
tgt: transnet, including the durban port, is an important national asset belonging to the people of south africa.

src: vennootskappe met die pri vaatsektor is noodsaaklik om nuwe beleggings, tegnologie en kundigheid tot hawebedry wighede by te dra en om die toerusting en infrastruktuur te moderniseer.
tgt: partnerships with the private sector are crucial to bring new investment, technology and expertise to port operations and to modernise equipment and infrastructure.

src: transnet beplan byvoorbeeld om later vanjaar n konsessie te adverteer om die nuwe pointterminaal te bou en te bestuur.
tgt: transnet is planning, for example, to advertise a concession later this year to build and operate the new point terminal.

src: dit sal privaatbeleg gings lok en die doeltreffend heid van die hantering van skeepshouers verbeter.
tgt: this will bring in private investment and improve the efficiency of container handling.

src: ons is, deur middel van ons herbouproses, besig om stel selmatig die doeltreffendheid van ons hawens en spoorweë te verbeter en reuse belegging in infrastruktuur te ontsluit.
tgt: through our reform process we are steadily improving the efficiency of our ports and railways and unlocking massive investment in infrastructure.

src: dit sal nie net kostes verlaag en die mededingendheid van ons uitvoere verbeter nie, maar ook in die proses duisende werksgeleenthede skep.
tgt: this will not only lower costs and improve the competitiveness of our exports, but will create thousands of new jobs in the process.

src: durbanhawe sal, danksy bedryfsverbeteringe en struk tuurhervorming, weer sy plek as die toppresterende hawe in afrika kan inneem.
tgt: through both operational improvements and structural reforms, durban port will reclaim its place as the bestperforming port in africa.

src: ons sal, as deel van ons herbouen herstelplan, voort gaan om onvermoeid te werk om ons infrastruktuur uit te brei en ons netwerkbedryfsektore te hervorm.
tgt: as part of our reconstruction and recove ry plan, we will continue to work tirelessly to expand infrastructure investment and transform our network industries.

src: as my besoek aan durban my een ding laat besef het, is dit dat ons as suidafrikaners in staat is om projekte van reu se belang en skaal suksesvol uit te voer.
tgt: if my visit to durban left one thing in my mind, it is that we south africans are capable of succeeding in projects of vast importance and scale.

src: ons ambisies behoort die hoogtes van ons uitdagings te ewenaar.
tgt: our ambitions should match the size of our challenges.

src: ons bedank ons verpleërs allison cooper die land se verpleeg kundiges, saam met ander me diese personeel, waag hul lewens om ander tydens die koronavirussiekte pandemie ( kovid19) te help.
tgt: thanking our nurses allison cooper the country’s nurses, along with other medical staff, have put their lives on the line to help others during the coronavirus disease (cov id19) pandemic.

src: internasionale verpleeg sterdag, op 12 mei, is n geleentheid om ver pleegsters vir hul diens aan ander te vereer.
tgt: international nurses day, which is on 12 may, is an opportunity to celebrate nurses for their service to others.

src: professionele verpleër, luyanda ganuganu (25), van groote schuur hospi taal in die weskaap, sê die dag is ook n gelee ntheid vir verpleeg kundiges om voort te gaan om die helder lig van hul beroep te laat aanhou skyn.
tgt: professional nurse luyanda ganuganu (25), from groote schuur hospital in the western cape, says the day is also an opportunity for nurses to continue to shine the bright light of their profession.

src: "dit is n geleentheid vir verpleegkundiges om erken te word, maar ons moet ook voortgaan om gehaltesorg te bied, veral tydens die pandemie," sê hy.
tgt: "it’s an opportunity for nurses to be recognised, but we must continue to provide quality care, especially during the pandemic," he says.

src: ganuganu was gedu rende die pandemie se eerste en tweede golf in die voorste linie en het in die hospitaal se hoësorgkovid19 saal gewerk.
tgt: ganuganu was on the frontline during the pandemic’s first and second wave, working at the hospital’s high care covid19 ward.

src: "die beste deel was die ervaring wat ek opge doen het terwyl ek met pasiënte gewerk het, maar die ergste deel was al die sterftes wat in die saal voorgekom het.
tgt: "the best part was the experience gained while working with patients, but the worst part was all the deaths that took place in the ward.

src: dit was op emosionele vlak nie maklik nie.
tgt: emotionally, that was not easy.

src: "ganuganu, wat die afgelope twee jaar reeds n professionele ver pleër is, het dié beroep gekies omdat hy lief is daarvoor om mense te help.
tgt: "ganuganu, who has been a professional nurse for the past two years, chose the profession because he loves helping people.

src: "ek het in n landelike gebied in die ooskaap grootgeword en kon sien hoe mense sukkel weens n gebrek aan kli nieke met verpleeg sorg.
tgt: "i grew up in a rural area in the eastern cape and could see how people struggled due to a lack of clinics with nursing care.

src: dit het gelei tot my passie om n ver skil te wil maak," sê hy.
tgt: this developed my passion for wanting to make a difference," he says.

src: ganuganu moes gedure nde die pandemie leer om onder druk te werk.
tgt: during the pandemic, ganuganu has had to learn to work under pressure.

src: "besluite moet baie vinnig geneem word en jy moet op jou voete kan dink.
tgt: "decisions have to be made quickly and you have to think on your feet.

src: ek het ook geleer om met pasiënte te kommunikeer," voeg hy by.
tgt: i also learnt how to communicate with patients," he adds.

src: ganuganu het dit bit ter moeilik gevind om gedurende die tweede golf werk toe te gaan.
tgt: ganuganu found it very difficult to go to work during the second wave.

src: alhoe wel hy ander mense wou help, het hy ook vir sy eie familie se gesond heid gevrees.
tgt: while he wanted to help others, he also feared for his own family.

src: "ek is in desember 2020 getroud en my vrou is swanger.
tgt: "i got married in december 2020 and my wife is pregnant.

src: ek het heel wat swanger vroue in die kovid19 saal sien sterf.
tgt: i have seen a lot of pregnant women die in the covid19 ward.

src: ek moes selfs nog versig tiger as voorheen wees om dat ek nie my vrou se lewe in gevaar wou stel nie," sê hy.
tgt: i had to be even more careful because i did not want to put my wife’s life in danger," he says.

src: ganuganu is dank baar teenoor sy bestuur ders en kollegas.
tgt: ganuganu is grateful to his managers and colleagues.

src: "ek wil hulle be dank vir hul onder steuning en omdat hulle my die geleentheid ge bied het om as n ver pleër te groei.
tgt: "i want to thank them for their support and for giving me the opportunity to grow as a nurse.

src: dit is n ongelooflike ervaring om saam met kollegas te werk wat jonger per soneel ondersteun.
tgt: it’s an awesome experience to work with colleagues who support younger staff.

src: "sy boodskap aan die gemeenskap is om ver pleërs te help deur verant woordelik op te tree.
tgt: "his message to the community is to help nurses by being responsible.

src: "help ons om julle te help.
tgt: "help us to help you.

src: almal weet wat gedurende kovid19 van hulle verwag word.
tgt: everyone knows what is expected of them during covid19.

src: hou asseblief aan om al die riglyne en protokolle te volg," sê ganuganu.
tgt: please continue to follow all the guidelines and protocols," says ganuganu.

src: robuuste media nou belangriker as ooit tevore vukuzenzele unnamed ons woon in ‘n land waar nie net joer naliste nie, maar enige lid van die publiek hulle sienings, menings en inderdaad ook hulle onte vredenheid vrylik mag uit spreek – sonder vrees vir vergelding.
tgt: robust media more critical than ever vukuzenzele unnamed we live in a country where not just journalists but any member of the public is able to freely articulate their views, their opinions and indeed their dissatisfaction without fear of retribution.

src: ons het ‘n lang pad gestap sedert die dae waar sosiale verset deur kunstenaars met inperkingsbevele begroet is, en kritiese verslaggewing deur joernaliste die risiko geloop het van inhegtenisne ming of die sluiting van die betrokke publikasies.
tgt: we have come a long way from the days where social protest by artists attracted banning orders, and critical reporting by journalists risked imprisonment or the closure of publications.

src: die organisasie verslag gewers sonder grense (rsf) het onlangs die 2021wêreld persvryheidsindeks gepubli seer, ‘n barometer van die toestand van mediavryheid regoor die wêreld.
tgt: recently, the organisation reporters without borders published the 2021 world press freedom index, a barometer of the state of media freedom across the globe.

src: oor die algemeen het dit bevind dat daar ‘n afname in openbare toegang tot in ligting was en ‘n toename in struikelblokke tot nuusdek king in ‘n aantal lande.
tgt: overall, it was found that there has been a decline in public access to information and an increase in obstacles to news coverage in a number of countries.

src: die verslag het gesê dat joer naliste "heeltemal geblok keer of ernstig aan bande gelê word" in 73 lande en onder "streng voorwaardes werk" in 59 ander lande.
tgt: the report said that journalism is "totally blocked or seriously impeded" in 73 countries and "constrained" in 59 others.

src: wat kommerwekkend is, is dat mediavryheid agter uitgegaan het tydens die covid19pandemie, waar die onderskeie beperkinge wat ingestel is skynbaar gebruik is om mediavryheid in verskeie plekke in te perk.
tgt: what is worrying is that media freedom has deteriorated under the covid19 pandemic, with the various restrictions put in place having seemingly been used to curtail media activity in several places.

src: in hierdie jongste verslag lê suidafrika 32ste uit 180 lande op die ranglys.
tgt: in this latest report south africa ranked 32nd out of 180 countries.

src: die indeks beskryf die stand van mediavryheid in suidafrika as "gewaarborg maar broos."
tgt: the index describes the state of media freedom in south africa as "guaranteed but fragile".

src: dit dui aan dat alhoewel die suidafrikaanse grond wet vryheid beskerm en ons ‘n gevestigde kultuur van ondersoekende joernalistiek het, daar ‘n aantal struikel blokke is wat joernaliste nog steeds in die uitvoering van hulle pligte dwarsboom.
tgt: it notes that while the south african constitution protects freedom and we have an established culture of investigative journalism, a number of impediments still hinder journalists in the performance of their duties.

src: dit sluit in wetlike beper kinge op die neem van foto’s van nasionale sleutelpunte, of verslaggewing oor sake met betrekking tot staatsvei ligheid.
tgt: this includes legal injunctions against taking images of national key points or reporting on matters involving state security.

src: die verslag wys ook op ‘n toename gedurende 2020 in die intimidasie van joernalis te, veral vroulike joernaliste, op sosiale media.
tgt: the report also notes an increase during 2020 of the intimidation of journalists, especially female journalists on social media.

src: sodanige intimidasie is totaal onaanvaarbaar, maar is veral skadelik wanneer dit op vroulike joernaliste gemik is, en gaan dikwels gepaard met dreigemente van seksuele geweld.
tgt: such intimidation is totally unacceptable, but is particularly harmful when it is directed at female journalists and is occasionally accompanied by threats of sexual violence.

src: dit is uiters kommerwekkend en kan nie toegelaat word.
tgt: this is a matter of great concern and cannot be allowed.

src: terselfdertyd is dit ver troostend om te weet dat ons ‘n vrye, sterk media het wat sonder aansien des persoons kan verslag doen oor diegene aan bewind, oor die dringende maatskaplike kwessies van ons tyd, en wat akkurate, onpartydige inligting aan die publiek kan voorsien.
tgt: at the same time, we take great comfort in the knowledge that we have a free, robust media that is able to report without fear or favour about those in power, about the most pressing social issues of our time, and to provide accurate, impartial information to the public.

src: in ‘n tyd waar ons saam werk om die ekonomie en ons samelewing weer op te bou middein die koronaviruspandemie, is ‘n sterk media belangriker as ooit te vore.
tgt: at a time when we are working together to rebuild our economy and our society in the midst of the coronavirus pandemic, a robust media is more critical than ever.

src: die suidafrikaanse media het ‘n kernrol gespeel in dit wat ons vandag weet oor die ware omvang van staatska ping deur selfsugtige, kor rupte individue en entiteite.
tgt: the south african media has played a pivotal role in uncovering much of what we know today about the true extent of capture of the state by selfserving, corrupt individuals and entities.

src: hulle het voortgegaan met beriggewing, selfs ten spyte van intimidasie, waninlig ting en persoonlike aanvalle.
tgt: they sustained their reporting even in the face of intimidation, disinformation and attacks on their person.

src: korrupsie is geensins die enigste uitdaging wat ons as ‘n land in die gesig staar nie.
tgt: corruption is by no means the only challenge we face as a country.

src: baie suidafrikaners se daaglikse lewens word nog steeds beïnvloed deur armoede, ongelykheid en onderontwikkeling, swak dienslewering en ‘n gebrek aan toegang tot geleenthede.
tgt: the daily lives of many south africans are still affected by poverty, inequality and underdevelopment, poor service delivery and lack of access to opportunities.

src: indien die media getrou wil bly aan sy verantwoor delikheid om demokrasie te ondersteun, moet ons joer naliste voortgaan om sonder aansien des persoons oor die ander kwessies van die dag verslag te doen.
tgt: if the media is to remain true to its responsibility to support democracy, our journalists must continue to report without fear or favour on the other issues of the day.

src: hulle volgehoue verslag gewing moet geslagsgeba seerde geweld, misdaad in ons gemeenskappe en sosiale euwels soos middelmisbruik insluit.
tgt: their sustained coverage must include genderbased violence, crime in our communities and social ills like substance abuse.

src: ons media moet akkurate en onpartydige inligting ver skaf wat die publiek in staat stel om ingeligte besluite te neem, geleenthede te benut en hulle lewens te verbeter.
tgt: our media should provide accurate and impartial information, enabling the public to make informed decisions, to access opportunities and to improve their lives.

src: hulle moet voortgaan om joernalistiek te lewer wat ver der strek as hoofopskrifte op voorblaaie en wat bydra tot menslike ontwikkeling.
tgt: they should continue to produce journalism that goes beyond the headlines and front pages and that contributes to human development.

src: hulle behoort oor sowel die goeie as die slegte nuus verslag te doen, oor die vor dering wat ons maak en oor die uitdagings wat ons in die gesig staar.
tgt: they should report both the good news and the bad news, the progress we make and the challenges we face.

src: geloofwaardigheid is die sleutel om vertroue tussen joernaliste en die publiek te behou.
tgt: credibility is key to sustaining trust between journalists and the public.

src: tabakverslawing: jou gesondheid kan in rook opgaan deur kgaogelo letsebe om wêreldgeen tabakdag op 31 mei te vier, gesels vuk’uzenzele met ’n herstellende tabakslaaf oor sy oorwinning oor verslawing.
tgt: tobacco addiction: your health could go up in smoke kgaogelo letsebe to commemorate world no tobacco day on 31 may, vuk’uzenzelechats to a recovering tobacco addict about overcoming his addiction.

src: katlego makhanda van moiletswane in noordwes weet alte goed hoe moeilik dit is om op te hou rook.
tgt: katlego makhanda, from moiletswane in the north west, knows all too well how hard it is to stop smoking.

src: makhanda (28) het meer as 30 sigarette per dag gerook totdat hy vier jaar gelede ophou rook het.
tgt: until he stopped four years ago, makhanda (28) used to smoke over 30 cigarettes a day.

src: hy het weens groepsdruk begin rook toe hy 18 jaar oud was.
tgt: he started smoking when he was 18 as a result of peer pressure.

src: "ek het nie belanggestel om te rook nie – dit het my nie aangetrek nie, totdat ek in matriek was en ‘n groep ouens saam met wie ek ge reeld gekuier het, my begin uitsonder het omdat ek nie koel genoeg was om te rook nie."
tgt: "i was not interested in smoking – it didn’t appeal to me until i was in matric and a group of guys i used to hang out with started picking on me for not being cool enough to smoke."

src: makhanda het aanvanklik een of twee sigarette per dag gerook, maar dit het metter tyd meer geword.
tgt: makhanda initially smoked one or two cigarettes a day, but this increased over time.

src: "ná matriek is ek universi teit toe en die vryheid om nie by my ouers te woon nie, het beteken dat ek soveel alkohol kon drink as wat ek wou.
tgt: "after matric, i went to varsity and the freedom that came with not staying with my parents meant i could drink alcohol as frequently as i wanted.

src: dit het ook gemaak dat ek meer gerook het."
tgt: this increased my rate of smoking."

src: in 2017 het makhanda siek geword en is gehospitaliseer.
tgt: in 2017, makhanda fell ill and was hospitalised.

src: hy is gediagnoseer met tipe 2diabetes en was weke lank te swak om uit die bed te klim.
tgt: he was diagnosed with type 2 diabetes and for weeks was too weak to get out of bed.

src: "die dokter het dit duidelik gemaak dat ek nie my siekte sou kon bestuur as ek aanhou rook nie.
tgt: "the doctor was very specific that managing my illness couldn’t be done if i continued to smoke.

src: dit is toe wat ek besluit het om permanent op te hou.
tgt: that is when i decided to quit for good.

src: "dr midah maluleke van mpumalanga sê rook is ska delik vir byna elke orgaan.
tgt: "dr midah maluleke from mpumalanga says smoking is harmful to nearly every organ.

src: "siektes soos kanker, hart siektes, beroerte, longsiek tes, diabetes en chroniese obstruktiewe pulmonêre siektes kan almal weens rook ontstaan."
tgt: "illnesses such as cancer, heart disease, stroke, lung diseases, diabetes and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease can result from smoking.

src: "navorsing toon dat rokers 30% tot 40% meer geneig is om tipe 2diabetes te ontwik kel as nierokers.
tgt: "research shows that smokers are 30% to 40% more likely to develop type 2 diabetes than nonsmokers.

src: rook maak dit ook moeilik om die siekte te bestuur," sê hy.
tgt: smoking also creates difficulty in managing the disease," he says.

src: wenke om op te hou rookdie kankervereniging van suidafrika (kansa) gee die volgende wenke as jy wil ophou rook: besluit op ‘n datum om op te hou rook en doen dit dan.
tgt: tips to stop smokingthe cancer association of south africa (cansa) offers the following tips if you are trying to stop smoking: decide on a date to stop smoking and then do it.

src: gooi alles weg wat jou aan rook herinner.
tgt: throw away everything that reminds you of smoking.

src: dit sluit sigaretpakkies, as bakke en aanstekers in.
tgt: this includes cigarette packets, ashtrays, lighters.

src: drink baie water – dit sal help om die nikotien uit jou liggaam uit te spoel.
tgt: drink lots of water – it will help flush the nicotine from your body.

src: lig jou familie in dat jy probeer om op te hou rook sodat hulle jou kan ondersteun.
tgt: inform your family and friends that you are trying to stop so that they can support you.

src: jy mag dalk lighoofdig heid, hoofpyn of ‘n ge hoes ervaar as jy ophou rook.
tgt: you may experience some dizziness, headaches or coughing once you have stopped smoking.

src: dit is normaal en behoort na ‘n dag of twee beter te raak, en na 14 dae te verdwyn.
tgt: this is normal and should improve after a day or two and disappear within 14 days.

src: makhanda sê sy pad was nie maklik nie, maar hy is daartoe verbind om nie te rook nie.
tgt: makhanda says his journey hasn’t been easy, but he is committed to not smoking.

src: "die plaaslike kliniek en personeel het my ondersteun en inligting verskaf oor die belangrikheid van ‘n tabak vrye lewe.
tgt: "the local clinic and staff provided me with support and information on the importance of living a tobaccofree life.

src: israel, palestina word gevra om suidafrika na te boots deur vrede na te streef vukuzenzele unnamed ons ervaring van ons land se demokra tiese oorgang is n les oor die mag van em patie, onderhandeling en kompromie.
tgt: israel, palestine urged to emulate sa by pursuing peace vukuzenzele unnamed our experience with the democratic transition is a lesson about the power of empathy, negotiation and compromise.

src: die verergerende situasie in israel en palestina bevestig weereens wat ons as suidafrikaners al te goed weet – dat onversetlike konflik slegs deur vreedsame onder handeling opgelos kan word.
tgt: the escalating situation in israel and palestine affirms once more what we south africans know too well, that intractable conflicts can only be solved through peaceful negotiation.

src: dit demonstreer ook dat tensy die grondoorsake van n konflik aangespreek word – in dié geval, die onwettige okkupasie van palestina deur israel en die weiering van die palestynse mense se reg tot selfbeskikking – vrede en versoening buite bereik sal bly.
tgt: it also demonstrates that unless the root causes of a conflict are addressed, in this case the illegal occupation by israel of palestinian land and the denial of the palestinian people’s right to selfdetermination, there will never be peace.

src: die nuutste geweld is aangewakker deur n israeliese hof se beslissing om in die sheikh jarrahbuurt in oosjerusalem n groep fami lies daar woonagtig te ontset om plek te maak vir israeliese nedersettings.
tgt: the latest violence was sparked by an israeli court decision to evict a group of families from their homes in the sheikh jarrah neighbourhood in east jerusalem to make way for israeli settlements.

src: om te sien hoe mans, vrouens en kinders verwyder word uit die huise waarin hul families vir geslagte lank gewoon het, bring pynlike gedeelde en persoonlike herinneringe na vore vir die meerderheid suidafrikaners – herinneringe van geforseer de verwyderings en grond onteiening.
tgt: the sight of men, women and children being evicted from the homes their families have lived in for generations brings back painful collective and personal memories for the majority of south africans – of forced removals and land dispossession.

src: dit was pyn en vernedering wat my eie familie, en baie suidafrikaanse families, deurgegaan het.
tgt: it was a pain and humiliation faced by my own family, and by many south african families.

src: my gesin is op twee geleenthede geweld dadig na verskillende dele van die land geskuif.
tgt: my family was forcibly moved to different parts of the country on two occasions.

src: om met n vuurwapen uit jou huis geforseer te word is nie maklik om te vergeet nie en die nagevolge van só ’n trauma duur geslagte lank.
tgt: being forced from one’s home at gunpoint is a trauma not easily forgotten and is carried across generations.

src: ons, as n land, leef steeds met die blywende nagevolge van die gevoellose dade wat in die naam van apartheid ruimtelike beplanning ge pleeg is.
tgt: as a country, we are still living with the residual effects of the callous acts carried out in the name of apartheid spatial planning.

src: as mense wat glo in gelyk heid, geregtigheid en mense regte kan ons nie anders as om geroer te word en inderdaad ook kwaad te word oor die pyn en vernedering wat die palestynse mense aangedoen word nie; want dit eggo ons eie geskiedenis van pyn en vernedering.
tgt: for all who believe in equality, justice and human rights, we cannot but be moved and indeed angered, at the pain and humiliation being inflicted on the palestinian people; for it echoes our own.

src: hulle verontagsaam herhaalde beslissings van die verenigde nasies se veilig heidsraad wat aandring op n einde aan die okkupasie van palestynse grond en die verwesenliking van die palestynse mense se regte.
tgt: they show a total disregard for successive united nations security council reso lutions that call for an end to the occupation of palestinian land and for the fulfilment of the rights of the palestinian people.

src: sedert israeliese magte verlede week aanvalle op aanbidders by die al aqsamoskee in jerusalem geloods het, het die geweld intussen die gazastrook, groot ge deeltes van die wesoewer en n aantal israelitiese stede verswelg.
tgt: since israeli security forces launched assaults on worshippers at alaqsa mosque in jerusalem, the violence has now engulfed the gaza strip, large parts of the west bank and a number of israeli cities.

src: dit het dosyne mense, waaronder kinders, se lewens geëis.
tgt: it has claimed the lives of dozens of people, including children.

src: dit is ook baie kommerwek kend dat israeliese magte n multiverdiepinggebou wat n aantal mediaorganisasies ge huisves het, vernietig het en sodoende n kil boodskap aan die media wat oor die geweld verslag doen, gestuur het.
tgt: it is also deeply troubling that israeli forces destroyed a multistorey building that housed a number of media organisations, sending a chilling message to media reporting on the violence.

src: die sinnelose en voort gesette israeliese bombarder ing van gaza sal verwoes tende gevolge vir die meer as twee miljoen mense hê wat vir die afgelope 14 jaar onder ’n onwettige israeliese blokkade ly.
tgt: the senseless and continued israeli bombardment of gaza will have devastating consequences for more than two million people who have been suffering under an illegal israeli blockade for 14 years.

src: ons doen n beroep op alle betrokke partye om selfbe heersing toe te pas, respek vir menselewens te toon en die huidige aggressie te staak.
tgt: we call on all parties involved to show restraint, to respect human life and to cease the current hostilities.

src: ons, as suidafrika, is daar toe verbind om deel te wees van internasionale pogings wat ten doel het om weer n politieke proses aan te wak ker wat sal lei tot die vestig ing van n lewensvatbare palestynse staat; ’n palestynse staat wat syaansy in vrede met israel en binne interna sionaal erkende grense kan bestaan.
tgt: as south africa, we are committed to being part of international efforts aimed at reviving a political process that will lead to the establishment of a viable palestinian state existing sidebyside in peace with israel and within internationally recognised borders.

src: die tweestaatoplossing bly die mees lewensvatbare opsie vir die mense van israel en palestina en moet steeds ondersteun word.
tgt: the twostate solution remains the most viable option for the peoples of israel and palestine and must continue to be supported.

src: net soos wat israeliese magte aanbidders by die al aqsamoskee aangeval het, is ons besig om voor te berei om die eeufees van die bulhoek slagting by n godsdienstige plek in ntabelanga in die ooskaap te herdenk.
tgt: just as israeli security forces were attacking worshippers at the alaqsa mosque, we in south africa were preparing to commemorate the centenary of the bulhoek massacre at a religious site in ntabelanga in the eastern cape.

src: op 24 mei 1921 het kolo niale veiligheidsmagte, ge wapen met masjiengewere en artillerie, op aanbidders losgebrand.
tgt: on 24 may 1921, colonial security forces armed with machine guns and artillery opened fire on worshippers, killing more than 160 people and wounding nearly 130. the massacre laid bare the brutality not only of the police force of the union of south africa, but also the racist system that it was charged to uphold.

src: net soos die geskil in die sheik jarrahbuurt, was die gruweldaad by bulhoek nie net weens n plaaslike geskil nie; dit was fundamenteel oor die geforseerde onteien ing van grond, oor koloniale okkupasie, oor rassediskrimi nasie en oor gewelddadige onderdrukking van onenig heid.
tgt: just like the dispute in the sheik jarrah neighbourhood, the atrocity at bulhoek was not just about a local dispute; it was fundamentally about the forced dispossession of land, about colonial occupa tion, about racial discrimi nation and about the violent suppression of dissent.

src: wanneer ons nadink oor die krisis in die middeooste en veral die lyding van die palestynse mense, sal dit vir ons raadsaam wees om die woorde van selby msimang, stigterslid van die african national congress, te her roep.
tgt: as we reflect on the crisis in the middle east and particularly on the suffering of the palestinian people, we would do well to recall the words of selby msimang, a founding member of the african national congress.

src: na aanleiding van die bul hoekslagting het hy geskryf: "geskiedenis dui daarop dat die menslike siel van nature teen ongeregtigheid in op stand kom."
tgt: in the aftermath of the bulhoek massacre he wrote: "history has shown that the human soul naturally revolts against injustice".

src: die betogings en die op stand van die onderdrukte mense van suidafrika teen kolonialisme en apartheid het die waarheid van dié woorde bewys.
tgt: the protests and the revolt of the oppressed people of south africa against colonialism and apartheid proved the veracity of this prophecy.

src: ons, as mense met ’n liefde vir vryheid en geregtig heid, staan saam met die palestynse mense in hul soektog na selfbeskikking, maar ook in hul weerstand teen die ontneming van hul menseregte en die weiering van hul waardigheid.
tgt: as lovers of freedom and of justice, we stand with the palestinian people in their quest for selfdetermination, but also in their resistance against the deprivation of their human rights and the denial of their dignity.

src: beskerm jou kinders teen kuberafknouery kgaogelo letsebe wnnrdeskundiges gee wenke hoe tegnologie gebruik kan word om kuberafknouery te bekamp.
tgt: protect children from cyberbullying kgaogelo letsebe csir experts use technology to try and eliminate cyberbullying the cruelty and devastating effects of cyberbul lying on children have been laid bare in recent months.

src: die wreedheid en vernietigende gevolge van kuber afknouery onder kinders is die afgelope maande weereens blootgelê.
tgt: in a recent case of cyberbullying, grade 10 learner lufuno mavhunga, from mbilwi secondary school in limpopo, died by suicide after being beaten by another learner.

src: in ’n onlangse geval van kuberafknouery is lufuno mavhunga, ’n graad 10leer der van mbilwi sekondêre skool in limpopo, oorlede weens selfdood nadat sy deur n ander leerder aangerand is.
tgt: mavhunga overdosed on prescription pills after the video of the beating was shared on social media.

src: kubersekuriteitsdeskundi ges van die wetenskaplike en nywerheidsnavorsingsraad (wnnr) sê dat kuberaf knouery uiters skadelik vir kinders is en kan lei tot depressie, hartseer, woede, frustrasie, angs en vrees.
tgt: cyber security experts from the council for scientific and industrial research (csir) say cyberbullying is extremely harmful to children and can lead to depression, sadness, anger, frustration, anxiety and fear.

src: "dit kan ook lei tot ’n lae selfbeeld, misdadige gedrag, skoolgeweld, gesinsprobleme en selfmoordgedagtes," verduidelik sipho ngobeni, ’n senior navorser by die wnnr.
tgt: "it can also lead to low selfesteem, delinquency, school violence, family problems and suicidal thoughts," explains csir senior researcher sipho ngobeni.

src: kuberafknouery vind plaas wanneer iemand elektroniese kommunikasie gebruik om doelbewus n ander persoon te teister, dreig, verneder, in timideer, in die verleentheid bring of spot.
tgt: cyberbullying occurs when someone uses electronic communication to intentionally harass, threaten, embarrass, intimidate, stalk, humiliate or make fun of another person.

src: volgens ngobeni toon na vorsing dat 41% van kinders na afleiding van kuberaf knouery sosiale angs ontwik kel, 37% depressief raak, 26% selfmoordgedagtes kry en 25% hulself leed aandoen.
tgt: ngobeni says research shows that 41% of children develop social anxiety after experiencing cyberbullying, 37% develop depression, 26% have suicidal thoughts and 25% engage in selfharm.

src: "dié bevindings dui daarop dat kuberafknouery n ernstige kwessie is... dit is van sleutelbelang om alle betrokke partye te betrek – die jeug, ouers, opvoeders, wetstoepassers en sosiale mediamaatskappye – om hierdie probleem aan te spreek," voeg hy by.
tgt: "these findings show that cyberbullying is a serious issue... getting everyone involved – youth, parents, educators, law enforcement and social media companies – is the key to dealing with this problem," he adds.

src: kuberafknouery vind mees tal plaas op instagram (42%), facebook (31%), snapchat (31%), whatsapp (12%), youtube (10%) en twitter (9%).
tgt: most cyberbullying, 42%, occurs on instagram, 31% on facebook, 31% on snapchat, 12% on whatsapp, 10% on youtube and 9% on twitter.

src: wnnrdeskundige, rofhiwa netshiya sê dat daar n behoefte is aan openbare opvoeding oor alle vorme van kuberafknouery.
tgt: csir expert rofhiwa netshiya says there is a need for public education about all forms of cyberbullying.

src: "ons moet kinders leer dat kuberafknouery ernstige gevolge kan hê," sê sy.
tgt: "we need to educate children that cyberbullying can lead to serious consequences," she says.

src: die wnnr werk tans aan die ontwikkeling van aan n platform om kuberafknouery in geselskamers te identifiseer.
tgt: to tackle cyberbullying, the csir team is working on a platform that detects bullying in chatrooms.

src: "die platform sal outoma ties kuberafknouery in geselsgroepe identifiseer en gebruikers wat aanhou om haatspraak te stuur, blokkeer.
tgt: "the platform will automatically detect cyberbullying on chat groups and block users who continue to send hate speech.

src: dit sal die gebruiker drie waarskuwingsboodskappe gee en, as hulle volhou, sal dit hulle blokkeer," sê netshiya.
tgt: it will give the user three warning messages and, if they persist, it will block them," says netshiya.

src: sy raai ouers aan om basiese internetkontrolesagteware op hul kinders se toestelle te installeer om hul aktiwiteite te kontroleer.
tgt: she advises parents to install basic internet monitoring software on their children's devices to monitor their activities.

src: "daar is laekosteprodukte wat jou kinders se aktiwiteite onopsigtelik kan monitor en die bevindinge privaat en so dikwels soos wat jy verkies aan jou kan epos.
tgt: "there are lowcost products that can invisibly monitor the activities of your kids and privately email you the results as often as you like.

src: dit is baie belangrik om die webwerwe wat besoek is, inhoud wat afgelaai is, gesprekke in ge selskamers en onmiddellike boodskappe na te spoor.
tgt: these are very important to track internet sites visited, downloads, chatroom conversations and instant messaging.

src: "die wnnr bied die vol gende wenke aan ouers wat vermoed dat hul kinders die slagoffers van kuberaf knouery is: maak seker dat jou kind veilig voel; gee onvoor waardelike ondersteuning.
tgt: "the csir offers the following tips for parents who suspect their children are victims of cyberbullying: ensure the child feels safe, show unconditional support.

src: sa streef daarna om die grondwet se visie te verwesenlik vukuzenzele unnamed suidafrika het 60 jaar gelede, op 31 mei 1961, n repu bliek geword en sy bande met die britse ryk ver breek.
tgt: sa strives to realise the vision of the constitution vukuzenzele unnamed sixty years ago, on 31 may 1961, apartheid south africa became a republic, cutting its ties with the british empire.

src: alhoewel n "republiek" algemeen omskryf word as n staat waarin die landsburgers en hul verkose verteenwoor digers die oppermag het, was dit egter nie die geval in suidafrika nie.
tgt: while a ‘republic’ is generally defined as a state in which supreme power is held by the people and their elected representatives, this was not the case in south africa.

src: die grondwet van die apartheidsrepubliek het trou aan god gesweer "wat ons voorvaders vanuit baie lande byeengebring het en aan hulle hierdie as hul eie gegee het".
tgt: the constitution of the apartheid republic pledged allegiance to god, "who gathered our forebears together from many lands and gave them this as their own".

src: dit was n grondwet wat deur en vir die rasseminder heid geskryf is en wat geloof gebruik het om despotisme te regverdig.
tgt: it was a constitution written by and for a racial minority, and it used faith to justify tyranny.

src: dit het die re gering se administrasie om skryf en voorsiening daarvoor gemaak dat slegs blankes daarop geregtig was om te stem en as staatsamptenare te dien.
tgt: it outlined the administration of government, providing that only white people were eligible to vote and serve as public representatives.

src: die land se meerderheid is relegeer tot n voetnota aan bykans die einde van hierdie grondwet se 121 voorskrifte, in n afdeling getiteld "ad ministrasie van bantoesake, ens.".
tgt: the country’s majority was relegated to a footnote towards the end of its 121 provisions, in a section titled ‘administration of bantu affairs, etc.’.

src: die eerste minister, hf verwoerd, het tydens n tvuitsending gesê: "ons streef na die geleidelike ontwik keling van elkeen van ons groepe in n sekere rigting.
tgt: in a televised message, prime minister hf verwoerd said: "we seek the gradual development of each of our groups in a certain direction.

src: die oplossing word hier openlik nagestreef deur die blanke man se leidende hand te behou.
tgt: here the solution is openly sought by retaining the white man’s guiding hand.

src: "ons is baie gelukkig om n verenigde volk te wees," het hy aan die wêreld verklaar.
tgt: "we are very happy to be a united people," he declared to the world.

src: die realiteit was egter dat ons nie n verenigde volk was nie.
tgt: but the reality was that we were not a united people.

src: ons was inwoners van n land waar mense se regte, vooruitsigte en lewensver wagting deur hul ras bepaal is.
tgt: we were inhabitants of a country where one’s rights, prospects and life expectancy was determined by one’s race.

src: die grondwet van die republiek van suidafrika, 1961 was vir twee dekades die wetlike dryfkrag agter die onderdrukking van byna 90% van die suidafrikaanse bevolking.
tgt: for two decades, the republic of south africa constitution act of 1961 was the legal impetus for the repression of nearly 90% of the south african population.

src: dié ongelukkige herdenk ing het in dieselfde maand plaasgevind as die 25ste herdenking van die grond wetlike vergadering se goedkeuring van ons nuwe demokratiese grondwet, wat die geboortesertifikaat vir n nasie wat waarlik verenig is, geword het.
tgt: this unhappy anniversary took place in the same month that we celebrated the 25th anniversary of the adoption by the constitutional assembly of our new democratic constitution, which became the birth certificate of a real united nation.

src: ons het nou een wet vir een nasie.
tgt: now we have one law for one nation.

src: ons het saam n regering stelsel vir onsself gekies wat ware betekenis aan die kon sep van n republiek gee.
tgt: together, we have chosen for ourselves a system of government that gives true meaning to the concept of a republic.

src: ons het gesê dat almal in ons de mokratiese republiek gelyk voor die gereg is en die reg besit tot gelyke beskerming deur en voordeel uit die reg.
tgt: we have said that in our democratic republic, everyone is equal before the law and has the right to equal protection and benefit of the law.

src: suidafrika is vandag n land waar onafhanklike howe en n regsbank wat slegs onderhewig aan die grond wet is, oor die regsbedeling beskik.
tgt: south africa today is a country where the administration of justice is vested in independent courts and a judiciary that is subject only to the constitution.

src: ons leef in n land waar almal die reg het om die howe te nader ter vervulling van hul regte.
tgt: we live in a country where everyone has the right to approach the courts for the fulfilment of their rights.

src: ons leef in n land waar gemeenskappe wettig kan aanspraak maak op grond waarvandaan hul geweld dadig verskuif is en waar in dividue of gesinne beskerm is teen arbitrêre uitsetting uit hul huise.
tgt: we live in a country where communities can stake a legal claim on land they were forcefully moved from, and where individuals or families are protected against arbitrary eviction from their homes.

src: ons leef in n land waar al mal toegelaat word om hul kultuur en tradisies vrylik uit te leef.
tgt: we live in a country where everyone is permitted to freely practise their culture and traditions.

src: dit is n land waar enig iemand vrylik en op enige plek ter ondersteuning van maatskaplike, politieke en ander sake kan betoog.
tgt: it is a country where anyone can freely protest in support of social, political and other causes anywhere.

src: ons grondwetlike bedeling is geskoei op n aanspreeklike regering waar die uitvoeren de raad rekenskap aan die mense verskuldig is en waar die parlement verteenwoor digend van die mense is.
tgt: our constitutional dispensation is premised on accountable government, where the executive is answerable to the people and where parliament is representative of the people.

src: dit is n land waar die reg gelyk op enige burger toepas lik is.
tgt: it is a country where the law applies equally to any citizen.

src: ons het nou n regering van die mense, vir die mense en deur die mense.
tgt: we now have a government of the people, for the people and by the people.

src: die apartheidsregime het, toe hy triomfantlik sy ras sistiese grondwet 60 jaar gelede voor die wêreld geparadeer het, misplaaste vertroue gehad dat dit in stand sou bly.
tgt: when the apartheid regime triumphantly paraded its racist constitution to the world 60 years ago, it had misplaced confidence that it would endure.

src: nelson mandela het, n maand voor dat die republiek verklaar is, in n brief aan verwoerd wat nie beantwoord was nie, die bevrydingsbeweging se verwerping van die blanke republiek wat met geweld afgedwing is, verklaar.
tgt: in an unanswered letter to verwoerd a month before the republic was declared, nelson mandela affirmed the liberation movement’s rejection of the forcibly imposed white republic.

src: hy het gesê dat geen grondwet of vorm van rege ring waarop daar besluit is sonder die deelname van die afrikamense, morele geldig heid sou geniet nie.
tgt: he said that no constitution or form of government decided without the participation of the african people would enjoy moral validity.

src: trouens, geen stelsel wat die stelselmatige ontkenning van mense se regte verskans, kan volhou word nie.
tgt: indeed no system that entrenches the systematic denial of people’s rights can be sustained.

src: ons het uiteindelik ons vryheid gewen, alhoewel dit meer as drie dekades sou neem voordat daar aan die eise van die bevrydingsbeweging voldoen is.
tgt: though it would be over three decades before the demands of the liberation movement were met, we eventually won our freedom.

src: ons het, toe ons die apart heidsgrondwet na die asblik van geskiedenis verban het, onsself verbind tot n nuwe grondwet en n nuwe stel waardes.
tgt: in relegating the apartheid constitution to the dustbin of history, we committed ourselves to a new constitution and a new set of values.

src: toe ek 25 jaar gelede die grondwetlike vergadering aangespreek het, het ek gesê dat ons grondwet meer as woorde op papier moet word; dit moet n werklikheid in ons mense se lewens word.
tgt: when i addressed the constitutional assembly 25 years ago, i said our constitution must become more than words on a page; it must become a reality in the lives of our people.

src: dié progressiewe en re volusionêre dokument sal ontoepaslik en niksseggend word as ons dit nie doen nie.
tgt: unless we do so, this progressive and revolutionary document will be rendered irrelevant and meaningless.

src: ons het lank reeds besluit watter tipe samelewing ons wil wees.
tgt: we have long decided what kind of society we want to be.

src: dit is n samelewing geskoei op menswaardig heid, gelykheid, vryheid en niediskriminasie.
tgt: it is a society rooted in human dignity, equality, freedom and nondiscrimination.

src: ons het vir n kwarteeu daaraan gewerk om so n sa melewing te ontwikkel.
tgt: for a quarter of a century we have worked to build such a society.

src: tafelkopboere se drome bewaarheid vukuzenzele unnamed ngroep swart boere van tafelkop in groblersdal, lim popo, is die trotse nuwe eienaars van die 189hek taar grond waarop hulle vir die afgelope 25 jaar boer.
tgt: dreams come true for tafelkop community vukuzenzele unnamed a group of black farmers in tafelkop in grob lersdal, limpopo are the proud owners of 189 hectares of land, which they have been farming for the past 25 years.

src: president cyril ramaphosa het die grond se titelaktes aan die 30 boere oorhandig nadat die departement van openbare werke en infra struktuur dit vir grondher verspreidingsdoeleindes oorgedra het.
tgt: the 30 farmers received title deeds for the land from president cyril ramaphosa after the department of public works and infrastructure transferred it for land redistribution purposes.

src: die grond, ter waarde van meer as r25.5 miljoen, is gra tis aan die boere oorhandig.
tgt: the land is valued at more than r25.5 million, but was handed over to the farmers for free.

src: "dit is inderdaad n won derlike dag vir die tafelkop gemeenskap, vir die mense van limpopo en vir die hele suidafrika," het die president by die oorhandig ingseremonie gesê.
tgt: "this is indeed a great day for the community of tafelkop, for the people of limpopo and for the whole of south africa.

src: "ons sien vandag hoe n gemeenskap se droom verwesenlik word.
tgt: "today we are witnessing a community’s dream being fulfilled.

src: dít is die visie waarvoor hierdie gemeenskap vir die afgelope 25 jaar veg."
tgt: it is the vision that this community has spent the past 25 years fighting to see realised," said the president at the handover ceremony.

src: die boere boer sedert 1996 suksesvol met verskeie landbouprodukte op die grond.
tgt: the farmers have been successfully farming various agricultural produce on the land since 1996. they organised themselves in the 1990s to be registered commercial farmers under the banner of the tafelkop farmers association and started to engage government.

src: hulle het hulself in die 1990’s as kommersiële boere onder die banier van die tafelkopboerevereniging registreer en het begin om met die regering in gesprek te tree.
tgt: in 2000, the then national department of agriculture entered into lease agreements with the tafelkop farmers association in terms of the land redistribution for agricultural development programme.

src: die destydse nasionale departement van landbou het in 2000 huurooreen komste met die tafelkopboerevereniging geteken ingevolge die program vir grondherverspreiding vir landbouontwikkeling.
tgt: in 2009, the former limpopo department of agri culture recommended to the department of public works that the land be transferred to the farmers.

src: die grond word tans ge bruik om met tabak, katoen en vars produkte te boer.
tgt: the land is currently being used to farm tobacco, cotton and fresh produce.

src: tweeendertig huishou dings word deur die grond onderhou en boerderyaktiwiteite verskaf werk vir 128 permanente werkers en tot 320 seisoenswerkers.
tgt: thirtytwo households are supported by the land and farming activities which provide employment to 128 permanent workers and up to 320 seasonal workers.

src: geregtigheid vir die gemeenskapdie president het gesê dat die gemeenskap oor die jare baie teëspoed ervaar het and dat die "titelaktes geregtigheid vir n onteiende gemeenskap bring".
tgt: justice for the communitythe president said the com munity had endured many hardships over the years and the "title deeds bring justice to a dispossessed community".

src: "ons het nie vergeet van die onteiening, gronddief stal en geforseerde verwy dering wat die mense van dié gemeenskap en baie gemeenskappe regoor die land moes verdra nie.
tgt: "we have not forgotten the dispossession, land theft and forced removals that the people of this community and many communities across the country had to endure.

src: "ons het nie vergeet van die wrede nalatenskap van landbou hier in limpopo nie, waar plaasbewoners ge forseer is om woonarbeiders te wees op hul voorvaders se grond en nie toegelaat is om grond te besit om hul ge sinne te voer of as weiding vir hul vee te gebruik nie."
tgt: "we have not forgotten the harsh legacy of farming here in limpopo, where farmdwellers were forced to be labour tenants on their forefathers’ land and not allowed to own land to feed their families or graze their animals."

src: hy het bygevoeg dat swart plaaswerkers in die voor malige noordtransvaal uitgebuit en mishandel is.
tgt: he added that black farmworkers were exploited and abused in what was previously the northern transvaal.

src: "ons onthou ook hoe die apartheidsregering blanke boere ondersteun het met toerusting, tegniese steun en toegang tot krediet om hul besighede te ontwikkel, maar swart bestaansboere het gesukkel om te oorleef.
tgt: "we also recall how the apartheid government supported white farmers with equipment, technical support and access to credit to build their businesses, but black subsistence farmers struggled to survive.

src: "transformasie van die landboubedryfdie president het gesê dat die oordrag van grond hoop aanwakker, want dit dui daarop dat die landboube dryf met die regte onder steuning en geleenthede getransformeer kan word tot die land se voordeel.
tgt: "transforming the agricultural industrythe president said the trans fer of land inspires hope because it shows that with the right support and opportunities, the agricultural industry can be transformed for the benefit of the country.

src: "ons vier ons vordering omdat ons grondhervor mingsprogram daagliks momentum kry.
tgt: "we celebrate our progress, because day by day our land reform programme is gaining momentum.

src: "die regering het tot op hede meer as vyf miljoen hektaar grond herversprei, met n totaal van ongeveer 5 500 plase, na meer as 300 000 begunstigdes."
tgt: "to date, government has redistributed over five million hectares of land, totalling around 5 500 farms, to more than 300 000 beneficiaries."

src: die grondherstelproses het tot dusver meer as twee mil joen grondeisers bevoordeel en die oordrag van ongeveer 2.7 miljoen hektaar tot ge volg gehad.
tgt: so far, the land restitution process has benefited over two million land claimants and resulted in the transfer of around 2.7 million hectares.

src: "grondhervorming is nie net in die belang van reg stelling, geregtigheid and maatskaplike samehang nie.
tgt: "land reform isn’t just in the interests of redress, justice and social cohesion.

src: dit gaan ook oor eko nomiese ontwikkeling.
tgt: it is also about economic development.

src: "landbou en die land bouwaardeketting kan en moet landelike ekonomieë transformeer," het president ramaphosa gesê.
tgt: agriculture and the agriculture value chain can and must transform rural economies," said president ramaphosa.

src: die regering beplan om n hervormingsagentskap vir grond en grondbesitters te vestig wat grondhervorming sal bespoedig.
tgt: government plans to establish a land and agrarian reform agency to fasttrack land reform.

src: "ons kyk na hoe doeltref fend ons vorige beleide was.
tgt: "we are looking at how effective our past policies have been.

src: ons gaan hierdie kwessie van grondhervorming dringend aanspreek.
tgt: we are going to address this issue of land reform urgently.

src: "spreek vorige foute aandie president het gesê dat die regering hard werk om dit wat tydens die apart heidsjare en sedert die begin van demokrasie verkeerd geloop het, reg te stel.
tgt: "addressing past mistakesthe president said govern ment was working hard to correct what went wrong during the apartheid years and since the start of de mocracy.

src: grondhervorming is van kernbelang om die land se voedselsekerheid te verbeter, n inklusiewe ekonomie te ontwikkel en n beter toekoms vir alle suid afrikaners te verskaf, het die president bygevoeg.
tgt: "land reform is vital to improving the country’s food security, building an inclusive economy and providing a better future for all south africans, added the president.

src: hy moedig die tafelkopboere aan om die grond verstandig en tot die ge meenskap se voordeel te gebruik.
tgt: he urged the tafelkop farmers to use the land wisely and for the benefit of the community.

src: "vandag was vir my die beste dag op kantoor; om die grond en stof te skop en julle opbrengste te sien," het hy gesê.
tgt: "for me, today has been the best day in the office; to kick the soil and dust and see your produce.

src: "daar is vir my geen twyfel dat die projek steeds sal flo reer met al die betrokkenes se toewyding en energie nie.
tgt: "i have no doubt that with the commitment and energy of all involved, this project will continue to thrive," he said.

src: "die voorsitter van die tafelkopboerevereniging, jerry sefoloshe, het die regering bedank dat dit vir die boere moontlik gemaak is om die eienaars te word van die grond waarop hulle vir al dekades boer.
tgt: chairperson of the tafelkop farmers association jerry sefoloshe thanked government for making it possible for the farmers to become the owners of the land they have worked for decades.

src: die jeug is ons grootste bate vukuzenzele unnamed op 16 junie 1976 het die jeug van so weto en ander dele van die land opge staan teen die gru wel van bantoe onderwys.
tgt: the youth are our greatest asset vukuzenzele unnamed on june 16th 1976, the youth of soweto and other parts of the country rose up against the iniquity of bantu education.

src: op daardie dag en die dae wat daarop sou volg, het baie mense hulle lewens verloor.
tgt: on that day and in the days that followed, many lost their lives.

src: hulle is vermoor deur ‘n hartelose regering wat bitter min omgegee het vir swart lewens, en wat niks daarvan gedink het nie om met geweervuur los te brand op ongewapende kinders in skoolklere nie.
tgt: they were killed by a callous regime that had little regard for black lives and thought nothing of opening fire on unarmed, uniformed schoolchildren.

src: hierdie gebeure het die internasionale sentiment teen die apartheidsregering versterk en verdere stukrag aan die bevrydingstryd verleen.
tgt: these events hardened international opinion against the apartheid regime and gave further impetus to the liberation struggle.

src: jong mense het nog altyd die voortou geneem in sosiale verset van die antioutoritêre optogte in latynsamerika in die laat 1950’s tot die betogings regoor afrika in die laat 1960’s.
tgt: young people have always been at the forefront of social protest, from the antiauthoritarian protests in latin america in the late 1950s, to the protests across africa in the late 1960s.

src: die geskiedenis het die bydrae van die generasie van 1976 tot die internasionale studentebeweging en sy standpunt teen onderdrukking en onregverdigheid getrou opgeteken.
tgt: history faithfully records the contribution of the generation of 1976 to the international student movement and its stance against oppression and injustice.

src: hierdie historiese gebeurtenis 45 jaar gelede word nog steeds regoor afrika en die wêreld herdenk.
tgt: this historic event 45 years ago continues to be commemorated across africa and the world.

src: daarom is dit ontstellend dat kennis oor 16 junie besig is om af te neem onder jong suidafrikaners.
tgt: it is therefore disturbing that knowledge of june 16th is diminishing among young south africans.

src: dit gebeur veral onder die sogenaamde generasie z, die jong mense wat tussen 1997 en 2015 gebore is.
tgt: this is particularly so among the socalled generation z, or young people born between 1997 and 2015. the 2019/2020 south african social attitudes survey published by the human sciences research council found that close to 40% of generation z has not heard of the historical events of june 16th.

src: ‘n soortgelyke persentasie het daarvan gehoor, maar weet baie min of niks daaromtrent nie.
tgt: a similar percentage has heard about it but knows very little or nothing about it.

src: desondanks het die opname bevind dat jong mense van hierdie generasie bereid is om meer te leer oor sleutel historiese gebeure en ook glo in die voortgesette belangrikheid daarvan.
tgt: nevertheless, the survey also found that young people of this generation are open to learning about key historical events and believe in their continued importance.

src: ons as ‘n land moet meer doen om seker te maak dat die boodskap van 1976 getrou oorgedra word.
tgt: we need to do more as a country to ensure that the message of 1976 is transmitted faithfully.

src: dit is die regering, skole, tersiêre instellings, ouers, families, musikante, kunstenaars en die hele samelewing se gesamentlike verantwoordelikheid.
tgt: this is a collective responsibility of government, schools, tertiary institutions, parents, families, musicians, artists, and all of society.

src: die generasie wat gebore is nadat apartheid beëindig is, het ‘n land geërf met ‘n demokratiese grondwet waar fundamentele vryhede beskerm word.
tgt: the generation that was born after apartheid ended inherited a country with a democratic constitution and where fundamental freedoms are protected.

src: deur die storie van 16 junie lewendig te hou, dien dit as ‘n herinnering aan vandag se generasie van die groot opofferings wat gemaak is om hulle vryheid te bewerkstellig.
tgt: keeping the story of june 16th alive is a reminder to today’s generation of the great sacrifices made to secure their freedom.

src: jeugdag is ‘n herinnering aan die ontsaglike krag en bemiddeling waaroor jong mense beskik om vir hulleself ‘n beter toekoms te skep.
tgt: youth day is a reminder of the immense power and agency that young people have to create a better future for themselves.

src: vandag se jong mense beleef baie struikelblokke.
tgt: the struggles of young people in south africa today are many.

src: jong mense bly steeds aan die voorpunt van aktivisme, ongeag of dit in die strewe na gratis opvoeding of teen maatskaplike euwels soos geslaggebaseerde geweld is.
tgt: young people have remained at the forefront of activism, whether in pursuit of free education or against social ills like genderbased violence.

src: die grootste stryd wat jong mense vandag stry, is teen werkloosheid, wat onder die covid19pandemie toegeneem het.
tgt: today the greatest struggle young people wage is against unemployment, which has worsened under the covid19 pandemic.

src: die regering se eerste prioriteit is om meer geleenthede, sowel as toegang daartoe, vir ons jong mense te skep.
tgt: creating more opportunities for young people, and access to these opportunities, is government’s foremost priority.

src: alles wat ons as ‘n regering doen, dra by tot die verbetering van die lewens van jong mense.
tgt: everything that we do as a government contributes towards improving the lives of young people.

src: om werkloosheid onder die jeug aan te pak, vereis versnelde ekonomiese groei, veral in arbeidsintensiewe sektore, sowel as die uitbouing van die staat se vermoë om sy ontwikkelingsrol te vervul.
tgt: tackling youth unemployment requires accelerating economic growth, particularly in labourintensive sectors, and building the capability of the state to fulfil its developmental role.

src: ons bevorder hierdie agenda deur teikenintervensies.
tgt: we are also driving this agenda through targeted interventions.

src: dit sluit in die presidensiële werkskeppingstimulus, wat werksgeleenthede en lewensonderhoud aan baie jong mense verskaf het.
tgt: these include the presidential employment stimulus, which has provided work opportunities and livelihoods support for many young people.

src: ons het ‘n reeks addisionele maatreëls in plek gestel om geleenthede te skep, vaardigheidsontwikkeling te verbeter, jong entrepreneurs te ondersteun en jong mense in staat te stel om ten volle by die ekonomie in te skakel.
tgt: we have launched a range of additional measures to create opportunities, enhance skills development, support young entrepreneurs and enable the full participation of young people in the economy.

src: dit sluit in die vestiging van ‘n nasionale roetebestuursnetwerk, sa jeug, wat dit makliker moet maak vir jong mense om geleenthede raak te sien en te benut, en om aktiewe ondersteuning te kry om roetes na die arbeidsmark te betree.
