tgt: this includes the establishment of a national pathway management network, sa youth, to make it easier for young people to view and access opportunities and receive active support to find pathways into the labour market.

src: laasgenoemde is enkele van die presidensiele jeugindiensnemingsintervensie se prioriteite, wat slegs weke voor die nasionale inperking verlede jaar bekendgestel is en wat tans ten volle geïmplementeer word.
tgt: these are among the priorities of the presidential youth employment intervention, which was launched just weeks before we entered a national lockdown last year and which is now entering full implementation.

src: die presidensiële jeugindiensnemingsintervensie is gebou op die verstandhouding dat die oplossing vir die jeug se werkloosheidskrisis innoverende denke en sterk vennootskappe regoor die samelewing vereis.
tgt: the presidential youth employment intervention was built on the understanding that addressing the youth unemployment crisis requires innovative thinking and strong partnerships across society.

src: die uiteindelike doelwit is om modelle te kry wat werk, of dit nou in vaardigheidsontwikkeling is of aktiewe arbeidsmarkbeleide, en om dit vinnig te skaleer sodat soveel as moontlik jongmense bereik word.
tgt: its ultimate objective is to find models that work, whether in skills development or active labour market policies, and to scale these rapidly to reach as many young people as possible.

src: die belangrikste is dat die presidensiële jeugindiensnemingsintervensie erken dat jong mense sentraal moet staan in enige poging om jeugindiensneming ‘n hupstoot te gee.
tgt: most importantly, it recognises that young people must be at the centre of any effort to boost youth employment.

src: jong mense is ons grootste bate en ons grootste wapen in hierdie stryd.
tgt: young people are our greatest asset, and our greatest weapon in this fight.

src: ons salueer die veerkragtigheid van elke jong persoon wat hulle deel doen om hierdie land op te bou en te ontwikkel.
tgt: we salute the resilience of every young person playing their part to build and develop this country.

src: hulle is die jong mense wat vrywilligerwerk in ons gemeenskappe doen en ons land opbou deur die presidensiële werkskeppingstimulus, wat hulle eie besighede bedryf en studeer om hulleself beter te bekwaam.
tgt: they are the young people volunteering in our communities, building our country through the presidential employment stimulus, running their own businesses and studying to better themselves.

src: hulle is die jong mense wat hulle eie paadjie uitkap en hulle gesinne saam met hulle neem.
tgt: they are the young people who are forging their own path and bringing their families along with them.

src: voorkom brandwonde hierdie winter allison cooper net soos wat die winter die behoefte aan warmte mee bring, verhoog dit ook die risiko van brandwonde weens kerse, vure, stowe, verwarmers en kookwater.
tgt: prevent burns this winter allison cooper just as winter brings with it the need to keep warm, it also increases the risk of burn injuries from candles, fires, stoves, heaters and boiling water.

src: "brandwonde neem drama ties toe in die winter en ou ers en versorgers moet ekstra versigtig wees om hul eie en hulle kinders se veiligheid te verseker," sê dokter gary dos passos.
tgt: "burn injuries inc rease dramatically during winter and parents and caregivers need to be extra careful to ensure their own and their children’s safety," says doctor gary dos passos.

src: hy is die hoof van die eenheid vir brandwonde aan die rooikruis oorlogs gedenkkinderhospitaal (rc mch) en lid van die uitvoerende komitee van die brandvere niging van suidafrika.
tgt: he is the head of the burns unit at the red cross war memorial children’s hospital (rcwmch) and an executive committee member of the burn society of south africa.

src: alhoewel brande wat per ongeluk ontstaan onvermyde lik is, kan talle brandwonde voorkom word deur waaksaam heid, behoorlike volwasse toesig en veiliger gewoontes aan te kweek.
tgt: while accidental fires are inevitable, many burn injuries can be prevented with vigilance, proper adult supervision and safer practices.

src: "brandwonde weens vlamme is rampspoe dige beserings met wese nlike lewenslange fisiese en psigososiale gevolge vir die beseerde oorlewendes en hulle gesinne," sê dr. dos passos.
tgt: "flame burns are devastat ing injuries with substantial lifelong physical and psychosocial consequences for the affected survivors and their families," says dr dos passos.

src: hoe om brandwonde te voorkombrandwonde in en om die huis kan voorkom word.
tgt: how to prevent burnsburn injuries can be pre vented around the home.

src: hier is ‘n paar wenke:l hou vuurhoutjies, aanste kers, versnelmiddels (petrol en paraffien), kerse, gasen paraffienlampe en verwarmers buite bereik van kinders.
tgt: here are some tips: keep matches, lighters, accelerants (petrol and paraffin), candles, gas and paraffin lamps and heaters out of children’s reach.

src: dit is ui ters gevaarlik.
tgt: this is extremely dangerous.

src: l moenie toelaat dat kinders na by paraffienof gaslampe of verwarmers speel nie.
tgt: do not let children play near paraffin or gas lamps or heaters.

src: l moenie ‘n kind optel terwyl jy kook nie of ‘n kind sonder toesig in of naby die kombuis los nie.
tgt: do not hold a child while cooking or leave children unsupervised in or near the kitchen.

src: l maak seker dat die ketel buite bereik is.
tgt: ensure the kettle is out of reach.

src: koop ‘n koord lose ketel as jy kan. lmoenie kookwaterkanne of potte met kookwater na by kinders ronddra nie.
tgt: buy a cordless kettle if you can.

src: ldraai potte se hand vatsels weg van die voorkant van die stoof af.
tgt: turn pot handles away from the front of the stove.

src: l sit kerse in ‘n diep glas bottel met sand onder in sodat hulle geblus word as hulle omval.
tgt: put candles in a deep glass bottle with sand at the bottom so that they will go out if they fall over.

src: l moenie vure met sand bedek nie.
tgt: do not cover fires with sand.

src: die sand behou die hitte vir ure.
tgt: the heat stays in the sand for hours.

src: l tap eers koue water in die bad en dan warm water.
tgt: put cold water in the bath first, and then add hot water.

src: sterker soe’s moet ekonomiese groei en transformasie aandryf vukuzenzele unnamed suidafrika se onder nemings in staats besit (soe’s) word op die voorgrond al jare lank merendeels met staatskaping, finan siële wanbestuur en onbe kwaamheid vereenselwig.
tgt: soes must drive economic growth and transformation vukuzenzele unnamed for some years now, south africa’s stateowned enterprises (soes) have mostly been associated in the public eye with state capture, financial mismanagement and inefficiency.

src: benewens die gereelde finansiële inspuitings wat sommige van die land se grootste en belangrikste soe’s vanaf die regering benodig, sukkel hulle boonop om hul mandate na te kom.
tgt: in addition to needing regular bailouts from government, some of the country’s biggest and most important stateowned companies have been struggling to meet their mandates.

src: hierdie soe’s behoort aan die spits van ekonomiese en gemeenskaplike transformasie te staan.
tgt: these soes should be at the forefront of economic and social transformation.

src: hulle is daarvoor verantwoordelik om die infrastruktuur en dienste te verskaf waarop die ekonomie staatmaak, hetsy dit elektrisiteitsopwekking, pendelaarvervoer, waterverskaffing, vraglogistiek of telekommunikasie is.
tgt: they are responsible for providing the infrastructure and the services on which the economy depends, whether it be in the generation of electricity, commuter transport, water provision, freight logistics or telecommunications.

src: daar word aan ons benadering tot staatsbesit gestalte gegee deur die behoefte aan belangrike netwerkbedrywe wat doeltreffend funksioneer, soos energie en hawens, en die behoefte om te verseker dat daar aan die basiese behoeftes van alle suidafrikaners, veral die behoeftiges, voldoen kan word.
tgt: our approach to state ownership is informed by the need for the effective functioning of key network industries, such as energy and ports, and by the need to ensure that the basic needs of all south africans, particularly the poor, can be met.

src: ons glo vas dat staatseienaarskap in kernsektore van die ekonomie nodig is en dat die land sterk soe’s benodig wat ekonomiese groei en transformasie kan aandryf.
tgt: we firmly believe that public ownership is necessary in critical sectors of the economy and that the country needs robust soes that are able to drive economic growth and transformation.

src: dit is veral die geval in die lewering van staatsgoedere soos elektrisiteit en water waar soe’s in staat is om n ontwikkelingsmandaat in die openbare belang, teenoor n uitsluitlik kommersiële een, na te streef.
tgt: this is particularly the case in the delivery of public goods such as electricity and water, where soes are able to pursue a developmental mandate in the public interest as opposed to a purely commercial one.

src: dit is waarom ons die ommeswaai van hierdie ondernemings n regeringsprioriteit gemaak het – om korrupsie met wortel en tak uit te roei, hul bestuur te verbeter en hul in staat te stel om hul nodige rol te speel om ekonomiese groei en werkskepping aan te spoor.
tgt: that is why we have made it a priority of this government to turn these companies around to root out corruption, improve their governance and enable them to play the role they should in driving economic growth and employment creation.

src: ons het, met dié doel voor oë, n aantal verbeterings onderneem om hierdie soe’s te versterk sodat hulle die resultate wat die land benodig en verwag, kan lewer.
tgt: to this end, we have embarked upon a number of reforms to strengthen these soes so that they can produce the results that the country needs and expects.

src: een van die belangrikste verbeterings is in die energiesektor.
tgt: one of the most important reforms is in the energy sector.

src: ons het die proses begin om eskom te herstruktureer in drie soe’s wat verantwoordelik is vir onderskeidelik opwekking, geleiding en verspreiding.
tgt: we have begun the process of restructuring eskom into three different soes, responsible for generation, transmission and distribution, respectively.

src: die rede hiervoor is dat die vorige struktuur van eskom nie gepas was vir die veranderende energielandskap nie – dit het ondoeltreffend en duur geword en was nie deursigtig genoeg nie.
tgt: this is because the previous structure of eskom was illsuited for a changing energy landscape.

src: die spesifieke vestiging van n geleidingsentiteit sal beteken dat eskom in staat sal wees om krag vanaf n wyer reeks verskaffers, beide privaat en vanaf die staat, aan te koop.
tgt: the establishment of a transmission entity in particular will mean that eskom will be able to purchase power from a broader range of providers, both private and public.

src: dit sal deursigtigheid verbeter, mededingendheid verhoog en die aankoop van elektrisiteit teen die laagste koste bevorder.
tgt: this will improve transparency, increase competitiveness and promote the purchase of lowestcost electricity.

src: daar was beduidende privaat belegging in kragopwekking as deel van die program vir die verkryging van hernubare energie van onafhanklike kragprodusente (reippp).
tgt: through the renewable energy independent power producers programme, there has been significant private investment in energy generation.

src: ons kan selfs meer privaat beleggings verwag met die voorstel om lisensiëringsvrystelling vir vasgelegde geleiding – waar maatskappye vir hulself en ander kommersiële verbruikers elektrisiteit vervaardig – van 1mw tot 100mw te verhoog.
tgt: with the proposal to raise the licencing exemption for embedded generation – where companies produce electricity for themselves and other commercial users – from 1mw to 100mw, we can expect even more private investment.

src: dit is van kernbelang op n tydstip wat die land weens erge en volgehoue elektrisiteitstekorte swaarkry en waar nóg eskom nóg die regering in staat is om in nuwe opwekkingskapasiteit te belê.
tgt: this is vital at a time when the country is suffering from severe and sustained electricity shortages and where neither eskom nor the state is able to invest in new generation capacity.

src: dit is belangrik dat dié verbeterings ook aan eskom die ruimte sal gun om sy finansiële en bestuursuitdagings aan te spreek.
tgt: importantly, these reforms will give eskom the space to address its financial and operational challenges.

src: nóg n belangrike verbetering is die vestiging van die nasionale haweowerheid as n onafhanklike filiaalmaatskappy van transnet.
tgt: another critical reform is the establishment of the national ports authority as an independent subsidiary of transnet.

src: dit is n deurslaggewende deel van transnet se breedvoerige strategie om nuwe lewe te blaas in ons logistiekinfrastruktuur.
tgt: this a crucial part of transnet’s broader strategy to revitalise our logistics infrastructure.

src: transnet beplan om oor die volgende vyf jaar r100 miljard in die opgradering van sy infrastruktuur regoor die hawestelsel te belê.
tgt: transnet plans to invest r100 billion over the next five years in upgrading its infrastructure across the ports system.

src: dit sal ons hawens meer doeltreffend en ons uitvoere meer mededingend maak en die hele ekonomie bevoordeel.
tgt: this will make our ports more efficient and our exports more competitive, and benefit the entire economy.

src: vir die gewone verbruiker beteken dit verlaagde pryse op baie van ons goedere oor die langtermyn.
tgt: for the ordinary consumer, it will mean reduced prices in the long term for many of our goods.

src: vir ons uitvoerders sal dit meer mededingendheid in wêreldmarkte beteken.
tgt: for our exporters, it will mean greater competitiveness in global markets.

src: ons ekonomie sal uitbrei en meer werke skep namate ons uitvoere groei.
tgt: as our exports grow, our economy will expand and create more jobs.

src: meer doeltreffende hawens sal die hele ekonomie beter laat werk – ’n styging in hawevolumes sal lei tot groter werkskepping in die hawens self.
tgt: more efficient ports will make the entire economy work better – and as port volumes increase, jobs will be created at the ports themselves.

src: die vestiging van die nasionale haweowerheid as n transnetfiliaalmaatskappy met sy eie raad sal, onder meer, beteken dat inkomste wat deur die hawens gegenereer word, gebruik kan word om ou toerusting te vervang en ons hawens op te gradeer en uit te brei – werk wat vir meer as n dekade vertraag is.
tgt: establishing the national ports authority as a transnet subsidiary with its own board will, among other things, mean that revenues generated by the ports can be used to replace old equipment and upgrade and expand our ports, work which has been delayed for more than a decade.

src: dié verbeterings sal onder meer meer privaat belegging in die land se ekonomiese infrastruktuur aanspoor.
tgt: among other things, these reforms will encourage greater private investment in the country’s economic infrastructure.

src: sommige mense het kommer uitgespreek dat dit die belangrikheid of waarde van soe’s sal verminder – inderwaarheid sal dit die teenoorgestelde tot gevolg hê.
tgt: some people have expressed concerns that this will diminish the importance or reduce the value of soes.

src: voorkom identiteitsdiefstal kgaogelo letsebe shenki mabitsela (28) is alte bewus van identiteitsdiefstal en die misdade daar aan verwant, aangesien hy sélf al n slagoffer daarvan was.
tgt: prevent identity theft kgaogelo letsebe shenki mabitsela (28) is all too aware of identity theft and the crimes relating to it, as he has been a victim of it.

src: mabitsela, van modimolle in limpopo, het in november 2020 by n bank aansoek gedoen om n lening, maar is ingelig dat hy te diep in die skuld is en nie kwalifiseer nie.
tgt: mabitsela, from modimolle in limpopo, applied for a loan at a bank in november 2020, but was told he was overindebted and didn’t qualify.

src: "ek het gegaan om aansoek te doen vir n korttermyn lening omdat ek gesukkel het om kop bo water te hou nadat ek in junie 2020 afgelê is.
tgt: "i went to apply for a shortterm loan as i needed to make ends meet after being retrenched in june 2020. to my surprise, i was told i did not qualify.

src: "ek het aanvanklik gedink dat dit weens my onstabiele inkomste was, maar dit was egter nie die geval nie.
tgt: "i initially thought it was because of my unstable income, but it wasn’t.

src: ek het geweet dat ek net een klererekening en geen ander skuld het nie, so ek het vir n afskrif van my profiel gevra," sê hy.
tgt: i knew i only had one clothing account and no other debt, so i asked for a printout of my profile," he says.

src: mabitsela het gesien dat twee selfoonkontrakte, n banklening van r65 000 en verskeie kleinhandelsrekeninge in sy naam aangegaan is.
tgt: mabitsela saw that two cellphone contracts, a r65 000 bank loan and numerous re tail shop accounts had been opened in his name.

src: die skuld was altesaam nagenoeg r100 000.
tgt: the debt was close to r100 000.

src: "ek het net voor die nasionale vlak5 grendeltydperk my idboek verloor.
tgt: "just before the national level 5 lockdown, i lost my id book.

src: ek het gedink dit is iewers in die huis en was nie te bekommerd nie, want ek het my slimkaartid gehad," sê hy.
tgt: i thought it was somewhere in the house and wasn’t too worried because i had my smart card id," he says.

src: mabitsela het n saak van identiteitsdiefstal by die suidafrikaanse polisiediens (sapd) aanhangig gemaak nadat hy besef het dat iemand op sy naam skuld aangaan.
tgt: after realising that someone was creating debt in his name, mabitsela opened a case of stolen identity at the south african police service (saps).

src: hy moes n beëdigde verklaring aflê wat bevestig dat hy sy identiteitsboek verloor het en moes dit, tesame met sy saaknommer, na die krediteure toe neem om te keer dat hy op die swartlys geplaas word.
tgt: he had to write an affidavit stating that he lost his identity book and take it to credi tors with his case number to avoid being blacklisted.

src: mabitsela se ervaring is nie enig in sy soort nie.
tgt: mabitsela’s experience is not unique.

src: bedrog het, volgens die suidafrikaanse bedrogvoorkomingsdiens (safps) se bedrogverslag vir 2020, verlede jaar met 161% in die ooskaap en met 120% in gauteng gestyg.
tgt: according to the south african fraud prevention service’s (safps) 2020 fraud report, last year fraud increased by 161% in the eastern cape and 120% in gauteng.

src: steun vir besighede en werkers vukuzenzele unnamed om n besigheid te begin en te bedryf is baie soos om n gesin groot te maak.
tgt: support for businesses and workers vukuzenzele unnamed starting and building a business is a lot like raising a family.

src: dit neem van kleintyd tot volwassenheid tyd, geduld, volgehoue ondersteuning en koestering.
tgt: it takes time, patience, con stant support and consistent nurturing from infancy to maturity.

src: dit is vir baie besigheidseie naars hartverskeurend om te sien hoe die besigheid wat jy van niks af begin het en opgebou het, nou sukkel om aan die gang te bly of sy deure moet sluit.
tgt: for many business owners, seeing a business that you grew from scratch struggling to survive, or even being forced to close its doors, is heartbreaking.

src: dit is egter sedert uitbreek van die kovid19pandemie die situasie waarin baie besig hede — groot én klein — hulself bevind; nie net in ons land nie, maar regoor die wêreld.
tgt: since the onset of the covid19 pandemic, this has sadly been the situation facing many businesses both large and small, not just in our country but around the world.

src: die pandemie en die maatreëls wat ons moes instel om die verspreiding van die virus te bekamp, het n nadelige impak op besighede gehad.
tgt: the pandemic and the meas ures we have had to take to contain the spread of the virus have had a detrimental impact on businesses.

src: ons het, soos wat ons die pandemie hanteer, gepoog om n bewysgebaseerde benadering te volg, beide in beleid en praktyk, deur wetenskaplike navorsing, kliniese deskundigheid en vermoëns en daarmee saam ook die impak van die pandemie op alle dele van die bevolking, in oorweging te bring.
tgt: in dealing with the pandemic we have sought to adopt an evidencebased approach in both policy and practice, con sidering scientific research, clinical expertise and capabil ities, and impact on all sectors of the population.

src: ons het gepoog om n balans tussen die red van lewens en die red van mense se lewensbestaan, te handhaaf.
tgt: we have sought to have a balance between saving lives and preserving livelihoods.

src: ons het gepoog om die impak van die opeenvolgende inper kingbeperkings op mense se lewensbestaan te versag en terselfdertyd die risiko van n tweede en selfs erger armoedeen hongersnoodepidemie in die toekoms te vermy.
tgt: we have sought to mitigate the impact of the successive lockdown restrictions on people’s livelihoods, or risk a second and possibly worse epidemic of poverty and hunger in future.

src: ons het laasjaar, aan die begin van die pandemie, maat reëls soos die kovid19 tydelike werkgewer/werknemerverligtingskema (ters), die kovid19leningswaarborgskema en verskeie ander meganismes ingestel om klein besighede te ondersteun en onmiddellike, korttermynverligting aan werknemers en besigheidseienaars te bied.
tgt: in the earliest days last year, we introduced measures such as the covid temporary employer/employee relief scheme (ters), the covid19 loan guarantee scheme and various mechanisms to support small businesses to provide immediate and shortterm relief to burdened employees and business owners.

src: daarbenewens het die spesiale kovid19 maatskaplike noodverligtingstoelaag tesame met meer breedvoerige bestaande maatskaplike toelaes n lewenslyn aan behoeftige individue en gesinne gebied.
tgt: in addition, the special covid19 social relief of distress grant and broadening access to existing social grants provided lifelines to indigent individuals and families.

src: dit was, deur dié ingrypings, vir ons moontlik om die ergste gevolge van die pandemie te versag, die sluiting van baie besighede en daarmee saam ver dere werksverliese, te vermy.
tgt: through these interventions we were able to mitigate the worst effects of the pandemic, preventing the closure of many businesses and the loss of even further jobs.

src: dié ingrypings het n stewige basis vir die ekonomiese heropbouen herstelplan wat ons in oktober laasjaar geloods het, gevorm.
tgt: they pro vided a firm foundation for the economic reconstruction and recovery plan that we launched in october last year.

src: ons het die presidensiële werkskeppingstimulus as deel van daardie plan gestig om inkomsteen lewensbestaansteun aan miljoene begunstigdes te verskaf.
tgt: as part of that plan, we introduced the presidential employment stimulus to provide income and livelihood support to millions of beneficiaries.

src: meer as 300 000 jongmense is, danksy dié stimulus, as skoolassistente aangestel.
tgt: through the stimulus, over 300 000 young people have been placed as school assistants.

src: meer as 100 000 bestaansboere is op die eerste databasis van sy soort geregi streer, waar hulle toegang tot tegniese steun het.
tgt: more than 100 000 subsistence farmers are registered on the firstever database of its kind where they have access to technical support.

src: meer as 30 000 jongmense is geleenthede in die kulturele, kreatiewe en sportsektore gegun.
tgt: more than 30 000 young people have been given opportunities in the cultural, creative and sports sectors.

src: jong beroepsmense is geleenthede in infrastruktuurontwikkeling, gesondheidsorg, omgewingsbewaring en n aantal ander sektore, gegun.
tgt: young professionals have been given opportunities in infrastructure development, healthcare, environmental conservation and a number of other sectors.

src: daar is belowende tekens dat ons ekonomie voortdurend herstel, met groei en werkskepping in n aantal sektore, van ver vaardiging tot mynwese en landbou.
tgt: there are promising indi cations that our economy is steadily recovering, with growth and job creation in a number of sectors, from manufacturing to mining to agriculture.

src: ons weet terselfdertyd dat dié "groter prentjie" nie veel van n vertroosting vir werkers en besigheidseienaars is wat in die afgelope jaar en n half vreeslik swaargekry het en gehoop het om n verbetering in hul omstandighede te sien met die stadige heropening van die ekonomie, nie.
tgt: at the same time we know that this ‘bigger picture’ is cold comfort to workers and business owners who have suffered immeasurably over the past year and a half, and were hoping to see their situa tions improve as the economy slowly opened up.

src: die blitsige styging in infeksies wat deur die nuwe deltavariant aangevuur word, het strenger beperkings op, onder meer, die beweging van mense, die bedryf van sekere soorte besighede en openbare byeenkomste vereis.
tgt: the rapid rise in infections being fueled by the new delta variant necessitated the imposing of tighter restric tions on the movement of persons, on the operation of certain businesses and on public gatherings, among others.

src: dié besluite was nie maklik om te maak nie, gedagtig aan die impak wat dit op mense se lewensbestaan sou hê.
tgt: these were not been easy decisions to make, mindful of their impact on people’s livelihoods.

src: ons het, net soos wat ons aan die begin van die pandemie gedoen het, met al ons maatskaplike vennote en die handel, arbeiden burgerlike samelewing beraadslaag om te sien watter vol houbare finansiële maatreëls ons kon instel om besighede en mense in nood in dié tyd te ondersteun.
tgt: just as we did at the beginning of the pandemic, we engaged in deliberations with all social partners, business, labour and civil society to see what financially sustainable measures we could intro duce to support businesses and individuals in distress at this time.

src: die onderhandelinge by die nasionale ekonomiese, ontwikkelingsen arbeidsraad het tot n konsensus gelei dat die mees praktiese en volhoubare finansiële maatreël wat drin gende verligting kan bring, die verlenging van die kovid19 tersskema in sektore wat deur die aangepaste waarsku wingsvlak 4beperkings geraak word, is.
tgt: the negotiations at the national economic development and labour council resulted in consen sus that the most practical and financially sustainable measure that can provide urgent relief is extending the covid19 ters scheme to sectors that have been affected by the adjusted level 4 restrictions.

src: ons het, as ondersteuning vir besighede, die geldigheid van hulle bedryfslisensies en per mitte wat tussen maart 2020 en junie 2021 verval het, tot 31 desember 2022 verleng.
tgt: to support businesses whose operating licenses and per mits expired between march 2020 and june 2021, we are extending their validity until 31 december 2022. in addition, new business licenses or permits that are issued from the 1 july will also be valid until 31 december 2022, and no license fee will be payable.

src: ons het in die afgelope jaar ook deurlopend daaraan gewerk om kwesbare werkers wie se werke in gedrang was, veral in sektore soos kleinhandel, voedsel en drank en die metaalbedryf wat swaar getref is, te beskerm.
tgt: over the past year, we have also been working consist ently to protect vulnerable workers whose jobs were at risk, particularly in hardhit sectors like retail, food and beverage and the metals industry.

src: sowat 58 00 werke is, deur middel van prosesse wat deur die kommissie vir versoening, bemiddeling en arbitrasie onder steun is, gered.
tgt: through processes facili tated by the commission for conciliation, mediation and arbitration, some 58 000 jobs have been saved.

src: besighede en werkers bly, met geen teken dat die pandemie binnekort te eindig nie, kwesbaar.
tgt: with the pandemic show ing no immediate signs of ending, businesses and work ers remain vulnerable.

src: ons kan, danksy die voortdurende maatskaplike ooreenkomste voortgaan om as staat, handel en arbeid saam te werk om n buffer te skep om werkers en besighede teen die pandemie se ergste ekonomiese impakte te beskerm.
tgt: it is thanks to the social com pacts we continue to forge that government, business and labour have been able to work together to buffer work ers and businesses from the pandemic’s harsh economic impacts.

src: ons eerste prioriteit bly vir nou om lewens te red en te verseker dat ons die nodige steun, binne ons vermoëns, verskaf om te ver hoed dat meer besighede sluit en meer werksgeleenthede verlore gaan.
tgt: for now, our priority is saving lives, and ensuring that we provide the necessary support, within our means, to prevent more businesses closing down and more jobs being lost.

src: sanw veg saam teen kovid19 more matshediso die suidafrikaanse nasionale weermag (sanw) verleen hulp in die stryd teen die koronaviruspandemie in gauteng wat tans die episentrum van die derde kovid19 vlaag is.
tgt: sandf fights covid19 more matshediso the south african national defence force (sandf) is helping fight the coronavirus disease (covid19) pandemic in gauteng, which is currently the epicentre of the third wave.

src: die sanw verskaf steun met massatoetsing, sifting en kon taknasporing onder plaaslike gemeenskappe en verleen ook hulp by hospitale.
tgt: the sandf is assisting with mass community test ing, screening and contact tracing, and is also lending a hand at hospitals.

src: die suidafrikaanse militêre gesondheidsdiens is in die provinsie ontplooi om die druk op gesondheidswerkers te verlig.
tgt: the south african military health service was deployed in the province to ease the burden on healthcare workers.

src: n mediese taakgroep is by die chris hani baragwanath akademiese hospitaal in johannesburg gestasioneer.
tgt: a medical task group has been stationed at chris hani baragwanath academic hospital in johannesburg.

src: die hospitaal is, met dié dat gauteng tot dusver die hoog ste aantal kovid19gevalle tydens die derde vlaag aangeteken het, as n provinsiale gesondheidsfasiliteit verklaar en fokus nou hoofsaaklik op pasiënte met kovid19.
tgt: with gauteng recording the highest number of covid19 cases during the third wave, the hospital was named a pro vincial health facility and is now dedicated to patients with covid19.

src: die mediese taakgroep is eers as voorsorg teen die virus ingeënt voordat hulle hul pligte opgeneem het, terwyl hulle die stygende aantal positiewe gevalle en hospitaalopnames hanteer.
tgt: before assuming their duties, the medical task group had to be vaccinated so that they could be kept safe while handling the increased number of positive cases and hospital admissions.

src: kolonelkommandant fezeka mabona van die mediese taak groep, ook n professionele verpleër, sê dat sy op grondvlak saam met die lede van die groep werk.
tgt: medical task group commander colonel fezeka mabona, who is a professional nurse, says she works on the ground with other members of the group.

src: "die groep bestaan uit verskeie gesondheidsorgdeskundiges, waaronder verpleërs, dokters, kliniese medewerkers en beroepsgesondheiden beroeps veiligheidsdeskundiges," sê sy.
tgt: "the group comprises various healthcare professionals, including nurses, doctors, clinical associates and occu pational health and safety professionals," she says.

src: die meerderheid van die verpleërs het verpleegkwalifikasies op graadvlak met verskillende spesi aliteitsvelde, waaronder primêre gesondheidsorg.
tgt: the majority of the nurses have nursing qualifications at the degree level, with different specialities, including primary healthcare.

src: "sommige van die verpleërs is opgelei vir teaterdiens.
tgt: "some nurses are theatre tr ained.

src: almal van ons het al as algemene verpleërs, vroedmeesters, verpleegop voeders en bestuurders in beide die militêre en die openbare gesondheidsorgstelsel gewerk," voeg sy by.
tgt: all of us have worked as general nurses, midwives, nurse educators and managers in both the military and public health system," she adds.

src: die groep is opgedeel in taakspanne en werk saam met die hospitaalpersoneel in skofte wat deur die behoefte aan versorging by die fasiliteit bepaal word.
tgt: the group is divided into task teams and work with the hospital staff in shifts, according to the demand at the facility.

src: die span verskaf tans gesondheidsorg dienste in ses van die hospitaal se sale.
tgt: the team is currently providing healthcare services in six wards.

src: "die hoeveelheid hospitaal personeel is op die oomblik baie laag in vergelyking met die aantal kovid19gevalle.
tgt: "the hospital staff is quite low to handle the number of cases at the moment.

src: dit is baie belangrik dat ons poog om soveel as moontlik te doen om hulle te help sodat ons saam verdere druk op die gesondheidsorgstelsel kan vermy," sê mabona.
tgt: it is very important for us to try as much as we can to assist them in order for all of us to avoid further strain on the health care system," says mabona.

src: inklusiewe gemeenskappe is noodsaaklik vir sa se sukses vukuzenzele unnamed alhoewel die ge weld en verwoes ting wat dele van kwazulunatal en gauteng onlangs ge teister het, groot skade aan eiendom en mense se lewensbestane be rokken het, het dit ook n reuse impak op die samehorigheid in ons gemeenskappe gehad.
tgt: inclusive communities critical to sa’s success vukuzenzele unnamed while the violence and destruction that engulfed parts of kwazulunatal and gauteng recently caused much damage to property and livelihoods, it also had a huge impact on the cohesion of our communities.

src: dit was veral ooglopend in die tragiese gebeure wat rondom phoenix en ethekwini afgespeel het.
tgt: this was most evident in the tragic events that took place in and around phoenix in ethekwini.

src: tydens die ergste onluste in ons demokrasie, en in n klimaat wat reeds gelaai is met agterdog en paranoia, het mense wat voorheen sy aan sy in relatiewe vrede geleef het, teen mekaar gedraai.
tgt: during some of the worst unrest in our democracy, and in a climate already thick with suspicion and paranoia, people that had lived sidebyside in relative peace turned on each other.

src: daar is nog baie wat aan die lig moet kom oor die gebeure wat plaasgevind het.
tgt: there is still much we have to unearth about the events that took place.

src: die toe name in vals nuus, gedokterde foto’s en foutiewe inligting het dit moeilik gemaak om tussen feit en fiksie te onderskei.
tgt: the proliferation of fake news, doctored images and incorrect information has made it difficult to separate fact from fiction.

src: maar ons weet wel, uit die amptelike verslae en persoon like ervarings van mense, dat mense volgens rasseprofiel uitgesonder is by onwettige padblokkades, dat sommige mense uit hul motors geruk en geslaan is, en dat sommige mense verne der en beledig is.
tgt: but we do know from official reports and personal accounts that people were racially profiled at illegal roadblocks, some people were pulled out of cars and beaten, and some were humiliated and degraded.

src: baie van die dinge wat gebeur het, is die onver mydelike uiteinde wanneer mense die reg in eie hande neem.
tgt: much of what has happened is the inevitable outcome when people take the law into their own hands.

src: eiegeregtigheid en vigilantisme sal nie in hierdie land geduld word nie.
tgt: vigilantism will not be tolerated in this country.

src: dit is onwettig en dit is gevaarlik.
tgt: it is criminal and it is dangerous.

src: noudat rus en vrede in die areas herstel is, is ons wetstoepassingsagentskappe besig om alle kriminele dade te ondersoek.
tgt: now that calm has been restored to the affected areas, our law enforcement agencies are investigating all acts of criminality.

src: n span speurders is aan gestel om die moorde te ondersoek en werk nou saam met die plaaslike gemeenskappe.
tgt: a team of detectives has been assigned to deal with the murders and are working closely with local communities.

src: daar is al inhegtenisnames uitgevoer en diegene wat verantwoordelik is, sal met die volle mag van die reg te doen kry.
tgt: there have been arrests and those responsible will face the full might of the law.

src: n groot deel van die relaas rondom die gebeure in phoenix is oorheers deur pogings om een ras teen n ander op te stook.
tgt: much of the narrative around the events in phoenix has been dominated by attempts to turn one race against another.

src: dit is aangeblaas deur naamlose mense wat buitensporige aantygings op sosiale media en boodskapgroepe ge maak het en wraaklustig heid onder mense gesaai het.
tgt: it has been stoked by anonymous people on social media and in messaging groups making outrageous claims and calling for revenge.

src: daar is n poging om dit te laat blyk as die ineenstorting van rasseverhoudinge tussen afrikaen indi ërgemeenskappe.
tgt: there is an attempt to present this as a sign of imploding race relations between african and indian communities.

src: net soos daar mense was wat probeer het om mense se weerloosheid uit te buit en chaos te veroorsaak, is daar diegene wat kriminele dade volgens rasseterme wou voorhou om hul eie agenda te dien.
tgt: just as there were people who tried to exploit people’s vulnerability and cause mayhem, there are those who want to present criminal acts in racial terms to serve their own purposes.

src: hulle sal nie slaag nie.
tgt: they will not succeed.

src: suidafrika het n trotse geskiedenis van begin selvaste, nierassige en werkersklassolidariteit.
tgt: south africa has a proud history of principled nonracialism and working class solidarity.

src: afrikaen indi ërgemeen skappe is verenig in die stryd teen apartheid en, tesame met ander gemeenskappe, bly verbind tot n verenigde en demokratiese samelewing.
tgt: african and indian communities were united in the struggle against apartheid and, together with other communities, remain committed to a united and democratic society.

src: in antwoord op die vrees en wantroue werk die mense van phoenix en die aan grensende bhambayi, zwelitsha en amaoti hard daaraan om die skade te herstel.
tgt: in response to the fear and mistrust, the people of phoenix and the neighbouring areas of bhambayi, zwelitsha and amaoti are working to repair the damage.

src: met behulp van n vredes forum wat deur die suid afrikaanse polisiediens op die been gebring is, in vennootskap met gemeenskapsleiers, het die gemeenskappe byeen gekom om diegene te ondersteun wat deur die onrus geraak is en om gesprekskanale te skep.
tgt: aided by a peace forum established by the south african police service in partnership with community leaders, the communities have come together to support those affected by the unrest and to open channels of dialogue.

src: dit is nie die enigste deel van die land wat voor sulke uitdagings staan nie.
tgt: this is not the only part of the country that is confronted with such challenges.

src: ons pogings om geïnte greerde gemeenskappe te bou word bemoeilik deur die nalatenskap van die beplanning onder apartheid en voortdurende ongelykheid.
tgt: our efforts to build integrated communities are frustrated by the legacy of apartheid planning and persistent inequality.

src: ons stede, dorpe en landelike gebiede word steeds verdeel op gronde van ras sowel as klas.
tgt: our cities, towns and rural areas are still all divided by both race and class.

src: dit ontmoe dig samewerking en begrip, en is n remskoen in ons poging om n nierassige samelewing te bou.
tgt: this discourages cooperation and understanding, and hampers the work we have undertaken to build a nonracial society.

src: om hierdie ruimtelike verwrongenheid reg te stel, moet n deel van ons werk wees om n inklusiewe ekonomie te bou en die lewenstoestande van alle suidafrikaners te verbeter.
tgt: correcting these spatial distortions must be part of our work of building an inclusive economy and improving the living conditions of all south africans.

src: dit is waarom ons hard werk om florerende informele nedersettings en landelike ekonomieë te vestig en fokus op die groei van kleinsakeondernemings.
tgt: it is why we are working to build flourishing township and rural economies, and focusing on the growth of small businesses.

src: dit is waarom ons in infra struktuur in hierdie areas belê en werk om diensver skaffing te verbeter.
tgt: it is why we are investing in infrastructure in these areas and working to improve the provision of services.

src: terselfdertyd moet ons ras sisme in ons samelewing konfronteer.
tgt: at the same time, we need to confront racism in our society.

src: ons moet eer like gesprekke hê, nie net oor ons gesindhede teenoor mekaar nie, maar ook oor die materiële toestande wat ons verdeel.
tgt: we need to have honest conversations not only about our attitudes to one another, but also about the material conditions that divide us.

src: solank as wat die verdeling van rykdom en geleenthede in suidafrika nog grootliks deur ras en geslag bepaal word, sal ons nie in staat wees om n werklik verenigde nasie te kan bou nie.
tgt: for as long as the division of wealth and opportunity in south africa is largely still determined by race and gender, we will not be able to build a truly united nation.

src: die gebeure in phoenix is n pynlike herinnering aan hoe veel werk ons nog moet doen om inklusiewe gemeenskappe te bou waar die grense van die verlede suksesvol afge breek is.
tgt: the events in phoenix are a painful reminder of how much work we still need to do to build inclusive communities that have successfully broken down the boundaries of the past.

src: hierdie gebeure toon ook hoe vasberade sommige mense is om ons te verdeel, en hoe ons alles in die stryd moet werp om hulle te weer staan.
tgt: these events also demonstrate how determined some people are to divide us, and how we need to do everything we can to resist them.

src: dit is ons gesamentlike ver antwoordelikheid om hierdie gemeenskappe in ethekwini en elders te ondersteun in hul reis na versoening en genesing.
tgt: it is our collective responsibility to support these communities in ethekwini and elsewhere in their journey towards reconciliation and healing.

src: ons demokrasie is gebou deur brugbouers en vrede makers.
tgt: our democracy was built by peacemakers and bridgebuilders.

src: die argitekte van ons vryheid was waagmoedige afrika, indiër, kleurlingen wit mans en vrouens wat die pad van versoening bo vergelding gekies het, wat vrede bo oorlog gestel het.
tgt: the architects of our freedom were african, indian, coloured and white men and women of great courage who chose the path of reconciliation over retribution, and of peace over war.

src: help leerders om hul pad te vind deur kovid19 more matshediso onderwysouers en opvoeders kan leerders help om die angs en depressie wat hulle weens die koronaviruspandemie ervaar, te hanteer.
tgt: help learners cope with covid19 vukuzenzele unnamed parents and teachers can help learners cope with the anxiety and depression they are experiencing because of the coronavirus disease pandemic.

src: na aanleiding van die uitbreek van die koronavirus pandemie (kovid19) en die beperkings tydens die grendeltyd is leer ders met baie uitdagings gekonfronteer.
tgt: more matshediso learners have been faced with many challenges as a result of the coronavirus disease (covid19) and the lockdown restrictions.

src: die konstante verandering in die leeromgewing van suidafrikaanse skole kon en kan steeds tot angstigheid en vrees onder leerders lei.
tgt: there has been constant change in the learning environment at south africa’s schools, which can leave learners feeling anxious and fearful.

src: leerders moes aan n nuwe wêreld van aanlynleer wat soms ongereeld was en uitgestelde skoolbywoning, sosiale isolasie, verlies, rou en trauma gewoond raak, wat alles aanleiding kan gee tot n toename in angs en depressie.
tgt: learners have had to navigate a new world of online or delayed learning, social isolation, loss, grief and trauma, all of which can cause increased anxiety and depression.

src: boitumelo tlhapane, n voorligtingsielkundige aan die inklusiewe onderwyseen heid (ieu) van die vrystaatse onderwysdepartement, sê dat dit verstaanbaar is dat leerders angstig en depressief kan voel in hierdie moeilike tye.
tgt: counselling psychologist boitumelo tlhapane, who works for the inclusive education unit at the free state department of education, says feeling anxious or depressed during these trying times is understandable.

src: "in die afgelope ongeveer jaar en n half moes leerders by n nuwe manier van leer aanpas, met minder kontaken onderrigtyd.
tgt: "for about ayearandahalf now, learners have had to adjust to a new way of learning, with less contact and teaching time.

src: "baie leerders moes onaf hanklik studeer terwyl hulle met onsekerheid oor hul toekoms en die impak van kovid19 op hul drome, gesinne en sosiale lewe moes saamleef," sê tlhapane.
tgt: "many have had to study independently, while living with uncertainty about their future and the impact of covid19 on their hopes and dreams, family and social life," says tlhapane.

src: hanteer dit só sy verduidelik dat angs die vrees vir iets of die bekom mernis oor iets is waarvan die uitkoms onseker is.
tgt: how to cope she explains that anxiety is the fear of or worrying about something that has an uncertain outcome.

src: om leerders te help om dit te hanteer, bied sy die volgende raad: l verstaan dat dit normaal is om angstig of bang te wees.
tgt: to help learners to cope, she offers the following advice: understand that it is normal to be anxious or fearful.

src: dit beteken nie dat jy swak is nie.
tgt: this does not mean that you are weak.

src: l wat van belang is, is dít wat jy met jou vrees doen.
tgt: what you do with your fear is what is important.

src: kom jy al die kovid19reëls na wat in plek gestel is om jou en ander mense se veiligheid te verseker?
tgt: are you obeying all the covid19 rules that have put in place to protect you and others?

src: wat kan jy nog doen om jou en ander mense se veilig heid te verseker?
tgt: what else can you do to ensure your and others’ safety?

src: l het jy betroubare inligting oor kovid19 in geval jy of n geliefde siek word?
tgt: do you have reliable information about covid19 in case you or a loved one gets infected?

src: l het jy die ondersteuning van onderwysers, familie en vriende om jou te help wan neer jy onseker, gespanne of angstig voel?
tgt: do you have the support of teachers, family and friends to help you when you feel uncertain or stressed or anxious?

src: dit is baie belangrik.
tgt: this is very important.

src: onderwysers kan ook niekontakondersteuning bied deur middel van aanlyn materiaal en studiegroepe, om leerders gereeld te herinner en te motiveer om tuis te studeer en om hulle aan te moedig om hul vrese rondom skoolgaan te kom munikeer.
tgt: teachers can also provide noncontact support and learning through online material and study groups; by setting up reminders to motivate learners to study at home; and by encouraging them to communicate their fears about schooling.

src: "dit is belangrik, veral vir vakke wat hulle uitdagend vind," voeg sy by.
tgt: "this is important, especially for subjects that learners find challenging," she adds.

src: familie en vriende kan emo sionele ondersteuning aan leerders bied in die vorm van aanmoediging en deurlopende gerusstelling, sê tlhapane.
tgt: family and friends can provide learners with emotional support, in the form of encouragement and constant reassurance, says tlhapane.

src: "leerders moet voortdu rend daaraan herinner word dat hul moeite en toewyding raakgesien en waardeer word; sodoende bou dit hulle self vertroue.
tgt: "learners need to be constantly reminded that their efforts and dedication are recognised and appreciated, thus increasing their confidence.

src: "hoe om angstigheid te vermindertlhapane sê daar is verskeie maniere waarop ouers en leer ders angstigheid kan beperk.
tgt: "how to reduce anxietytlhapane says there are various ways that parents and learners can reduce anxiety.

src: dit sluit die volgende in:l maak seker daar is n streng roetine met betrekking tot studeer, slaap en sosiali sering.
tgt: these include: ensure that there is a strict routine for studying, sleeping and socialising.

src: dit sal leerders help om hul doelwitte te bereik en sperdatums te haal, terwyl dit hulle help om in beheer van hul studies te voel.
tgt: this will help learners meet their goals and deadlines, while helping them to feel in control of their studies.

src: l leerders moet gebruik maak van alle beskikbare hulpbronne wat deur die skool en opvoedkundige programme aangebied word, in lyn met die kur rikulum, wat op die televisie en radio uitgesaai word.
tgt: learners must use all of the available resources provided at school and on educational programmes, in line with the curriculum, that are broadcast on television and radio.

src: l ouers kan help deur toe te sien dat leerders nie te veel blootgestel word aan kovid19nuus nie, veral rondom die sterftesyfer en die samesweringsteo rieë wat die rondtes doen, aangesien dit hul vrese kan aanblaas en tot meer gees teskwelling kan lei.
tgt: parents can assist by ensuring that learners are not overexposed to covid19 news, especially around death and conspiracy theories, as this may fuel their fears and lead to more psychological conditions.

src: l leerders behoort hul bloot stelling en deelname aan sosiale media te beperk, aangesien kosbare studie tyd verlore gaan en dit die aandag van hul studies aftrek.
tgt: learners should limit social media consumption, as it wastes study time and is a major distraction.

src: l die gesin kan hul lewenstyl aanpas deur selfsorgtake soos fisiese oefening en speel in te bring.
tgt: the family can adapt their lifestyle by adding selfcare tasks, such as physical exercise and play.

src: "indien n leerder n geliefde verloor, mag hulle simp tome van droefheid ervaar soortgelyk aan depressie of angstigheid.
tgt: "if a learner loses a loved one, they may experience grief symptoms that resemble depression or anxiety.

src: "dit is belangrik dat die skool en die ouers hierdie leerders verwys vir psigososiale ondersteuning wat deur die departement van basiese onderwys aangebied word, of gratis hulpbronne of die plaaslike kliniek vir n verwy sing raadpleeg," sê tlhapane.
tgt: "it is important that the school and the parents refer these learners for psychosocial support, which is provided by the department of basic education, or consult free resources or local clinics for a referral," says tlhapane.

src: kweltekens ouers moet bedag wees op verskeie tekens wat kan aandui dat die leerder hulp benodig.
tgt: signs of distress parents should be alert and watch for various signs that may indicate that their child is in distress.

src: l ongereelde eeten slaap patrone.
tgt: irregular eating and sleep patterns.

src: deur aanmekaar te huil, geïrri teerd te wees of maklik hul humeur te verloor.
tgt: being overly emotional, such as constantly crying, irritable moods or losing their temper quickly.

src: l sukkel om te konsentreer.
tgt: struggling to concentrate.

src: l voltooi nie take en huiswerk nie.
tgt: not completing tasks and homework.

src: l gedragsprobleme soos aggressie.
tgt: behavioural problems, such as aggressiveness.

src: l dink verskonings uit om nie skool toe te gaan nie.
tgt: making up excuses not to go to school.

src: om n samelewing vry van staatskaping te bou vukuzenzele unnamed die geskeduleerde verhore van die regterlike kommissie van ondersoek na staatskaping het onlangs ten einde geloop, meer as 1 000 dae nadat die eerste getuienis aangehoor is.
tgt: building a society free of state capture vukuzenzele unnamed the scheduled hearings of the judicial commission of inquiry into allegations of state capture, corruption and fraud in the public sector, including organs of state, recently ended, more than 1 000 days after the first witness testimony was heard.

src: alhoewel die kommissie se voorsitter, adjunkhoofregter, raymond zondo, gesê het dat dit nodig mag wees dat daar nog n paar persone se getuienis aangehoor word, is die kommissie se werk nou een tree nader aan voltooiing.
tgt: while the commission’s chairperson, deputy chief justice raymond zondo has said it may be necessary for a few more witnesses to testify, the work of the commission is now one step closer to completion.

src: dit is n belangrike mylpaal wat ons nog nader bring aan afrekening met een van die mees vernietigende episodes in die geskiedenis van ons demokrasie.
tgt: this is a significant milestone that brings us ever closer to a reckoning with one of the most ruinous episodes in the history of our democracy.

src: selfs nog voordat regter zondo sy bevindings en aanbevelings aan die president voorlê, sal ons almal saam stem dat die kommissie se werk van onskatbare waarde was.
tgt: even before judge zondo submits his findings and recommendations to the president, we can all agree that the commission’s work has been invaluable.

src: oor die verloop van drie jaar het ons gedetailleerde getuienis aangehoor van beweerde dade van korrupsie op n massiewe skaal.
tgt: over the course of three years, we have heard testimony detailing alleged acts of corruption on a massive scale.

src: ons het gehoor van aksies wat gelei het tot die diefstal van miljarde rande se staatsgeld.
tgt: we have heard about actions that resulted in the theft of billions of rands of public money.

src: ons het gehoor hoeveel instansies en staatsbeheerde maatskappye opsetlik verswak is.
tgt: we have heard how many public institutions and stateowned companies were deliberately weakened.

src: hierdie blootlegging van die aard, omvang en diepte van staatskaping het nie agter geslote deure plaasgevind nie, maar is oor die hele land uitgesaai.
tgt: this exposure of the nature, extent and depth of state capture did not take place behind closed doors, but was broadcast to the entire country.

src: deur toe te laat dat suidafrikaners die kommissie se verrigtinge volg, het dit gehelp om openbare vertroue in ons demokrasie by die publiek in te boesem deur die wyse waarop dit openheid en deursigtigheid bevorder.
tgt: by allowing all south africans to follow the commission’s proceedings, it has helped to instil public confidence in our democracy in the way it promotes openness and transparency.

src: die land is groot dank verskuldig aan almal wat betrokke was by die werk van die kom missie — vanaf diegene wat n massiewe hoeveelheid inligting moes ondersoek, navors en saamstel, die talle getuies wat getuig en bewyse voorgelê het, die joernaliste wat ywerig verslaggedoen het oor die verrigtinge tot die prokureurs wat getuienis help aanbied het.
tgt: the country owes a debt of gratitude to all who were involved in the work of the commission; from those who investigated, researched and compiled a huge amount of information; to the many witnesses who testified and provided evidence; to the journalists who diligently reported on the proceedings; to the lawyers who helped present evidence.

src: ons is ook dank verskuldig aan die talle individue, waarvan sommige onbekend is, wie se optrede in die eerste plek tot die totstandkoming van die kommissie gelei het.
tgt: we also owe a debt of gratitude to the many individuals, some of whom remain unknown, whose actions led to the establishment of the commission in the first place.

src: dit is diegene wat hierdie kriminele dade aan die lig gebring het, wat weerstand gebied het, wat uitgepraat het en veldtogte begin het — sowel in die openbaar as agter die skerms — om staatskaping tot n einde te bring.
tgt: these are the people who unearthed these alleged criminal acts, who resisted, who spoke out and who took up campaigns – both public and behind the scenes – to end state capture.

src: dit is danksy hulle dat ons nou van staatskaping in die verlede tyd kan praat.
tgt: it is thanks to them that we now speak of state capture in the past tense.

src: staatskaping het nie vanself tot n einde gekom nie.
tgt: state capture did not end of its own accord.

src: dit is tot n einde gebring deur die gesamentlike dade van suidafrikaners uit alle vlakke van die samelewing wat op verskeie terreine saamgewerk het om die waardes van ons grondwetlike demokrasie te herstel en die onus rus op ons almal om te verseker dat hierdie praktyke nooit weer herhaal sal word nie.
tgt: it was brought to an end by the concerted actions of south africans from all walks of life, working in various areas to restore the values of our constitutional democracy.

src: ons het oor die afgelope drie jaar verskeie belangrike stappe geneem om korrupsie en staatskaping aan te pak.
tgt: over the past three years, we have taken several important steps to tackle corruption and state capture.

src: ons het liggame soos die nasionale vervolgingsgesag (nvg), die suidafrikaanse polisiediens (sapd), die suidafrikaanse inkomstediens (said) en ander met noukeurigheid begin herop bou.
tgt: we have been painstakingly rebuilding bodies like the national prosecuting authority (npa), the south african police service, the south african revenue service and others.

src: ons het nuwe strukture opgerig, soos die ondersoek direktoraat van die nvg om hoëvlakkorrupsie te vervolg en die soe se spesiale beslissingsraad om gesteelde staatsfondse terug te win.
tgt: we have set up new structures, like the investigating directorate in the npa to prosecute highlevel corruption and the special investigating unit (siu) special tribunal to recover stolen public funds.

src: ons het ons misdaadbestrydings kapasiteit verbeter deur die totstandkoming van die verbindingsentrum wat verskeie wetstoepassingsagentskappe bymekaar bring om inligting te deel en die ondersoek en vervolging van misdaad te koördineer.
tgt: we have improved our crimefighting capacity through the establishment of the fusion centre, which brings together various lawenforcement agencies to share information and coordinate the investigation and prosecution of crime.

src: ons het die leierskap van verskeie strategiese staats beheerde ondernemings verander en het die proses begin om hulle finansiële en operasionele gesondheid te herstel.
tgt: we have changed the leadership at several strategic stateowned enterprises (soes), and begun the process of restoring them to financial and operational health.

src: ons kyk na n nuwe sbomodel wat groter deursigtigheid, verantwoord baarheid en volhoubaarheid bevorder.
tgt: we are working towards a new soe model that promotes greater transparency, accountability and sustainability.

src: baie van hierdie werk is van voortgaande aard.
tgt: much of this work is ongoing.

src: daar is gebiede waar die vorde ring baie stadiger is as wat ons wou hê, en hierdie areas geniet nou groter aandag.
tgt: there are areas where progress has been far slower than we would have hoped, and these are now receiving closer attention.

src: die bevindinge en aanbeve lings van die kommissie sal hierdie pogings ongetwyfeld versterk.
tgt: the findings and recommendations of the commission will undoubtedly strengthen these efforts.

src: ons verwag dat die kommissie sommige van die sistemiese swakplekke wat staatskaping moontlik gemaak het, sal identifiseer.
tgt: we expect that the commission will identify some of the systemic weaknesses that allowed state capture to take place.

src: dit sal ons in staat stel om verdere korrektiewe maatreëls te implementeer.
tgt: this will empower us to take further corrective measures.

src: alhoewel ons kan sê dat die era van staatskaping verby is, het ons nog nie korrupsie oorwin nie.
tgt: while we can say that the era of state capture is over, we have not defeated corruption.

src: bedrog en korrup sie bly diep ingebed in sowel die openbare as die privaat sektor.
tgt: fraud and corruption remain pervasive and deeply entrenched in both the public and private sectors.

src: alhoewel dit nie op die skaal van staatskaping lê nie, kom sulke kriminele aktiwiteite ons land duur te staan, verswak ons instellings en ontneem dit suidafrikaners van baie basiese behoeftes.
tgt: although it may not be on the scale of state capture, such criminal activities cost our country greatly, weaken our institutions and deprive south africans of many basic needs.

src: korrupsie is ten beste immo reel, maar dit sny nog dieper ten tyde van n humanitêre krisis.
tgt: corruption is deeply immoral at the best of times, but takes on a greater depravity in the midst of a humanitarian crisis.

src: n mens praat hier van die afskuwelike dade van korrupsie, verlede jaar, in die verkryging van goedere en dienste wat nodig was in ons stryd teen die kovid19pandemie.
tgt: one speaks here of the despicable acts of corruption last year in the procurement of goods and services needed for our fight against the covid19 pandemic.

src: ons het vinnig opgetree om sodanige korrupsie te staak, om diegene wat verantwoordelik is te identifiseer en teen hulle op te tree.
tgt: we acted swiftly to stop such corruption, to identify those responsible and to take action against them.

src: dit is n bewys van ons toewyding om kor rupsie uit te roei.
tgt: this is proof of our commitment to root out corruption.

src: ons het die tesourieregulasies verskerp, die verbindingsentrum gestig en die spesiale ondersoekeenheid (soe) n breë mandaat gegee om alle kovid19ver wante korrupsiebewerings te ondersoek.
tgt: we tightened up treasury regulations, established the fusion centre and gave the siu a wideranging mandate to investigate all covid19related corruption allegations.

src: in wat as n eerste vir die land beskou word, het ons al die besonderhede van alle kovid19ver krygingskontrakte van alle staatsentiteite aanlyn gepubliseer.
tgt: in a first for the country, we also published online the details of all covid19 procurement contracts across all public entities.

src: die skade wat aan ons land aangerig is deur staatskaping, is diepliggend.
tgt: the damage done to our country by state capture is deep.

src: help om selfmoord tevoorkom allison cooper meer mense sterf as gevolg van selfmoord as van miv, malaria, borskanker, oorlog en moord.
tgt: help prevent suicide allison cooper more people die as a result of suicide than hiv, malaria, breast cancer, war and homicide.

src: dit is volgens die wêreld gesondheidsorganisasie (wgo) se jongste stati stieke wat aantoon dat meer as 700 000 mense jaarliks weens selfmoord sterf — dit is een uit elke 100 sterftes en ongeveer een persoon elke 40 sekondes.
tgt: this is according to the world health organisation’s (who) latest statistics, which show that over 700 000 people die by suicide each year – that is one in every 100 deaths and approximately one person every 40 seconds.

src: "ons kan nie — en moenie — selfmoord ignoreer nie," sê dr. tedros adhanom ghebreyesus, direkteurgeneraal van die wgo.
tgt: "we cannot – and must not – ignore suicide," says dr tedros adhanom ghebreyesus, directorgeneral of the who.

src: "elke selfmoord is n tragedie.
tgt: "each one is a tragedy.

src: dit is nou nog belangriker om ons aandag op selfmoord voorkoming te vestig ná baie maande waarin ons met die koronaviruspandemie moet saamleef, met baie van die risikofaktore vir selfmoord — werksverlies, finansiële stres en sosiale isolasie — wat nog steeds deel van ons lewens uitmaak," sê hy.
tgt: our attention to suicide prevention is even more important now, after many months of living with the coronavirus disease pandemic, with many of the risk factors for suicide – job loss, financial stress and social isolation – still very much present," he adds.

src: wêreldselfmoordvoorko mingsdagwêreldselfmoordvoorko mingsdag is op 10 september 2003 by die internasionale vereniging vir selfmoordvoor koming (iasp) bekendgestel.
tgt: world suicide prevention dayworld suicide prevention day was launched on 10 september 2003, by the international association for suicide prevention.

src: hulle doel is om selfmoord en selfmoordneigings te voor kom, die gevolge te verlig en n forum vir akademici, geestesgesondheidsdeskundiges, krisiswerkers, vrywilligers en selfmoordoorlewendes te bied.
tgt: it aims to prevent suicide and suicidal beha viour, alleviate its effects and provides a forum for academics, mental health professionals, crisis workers, volunteers and suicide survivors.

src: volgens die suidafrikaanse depressieen angsgroep (sadag) word daar daagliks 23 selfmoordgevalle en 230 ernstige selfmoordpogings in suidafrika aangeteken.
tgt: according to the south african depression and anxiety group (sadag), there are 23 suicides and 230 serious suicide attempts recorded in south africa daily.

src: "selfmoord is nog steeds n verbode onderwerp in ons samelewing — niemand wil daaroor praat nie; niemand weet hoe om daaroor te praat nie en ouers wil nie met hulle kinders daaroor praat nie in geval dit ‘idees’ in hulle koppe plant.
tgt: "suicide is still a very taboo topic in our society – no one wants to talk about it; no one knows how to talk about it and parents don’t want to talk to their children about it in case it ‘plants ideas’.

src: dit is egter werklik n kwessie en is duidelik te sien aan die toename in die aantal daaglikse oproepe wat ons kry," sê cassey chambers, sadag se uitvoerende direk teur.
tgt: however, it is a very real issue, and can be seen by the increasing daily calls we receive," says cassey chambers, sadag’s operations director.

src: "as meer mense bewus is van selfmoord en weet hoe om hulp vir iemand te kry voordat dit te laat is, kan ons help om die selfmoordsyfer af te bring," sê sy.
tgt: "if more people are aware of suicide and know how to get someone help before it’s too late, we can help reduce the suicide rate," she says.

src: moontlike waarskuwingste kens vir selfmoord sluit in:l praat oor beëindiging van hulle lewe, om te sterf of selfmoord.
tgt: possible suicide warning signs include: talking about ending one's life, dying or suicide.

src: l sterk begeerte om te sterf of n preokkupasie met dood en sterfte.
tgt: strong wish to die or a preoccupation with death and dying.

src: l gee kosbare besittings weg.
tgt: giving away prized possessions.

src: l tekens van depressie soos buierigheid, hooploosheid, onttrekking, swak eetlus en om slegs te slaap en belang in alledaagse aktiwiteite te verloor.
tgt: signs of depression, such as moodiness, hopelessness, withdrawal, difficul ty with appetite and sleep, and loss of interest in usual activities.

src: suidafrika huldig oopvlekkers vukuzenzele unnamed in die afgelope drie jaar sedert die kommissie van ondersoek na staatskaping afgeskop het, het ons te hore gekom van die uiterstes waartoe die oortreders wat korrupsie gepleeg het, gegaan het om hul misdade weg te steek.
tgt: sa salutes whistleblowers vukuzenzele unnamed over the course of the three years, since the commission of inquiry into state capture started its work, we have heard of the lengths to which the perpetrators of corrupt acts have gone to conceal their misdeeds.

src: dit was n uiterse ingewik kelde taak om die strekking van die netwerke van invloed wat korrupsie bemoontlik het, te ontrafel.
tgt: it has been an extremely complex undertaking to unravel the networks of influence that enabled corruption.

src: onder meer is talle frontmaatskappye gestig om fondse rond te skuif en beta lings aan politiesinvloedryke individue te verskans.
tgt: among other things, vast webs of front companies were established to move funds around and disguise payments made to politicallyconnected individuals.

src: dieselfde patrone is gesien in verskeie onder soeke na korrupsie wat onderneem is deur die spe siale ondersoekeenheid, die direktoraat van prioriteitsmis daadondersoek, die nasionale vervolgingsowerheid (nvo) se ondersoekdirektoraat en andere.
tgt: the same patterns have been seen in a number of investigations into corruption being undertaken by the special investigating unit (siu) the directorate for priority crime investigation, the national prosecuting authority's (npa) investigating directorate and others.

src: namate hierdie ondersoeke gevorder het en die strop al nouer getrek het om individue wat in hierdie misdade ver wikkel is, het ons ook gesien hoe ooggetuies gedreig is, hul families geïntimideer is, hulle geforseer is om weg te kruip, en selfs vermoor is.
tgt: as these investigations progressed and the net began to close on implicated individuals, we have seen witnesses being threatened, their families intimidated, being forced into hiding, and even killed.

src: die moord op babita deoka ran, n senior finansiesbeampte in die gautengse departement van gesondheid, beklemtoon weereens wát alles op die spel geplaas word in ons gesa mentlike poging om hierdie kanker uit ons samelewing te sny.
tgt: the murder of babita deokaran, a senior finance official in the gauteng health department, is a stark reminder of the high stakes involved in our collective quest to remove this cancer from our society.

src: alhoewel ons nog nie weet wat die beweegrede agter haar moord is nie, weet ons dat sy n sleutelgetuie was in n soeondersoek na die verkryging van persoonlike veiligheids toerusting in die departement.
tgt: while we do not yet know the motive for her murder, she was a key witness in a siu investigation into the procurement of personal protective equipment in the department.

src: die sapd en privaat sekuri teitspanne wat onlangs sewe verdagtes vasgetrek het, moet geprys word vir hul harde werk.
tgt: the saps and the private security teams who apprehended seven suspects recently are to be commended for their work.

src: die dossier is oorgegee aan die valke en die ondersoek sal hopelik verdere lig werp op die rede waarom me.
tgt: the docket has been transferred to the hawks, and the investigation will yield further information on why ms deokaran was murdered.

src: deokaran n heldin en n patriot, so ook die krygsmag oopvlek kers wat, teen groot eie risiko, help om gevalle van misdaad, wanadministrasie, baantjies vir boeties en diefstal aan die kaak te stel.
tgt: as are the legions of whistleblowers who, at great risk to themselves, help to unearth instances of misdeeds, maladministration, cronyism and theft.

src: sonder hul dapper en begin selvaste intrede sou ons nie in staat wees om diegene wat korrupsie pleeg, te ontmasker nie.
tgt: without their brave and principled interventions, we would be unable to unmask those committing corruption.

src: alhoewel die aandag die afgelope ruk merendeels op oopvlekkers in die openbare sektor gevestig is, is ons ook dankbaarheid verskuldig aan dié in die privaat sektor wie se optrede minder aandag geniet het, maar net so belangrik is.
tgt: though much focus in recent times has been on whistleblowers in the public sector, we also owe a debt of gratitude to those in the private sector whose actions receive less attention, but are equally important.

src: oopvlekkers is belangrike bewakers van ons demokra sie.
tgt: whistleblowers are important guardians of our democracy.

src: hulle maak alarm teen onetiese dade en praktyke in die regering en organisasies.
tgt: they raise the alarm against unethical acts and practices in government and organisations.

src: hulle kom op en maak stem dik in goedertrou en met die billike verwagting dat daar nie net opgetree sal word na aan leiding van hul onthullings nie, maar dat hulle ook beskerm sal word en nie geviktimiseer of vooroordeel sal word nie.
tgt: they speak out in good faith and with a reasonable expectation not only that action will be taken on their disclosures, but that they will be protected and not suffer victimisation or prejudice.

src: in suidafrika is daar breed voerige wetlike beskerming vir oopvlekkers, waaronder by wyse van die wet op beskerm ende bekendmakings, die wet op arbeidsverhoudinge, die maatskappywet, die wet op beskerming teen teistering asook die grondwet self.
tgt: in south africa there is extensive legislative protection for whistleblowers, including through the protected disclosures act, labour relations act, companies act, protection against harassment act, and the constitution itself.

src: daarbenewens verskaf die kantoor vir getuiebeskerming wat deur die departement van justisie en korrektiewe diens te in samewerking met ander wetstoepassingsagentskappe bestuur word, steun aan weerlose getuies en getuies wat tydens enige regsprosesse geïntimideer word.
tgt: in addition, the department of justice and correctional services, working with other lawenforcement agencies, administers the office of witness protection to provide support to vulnerable and intimidated witnesses in any judicial proceedings.

src: om die getuiebeskermingsprogram te betree is vrywillig en nóg die sapd nóg die nvo kan n getuie daarin forseer nie.
tgt: entering witness protection is voluntary, and neither the saps nor the npa can compel a witness to do so.

src: sou n getuie lewensdrei gemente ontvang of onveilig voel, moet hulle die speurders in kennis stel en aansoek om die program doen.
tgt: should a witness receive threats to their life or feel unsafe, they have to inform investigators and apply for admission to the programme.

src: hierdie suksesvolle program het al meermale sedert die stigting daarvan n sleutelrol gespeel om suksesvolle vervolgings te verseker, veral met betrekking tot georganiseerde misdaad.
tgt: this successful programme has played a key role in securing successful prosecutions since its inception, particularly with regards to organised crime.

src: dit is duidelik dat, soos wat die stryd teen korrupsie momentum bou, ons drin gend ons huidige benadering tot nie slegs die beskerming van getuies nie, maar ook die beskerming van oopvlekkers in die algemeen moet hersien.
tgt: it is clear that as the fight against corruption gathers momentum, we need to urgently review our current approach not only to witness protection, but also to the broader protection of whistleblowers.

src: alhoewel verskeie stelsels in plek gestel is om oopvlekkers toe te laat om inligting ano niem te onthul, moet ons die huidige stelsels verskerp en meer ondersteuning lewer aan diegene wat in die openbaar met inligting na vore kom.
tgt: while numerous systems are in place to enable whistleblowers to report anonymously, we need to tighten up existing systems and provide greater support to those who publicly come forward with information.

src: as samelewing moet ons vasstel waar ons huidige wetgewing en beleide ontoerei kend is om die lewensbestaan, reputasies en veiligheid van oopvlekkers te beskerm en saam werk om dit aan te spreek.
tgt: as society, we need to identify where existing laws and policies are inadequate in protecting the livelihoods, reputations and safety of whistleblowers – and work together to address these.

src: kriminele wat oopvlekkers teiken het nie net ten doel om sekere individue stil te maak nie — hulle wil ook n boodskap stuur aan ander voornemende oopvlekkers.
tgt: the intent of the criminals who target whistleblowers is not only to silence particular individuals – it is also to send a message to other potential whistleblowers.

src: dag na dag staan suidafrikaners soos babita deokaran vas; hulle weier om deel te wees van korrupsie en is bereid om as getuies teen dit te staan.
tgt: day by day, brave south africans like babita deokaran are standing firm that they will not be party to corruption and they are prepared to bear witness against it.

src: as suidafrikaners bring ons hulde aan haar en al die ander oopvlekkers in die openbare en privaat sektor wat korrupsie ontbloot.
tgt: as the south african people, we salute her and all the whistleblowers in the public and private sectors who are exposing corruption to the harshest of glares.

src: hulle doen dit sonder om erkenning of vergoeding te verwag.
tgt: they are doing so without expectation of acknowledgement or reward.

src: dít is die hoogste vorm van openbare diens.
tgt: theirs is the highest form of public service.

src: ons kan hulle nie in die steek laat nie.
tgt: we cannot let them down.

src: let op na kinderkanker se waarkuwingstekens allison cooper kinderkanker is wêreldwyd aan die styg, met n beraamde een uit elke 408 kinders wêreldwyd wat voor die ouderdom van agt jaar met kanker gediagnoseer word.
tgt: spot childhood cancer warning signs allison cooper childhood cancer is on the rise globally, with an esti mated one in 408 children worldwide diagnosed with cancer before the age of 15. according to taryn seegers, the communications coordinator at the childhood cancer foundation of south africa (choc), it is believed that two thirds of children with cancer do not receive treatment and often those who do are already in the late stages of the disease.

src: volgens taryn seegers, die kommunikasiekoördineerder by die kinderkankervereni ging van suidafrika (bekend as choc), is die algemene opvatting dat tweederdes van kinders met kanker nie behandeling ontvang nie — en diegene wat wel behande ling ontvang, dikwels reeds in die latere stadiums van die siekte is.
tgt: since 2011, choc has been working with the department of health and traditional healers to provide health professionals, healthcare workers, traditional healers and communities with knowledge of childhood cancer.

src: choc werk sedert 2011 saam met die departement van gesondheid en tradisionele genesers om gesondheidspraktisyns, gesondheidsorgwerkers, tradisionele genesers en gemeenskappe met die nodige kennis oor kinderkanker te voorsien.
tgt: "these individuals are taught the siluan early warning signs and learn how to demystify myths and stigma in communities," says seegers.

src: "hierdie individue word geleer van die siluan vroeë waarskuwingstekens en leer ook hoe om bygelowe en stigma onder die lede van die gemeenskap te ontbloot en hok te slaan," sê seegers.
tgt: the siluan early warning signs are: seek: medical help for early, persistent symptoms.

src: die siluan vroeë waar skuwingstekens is as volg: seek: raadpleeg mediese hulp vir vroeë, aanhou dende simptome.
tgt: eye: white spot in the eye, new squint, new blindness, bulging eyeball.

src: eye: n wit kolletjie in die oog, skielike skeelheid, skielike blindheid, geswelde oogbol.
tgt: lump: abdomen and pelvis, head and neck, limbs, testes and glands.

src: lump: knoppe in die onder lyf en bekken, kop en nek, ledemate, testes en kliere.
tgt: unexplained: prolonged fever over two weeks, weight loss, pallor, fatigue, easy bruising or bleeding.

src: unexplained: onverklaar bare aanhoudende koors van twee weke of langer, gewigsverlies, bleekheid, moegheid, kneus of bloei maklik.
tgt: aching: bones, joints, back and easy fractures.

src: aching: pyn in beendere, gewrigte en rug; breek maklik bene.
tgt: neurological signs: change or deterioration in walk, balance or speech, regression of milestones, headache for more than a week with or without vomiting and an enlarged head.

src: kinderkankers"kinderkankers verskil van die kankers wat volwassenes raak.
tgt: childhood cancerschildhood cancers are different from cancers affecting adults.

src: hulle is meer geneig om in die organe voor te kom, lyk anders onder n mikroskoop en reageer meer gunstig op behandeling", sê seegers.
